module Amazonka.SESV2.Types.KinesisFirehoseDestination

-- | An object that defines an Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose destination for
--   email events. You can use Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose to stream data
--   to other services, such as Amazon S3 and Amazon Redshift.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newKinesisFirehoseDestination</a> smart constructor.
data KinesisFirehoseDestination
KinesisFirehoseDestination' :: Text -> Text -> KinesisFirehoseDestination

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that the Amazon SES API
--   v2 uses to send email events to the Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose
--   stream.
[$sel:iamRoleArn:KinesisFirehoseDestination'] :: KinesisFirehoseDestination -> Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose
--   stream that the Amazon SES API v2 sends email events to.
[$sel:deliveryStreamArn:KinesisFirehoseDestination'] :: KinesisFirehoseDestination -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>KinesisFirehoseDestination</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:iamRoleArn:KinesisFirehoseDestination'</a>,
--   <a>kinesisFirehoseDestination_iamRoleArn</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of the IAM role that the Amazon SES API v2 uses to send
--   email events to the Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose stream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deliveryStreamArn:KinesisFirehoseDestination'</a>,
--   <a>kinesisFirehoseDestination_deliveryStreamArn</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose stream that
--   the Amazon SES API v2 sends email events to.
newKinesisFirehoseDestination :: Text -> Text -> KinesisFirehoseDestination

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that the Amazon SES API
--   v2 uses to send email events to the Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose
--   stream.
kinesisFirehoseDestination_iamRoleArn :: Lens' KinesisFirehoseDestination Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose
--   stream that the Amazon SES API v2 sends email events to.
kinesisFirehoseDestination_deliveryStreamArn :: Lens' KinesisFirehoseDestination Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.SESV2.Types.KinesisFirehoseDestination.KinesisFirehoseDestination
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.SESV2.Types.KinesisFirehoseDestination.KinesisFirehoseDestination
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.SESV2.Types.KinesisFirehoseDestination.KinesisFirehoseDestination
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.SESV2.Types.KinesisFirehoseDestination.KinesisFirehoseDestination

module Amazonka.SESV2.Types.ListManagementOptions

-- | An object used to specify a list or topic to which an email belongs,
--   which will be used when a contact chooses to unsubscribe.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newListManagementOptions</a> smart constructor.
data ListManagementOptions

-- | The name of the topic.

--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:topicName:ListManagementOptions'</a>,
--   <a>listManagementOptions_topicName</a> - The name of the topic.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contactListName:ListManagementOptions'</a>,
--   <a>listManagementOptions_contactListName</a> - The name of the contact
--   list.

-- | The name of the contact list.

module Amazonka.SESV2.Types.MailFromDomainStatus

-- | The status of the MAIL FROM domain. This status can have the following
--   values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>PENDING</tt>  Amazon SES hasn't started searching for the MX
--   record yet.</li>
--   <li><tt>SUCCESS</tt>  Amazon SES detected the required MX record for
--   the MAIL FROM domain.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt>  Amazon SES can't find the required MX record, or
--   the record no longer exists.</li>
--   <li><tt>TEMPORARY_FAILURE</tt>  A temporary issue occurred, which
--   prevented Amazon SES from determining the status of the MAIL FROM
--   domain.</li>
--   </ul>
newtype MailFromDomainStatus
MailFromDomainStatus' :: Text -> MailFromDomainStatus
[fromMailFromDomainStatus] :: MailFromDomainStatus -> Text
pattern MailFromDomainStatus_FAILED :: MailFromDomainStatus
pattern MailFromDomainStatus_PENDING :: MailFromDomainStatus
pattern MailFromDomainStatus_SUCCESS :: MailFromDomainStatus
pattern MailFromDomainStatus_TEMPORARY_FAILURE :: MailFromDomainStatus
instance Amazonka.Data.XML.ToXML Amazonka.SESV2.Types.MailFromDomainStatus.MailFromDomainStatus
instance Amazonka.Data.XML.FromXML Amazonka.SESV2.Types.MailFromDomainStatus.MailFromDomainStatus
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSONKey Amazonka.SESV2.Types.MailFromDomainStatus.MailFromDomainStatus
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.SESV2.Types.MailFromDomainStatus.MailFromDomainStatus
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSONKey Amazonka.SESV2.Types.MailFromDomainStatus.MailFromDomainStatus
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.SESV2.Types.MailFromDomainStatus.MailFromDomainStatus
instance Amazonka.Data.Query.ToQuery Amazonka.SESV2.Types.MailFromDomainStatus.MailFromDomainStatus
instance Amazonka.Data.Headers.ToHeader Amazonka.SESV2.Types.MailFromDomainStatus.MailFromDomainStatus
instance Amazonka.Data.Log.ToLog Amazonka.SESV2.Types.MailFromDomainStatus.MailFromDomainStatus
instance Amazonka.Data.ByteString.ToByteString Amazonka.SESV2.Types.MailFromDomainStatus.MailFromDomainStatus
instance Amazonka.Data.Text.ToText Amazonka.SESV2.Types.MailFromDomainStatus.MailFromDomainStatus
instance Amazonka.Data.Text.FromText Amazonka.SESV2.Types.MailFromDomainStatus.MailFromDomainStatus
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.SESV2.Types.MailFromDomainStatus.MailFromDomainStatus
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.SESV2.Types.MailFromDomainStatus.MailFromDomainStatus
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.SESV2.Types.MailFromDomainStatus.MailFromDomainStatus
instance GHC.Classes.Ord Amazonka.SESV2.Types.MailFromDomainStatus.MailFromDomainStatus
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.SESV2.Types.MailFromDomainStatus.MailFromDomainStatus
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.SESV2.Types.MailFromDomainStatus.MailFromDomainStatus
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.SESV2.Types.MailFromDomainStatus.MailFromDomainStatus


module Amazonka.SESV2.Types.MailFromAttributes

-- | A list of attributes that are associated with a MAIL FROM domain.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMailFromAttributes</a> smart constructor.
data MailFromAttributes
MailFromAttributes' :: Text -> MailFromDomainStatus -> BehaviorOnMxFailure -> MailFromAttributes

-- | The name of a domain that an email identity uses as a custom MAIL FROM
--   domain.
[$sel:mailFromDomain:MailFromAttributes'] :: MailFromAttributes -> Text

-- | The status of the MAIL FROM domain. This status can have the following
--   values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>PENDING</tt>  Amazon SES hasn't started searching for the MX
--   record yet.</li>
--   <li><tt>SUCCESS</tt>  Amazon SES detected the required MX record for
--   the MAIL FROM domain.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt>  Amazon SES can't find the required MX record, or
--   the record no longer exists.</li>
--   <li><tt>TEMPORARY_FAILURE</tt>  A temporary issue occurred, which
--   prevented Amazon SES from determining the status of the MAIL FROM
--   domain.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:mailFromDomainStatus:MailFromAttributes'] :: MailFromAttributes -> MailFromDomainStatus

-- | The action to take if the required MX record can't be found when you
--   send an email. When you set this value to <tt>UseDefaultValue</tt>,
--   the mail is sent using <i>amazonses.com</i> as the MAIL FROM domain.
--   When you set this value to <tt>RejectMessage</tt>, the Amazon SES API
--   v2 returns a <tt>MailFromDomainNotVerified</tt> error, and doesn't
--   attempt to deliver the email.
--   
--   These behaviors are taken when the custom MAIL FROM domain
--   configuration is in the <tt>Pending</tt>, <tt>Failed</tt>, and
--   <tt>TemporaryFailure</tt> states.
[$sel:behaviorOnMxFailure:MailFromAttributes'] :: MailFromAttributes -> BehaviorOnMxFailure

-- | Create a value of <a>MailFromAttributes</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:mailFromDomain:MailFromAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>mailFromAttributes_mailFromDomain</a> - The name of a domain that
--   an email identity uses as a custom MAIL FROM domain.
--   
--   <a>$sel:mailFromDomainStatus:MailFromAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>mailFromAttributes_mailFromDomainStatus</a> - The status of the
--   MAIL FROM domain. This status can have the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>PENDING</tt>  Amazon SES hasn't started searching for the MX
--   record yet.</li>
--   <li><tt>SUCCESS</tt>  Amazon SES detected the required MX record for
--   the MAIL FROM domain.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt>  Amazon SES can't find the required MX record, or
--   the record no longer exists.</li>
--   <li><tt>TEMPORARY_FAILURE</tt>  A temporary issue occurred, which
--   prevented Amazon SES from determining the status of the MAIL FROM
--   domain.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:behaviorOnMxFailure:MailFromAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>mailFromAttributes_behaviorOnMxFailure</a> - The action to take if
--   the required MX record can't be found when you send an email. When you
--   set this value to <tt>UseDefaultValue</tt>, the mail is sent using
--   <i>amazonses.com</i> as the MAIL FROM domain. When you set this value
--   to <tt>RejectMessage</tt>, the Amazon SES API v2 returns a
--   <tt>MailFromDomainNotVerified</tt> error, and doesn't attempt to
--   deliver the email.
--   
--   These behaviors are taken when the custom MAIL FROM domain
--   configuration is in the <tt>Pending</tt>, <tt>Failed</tt>, and
--   <tt>TemporaryFailure</tt> states.
newMailFromAttributes :: Text -> MailFromDomainStatus -> BehaviorOnMxFailure -> MailFromAttributes

-- | The name of a domain that an email identity uses as a custom MAIL FROM
--   domain.
mailFromAttributes_mailFromDomain :: Lens' MailFromAttributes Text

-- | The status of the MAIL FROM domain. This status can have the following
--   values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>PENDING</tt>  Amazon SES hasn't started searching for the MX
--   record yet.</li>
--   <li><tt>SUCCESS</tt>  Amazon SES detected the required MX record for
--   the MAIL FROM domain.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt>  Amazon SES can't find the required MX record, or
--   the record no longer exists.</li>
--   <li><tt>TEMPORARY_FAILURE</tt>  A temporary issue occurred, which
--   prevented Amazon SES from determining the status of the MAIL FROM
--   domain.</li>
--   </ul>
mailFromAttributes_mailFromDomainStatus :: Lens' MailFromAttributes MailFromDomainStatus

-- | The action to take if the required MX record can't be found when you
--   send an email. When you set this value to <tt>UseDefaultValue</tt>,
--   the mail is sent using <i>amazonses.com</i> as the MAIL FROM domain.
--   When you set this value to <tt>RejectMessage</tt>, the Amazon SES API
--   v2 returns a <tt>MailFromDomainNotVerified</tt> error, and doesn't
--   attempt to deliver the email.
--   
--   These behaviors are taken when the custom MAIL FROM domain
--   configuration is in the <tt>Pending</tt>, <tt>Failed</tt>, and
--   <tt>TemporaryFailure</tt> states.
mailFromAttributes_behaviorOnMxFailure :: Lens' MailFromAttributes BehaviorOnMxFailure
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.SESV2.Types.MailFromAttributes.MailFromAttributes
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.SESV2.Types.MailFromAttributes.MailFromAttributes
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.SESV2.Types.MailFromAttributes.MailFromAttributes
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.SESV2.Types.MailFromAttributes.MailFromAttributes
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.SESV2.Types.MailFromAttributes.MailFromAttributes
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.SESV2.Types.MailFromAttributes.MailFromAttributes
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.SESV2.Types.MailFromAttributes.MailFromAttributes

module Amazonka.SESV2.Types.Message

-- | Represents the email message that you're sending. The <tt>Message</tt>
--   object consists of a subject line and a message body.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMessage</a> smart constructor.
data Message
Message' :: Content -> Body -> Message

-- | The subject line of the email. The subject line can only contain 7-bit
--   ASCII characters. However, you can specify non-ASCII characters in the
--   subject line by using encoded-word syntax, as described in <a>RFC
--   2047</a>.
[$sel:subject:Message'] :: Message -> Content

-- | The body of the message. You can specify an HTML version of the
--   message, a text-only version of the message, or both.
[$sel:body:Message'] :: Message -> Body

-- | Create a value of <a>Message</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:subject:Message'</a>, <a>message_subject</a> - The subject
--   line of the email. The subject line can only contain 7-bit ASCII
--   characters. However, you can specify non-ASCII characters in the
--   subject line by using encoded-word syntax, as described in <a>RFC
--   2047</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:body:Message'</a>, <a>message_body</a> - The body of the
--   message. You can specify an HTML version of the message, a text-only
--   version of the message, or both.
newMessage :: Content -> Body -> Message

-- | The subject line of the email. The subject line can only contain 7-bit
--   ASCII characters. However, you can specify non-ASCII characters in the
--   subject line by using encoded-word syntax, as described in <a>RFC
--   2047</a>.
message_subject :: Lens' Message Content

-- | The body of the message. You can specify an HTML version of the
--   message, a text-only version of the message, or both.
message_body :: Lens' Message Body
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.SESV2.Types.Message.Message
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.SESV2.Types.Message.Message
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.SESV2.Types.Message.Message
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.SESV2.Types.Message.Message
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.SESV2.Types.Message.Message
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.SESV2.Types.Message.Message
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.SESV2.Types.Message.Message


module Amazonka.SESV2.Types.MessageTag

-- | Contains the name and value of a tag that you apply to an email. You
--   can use message tags when you publish email sending events.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMessageTag</a> smart constructor.
data MessageTag
MessageTag' :: Text -> Text -> MessageTag

-- | The name of the message tag. The message tag name has to meet the
--   following criteria:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>It can only contain ASCII letters (az, AZ), numbers (09),
--   underscores (_), or dashes (-).</li>
--   <li>It can contain no more than 256 characters.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:name:MessageTag'] :: MessageTag -> Text

-- | The value of the message tag. The message tag value has to meet the
--   following criteria:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>It can only contain ASCII letters (az, AZ), numbers (09),
--   underscores (_), or dashes (-).</li>
--   <li>It can contain no more than 256 characters.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:value:MessageTag'] :: MessageTag -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>MessageTag</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:MessageTag'</a>, <a>messageTag_name</a> - The name of the
--   message tag. The message tag name has to meet the following criteria:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>It can only contain ASCII letters (az, AZ), numbers (09),
--   underscores (_), or dashes (-).</li>
--   <li>It can contain no more than 256 characters.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:MessageTag'</a>, <a>messageTag_value</a> - The value of
--   the message tag. The message tag value has to meet the following
--   criteria:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>It can only contain ASCII letters (az, AZ), numbers (09),
--   underscores (_), or dashes (-).</li>
--   <li>It can contain no more than 256 characters.</li>
--   </ul>
newMessageTag :: Text -> Text -> MessageTag

-- | The name of the message tag. The message tag name has to meet the
--   following criteria:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>It can only contain ASCII letters (az, AZ), numbers (09),
--   underscores (_), or dashes (-).</li>
--   <li>It can contain no more than 256 characters.</li>
--   </ul>
messageTag_name :: Lens' MessageTag Text

-- | The value of the message tag. The message tag value has to meet the
--   following criteria:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>It can only contain ASCII letters (az, AZ), numbers (09),
--   underscores (_), or dashes (-).</li>
--   <li>It can contain no more than 256 characters.</li>
--   </ul>
messageTag_value :: Lens' MessageTag Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.SESV2.Types.MessageTag.MessageTag
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.SESV2.Types.MessageTag.MessageTag
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.SESV2.Types.MessageTag.MessageTag
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.SESV2.Types.MessageTag.MessageTag
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.SESV2.Types.MessageTag.MessageTag
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.SESV2.Types.MessageTag.MessageTag
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.SESV2.Types.MessageTag.MessageTag

--   (ARN) of the Amazon Pinpoint project to send email events to.

--   email events to.
pinpointDestination_applicationArn :: Lens' PinpointDestination (Maybe Text)

module Amazonka.SESV2.Types.PlacementStatistics

-- | An object that contains inbox placement data for an email provider.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPlacementStatistics</a> smart constructor.
data PlacementStatistics
PlacementStatistics' :: Maybe Double -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Double -> PlacementStatistics

-- | The percentage of emails that didn't arrive in recipients' inboxes at
--   all during the predictive inbox placement test.
[$sel:missingPercentage:PlacementStatistics'] :: PlacementStatistics -> Maybe Double

-- | The percentage of emails that arrived in recipients' spam or junk mail
--   folders during the predictive inbox placement test.
[$sel:spamPercentage:PlacementStatistics'] :: PlacementStatistics -> Maybe Double

-- | The percentage of emails that were authenticated by using Sender
--   Policy Framework (SPF) during the predictive inbox placement test.
[$sel:spfPercentage:PlacementStatistics'] :: PlacementStatistics -> Maybe Double

-- | The percentage of emails that were authenticated by using DomainKeys
--   Identified Mail (DKIM) during the predictive inbox placement test.
[$sel:dkimPercentage:PlacementStatistics'] :: PlacementStatistics -> Maybe Double

-- | The percentage of emails that arrived in recipients' inboxes during
--   the predictive inbox placement test.
[$sel:inboxPercentage:PlacementStatistics'] :: PlacementStatistics -> Maybe Double

-- | Create a value of <a>PlacementStatistics</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:missingPercentage:PlacementStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>placementStatistics_missingPercentage</a> - The percentage of
--   emails that didn't arrive in recipients' inboxes at all during the
--   predictive inbox placement test.
--   
--   <a>$sel:spamPercentage:PlacementStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>placementStatistics_spamPercentage</a> - The percentage of emails
--   that arrived in recipients' spam or junk mail folders during the
--   predictive inbox placement test.
--   
--   <a>$sel:spfPercentage:PlacementStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>placementStatistics_spfPercentage</a> - The percentage of emails
--   that were authenticated by using Sender Policy Framework (SPF) during
--   the predictive inbox placement test.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dkimPercentage:PlacementStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>placementStatistics_dkimPercentage</a> - The percentage of emails
--   that were authenticated by using DomainKeys Identified Mail (DKIM)
--   during the predictive inbox placement test.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inboxPercentage:PlacementStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>placementStatistics_inboxPercentage</a> - The percentage of emails
--   that arrived in recipients' inboxes during the predictive inbox
--   placement test.
newPlacementStatistics :: PlacementStatistics

-- | The percentage of emails that didn't arrive in recipients' inboxes at
--   all during the predictive inbox placement test.
placementStatistics_missingPercentage :: Lens' PlacementStatistics (Maybe Double)

-- | The percentage of emails that arrived in recipients' spam or junk mail
--   folders during the predictive inbox placement test.
placementStatistics_spamPercentage :: Lens' PlacementStatistics (Maybe Double)

-- | The percentage of emails that were authenticated by using Sender
--   Policy Framework (SPF) during the predictive inbox placement test.
placementStatistics_spfPercentage :: Lens' PlacementStatistics (Maybe Double)

-- | The percentage of emails that were authenticated by using DomainKeys
--   Identified Mail (DKIM) during the predictive inbox placement test.
placementStatistics_dkimPercentage :: Lens' PlacementStatistics (Maybe Double)

-- | The percentage of emails that arrived in recipients' inboxes during
--   the predictive inbox placement test.
placementStatistics_inboxPercentage :: Lens' PlacementStatistics (Maybe Double)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.SESV2.Types.PlacementStatistics.PlacementStatistics
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.SESV2.Types.PlacementStatistics.PlacementStatistics
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.SESV2.Types.PlacementStatistics.PlacementStatistics
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.SESV2.Types.PlacementStatistics.PlacementStatistics
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.SESV2.Types.PlacementStatistics.PlacementStatistics
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.SESV2.Types.PlacementStatistics.PlacementStatistics
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.SESV2.Types.PlacementStatistics.PlacementStatistics


module Amazonka.SESV2.Types.IspPlacement

-- | An object that describes how email sent during the predictive inbox
--   placement test was handled by a certain email provider.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newIspPlacement</a> smart constructor.
data IspPlacement

--   provider.

--   to.
[$sel:ispName:IspPlacement'] :: IspPlacement -> Maybe Text

--   omitted.

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   inbox placement metrics for a specific email provider.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ispName:IspPlacement'</a>, <a>ispPlacement_ispName</a> - The
--   name of the email provider that the inbox placement data applies to.
newIspPlacement :: IspPlacement

-- | An object that contains inbox placement metrics for a specific email
--   provider.
ispPlacement_placementStatistics :: Lens' IspPlacement (Maybe PlacementStatistics)

--   to.

instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.SESV2.Types.IspPlacement.IspPlacement


module Amazonka.SESV2.Types.RawMessage

-- | Represents the raw content of an email message.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRawMessage</a> smart constructor.
data RawMessage
RawMessage' :: Base64 -> RawMessage

-- | The raw email message. The message has to meet the following criteria:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The message has to contain a header and a body, separated by one
--   blank line.</li>
--   <li>All of the required header fields must be present in the
--   message.</li>
--   <li>Each part of a multipart MIME message must be formatted
--   properly.</li>
--   <li>Attachments must be in a file format that the Amazon SES
--   supports.</li>
--   <li>The entire message must be Base64 encoded.</li>
--   <li>If any of the MIME parts in your message contain content that is
--   outside of the 7-bit ASCII character range, you should encode that
--   content to ensure that recipients' email clients render the message
--   properly.</li>
--   <li>The length of any single line of text in the message can't exceed
--   1,000 characters. This restriction is defined in <a>RFC 5321</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:data':RawMessage'] :: RawMessage -> Base64

-- | Create a value of <a>RawMessage</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:data':RawMessage'</a>, <a>rawMessage_data</a> - The raw email
--   message. The message has to meet the following criteria:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The message has to contain a header and a body, separated by one
--   blank line.</li>
--   <li>All of the required header fields must be present in the
--   message.</li>
--   <li>Each part of a multipart MIME message must be formatted
--   properly.</li>
--   <li>Attachments must be in a file format that the Amazon SES
--   supports.</li>
--   <li>The entire message must be Base64 encoded.</li>
--   <li>If any of the MIME parts in your message contain content that is
--   outside of the 7-bit ASCII character range, you should encode that
--   content to ensure that recipients' email clients render the message
--   properly.</li>
--   <li>The length of any single line of text in the message can't exceed
--   1,000 characters. This restriction is defined in <a>RFC
--   5321</a>.--</li>
--   <li>- <i>Note:</i> This <tt>Lens</tt> automatically encodes and
--   decodes Base64 data.</li>
--   <li>- The underlying isomorphism will encode to Base64 representation
--   during</li>
--   <li>- serialisation, and decode from Base64 representation during
--   deserialisation.</li>
--   <li>- This <tt>Lens</tt> accepts and returns only raw unencoded
--   data.</li>
--   </ul>
newRawMessage :: ByteString -> RawMessage

-- | The raw email message. The message has to meet the following criteria:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The message has to contain a header and a body, separated by one
--   blank line.</li>
--   <li>All of the required header fields must be present in the
--   message.</li>
--   <li>Each part of a multipart MIME message must be formatted
--   properly.</li>
--   <li>Attachments must be in a file format that the Amazon SES
--   supports.</li>
--   <li>The entire message must be Base64 encoded.</li>
--   <li>If any of the MIME parts in your message contain content that is
--   outside of the 7-bit ASCII character range, you should encode that
--   content to ensure that recipients' email clients render the message
--   properly.</li>
--   <li>The length of any single line of text in the message can't exceed
--   1,000 characters. This restriction is defined in <a>RFC
--   5321</a>.--</li>
--   <li>- <i>Note:</i> This <tt>Lens</tt> automatically encodes and
--   decodes Base64 data.</li>
--   <li>- The underlying isomorphism will encode to Base64 representation
--   during</li>
--   <li>- serialisation, and decode from Base64 representation during
--   deserialisation.</li>
--   <li>- This <tt>Lens</tt> accepts and returns only raw unencoded
--   data.</li>
--   </ul>
rawMessage_data :: Lens' RawMessage ByteString
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.SESV2.Types.RawMessage.RawMessage
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.SESV2.Types.RawMessage.RawMessage
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.SESV2.Types.RawMessage.RawMessage
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.SESV2.Types.RawMessage.RawMessage
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.SESV2.Types.RawMessage.RawMessage
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.SESV2.Types.RawMessage.RawMessage
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.SESV2.Types.RawMessage.RawMessage

--   is a JSON object, typically consisting of key-value pairs in which the
--   keys correspond to replacement tags in the email template.

--   replacement values to apply to the template. This parameter is a JSON

--   correspond to replacement tags in the email template.

--   is a JSON object, typically consisting of key-value pairs in which the
--   keys correspond to replacement tags in the email template.

module Amazonka.SESV2.Types.BulkEmailEntry

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newBulkEmailEntry</a> smart constructor.
data BulkEmailEntry
BulkEmailEntry' :: Maybe ReplacementEmailContent -> Maybe [MessageTag] -> Destination -> BulkEmailEntry

-- | The <tt>ReplacementEmailContent</tt> associated with a
--   <tt>BulkEmailEntry</tt>.
[$sel:replacementEmailContent:BulkEmailEntry'] :: BulkEmailEntry -> Maybe ReplacementEmailContent

-- | A list of tags, in the form of name/value pairs, to apply to an email
--   that you send using the <tt>SendBulkTemplatedEmail</tt> operation.
--   Tags correspond to characteristics of the email that you define, so
--   that you can publish email sending events.
[$sel:replacementTags:BulkEmailEntry'] :: BulkEmailEntry -> Maybe [MessageTag]

-- | Represents the destination of the message, consisting of To:, CC:, and
--   BCC: fields.
--   
--   Amazon SES does not support the SMTPUTF8 extension, as described in
--   <a>RFC6531</a>. For this reason, the local part of a destination email
--   address (the part of the email address that precedes the @ sign) may
--   only contain <a>7-bit ASCII characters</a>. If the domain part of an
--   address (the part after the @ sign) contains non-ASCII characters,
--   they must be encoded using Punycode, as described in <a>RFC3492</a>.
[$sel:destination:BulkEmailEntry'] :: BulkEmailEntry -> Destination

-- | Create a value of <a>BulkEmailEntry</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:replacementEmailContent:BulkEmailEntry'</a>,
--   <a>bulkEmailEntry_replacementEmailContent</a> - The
--   <tt>ReplacementEmailContent</tt> associated with a
--   <tt>BulkEmailEntry</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:replacementTags:BulkEmailEntry'</a>,
--   <a>bulkEmailEntry_replacementTags</a> - A list of tags, in the form of
--   name/value pairs, to apply to an email that you send using the
--   <tt>SendBulkTemplatedEmail</tt> operation. Tags correspond to
--   characteristics of the email that you define, so that you can publish
--   email sending events.
--   
--   <a>$sel:destination:BulkEmailEntry'</a>,
--   <a>bulkEmailEntry_destination</a> - Represents the destination of the
--   message, consisting of To:, CC:, and BCC: fields.
--   
--   Amazon SES does not support the SMTPUTF8 extension, as described in
--   <a>RFC6531</a>. For this reason, the local part of a destination email
--   address (the part of the email address that precedes the @ sign) may
--   only contain <a>7-bit ASCII characters</a>. If the domain part of an
--   address (the part after the @ sign) contains non-ASCII characters,
--   they must be encoded using Punycode, as described in <a>RFC3492</a>.
newBulkEmailEntry :: Destination -> BulkEmailEntry

-- | The <tt>ReplacementEmailContent</tt> associated with a
--   <tt>BulkEmailEntry</tt>.
bulkEmailEntry_replacementEmailContent :: Lens' BulkEmailEntry (Maybe ReplacementEmailContent)

-- | A list of tags, in the form of name/value pairs, to apply to an email
--   that you send using the <tt>SendBulkTemplatedEmail</tt> operation.
--   Tags correspond to characteristics of the email that you define, so
--   that you can publish email sending events.
bulkEmailEntry_replacementTags :: Lens' BulkEmailEntry (Maybe [MessageTag])

-- | Represents the destination of the message, consisting of To:, CC:, and
--   BCC: fields.
--   
--   Amazon SES does not support the SMTPUTF8 extension, as described in
--   <a>RFC6531</a>. For this reason, the local part of a destination email
--   address (the part of the email address that precedes the @ sign) may
--   only contain <a>7-bit ASCII characters</a>. If the domain part of an
--   address (the part after the @ sign) contains non-ASCII characters,
--   they must be encoded using Punycode, as described in <a>RFC3492</a>.
bulkEmailEntry_destination :: Lens' BulkEmailEntry Destination
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.SESV2.Types.BulkEmailEntry.BulkEmailEntry
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.SESV2.Types.BulkEmailEntry.BulkEmailEntry
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.SESV2.Types.BulkEmailEntry.BulkEmailEntry
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.SESV2.Types.BulkEmailEntry.BulkEmailEntry
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.SESV2.Types.BulkEmailEntry.BulkEmailEntry
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.SESV2.Types.BulkEmailEntry.BulkEmailEntry
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.SESV2.Types.BulkEmailEntry.BulkEmailEntry


module Amazonka.SESV2.Types.ReputationOptions

-- | Enable or disable collection of reputation metrics for emails that you
--   send using this configuration set in the current Amazon Web Services
--   Region.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newReputationOptions</a> smart constructor.
data ReputationOptions
ReputationOptions' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Bool -> ReputationOptions

-- | The date and time (in Unix time) when the reputation metrics were last
--   given a fresh start. When your account is given a fresh start, your
--   reputation metrics are calculated starting from the date of the fresh
--   start.
[$sel:lastFreshStart:ReputationOptions'] :: ReputationOptions -> Maybe POSIX

-- | If <tt>true</tt>, tracking of reputation metrics is enabled for the
--   configuration set. If <tt>false</tt>, tracking of reputation metrics
--   is disabled for the configuration set.
[$sel:reputationMetricsEnabled:ReputationOptions'] :: ReputationOptions -> Maybe Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>ReputationOptions</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastFreshStart:ReputationOptions'</a>,
--   <a>reputationOptions_lastFreshStart</a> - The date and time (in Unix
--   time) when the reputation metrics were last given a fresh start. When
--   your account is given a fresh start, your reputation metrics are
--   calculated starting from the date of the fresh start.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reputationMetricsEnabled:ReputationOptions'</a>,
--   <a>reputationOptions_reputationMetricsEnabled</a> - If <tt>true</tt>,
--   tracking of reputation metrics is enabled for the configuration set.
--   If <tt>false</tt>, tracking of reputation metrics is disabled for the
--   configuration set.
newReputationOptions :: ReputationOptions

-- | The date and time (in Unix time) when the reputation metrics were last
--   given a fresh start. When your account is given a fresh start, your
--   reputation metrics are calculated starting from the date of the fresh
--   start.
reputationOptions_lastFreshStart :: Lens' ReputationOptions (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | If <tt>true</tt>, tracking of reputation metrics is enabled for the
--   configuration set. If <tt>false</tt>, tracking of reputation metrics
--   is disabled for the configuration set.
reputationOptions_reputationMetricsEnabled :: Lens' ReputationOptions (Maybe Bool)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.SESV2.Types.ReputationOptions.ReputationOptions
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.SESV2.Types.ReputationOptions.ReputationOptions
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.SESV2.Types.ReputationOptions.ReputationOptions
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.SESV2.Types.ReputationOptions.ReputationOptions
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.SESV2.Types.ReputationOptions.ReputationOptions
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.SESV2.Types.ReputationOptions.ReputationOptions
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.SESV2.Types.ReputationOptions.ReputationOptions
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.SESV2.Types.ReputationOptions.ReputationOptions

module Amazonka.SESV2.Types.ReviewDetails

-- | An object that contains information about your account details review.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newReviewDetails</a> smart constructor.
data ReviewDetails
ReviewDetails' :: Maybe ReviewStatus -> Maybe Text -> ReviewDetails

-- | The status of the latest review of your account. The status can be one
--   of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>PENDING</tt>  We have received your appeal and are in the
--   process of reviewing it.</li>
--   <li><tt>GRANTED</tt>  Your appeal has been reviewed and your
--   production access has been granted.</li>
--   <li><tt>DENIED</tt>  Your appeal has been reviewed and your
--   production access has been denied.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt>  An internal error occurred and we didn't receive
--   your appeal. You can submit your appeal again.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:status:ReviewDetails'] :: ReviewDetails -> Maybe ReviewStatus

-- | The associated support center case ID (if any).
[$sel:caseId:ReviewDetails'] :: ReviewDetails -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ReviewDetails</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:ReviewDetails'</a>, <a>reviewDetails_status</a> - The
--   status of the latest review of your account. The status can be one of
--   the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>PENDING</tt>  We have received your appeal and are in the
--   process of reviewing it.</li>
--   <li><tt>GRANTED</tt>  Your appeal has been reviewed and your
--   production access has been granted.</li>
--   <li><tt>DENIED</tt>  Your appeal has been reviewed and your
--   production access has been denied.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt>  An internal error occurred and we didn't receive
--   your appeal. You can submit your appeal again.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:caseId:ReviewDetails'</a>, <a>reviewDetails_caseId</a> - The
--   associated support center case ID (if any).
newReviewDetails :: ReviewDetails

-- | The status of the latest review of your account. The status can be one
--   of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>PENDING</tt>  We have received your appeal and are in the
--   process of reviewing it.</li>
--   <li><tt>GRANTED</tt>  Your appeal has been reviewed and your
--   production access has been granted.</li>
--   <li><tt>DENIED</tt>  Your appeal has been reviewed and your
--   production access has been denied.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt>  An internal error occurred and we didn't receive
--   your appeal. You can submit your appeal again.</li>
--   </ul>
reviewDetails_status :: Lens' ReviewDetails (Maybe ReviewStatus)

-- | The associated support center case ID (if any).
reviewDetails_caseId :: Lens' ReviewDetails (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.SESV2.Types.ReviewDetails.ReviewDetails
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.SESV2.Types.ReviewDetails.ReviewDetails
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.SESV2.Types.ReviewDetails.ReviewDetails
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.SESV2.Types.ReviewDetails.ReviewDetails
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.SESV2.Types.ReviewDetails.ReviewDetails
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.SESV2.Types.ReviewDetails.ReviewDetails
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.SESV2.Types.ReviewDetails.ReviewDetails


module Amazonka.SESV2.Types.AccountDetails

-- | An object that contains information about your account details.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAccountDetails</a> smart constructor.
data AccountDetails
AccountDetails' :: Maybe ReviewDetails -> Maybe MailType -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe ContactLanguage -> Maybe (Sensitive (NonEmpty (Sensitive Text))) -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> AccountDetails

-- | Information about the review of the latest details you submitted.
[$sel:reviewDetails:AccountDetails'] :: AccountDetails -> Maybe ReviewDetails

-- | The type of email your account is sending. The mail type can be one of
--   the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>MARKETING</tt>  Most of your sending traffic is to keep your
--   customers informed of your latest offering.</li>
--   <li><tt>TRANSACTIONAL</tt>  Most of your sending traffic is to
--   communicate during a transaction with a customer.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:mailType:AccountDetails'] :: AccountDetails -> Maybe MailType

-- | A description of the types of email that you plan to send.
[$sel:useCaseDescription:AccountDetails'] :: AccountDetails -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | The language you would prefer for the case. The contact language can
--   be one of <tt>ENGLISH</tt> or <tt>JAPANESE</tt>.
[$sel:contactLanguage:AccountDetails'] :: AccountDetails -> Maybe ContactLanguage

-- | Additional email addresses where updates are sent about your account
--   review process.
[$sel:additionalContactEmailAddresses:AccountDetails'] :: AccountDetails -> Maybe (Sensitive (NonEmpty (Sensitive Text)))

-- | The URL of your website. This information helps us better understand
--   the type of content that you plan to send.
[$sel:websiteURL:AccountDetails'] :: AccountDetails -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | Create a value of <a>AccountDetails</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:reviewDetails:AccountDetails'</a>,
--   <a>accountDetails_reviewDetails</a> - Information about the review of
--   the latest details you submitted.
--   
--   <a>$sel:mailType:AccountDetails'</a>, <a>accountDetails_mailType</a> -
--   The type of email your account is sending. The mail type can be one of
--   the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>MARKETING</tt>  Most of your sending traffic is to keep your
--   customers informed of your latest offering.</li>
--   <li><tt>TRANSACTIONAL</tt>  Most of your sending traffic is to
--   communicate during a transaction with a customer.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:useCaseDescription:AccountDetails'</a>,
--   <a>accountDetails_useCaseDescription</a> - A description of the types
--   of email that you plan to send.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contactLanguage:AccountDetails'</a>,
--   <a>accountDetails_contactLanguage</a> - The language you would prefer
--   for the case. The contact language can be one of <tt>ENGLISH</tt> or
--   <tt>JAPANESE</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:additionalContactEmailAddresses:AccountDetails'</a>,
--   <a>accountDetails_additionalContactEmailAddresses</a> - Additional
--   email addresses where updates are sent about your account review
--   process.
--   
--   <a>$sel:websiteURL:AccountDetails'</a>,
--   <a>accountDetails_websiteURL</a> - The URL of your website. This
--   information helps us better understand the type of content that you
--   plan to send.
newAccountDetails :: AccountDetails

-- | Information about the review of the latest details you submitted.
accountDetails_reviewDetails :: Lens' AccountDetails (Maybe ReviewDetails)

-- | The type of email your account is sending. The mail type can be one of
--   the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>MARKETING</tt>  Most of your sending traffic is to keep your
--   customers informed of your latest offering.</li>
--   <li><tt>TRANSACTIONAL</tt>  Most of your sending traffic is to
--   communicate during a transaction with a customer.</li>
--   </ul>
accountDetails_mailType :: Lens' AccountDetails (Maybe MailType)

-- | A description of the types of email that you plan to send.
accountDetails_useCaseDescription :: Lens' AccountDetails (Maybe Text)

-- | The language you would prefer for the case. The contact language can
--   be one of <tt>ENGLISH</tt> or <tt>JAPANESE</tt>.
accountDetails_contactLanguage :: Lens' AccountDetails (Maybe ContactLanguage)

-- | Additional email addresses where updates are sent about your account
--   review process.
accountDetails_additionalContactEmailAddresses :: Lens' AccountDetails (Maybe (NonEmpty Text))

-- | The URL of your website. This information helps us better understand
--   the type of content that you plan to send.
accountDetails_websiteURL :: Lens' AccountDetails (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.SESV2.Types.AccountDetails.AccountDetails
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.SESV2.Types.AccountDetails.AccountDetails
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.SESV2.Types.AccountDetails.AccountDetails
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.SESV2.Types.AccountDetails.AccountDetails
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.SESV2.Types.AccountDetails.AccountDetails
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.SESV2.Types.AccountDetails.AccountDetails


module Amazonka.SESV2.Types.SendQuota

-- | An object that contains information about the per-day and per-second
--   sending limits for your Amazon SES account in the current Amazon Web
--   Services Region.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSendQuota</a> smart constructor.
data SendQuota
SendQuota' :: Maybe Double -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Double -> SendQuota

-- | The maximum number of emails that you can send per second in the
--   current Amazon Web Services Region. This value is also called your
--   /maximum sending rate<i> or your </i>maximum TPS (transactions per
--   second) rate/.
[$sel:maxSendRate:SendQuota'] :: SendQuota -> Maybe Double

-- | The number of emails sent from your Amazon SES account in the current
--   Amazon Web Services Region over the past 24 hours.
[$sel:sentLast24Hours:SendQuota'] :: SendQuota -> Maybe Double

-- | The maximum number of emails that you can send in the current Amazon
--   Web Services Region over a 24-hour period. This value is also called
--   your <i>sending quota</i>.
[$sel:max24HourSend:SendQuota'] :: SendQuota -> Maybe Double

-- | Create a value of <a>SendQuota</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxSendRate:SendQuota'</a>, <a>sendQuota_maxSendRate</a> - The
--   maximum number of emails that you can send per second in the current
--   Amazon Web Services Region. This value is also called your /maximum
--   sending rate<i> or your </i>maximum TPS (transactions per second)
--   rate/.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sentLast24Hours:SendQuota'</a>,
--   <a>sendQuota_sentLast24Hours</a> - The number of emails sent from your
--   Amazon SES account in the current Amazon Web Services Region over the
--   past 24 hours.
--   
--   <a>$sel:max24HourSend:SendQuota'</a>, <a>sendQuota_max24HourSend</a> -
--   The maximum number of emails that you can send in the current Amazon
--   Web Services Region over a 24-hour period. This value is also called
--   your <i>sending quota</i>.
newSendQuota :: SendQuota

-- | The maximum number of emails that you can send per second in the
--   current Amazon Web Services Region. This value is also called your
--   /maximum sending rate<i> or your </i>maximum TPS (transactions per
--   second) rate/.
sendQuota_maxSendRate :: Lens' SendQuota (Maybe Double)

-- | The number of emails sent from your Amazon SES account in the current
--   Amazon Web Services Region over the past 24 hours.
sendQuota_sentLast24Hours :: Lens' SendQuota (Maybe Double)

-- | The maximum number of emails that you can send in the current Amazon
--   Web Services Region over a 24-hour period. This value is also called
--   your <i>sending quota</i>.
sendQuota_max24HourSend :: Lens' SendQuota (Maybe Double)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.SESV2.Types.SendQuota.SendQuota
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.SESV2.Types.SendQuota.SendQuota
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.SESV2.Types.SendQuota.SendQuota
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.SESV2.Types.SendQuota.SendQuota
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.SESV2.Types.SendQuota.SendQuota
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.SESV2.Types.SendQuota.SendQuota
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.SESV2.Types.SendQuota.SendQuota


module Amazonka.SESV2.Types.SendingOptions

-- | Used to enable or disable email sending for messages that use this
--   configuration set in the current Amazon Web Services Region.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSendingOptions</a> smart constructor.
data SendingOptions
SendingOptions' :: Maybe Bool -> SendingOptions

-- | If <tt>true</tt>, email sending is enabled for the configuration set.
--   If <tt>false</tt>, email sending is disabled for the configuration
--   set.
[$sel:sendingEnabled:SendingOptions'] :: SendingOptions -> Maybe Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>SendingOptions</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:sendingEnabled:SendingOptions'</a>,
--   <a>sendingOptions_sendingEnabled</a> - If <tt>true</tt>, email sending
--   is enabled for the configuration set. If <tt>false</tt>, email sending
--   is disabled for the configuration set.
newSendingOptions :: SendingOptions

-- | If <tt>true</tt>, email sending is enabled for the configuration set.
--   If <tt>false</tt>, email sending is disabled for the configuration
--   set.
sendingOptions_sendingEnabled :: Lens' SendingOptions (Maybe Bool)

module Amazonka.SESV2.Types.SnsDestination

--   can use Amazon SNS to send notification when certain email events
--   occur.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSnsDestination</a> smart constructor.
data SnsDestination
SnsDestination' :: Text -> SnsDestination

--   email events to. For more information about Amazon SNS topics, see the
--   <a>Amazon SNS Developer Guide</a>.
[$sel:topicArn:SnsDestination'] :: SnsDestination -> Text

--   omitted.
--

--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:topicArn:SnsDestination'</a>, <a>snsDestination_topicArn</a> -
--   The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon SNS topic to publish
--   email events to. For more information about Amazon SNS topics, see the
--   <a>Amazon SNS Developer Guide</a>.
newSnsDestination :: Text -> SnsDestination

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon SNS topic to publish
--   email events to. For more information about Amazon SNS topics, see the
--   <a>Amazon SNS Developer Guide</a>.
snsDestination_topicArn :: Lens' SnsDestination Text

module Amazonka.SESV2.Types.EventDestinationDefinition

-- | An object that defines the event destination. Specifically, it defines
--   which services receive events from emails sent using the configuration
--   set that the event destination is associated with. Also defines the
--   types of events that are sent to the event destination.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEventDestinationDefinition</a> smart constructor.
data EventDestinationDefinition
EventDestinationDefinition' :: Maybe [EventType] -> Maybe PinpointDestination -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe KinesisFirehoseDestination -> Maybe CloudWatchDestination -> Maybe SnsDestination -> EventDestinationDefinition

-- | An array that specifies which events the Amazon SES API v2 should send
--   to the destinations in this <tt>EventDestinationDefinition</tt>.
[$sel:matchingEventTypes:EventDestinationDefinition'] :: EventDestinationDefinition -> Maybe [EventType]

-- | An object that defines an Amazon Pinpoint project destination for
--   email events. You can send email event data to a Amazon Pinpoint
--   project to view metrics using the Transactional Messaging dashboards
--   that are built in to Amazon Pinpoint. For more information, see
--   <a>Transactional Messaging Charts</a> in the <i>Amazon Pinpoint User
--   Guide</i>.
[$sel:pinpointDestination:EventDestinationDefinition'] :: EventDestinationDefinition -> Maybe PinpointDestination

-- | If <tt>true</tt>, the event destination is enabled. When the event
--   destination is enabled, the specified event types are sent to the
--   destinations in this <tt>EventDestinationDefinition</tt>.
--   
--   If <tt>false</tt>, the event destination is disabled. When the event
--   destination is disabled, events aren't sent to the specified
--   destinations.
[$sel:enabled:EventDestinationDefinition'] :: EventDestinationDefinition -> Maybe Bool

-- | An object that defines an Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose destination for
--   email events. You can use Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose to stream data
--   to other services, such as Amazon S3 and Amazon Redshift.
[$sel:kinesisFirehoseDestination:EventDestinationDefinition'] :: EventDestinationDefinition -> Maybe KinesisFirehoseDestination

-- | An object that defines an Amazon CloudWatch destination for email
--   events. You can use Amazon CloudWatch to monitor and gain insights on
--   your email sending metrics.
[$sel:cloudWatchDestination:EventDestinationDefinition'] :: EventDestinationDefinition -> Maybe CloudWatchDestination

-- | An object that defines an Amazon SNS destination for email events. You
--   can use Amazon SNS to send notification when certain email events
--   occur.
[$sel:snsDestination:EventDestinationDefinition'] :: EventDestinationDefinition -> Maybe SnsDestination

-- | Create a value of <a>EventDestinationDefinition</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:matchingEventTypes:EventDestinationDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>eventDestinationDefinition_matchingEventTypes</a> - An array that
--   specifies which events the Amazon SES API v2 should send to the
--   destinations in this <tt>EventDestinationDefinition</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:pinpointDestination:EventDestinationDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>eventDestinationDefinition_pinpointDestination</a> - An object that
--   defines an Amazon Pinpoint project destination for email events. You
--   can send email event data to a Amazon Pinpoint project to view metrics
--   using the Transactional Messaging dashboards that are built in to
--   Amazon Pinpoint. For more information, see <a>Transactional Messaging
--   Charts</a> in the <i>Amazon Pinpoint User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enabled:EventDestinationDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>eventDestinationDefinition_enabled</a> - If <tt>true</tt>, the
--   event destination is enabled. When the event destination is enabled,
--   the specified event types are sent to the destinations in this
--   <tt>EventDestinationDefinition</tt>.
--   
--   If <tt>false</tt>, the event destination is disabled. When the event
--   destination is disabled, events aren't sent to the specified
--   destinations.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kinesisFirehoseDestination:EventDestinationDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>eventDestinationDefinition_kinesisFirehoseDestination</a> - An
--   object that defines an Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose destination for
--   email events. You can use Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose to stream data
--   to other services, such as Amazon S3 and Amazon Redshift.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cloudWatchDestination:EventDestinationDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>eventDestinationDefinition_cloudWatchDestination</a> - An object
--   that defines an Amazon CloudWatch destination for email events. You
--   can use Amazon CloudWatch to monitor and gain insights on your email
--   sending metrics.
--   
--   <a>$sel:snsDestination:EventDestinationDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>eventDestinationDefinition_snsDestination</a> - An object that
--   defines an Amazon SNS destination for email events. You can use Amazon
--   SNS to send notification when certain email events occur.
newEventDestinationDefinition :: EventDestinationDefinition

-- | An array that specifies which events the Amazon SES API v2 should send
--   to the destinations in this <tt>EventDestinationDefinition</tt>.
eventDestinationDefinition_matchingEventTypes :: Lens' EventDestinationDefinition (Maybe [EventType])

-- | An object that defines an Amazon Pinpoint project destination for
--   email events. You can send email event data to a Amazon Pinpoint
--   project to view metrics using the Transactional Messaging dashboards
--   that are built in to Amazon Pinpoint. For more information, see
--   <a>Transactional Messaging Charts</a> in the <i>Amazon Pinpoint User
--   Guide</i>.
eventDestinationDefinition_pinpointDestination :: Lens' EventDestinationDefinition (Maybe PinpointDestination)

-- | If <tt>true</tt>, the event destination is enabled. When the event
--   destination is enabled, the specified event types are sent to the
--   destinations in this <tt>EventDestinationDefinition</tt>.
--   
--   If <tt>false</tt>, the event destination is disabled. When the event
--   destination is disabled, events aren't sent to the specified
--   destinations.
eventDestinationDefinition_enabled :: Lens' EventDestinationDefinition (Maybe Bool)

-- | An object that defines an Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose destination for
--   email events. You can use Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose to stream data
--   to other services, such as Amazon S3 and Amazon Redshift.
eventDestinationDefinition_kinesisFirehoseDestination :: Lens' EventDestinationDefinition (Maybe KinesisFirehoseDestination)

-- | An object that defines an Amazon CloudWatch destination for email
--   events. You can use Amazon CloudWatch to monitor and gain insights on
--   your email sending metrics.
eventDestinationDefinition_cloudWatchDestination :: Lens' EventDestinationDefinition (Maybe CloudWatchDestination)

-- | An object that defines an Amazon SNS destination for email events. You
--   can use Amazon SNS to send notification when certain email events
--   occur.
eventDestinationDefinition_snsDestination :: Lens' EventDestinationDefinition (Maybe SnsDestination)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.SESV2.Types.EventDestinationDefinition.EventDestinationDefinition
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.SESV2.Types.EventDestinationDefinition.EventDestinationDefinition
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.SESV2.Types.EventDestinationDefinition.EventDestinationDefinition
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.SESV2.Types.EventDestinationDefinition.EventDestinationDefinition
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.SESV2.Types.EventDestinationDefinition.EventDestinationDefinition
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.SESV2.Types.EventDestinationDefinition.EventDestinationDefinition
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.SESV2.Types.EventDestinationDefinition.EventDestinationDefinition


module Amazonka.SESV2.Types.EventDestination

-- | In the Amazon SES API v2, <i>events</i> include message sends,
--   deliveries, opens, clicks, bounces, complaints and delivery delays.
--   /Event destinations/ are places that you can send information about
--   these events to. For example, you can send event data to Amazon SNS to
--   receive notifications when you receive bounces or complaints, or you
--   can use Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose to stream data to Amazon S3 for
--   long-term storage.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEventDestination</a> smart constructor.
data EventDestination
EventDestination' :: Maybe PinpointDestination -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe KinesisFirehoseDestination -> Maybe CloudWatchDestination -> Maybe SnsDestination -> Text -> [EventType] -> EventDestination

-- | An object that defines an Amazon Pinpoint project destination for
--   email events. You can send email event data to a Amazon Pinpoint
--   project to view metrics using the Transactional Messaging dashboards
--   that are built in to Amazon Pinpoint. For more information, see
--   <a>Transactional Messaging Charts</a> in the <i>Amazon Pinpoint User
--   Guide</i>.
[$sel:pinpointDestination:EventDestination'] :: EventDestination -> Maybe PinpointDestination

-- | If <tt>true</tt>, the event destination is enabled. When the event
--   destination is enabled, the specified event types are sent to the
--   destinations in this <tt>EventDestinationDefinition</tt>.
--   
--   If <tt>false</tt>, the event destination is disabled. When the event
--   destination is disabled, events aren't sent to the specified
--   destinations.
[$sel:enabled:EventDestination'] :: EventDestination -> Maybe Bool

-- | An object that defines an Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose destination for
--   email events. You can use Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose to stream data
--   to other services, such as Amazon S3 and Amazon Redshift.
[$sel:kinesisFirehoseDestination:EventDestination'] :: EventDestination -> Maybe KinesisFirehoseDestination

-- | An object that defines an Amazon CloudWatch destination for email
--   events. You can use Amazon CloudWatch to monitor and gain insights on
--   your email sending metrics.
[$sel:cloudWatchDestination:EventDestination'] :: EventDestination -> Maybe CloudWatchDestination

-- | An object that defines an Amazon SNS destination for email events. You
--   can use Amazon SNS to send notification when certain email events
--   occur.
[$sel:snsDestination:EventDestination'] :: EventDestination -> Maybe SnsDestination

-- | A name that identifies the event destination.
[$sel:name:EventDestination'] :: EventDestination -> Text

-- | The types of events that Amazon SES sends to the specified event
--   destinations.
[$sel:matchingEventTypes:EventDestination'] :: EventDestination -> [EventType]

-- | Create a value of <a>EventDestination</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:pinpointDestination:EventDestination'</a>,
--   <a>eventDestination_pinpointDestination</a> - An object that defines
--   an Amazon Pinpoint project destination for email events. You can send
--   email event data to a Amazon Pinpoint project to view metrics using
--   the Transactional Messaging dashboards that are built in to Amazon
--   Pinpoint. For more information, see <a>Transactional Messaging
--   Charts</a> in the <i>Amazon Pinpoint User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enabled:EventDestination'</a>, <a>eventDestination_enabled</a>
--   - If <tt>true</tt>, the event destination is enabled. When the event
--   destination is enabled, the specified event types are sent to the
--   destinations in this <tt>EventDestinationDefinition</tt>.
--   
--   If <tt>false</tt>, the event destination is disabled. When the event
--   destination is disabled, events aren't sent to the specified
--   destinations.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kinesisFirehoseDestination:EventDestination'</a>,
--   <a>eventDestination_kinesisFirehoseDestination</a> - An object that
--   defines an Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose destination for email events.
--   You can use Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose to stream data to other
--   services, such as Amazon S3 and Amazon Redshift.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cloudWatchDestination:EventDestination'</a>,
--   <a>eventDestination_cloudWatchDestination</a> - An object that defines
--   an Amazon CloudWatch destination for email events. You can use Amazon
--   CloudWatch to monitor and gain insights on your email sending metrics.
--   
--   <a>$sel:snsDestination:EventDestination'</a>,
--   <a>eventDestination_snsDestination</a> - An object that defines an
--   Amazon SNS destination for email events. You can use Amazon SNS to
--   send notification when certain email events occur.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:EventDestination'</a>, <a>eventDestination_name</a> - A
--   name that identifies the event destination.
--   
--   <a>$sel:matchingEventTypes:EventDestination'</a>,
--   <a>eventDestination_matchingEventTypes</a> - The types of events that
--   Amazon SES sends to the specified event destinations.
newEventDestination :: Text -> EventDestination

-- | An object that defines an Amazon Pinpoint project destination for
--   email events. You can send email event data to a Amazon Pinpoint
--   project to view metrics using the Transactional Messaging dashboards
--   that are built in to Amazon Pinpoint. For more information, see
--   <a>Transactional Messaging Charts</a> in the <i>Amazon Pinpoint User
--   Guide</i>.
eventDestination_pinpointDestination :: Lens' EventDestination (Maybe PinpointDestination)

-- | If <tt>true</tt>, the event destination is enabled. When the event
--   destination is enabled, the specified event types are sent to the
--   destinations in this <tt>EventDestinationDefinition</tt>.
--   
--   If <tt>false</tt>, the event destination is disabled. When the event
--   destination is disabled, events aren't sent to the specified
--   destinations.
eventDestination_enabled :: Lens' EventDestination (Maybe Bool)

-- | An object that defines an Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose destination for
--   email events. You can use Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose to stream data
--   to other services, such as Amazon S3 and Amazon Redshift.
eventDestination_kinesisFirehoseDestination :: Lens' EventDestination (Maybe KinesisFirehoseDestination)

-- | An object that defines an Amazon CloudWatch destination for email
--   events. You can use Amazon CloudWatch to monitor and gain insights on
--   your email sending metrics.
eventDestination_cloudWatchDestination :: Lens' EventDestination (Maybe CloudWatchDestination)

-- | An object that defines an Amazon SNS destination for email events. You
--   can use Amazon SNS to send notification when certain email events
--   occur.
eventDestination_snsDestination :: Lens' EventDestination (Maybe SnsDestination)

-- | A name that identifies the event destination.
eventDestination_name :: Lens' EventDestination Text

-- | The types of events that Amazon SES sends to the specified event
--   destinations.
eventDestination_matchingEventTypes :: Lens' EventDestination [EventType]
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.SESV2.Types.EventDestination.EventDestination
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.SESV2.Types.EventDestination.EventDestination
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.SESV2.Types.EventDestination.EventDestination
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.SESV2.Types.EventDestination.EventDestination
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.SESV2.Types.EventDestination.EventDestination
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.SESV2.Types.EventDestination.EventDestination
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.SESV2.Types.EventDestination.EventDestination


module Amazonka.SESV2.Types.SubscriptionStatus
newtype SubscriptionStatus
SubscriptionStatus' :: Text -> SubscriptionStatus
[fromSubscriptionStatus] :: SubscriptionStatus -> Text
pattern SubscriptionStatus_OPT_IN :: SubscriptionStatus
pattern SubscriptionStatus_OPT_OUT :: SubscriptionStatus
instance Amazonka.Data.XML.ToXML Amazonka.SESV2.Types.SubscriptionStatus.SubscriptionStatus
instance Amazonka.Data.XML.FromXML Amazonka.SESV2.Types.SubscriptionStatus.SubscriptionStatus
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSONKey Amazonka.SESV2.Types.SubscriptionStatus.SubscriptionStatus
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.SESV2.Types.SubscriptionStatus.SubscriptionStatus
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSONKey Amazonka.SESV2.Types.SubscriptionStatus.SubscriptionStatus

module Amazonka.SESV2.Types.SuppressedDestinationAttributes

-- | An object that contains additional attributes that are related an
--   email address that is on the suppression list for your account.
--

--   constructor.
data SuppressedDestinationAttributes

--   the suppression list for your account.

--   address to be added to the suppression list for your account.

--   suppression list for your account.
--   
--   <a>$sel:messageId:SuppressedDestinationAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>suppressedDestinationAttributes_messageId</a> - The unique
--   identifier of the email message that caused the email address to be
--   added to the suppression list for your account.

module Amazonka.SESV2.Types.SuppressionListImportAction

-- | The type of action to perform on the address. The following are
--   possible values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>PUT: add the addresses to the suppression list.</li>
--   <li>DELETE: remove the address from the suppression list.</li>
--   </ul>

SuppressionListImportAction' :: Text -> SuppressionListImportAction
[fromSuppressionListImportAction] :: SuppressionListImportAction -> Text
pattern SuppressionListImportAction_DELETE :: SuppressionListImportAction
pattern SuppressionListImportAction_PUT :: SuppressionListImportAction

--   possible values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>PUT: add the addresses to the suppression list. If the record
--   already exists, it will override it with the new value.</li>
--   <li>DELETE: remove the addresses from the suppression list.</li>
--   </ul>

--   type of action to perform on the address. The following are possible
--   values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>PUT: add the addresses to the suppression list. If the record
--   already exists, it will override it with the new value.</li>
--   <li>DELETE: remove the addresses from the suppression list.</li>
--   </ul>
newSuppressionListDestination :: SuppressionListImportAction -> SuppressionListDestination

-- | The type of action to perform on the address. The following are
--   possible values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>PUT: add the addresses to the suppression list. If the record
--   already exists, it will override it with the new value.</li>
--   <li>DELETE: remove the addresses from the suppression list.</li>
--   </ul>

module Amazonka.SESV2.Types.SuppressionListReason

-- | The reason that the address was added to the suppression list for your
--   account. The value can be one of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>COMPLAINT</tt>  Amazon SES added an email address to the
--   suppression list for your account because a message sent to that
--   address results in a complaint.</li>
--   <li><tt>BOUNCE</tt>  Amazon SES added an email address to the
--   suppression list for your account because a message sent to that
--   address results in a hard bounce.</li>
--   </ul>
newtype SuppressionListReason
SuppressionListReason' :: Text -> SuppressionListReason
[fromSuppressionListReason] :: SuppressionListReason -> Text
pattern SuppressionListReason_BOUNCE :: SuppressionListReason
pattern SuppressionListReason_COMPLAINT :: SuppressionListReason
instance Amazonka.Data.XML.ToXML Amazonka.SESV2.Types.SuppressionListReason.SuppressionListReason
instance Amazonka.Data.XML.FromXML Amazonka.SESV2.Types.SuppressionListReason.SuppressionListReason
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSONKey Amazonka.SESV2.Types.SuppressionListReason.SuppressionListReason
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.SESV2.Types.SuppressionListReason.SuppressionListReason
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSONKey Amazonka.SESV2.Types.SuppressionListReason.SuppressionListReason
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.SESV2.Types.SuppressionListReason.SuppressionListReason
instance Amazonka.Data.Query.ToQuery Amazonka.SESV2.Types.SuppressionListReason.SuppressionListReason
instance Amazonka.Data.Headers.ToHeader Amazonka.SESV2.Types.SuppressionListReason.SuppressionListReason
instance Amazonka.Data.Log.ToLog Amazonka.SESV2.Types.SuppressionListReason.SuppressionListReason
instance Amazonka.Data.ByteString.ToByteString Amazonka.SESV2.Types.SuppressionListReason.SuppressionListReason
instance Amazonka.Data.Text.ToText Amazonka.SESV2.Types.SuppressionListReason.SuppressionListReason
instance Amazonka.Data.Text.FromText Amazonka.SESV2.Types.SuppressionListReason.SuppressionListReason
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.SESV2.Types.SuppressionListReason.SuppressionListReason
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.SESV2.Types.SuppressionListReason.SuppressionListReason
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.SESV2.Types.SuppressionListReason.SuppressionListReason
instance GHC.Classes.Ord Amazonka.SESV2.Types.SuppressionListReason.SuppressionListReason
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.SESV2.Types.SuppressionListReason.SuppressionListReason
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.SESV2.Types.SuppressionListReason.SuppressionListReason
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.SESV2.Types.SuppressionListReason.SuppressionListReason


module Amazonka.SESV2.Types.SuppressionAttributes

-- | An object that contains information about the email address
--   suppression preferences for your account in the current Amazon Web
--   Services Region.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSuppressionAttributes</a> smart constructor.
data SuppressionAttributes
SuppressionAttributes' :: Maybe [SuppressionListReason] -> SuppressionAttributes

-- | A list that contains the reasons that email addresses will be
--   automatically added to the suppression list for your account. This
--   list can contain any or all of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>COMPLAINT</tt>  Amazon SES adds an email address to the
--   suppression list for your account when a message sent to that address
--   results in a complaint.</li>
--   <li><tt>BOUNCE</tt>  Amazon SES adds an email address to the
--   suppression list for your account when a message sent to that address
--   results in a hard bounce.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:suppressedReasons:SuppressionAttributes'] :: SuppressionAttributes -> Maybe [SuppressionListReason]

-- | Create a value of <a>SuppressionAttributes</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:suppressedReasons:SuppressionAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>suppressionAttributes_suppressedReasons</a> - A list that contains
--   the reasons that email addresses will be automatically added to the
--   suppression list for your account. This list can contain any or all of
--   the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>COMPLAINT</tt>  Amazon SES adds an email address to the
--   suppression list for your account when a message sent to that address
--   results in a complaint.</li>
--   <li><tt>BOUNCE</tt>  Amazon SES adds an email address to the
--   suppression list for your account when a message sent to that address
--   results in a hard bounce.</li>
--   </ul>
newSuppressionAttributes :: SuppressionAttributes

-- | A list that contains the reasons that email addresses will be
--   automatically added to the suppression list for your account. This
--   list can contain any or all of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>COMPLAINT</tt>  Amazon SES adds an email address to the
--   suppression list for your account when a message sent to that address
--   results in a complaint.</li>
--   <li><tt>BOUNCE</tt>  Amazon SES adds an email address to the
--   suppression list for your account when a message sent to that address
--   results in a hard bounce.</li>
--   </ul>
suppressionAttributes_suppressedReasons :: Lens' SuppressionAttributes (Maybe [SuppressionListReason])
