instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.SESV2.Types.SuppressedDestination.SuppressedDestination
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.SESV2.Types.SuppressedDestination.SuppressedDestination
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.SESV2.Types.SuppressedDestination.SuppressedDestination


module Amazonka.SESV2.Types.SuppressionOptions

-- | An object that contains information about the suppression list
--   preferences for your account.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSuppressionOptions</a> smart constructor.
data SuppressionOptions
SuppressionOptions' :: Maybe [SuppressionListReason] -> SuppressionOptions

-- | A list that contains the reasons that email addresses are
--   automatically added to the suppression list for your account. This
--   list can contain any or all of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>COMPLAINT</tt>  Amazon SES adds an email address to the
--   suppression list for your account when a message sent to that address
--   results in a complaint.</li>
--   <li><tt>BOUNCE</tt>  Amazon SES adds an email address to the
--   suppression list for your account when a message sent to that address
--   results in a hard bounce.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:suppressedReasons:SuppressionOptions'] :: SuppressionOptions -> Maybe [SuppressionListReason]

-- | Create a value of <a>SuppressionOptions</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:suppressedReasons:SuppressionOptions'</a>,
--   <a>suppressionOptions_suppressedReasons</a> - A list that contains the
--   reasons that email addresses are automatically added to the
--   suppression list for your account. This list can contain any or all of
--   the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>COMPLAINT</tt>  Amazon SES adds an email address to the
--   suppression list for your account when a message sent to that address
--   results in a complaint.</li>
--   <li><tt>BOUNCE</tt>  Amazon SES adds an email address to the
--   suppression list for your account when a message sent to that address
--   results in a hard bounce.</li>
--   </ul>
newSuppressionOptions :: SuppressionOptions

-- | A list that contains the reasons that email addresses are
--   automatically added to the suppression list for your account. This
--   list can contain any or all of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>COMPLAINT</tt>  Amazon SES adds an email address to the
--   suppression list for your account when a message sent to that address
--   results in a complaint.</li>
--   <li><tt>BOUNCE</tt>  Amazon SES adds an email address to the
--   suppression list for your account when a message sent to that address
--   results in a hard bounce.</li>
--   </ul>
suppressionOptions_suppressedReasons :: Lens' SuppressionOptions (Maybe [SuppressionListReason])
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.SESV2.Types.SuppressionOptions.SuppressionOptions
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.SESV2.Types.SuppressionOptions.SuppressionOptions
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.SESV2.Types.SuppressionOptions.SuppressionOptions
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.SESV2.Types.SuppressionOptions.SuppressionOptions
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.SESV2.Types.SuppressionOptions.SuppressionOptions
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.SESV2.Types.SuppressionOptions.SuppressionOptions
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.SESV2.Types.SuppressionOptions.SuppressionOptions
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.SESV2.Types.SuppressionOptions.SuppressionOptions


module Amazonka.SESV2.Types.Tag

-- | An object that defines the tags that are associated with a resource. A
--   <i>tag</i> is a label that you optionally define and associate with a
--   resource. Tags can help you categorize and manage resources in
--   different ways, such as by purpose, owner, environment, or other
--   criteria. A resource can have as many as 50 tags.
--   
--   Each tag consists of a required <i>tag key</i> and an associated
--   <i>tag value</i>, both of which you define. A tag key is a general
--   label that acts as a category for a more specific tag value. A tag
--   value acts as a descriptor within a tag key. A tag key can contain as
--   many as 128 characters. A tag value can contain as many as 256
--   characters. The characters can be Unicode letters, digits, white
--   space, or one of the following symbols: _ . : / = + -. The following
--   additional restrictions apply to tags:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Tag keys and values are case sensitive.</li>
--   <li>For each associated resource, each tag key must be unique and it
--   can have only one value.</li>
--   <li>The <tt>aws:</tt> prefix is reserved for use by Amazon Web
--   Services; you cant use it in any tag keys or values that you define.
--   In addition, you can't edit or remove tag keys or values that use this
--   prefix. Tags that use this prefix dont count against the limit of 50
--   tags per resource.</li>
--   <li>You can associate tags with public or shared resources, but the
--   tags are available only for your Amazon Web Services account, not any
--   other accounts that share the resource. In addition, the tags are
--   available only for resources that are located in the specified Amazon
--   Web Services Region for your Amazon Web Services account.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTag</a> smart constructor.
data Tag
Tag' :: Text -> Text -> Tag

-- | One part of a key-value pair that defines a tag. The maximum length of
--   a tag key is 128 characters. The minimum length is 1 character.
[$sel:key:Tag'] :: Tag -> Text

-- | The optional part of a key-value pair that defines a tag. The maximum
--   length of a tag value is 256 characters. The minimum length is 0
--   characters. If you don't want a resource to have a specific tag value,
--   don't specify a value for this parameter. If you don't specify a
--   value, Amazon SES sets the value to an empty string.
[$sel:value:Tag'] :: Tag -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Tag</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_key</a> - One part of a key-value pair
--   that defines a tag. The maximum length of a tag key is 128 characters.
--   The minimum length is 1 character.
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_value</a> - The optional part of a
--   key-value pair that defines a tag. The maximum length of a tag value
--   is 256 characters. The minimum length is 0 characters. If you don't
--   want a resource to have a specific tag value, don't specify a value
--   for this parameter. If you don't specify a value, Amazon SES sets the
--   value to an empty string.
newTag :: Text -> Text -> Tag

-- | One part of a key-value pair that defines a tag. The maximum length of
--   a tag key is 128 characters. The minimum length is 1 character.
tag_key :: Lens' Tag Text

-- | The optional part of a key-value pair that defines a tag. The maximum
--   length of a tag value is 256 characters. The minimum length is 0
--   characters. If you don't want a resource to have a specific tag value,
--   don't specify a value for this parameter. If you don't specify a
--   value, Amazon SES sets the value to an empty string.
tag_value :: Lens' Tag Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.SESV2.Types.Tag.Tag
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.SESV2.Types.Tag.Tag
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.SESV2.Types.Tag.Tag
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.SESV2.Types.Tag.Tag
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.SESV2.Types.Tag.Tag
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.SESV2.Types.Tag.Tag
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.SESV2.Types.Tag.Tag
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.SESV2.Types.Tag.Tag


module Amazonka.SESV2.Types.Template

-- | An object that defines the email template to use for an email message,
--   and the values to use for any message variables in that template. An
--   <i>email template</i> is a type of message template that contains
--   content that you want to define, save, and reuse in email messages
--   that you send.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTemplate</a> smart constructor.
data Template
Template' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Template

-- | The name of the template. You will refer to this name when you send
--   email using the <tt>SendTemplatedEmail</tt> or
--   <tt>SendBulkTemplatedEmail</tt> operations.
[$sel:templateName:Template'] :: Template -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the template.
[$sel:templateArn:Template'] :: Template -> Maybe Text

-- | An object that defines the values to use for message variables in the
--   template. This object is a set of key-value pairs. Each key defines a
--   message variable in the template. The corresponding value defines the
--   value to use for that variable.
[$sel:templateData:Template'] :: Template -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Template</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateName:Template'</a>, <a>template_templateName</a> - The
--   name of the template. You will refer to this name when you send email
--   using the <tt>SendTemplatedEmail</tt> or
--   <tt>SendBulkTemplatedEmail</tt> operations.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateArn:Template'</a>, <a>template_templateArn</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateData:Template'</a>, <a>template_templateData</a> - An
--   object that defines the values to use for message variables in the
--   template. This object is a set of key-value pairs. Each key defines a
--   message variable in the template. The corresponding value defines the
--   value to use for that variable.
newTemplate :: Template

-- | The name of the template. You will refer to this name when you send
--   email using the <tt>SendTemplatedEmail</tt> or
--   <tt>SendBulkTemplatedEmail</tt> operations.
template_templateName :: Lens' Template (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the template.
template_templateArn :: Lens' Template (Maybe Text)

-- | An object that defines the values to use for message variables in the
--   template. This object is a set of key-value pairs. Each key defines a
--   message variable in the template. The corresponding value defines the
--   value to use for that variable.
template_templateData :: Lens' Template (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.SESV2.Types.Template.Template
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.SESV2.Types.Template.Template
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.SESV2.Types.Template.Template
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.SESV2.Types.Template.Template
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.SESV2.Types.Template.Template
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.SESV2.Types.Template.Template
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.SESV2.Types.Template.Template


module Amazonka.SESV2.Types.EmailContent

-- | An object that defines the entire content of the email, including the
--   message headers and the body content. You can create a simple email
--   message, in which you specify the subject and the text and HTML
--   versions of the message body. You can also create raw messages, in
--   which you specify a complete MIME-formatted message. Raw messages can
--   include attachments and custom headers.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEmailContent</a> smart constructor.
data EmailContent
EmailContent' :: Maybe RawMessage -> Maybe Message -> Maybe Template -> EmailContent

-- | The raw email message. The message has to meet the following criteria:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The message has to contain a header and a body, separated by one
--   blank line.</li>
--   <li>All of the required header fields must be present in the
--   message.</li>
--   <li>Each part of a multipart MIME message must be formatted
--   properly.</li>
--   <li>If you include attachments, they must be in a file format that the
--   Amazon SES API v2 supports.</li>
--   <li>The entire message must be Base64 encoded.</li>
--   <li>If any of the MIME parts in your message contain content that is
--   outside of the 7-bit ASCII character range, you should encode that
--   content to ensure that recipients' email clients render the message
--   properly.</li>
--   <li>The length of any single line of text in the message can't exceed
--   1,000 characters. This restriction is defined in <a>RFC 5321</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:raw:EmailContent'] :: EmailContent -> Maybe RawMessage

-- | The simple email message. The message consists of a subject and a
--   message body.
[$sel:simple:EmailContent'] :: EmailContent -> Maybe Message

-- | The template to use for the email message.
[$sel:template:EmailContent'] :: EmailContent -> Maybe Template

-- | Create a value of <a>EmailContent</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:raw:EmailContent'</a>, <a>emailContent_raw</a> - The raw email
--   message. The message has to meet the following criteria:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The message has to contain a header and a body, separated by one
--   blank line.</li>
--   <li>All of the required header fields must be present in the
--   message.</li>
--   <li>Each part of a multipart MIME message must be formatted
--   properly.</li>
--   <li>If you include attachments, they must be in a file format that the
--   Amazon SES API v2 supports.</li>
--   <li>The entire message must be Base64 encoded.</li>
--   <li>If any of the MIME parts in your message contain content that is
--   outside of the 7-bit ASCII character range, you should encode that
--   content to ensure that recipients' email clients render the message
--   properly.</li>
--   <li>The length of any single line of text in the message can't exceed
--   1,000 characters. This restriction is defined in <a>RFC 5321</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:simple:EmailContent'</a>, <a>emailContent_simple</a> - The
--   simple email message. The message consists of a subject and a message
--   body.
--   
--   <a>$sel:template:EmailContent'</a>, <a>emailContent_template</a> - The
--   template to use for the email message.
newEmailContent :: EmailContent

-- | The raw email message. The message has to meet the following criteria:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The message has to contain a header and a body, separated by one
--   blank line.</li>
--   <li>All of the required header fields must be present in the
--   message.</li>
--   <li>Each part of a multipart MIME message must be formatted
--   properly.</li>
--   <li>If you include attachments, they must be in a file format that the
--   Amazon SES API v2 supports.</li>
--   <li>The entire message must be Base64 encoded.</li>
--   <li>If any of the MIME parts in your message contain content that is
--   outside of the 7-bit ASCII character range, you should encode that
--   content to ensure that recipients' email clients render the message
--   properly.</li>
--   <li>The length of any single line of text in the message can't exceed
--   1,000 characters. This restriction is defined in <a>RFC 5321</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
emailContent_raw :: Lens' EmailContent (Maybe RawMessage)

-- | The simple email message. The message consists of a subject and a
--   message body.
emailContent_simple :: Lens' EmailContent (Maybe Message)

-- | The template to use for the email message.
emailContent_template :: Lens' EmailContent (Maybe Template)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.SESV2.Types.EmailContent.EmailContent
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.SESV2.Types.EmailContent.EmailContent
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.SESV2.Types.EmailContent.EmailContent
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.SESV2.Types.EmailContent.EmailContent
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.SESV2.Types.EmailContent.EmailContent
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.SESV2.Types.EmailContent.EmailContent
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.SESV2.Types.EmailContent.EmailContent

module Amazonka.SESV2.Types.TlsPolicy

-- | Specifies whether messages that use the configuration set are required
--   to use Transport Layer Security (TLS). If the value is
--   <tt>Require</tt>, messages are only delivered if a TLS connection can
--   be established. If the value is <tt>Optional</tt>, messages can be
--   delivered in plain text if a TLS connection can't be established.
newtype TlsPolicy
TlsPolicy' :: Text -> TlsPolicy
[fromTlsPolicy] :: TlsPolicy -> Text
pattern TlsPolicy_OPTIONAL :: TlsPolicy
pattern TlsPolicy_REQUIRE :: TlsPolicy
instance Amazonka.Data.XML.ToXML Amazonka.SESV2.Types.TlsPolicy.TlsPolicy
instance Amazonka.Data.XML.FromXML Amazonka.SESV2.Types.TlsPolicy.TlsPolicy
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSONKey Amazonka.SESV2.Types.TlsPolicy.TlsPolicy
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.SESV2.Types.TlsPolicy.TlsPolicy
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSONKey Amazonka.SESV2.Types.TlsPolicy.TlsPolicy
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.SESV2.Types.TlsPolicy.TlsPolicy
instance Amazonka.Data.Query.ToQuery Amazonka.SESV2.Types.TlsPolicy.TlsPolicy
instance Amazonka.Data.Headers.ToHeader Amazonka.SESV2.Types.TlsPolicy.TlsPolicy
instance Amazonka.Data.Log.ToLog Amazonka.SESV2.Types.TlsPolicy.TlsPolicy
instance Amazonka.Data.ByteString.ToByteString Amazonka.SESV2.Types.TlsPolicy.TlsPolicy
instance Amazonka.Data.Text.ToText Amazonka.SESV2.Types.TlsPolicy.TlsPolicy
instance Amazonka.Data.Text.FromText Amazonka.SESV2.Types.TlsPolicy.TlsPolicy
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.SESV2.Types.TlsPolicy.TlsPolicy
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.SESV2.Types.TlsPolicy.TlsPolicy
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.SESV2.Types.TlsPolicy.TlsPolicy
instance GHC.Classes.Ord Amazonka.SESV2.Types.TlsPolicy.TlsPolicy
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.SESV2.Types.TlsPolicy.TlsPolicy
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.SESV2.Types.TlsPolicy.TlsPolicy
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.SESV2.Types.TlsPolicy.TlsPolicy


module Amazonka.SESV2.Types.DeliveryOptions

-- | Used to associate a configuration set with a dedicated IP pool.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDeliveryOptions</a> smart constructor.
data DeliveryOptions
DeliveryOptions' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe TlsPolicy -> DeliveryOptions

-- | The name of the dedicated IP pool to associate with the configuration
--   set.
[$sel:sendingPoolName:DeliveryOptions'] :: DeliveryOptions -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies whether messages that use the configuration set are required
--   to use Transport Layer Security (TLS). If the value is
--   <tt>Require</tt>, messages are only delivered if a TLS connection can
--   be established. If the value is <tt>Optional</tt>, messages can be
--   delivered in plain text if a TLS connection can't be established.

--   pool to associate with the configuration set.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tlsPolicy:DeliveryOptions'</a>,
--   <a>deliveryOptions_tlsPolicy</a> - Specifies whether messages that use
--   the configuration set are required to use Transport Layer Security
--   (TLS). If the value is <tt>Require</tt>, messages are only delivered
--   if a TLS connection can be established. If the value is
--   <tt>Optional</tt>, messages can be delivered in plain text if a TLS
--   connection can't be established.
newDeliveryOptions :: DeliveryOptions

--   set.

-- | Specifies whether messages that use the configuration set are required
--   to use Transport Layer Security (TLS). If the value is
--   <tt>Require</tt>, messages are only delivered if a TLS connection can
--   be established. If the value is <tt>Optional</tt>, messages can be
--   delivered in plain text if a TLS connection can't be established.
deliveryOptions_tlsPolicy :: Lens' DeliveryOptions (Maybe TlsPolicy)

module Amazonka.SESV2.Types.Topic

-- | An interest group, theme, or label within a list. Lists can have
--   multiple topics.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTopic</a> smart constructor.
data Topic
Topic' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> SubscriptionStatus -> Topic

-- | A description of what the topic is about, which the contact will see.
[$sel:description:Topic'] :: Topic -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the topic.
[$sel:topicName:Topic'] :: Topic -> Text

-- | The name of the topic the contact will see.
[$sel:displayName:Topic'] :: Topic -> Text

-- | The default subscription status to be applied to a contact if the
--   contact has not noted their preference for subscribing to a topic.
[$sel:defaultSubscriptionStatus:Topic'] :: Topic -> SubscriptionStatus

-- | Create a value of <a>Topic</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:Topic'</a>, <a>topic_description</a> - A
--   description of what the topic is about, which the contact will see.
--   
--   <a>$sel:topicName:Topic'</a>, <a>topic_topicName</a> - The name of the
--   topic.
--   
--   <a>$sel:displayName:Topic'</a>, <a>topic_displayName</a> - The name of
--   the topic the contact will see.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultSubscriptionStatus:Topic'</a>,
--   <a>topic_defaultSubscriptionStatus</a> - The default subscription
--   status to be applied to a contact if the contact has not noted their
--   preference for subscribing to a topic.
newTopic :: Text -> Text -> SubscriptionStatus -> Topic

-- | A description of what the topic is about, which the contact will see.
topic_description :: Lens' Topic (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the topic.
topic_topicName :: Lens' Topic Text

-- | The name of the topic the contact will see.
topic_displayName :: Lens' Topic Text

-- | The default subscription status to be applied to a contact if the
--   contact has not noted their preference for subscribing to a topic.
topic_defaultSubscriptionStatus :: Lens' Topic SubscriptionStatus
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.SESV2.Types.Topic.Topic
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.SESV2.Types.Topic.Topic
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.SESV2.Types.Topic.Topic
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.SESV2.Types.Topic.Topic
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.SESV2.Types.Topic.Topic
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.SESV2.Types.Topic.Topic
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.SESV2.Types.Topic.Topic
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.SESV2.Types.Topic.Topic


module Amazonka.SESV2.Types.TopicFilter

-- | Used for filtering by a specific topic preference.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTopicFilter</a> smart constructor.
data TopicFilter
TopicFilter' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> TopicFilter

-- | The name of a topic on which you wish to apply the filter.
[$sel:topicName:TopicFilter'] :: TopicFilter -> Maybe Text

-- | Notes that the default subscription status should be applied to a
--   contact because the contact has not noted their preference for
--   subscribing to a topic.
[$sel:useDefaultIfPreferenceUnavailable:TopicFilter'] :: TopicFilter -> Maybe Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>TopicFilter</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:topicName:TopicFilter'</a>, <a>topicFilter_topicName</a> - The
--   name of a topic on which you wish to apply the filter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:useDefaultIfPreferenceUnavailable:TopicFilter'</a>,
--   <a>topicFilter_useDefaultIfPreferenceUnavailable</a> - Notes that the
--   default subscription status should be applied to a contact because the
--   contact has not noted their preference for subscribing to a topic.
newTopicFilter :: TopicFilter

-- | The name of a topic on which you wish to apply the filter.
topicFilter_topicName :: Lens' TopicFilter (Maybe Text)

-- | Notes that the default subscription status should be applied to a
--   contact because the contact has not noted their preference for
--   subscribing to a topic.
topicFilter_useDefaultIfPreferenceUnavailable :: Lens' TopicFilter (Maybe Bool)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.SESV2.Types.TopicFilter.TopicFilter
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.SESV2.Types.TopicFilter.TopicFilter
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.SESV2.Types.TopicFilter.TopicFilter
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.SESV2.Types.TopicFilter.TopicFilter
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.SESV2.Types.TopicFilter.TopicFilter
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.SESV2.Types.TopicFilter.TopicFilter
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.SESV2.Types.TopicFilter.TopicFilter


module Amazonka.SESV2.Types.ListContactsFilter

-- | A filter that can be applied to a list of contacts.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newListContactsFilter</a> smart constructor.
data ListContactsFilter
ListContactsFilter' :: Maybe SubscriptionStatus -> Maybe TopicFilter -> ListContactsFilter

-- | The status by which you are filtering: <tt>OPT_IN</tt> or
--   <tt>OPT_OUT</tt>.
[$sel:filteredStatus:ListContactsFilter'] :: ListContactsFilter -> Maybe SubscriptionStatus

-- | Used for filtering by a specific topic preference.
[$sel:topicFilter:ListContactsFilter'] :: ListContactsFilter -> Maybe TopicFilter

-- | Create a value of <a>ListContactsFilter</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   filtering: <tt>OPT_IN</tt> or <tt>OPT_OUT</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:topicFilter:ListContactsFilter'</a>,
--   <a>listContactsFilter_topicFilter</a> - Used for filtering by a
--   specific topic preference.
newListContactsFilter :: ListContactsFilter

-- | The status by which you are filtering: <tt>OPT_IN</tt> or
--   <tt>OPT_OUT</tt>.

-- | Used for filtering by a specific topic preference.
listContactsFilter_topicFilter :: Lens' ListContactsFilter (Maybe TopicFilter)

module Amazonka.SESV2.Types.TopicPreference

-- | The contact's preference for being opted-in to or opted-out of a
--   topic.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTopicPreference</a> smart constructor.
data TopicPreference
TopicPreference' :: Text -> SubscriptionStatus -> TopicPreference

-- | The name of the topic.
[$sel:topicName:TopicPreference'] :: TopicPreference -> Text

-- | The contact's subscription status to a topic which is either
--   <tt>OPT_IN</tt> or <tt>OPT_OUT</tt>.
[$sel:subscriptionStatus:TopicPreference'] :: TopicPreference -> SubscriptionStatus

-- | Create a value of <a>TopicPreference</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--

--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   <a>topicPreference_topicName</a> - The name of the topic.
--   
--   <a>$sel:subscriptionStatus:TopicPreference'</a>,
--   <a>topicPreference_subscriptionStatus</a> - The contact's subscription
--   status to a topic which is either <tt>OPT_IN</tt> or <tt>OPT_OUT</tt>.
newTopicPreference :: Text -> SubscriptionStatus -> TopicPreference

-- | The name of the topic.
topicPreference_topicName :: Lens' TopicPreference Text

-- | The contact's subscription status to a topic which is either
--   <tt>OPT_IN</tt> or <tt>OPT_OUT</tt>.

module Amazonka.SESV2.Types.Contact

-- | A contact is the end-user who is receiving the email.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newContact</a> smart constructor.
data Contact
Contact' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe [TopicPreference] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe [TopicPreference] -> Contact

-- | A boolean value status noting if the contact is unsubscribed from all
--   contact list topics.
[$sel:unsubscribeAll:Contact'] :: Contact -> Maybe Bool

-- | The default topic preferences applied to the contact.
[$sel:topicDefaultPreferences:Contact'] :: Contact -> Maybe [TopicPreference]

-- | The contact's email address.
[$sel:emailAddress:Contact'] :: Contact -> Maybe Text

-- | A timestamp noting the last time the contact's information was
--   updated.
[$sel:lastUpdatedTimestamp:Contact'] :: Contact -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The contact's preference for being opted-in to or opted-out of a
--   topic.
[$sel:topicPreferences:Contact'] :: Contact -> Maybe [TopicPreference]

-- | Create a value of <a>Contact</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:unsubscribeAll:Contact'</a>, <a>contact_unsubscribeAll</a> - A
--   boolean value status noting if the contact is unsubscribed from all
--   contact list topics.
--   
--   <a>$sel:topicDefaultPreferences:Contact'</a>,
--   <a>contact_topicDefaultPreferences</a> - The default topic preferences
--   applied to the contact.
--   
--   <a>$sel:emailAddress:Contact'</a>, <a>contact_emailAddress</a> - The
--   contact's email address.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastUpdatedTimestamp:Contact'</a>,
--   <a>contact_lastUpdatedTimestamp</a> - A timestamp noting the last time
--   the contact's information was updated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:topicPreferences:Contact'</a>, <a>contact_topicPreferences</a>
--   - The contact's preference for being opted-in to or opted-out of a
--   topic.
newContact :: Contact

-- | A boolean value status noting if the contact is unsubscribed from all
--   contact list topics.
contact_unsubscribeAll :: Lens' Contact (Maybe Bool)

-- | The default topic preferences applied to the contact.
contact_topicDefaultPreferences :: Lens' Contact (Maybe [TopicPreference])

-- | The contact's email address.
contact_emailAddress :: Lens' Contact (Maybe Text)

-- | A timestamp noting the last time the contact's information was
--   updated.
contact_lastUpdatedTimestamp :: Lens' Contact (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The contact's preference for being opted-in to or opted-out of a
--   topic.
contact_topicPreferences :: Lens' Contact (Maybe [TopicPreference])
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.SESV2.Types.Contact.Contact
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.SESV2.Types.Contact.Contact
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.SESV2.Types.Contact.Contact
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.SESV2.Types.Contact.Contact
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.SESV2.Types.Contact.Contact
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.SESV2.Types.Contact.Contact
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.SESV2.Types.Contact.Contact


module Amazonka.SESV2.Types.TrackingOptions

-- | An object that defines the tracking options for a configuration set.
--   When you use the Amazon SES API v2 to send an email, it contains an
--   invisible image that's used to track when recipients open your email.
--   If your email contains links, those links are changed slightly in
--   order to track when recipients click them.
--   
--   These images and links include references to a domain operated by
--   Amazon Web Services. You can optionally configure the Amazon SES to
--   use a domain that you operate for these images and links.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTrackingOptions</a> smart constructor.
data TrackingOptions
TrackingOptions' :: Text -> TrackingOptions

-- | The domain to use for tracking open and click events.
[$sel:customRedirectDomain:TrackingOptions'] :: TrackingOptions -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>TrackingOptions</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:customRedirectDomain:TrackingOptions'</a>,
--   <a>trackingOptions_customRedirectDomain</a> - The domain to use for
--   tracking open and click events.
newTrackingOptions :: Text -> TrackingOptions

-- | The domain to use for tracking open and click events.
trackingOptions_customRedirectDomain :: Lens' TrackingOptions Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.SESV2.Types.TrackingOptions.TrackingOptions
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.SESV2.Types.TrackingOptions.TrackingOptions
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.SESV2.Types.TrackingOptions.TrackingOptions
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.SESV2.Types.TrackingOptions.TrackingOptions
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.SESV2.Types.TrackingOptions.TrackingOptions
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.SESV2.Types.TrackingOptions.TrackingOptions
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.SESV2.Types.TrackingOptions.TrackingOptions
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.SESV2.Types.TrackingOptions.TrackingOptions


module Amazonka.SESV2.Types.VolumeStatistics

-- | An object that contains information about the amount of email that was
--   delivered to recipients.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newVolumeStatistics</a> smart constructor.
data VolumeStatistics
VolumeStatistics' :: Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> VolumeStatistics

-- | The total number of emails that arrived in recipients' inboxes.
[$sel:inboxRawCount:VolumeStatistics'] :: VolumeStatistics -> Maybe Integer

-- | An estimate of the percentage of emails sent from the current domain
--   that will arrive in recipients' spam or junk mail folders.
[$sel:projectedSpam:VolumeStatistics'] :: VolumeStatistics -> Maybe Integer

-- | An estimate of the percentage of emails sent from the current domain
--   that will arrive in recipients' inboxes.
[$sel:projectedInbox:VolumeStatistics'] :: VolumeStatistics -> Maybe Integer

-- | The total number of emails that arrived in recipients' spam or junk
--   mail folders.
[$sel:spamRawCount:VolumeStatistics'] :: VolumeStatistics -> Maybe Integer

-- | Create a value of <a>VolumeStatistics</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:inboxRawCount:VolumeStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>volumeStatistics_inboxRawCount</a> - The total number of emails
--   that arrived in recipients' inboxes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:projectedSpam:VolumeStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>volumeStatistics_projectedSpam</a> - An estimate of the percentage
--   of emails sent from the current domain that will arrive in recipients'
--   spam or junk mail folders.
--   
--   <a>$sel:projectedInbox:VolumeStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>volumeStatistics_projectedInbox</a> - An estimate of the percentage
--   of emails sent from the current domain that will arrive in recipients'
--   inboxes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:spamRawCount:VolumeStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>volumeStatistics_spamRawCount</a> - The total number of emails that
--   arrived in recipients' spam or junk mail folders.
newVolumeStatistics :: VolumeStatistics

-- | The total number of emails that arrived in recipients' inboxes.
volumeStatistics_inboxRawCount :: Lens' VolumeStatistics (Maybe Integer)

-- | An estimate of the percentage of emails sent from the current domain
--   that will arrive in recipients' spam or junk mail folders.
volumeStatistics_projectedSpam :: Lens' VolumeStatistics (Maybe Integer)

-- | An estimate of the percentage of emails sent from the current domain
--   that will arrive in recipients' inboxes.
volumeStatistics_projectedInbox :: Lens' VolumeStatistics (Maybe Integer)

-- | The total number of emails that arrived in recipients' spam or junk
--   mail folders.
volumeStatistics_spamRawCount :: Lens' VolumeStatistics (Maybe Integer)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.SESV2.Types.VolumeStatistics.VolumeStatistics
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.SESV2.Types.VolumeStatistics.VolumeStatistics
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.SESV2.Types.VolumeStatistics.VolumeStatistics
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.SESV2.Types.VolumeStatistics.VolumeStatistics
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.SESV2.Types.VolumeStatistics.VolumeStatistics
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.SESV2.Types.VolumeStatistics.VolumeStatistics
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.SESV2.Types.VolumeStatistics.VolumeStatistics


module Amazonka.SESV2.Types.OverallVolume

-- | An object that contains information about email that was sent from the
--   selected domain.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newOverallVolume</a> smart constructor.
data OverallVolume
OverallVolume' :: Maybe [DomainIspPlacement] -> Maybe VolumeStatistics -> Maybe Double -> OverallVolume

-- | An object that contains inbox and junk mail placement metrics for
--   individual email providers.
[$sel:domainIspPlacements:OverallVolume'] :: OverallVolume -> Maybe [DomainIspPlacement]

-- | An object that contains information about the numbers of messages that
--   arrived in recipients' inboxes and junk mail folders.
[$sel:volumeStatistics:OverallVolume'] :: OverallVolume -> Maybe VolumeStatistics

-- | The percentage of emails that were sent from the domain that were read
--   by their recipients.
[$sel:readRatePercent:OverallVolume'] :: OverallVolume -> Maybe Double

-- | Create a value of <a>OverallVolume</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:domainIspPlacements:OverallVolume'</a>,
--   <a>overallVolume_domainIspPlacements</a> - An object that contains
--   inbox and junk mail placement metrics for individual email providers.
--   
--   <a>$sel:volumeStatistics:OverallVolume'</a>,
--   <a>overallVolume_volumeStatistics</a> - An object that contains
--   information about the numbers of messages that arrived in recipients'
--   inboxes and junk mail folders.
--   
--   <a>$sel:readRatePercent:OverallVolume'</a>,
--   <a>overallVolume_readRatePercent</a> - The percentage of emails that
--   were sent from the domain that were read by their recipients.
newOverallVolume :: OverallVolume

-- | An object that contains inbox and junk mail placement metrics for
--   individual email providers.
overallVolume_domainIspPlacements :: Lens' OverallVolume (Maybe [DomainIspPlacement])

-- | An object that contains information about the numbers of messages that
--   arrived in recipients' inboxes and junk mail folders.
overallVolume_volumeStatistics :: Lens' OverallVolume (Maybe VolumeStatistics)

-- | The percentage of emails that were sent from the domain that were read
--   by their recipients.
overallVolume_readRatePercent :: Lens' OverallVolume (Maybe Double)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.SESV2.Types.OverallVolume.OverallVolume
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.SESV2.Types.OverallVolume.OverallVolume
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.SESV2.Types.OverallVolume.OverallVolume

instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.SESV2.Types.OverallVolume.OverallVolume


module Amazonka.SESV2.Types.DailyVolume

-- | An object that contains information about the volume of email sent on
--   each day of the analysis period.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDailyVolume</a> smart constructor.
data DailyVolume
DailyVolume' :: Maybe [DomainIspPlacement] -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe VolumeStatistics -> DailyVolume

-- | An object that contains inbox placement metrics for a specified day in
--   the analysis period, broken out by the recipient's email provider.
[$sel:domainIspPlacements:DailyVolume'] :: DailyVolume -> Maybe [DomainIspPlacement]

-- | The date that the DailyVolume metrics apply to, in Unix time.
[$sel:startDate:DailyVolume'] :: DailyVolume -> Maybe POSIX

-- | An object that contains inbox placement metrics for a specific day in
--   the analysis period.
[$sel:volumeStatistics:DailyVolume'] :: DailyVolume -> Maybe VolumeStatistics

-- | Create a value of <a>DailyVolume</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:domainIspPlacements:DailyVolume'</a>,
--   <a>dailyVolume_domainIspPlacements</a> - An object that contains inbox
--   placement metrics for a specified day in the analysis period, broken
--   out by the recipient's email provider.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startDate:DailyVolume'</a>, <a>dailyVolume_startDate</a> - The
--   date that the DailyVolume metrics apply to, in Unix time.
--   
--   <a>$sel:volumeStatistics:DailyVolume'</a>,
--   <a>dailyVolume_volumeStatistics</a> - An object that contains inbox
--   placement metrics for a specific day in the analysis period.
newDailyVolume :: DailyVolume

-- | An object that contains inbox placement metrics for a specified day in
--   the analysis period, broken out by the recipient's email provider.
dailyVolume_domainIspPlacements :: Lens' DailyVolume (Maybe [DomainIspPlacement])

-- | The date that the DailyVolume metrics apply to, in Unix time.
dailyVolume_startDate :: Lens' DailyVolume (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | An object that contains inbox placement metrics for a specific day in
--   the analysis period.
dailyVolume_volumeStatistics :: Lens' DailyVolume (Maybe VolumeStatistics)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.SESV2.Types.DailyVolume.DailyVolume
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.SESV2.Types.DailyVolume.DailyVolume

instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.SESV2.Types.DailyVolume.DailyVolume
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.SESV2.Types.DailyVolume.DailyVolume


module Amazonka.SESV2.Types.WarmupStatus

-- | The warmup status of a dedicated IP.
newtype WarmupStatus
WarmupStatus' :: Text -> WarmupStatus
[fromWarmupStatus] :: WarmupStatus -> Text
pattern WarmupStatus_DONE :: WarmupStatus
pattern WarmupStatus_IN_PROGRESS :: WarmupStatus
instance Amazonka.Data.XML.ToXML Amazonka.SESV2.Types.WarmupStatus.WarmupStatus
instance Amazonka.Data.XML.FromXML Amazonka.SESV2.Types.WarmupStatus.WarmupStatus
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSONKey Amazonka.SESV2.Types.WarmupStatus.WarmupStatus
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.SESV2.Types.WarmupStatus.WarmupStatus
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSONKey Amazonka.SESV2.Types.WarmupStatus.WarmupStatus
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.SESV2.Types.WarmupStatus.WarmupStatus
instance Amazonka.Data.Query.ToQuery Amazonka.SESV2.Types.WarmupStatus.WarmupStatus
instance Amazonka.Data.Headers.ToHeader Amazonka.SESV2.Types.WarmupStatus.WarmupStatus
instance Amazonka.Data.Log.ToLog Amazonka.SESV2.Types.WarmupStatus.WarmupStatus
instance Amazonka.Data.ByteString.ToByteString Amazonka.SESV2.Types.WarmupStatus.WarmupStatus
instance Amazonka.Data.Text.ToText Amazonka.SESV2.Types.WarmupStatus.WarmupStatus
instance Amazonka.Data.Text.FromText Amazonka.SESV2.Types.WarmupStatus.WarmupStatus
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.SESV2.Types.WarmupStatus.WarmupStatus
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.SESV2.Types.WarmupStatus.WarmupStatus
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.SESV2.Types.WarmupStatus.WarmupStatus
instance GHC.Classes.Ord Amazonka.SESV2.Types.WarmupStatus.WarmupStatus
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.SESV2.Types.WarmupStatus.WarmupStatus
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.SESV2.Types.WarmupStatus.WarmupStatus
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.SESV2.Types.WarmupStatus.WarmupStatus


module Amazonka.SESV2.Types.DedicatedIp

-- | Contains information about a dedicated IP address that is associated
--   with your Amazon SES account.
--   
--   To learn more about requesting dedicated IP addresses, see
--   <a>Requesting and Relinquishing Dedicated IP Addresses</a> in the
--   <i>Amazon SES Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDedicatedIp</a> smart constructor.
data DedicatedIp
DedicatedIp' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> WarmupStatus -> Int -> DedicatedIp

-- | The name of the dedicated IP pool that the IP address is associated
--   with.
[$sel:poolName:DedicatedIp'] :: DedicatedIp -> Maybe Text

-- | An IPv4 address.
[$sel:ip:DedicatedIp'] :: DedicatedIp -> Text

-- | The warm-up status of a dedicated IP address. The status can have one
--   of the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt>  The IP address isn't ready to use because
--   the dedicated IP warm-up process is ongoing.</li>
--   <li><tt>DONE</tt>  The dedicated IP warm-up process is complete, and
--   the IP address is ready to use.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:warmupStatus:DedicatedIp'] :: DedicatedIp -> WarmupStatus

-- | Indicates how complete the dedicated IP warm-up process is. When this
--   value equals 1, the address has completed the warm-up process and is
--   ready for use.
[$sel:warmupPercentage:DedicatedIp'] :: DedicatedIp -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>DedicatedIp</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:poolName:DedicatedIp'</a>, <a>dedicatedIp_poolName</a> - The
--   name of the dedicated IP pool that the IP address is associated with.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ip:DedicatedIp'</a>, <a>dedicatedIp_ip</a> - An IPv4 address.
--   
--   <a>$sel:warmupStatus:DedicatedIp'</a>, <a>dedicatedIp_warmupStatus</a>
--   - The warm-up status of a dedicated IP address. The status can have
--   one of the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt>  The IP address isn't ready to use because
--   the dedicated IP warm-up process is ongoing.</li>
--   <li><tt>DONE</tt>  The dedicated IP warm-up process is complete, and
--   the IP address is ready to use.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:warmupPercentage:DedicatedIp'</a>,
--   <a>dedicatedIp_warmupPercentage</a> - Indicates how complete the
--   dedicated IP warm-up process is. When this value equals 1, the address
--   has completed the warm-up process and is ready for use.
newDedicatedIp :: Text -> WarmupStatus -> Int -> DedicatedIp

-- | The name of the dedicated IP pool that the IP address is associated
--   with.
dedicatedIp_poolName :: Lens' DedicatedIp (Maybe Text)

-- | An IPv4 address.
dedicatedIp_ip :: Lens' DedicatedIp Text

-- | The warm-up status of a dedicated IP address. The status can have one
--   of the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt>  The IP address isn't ready to use because
--   the dedicated IP warm-up process is ongoing.</li>
--   <li><tt>DONE</tt>  The dedicated IP warm-up process is complete, and
--   the IP address is ready to use.</li>
--   </ul>
dedicatedIp_warmupStatus :: Lens' DedicatedIp WarmupStatus

-- | Indicates how complete the dedicated IP warm-up process is. When this
--   value equals 1, the address has completed the warm-up process and is
--   ready for use.
dedicatedIp_warmupPercentage :: Lens' DedicatedIp Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.SESV2.Types.DedicatedIp.DedicatedIp
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.SESV2.Types.DedicatedIp.DedicatedIp
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.SESV2.Types.DedicatedIp.DedicatedIp
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.SESV2.Types.DedicatedIp.DedicatedIp
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.SESV2.Types.DedicatedIp.DedicatedIp
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.SESV2.Types.DedicatedIp.DedicatedIp
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.SESV2.Types.DedicatedIp.DedicatedIp


module Amazonka.SESV2.Types

-- | API version <tt>2019-09-27</tt> of the Amazon Simple Email Service SDK
--   configuration.
defaultService :: Service

-- | The message can't be sent because it contains invalid content.
_MessageRejected :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The message can't be sent because the sending domain isn't verified.
_MailFromDomainNotVerifiedException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | If there is already an ongoing account details update under review.
_ConflictException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The resource you attempted to access doesn't exist.
_NotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Too many requests have been made to the operation.
_TooManyRequestsException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The resource is being modified by another operation or thread.
_ConcurrentModificationException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The specified request includes an invalid or expired token.
_InvalidNextTokenException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The message can't be sent because the account's ability to send email
--   has been permanently restricted.
_AccountSuspendedException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The message can't be sent because the account's ability to send email
--   is currently paused.
_SendingPausedException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The input you provided is invalid.
_BadRequestException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The resource specified in your request already exists.
_AlreadyExistsException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | There are too many instances of the specified resource type.
_LimitExceededException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The action to take if the required MX record can't be found when you
--   send an email. When you set this value to <tt>UseDefaultValue</tt>,
--   the mail is sent using <i>amazonses.com</i> as the MAIL FROM domain.
--   When you set this value to <tt>RejectMessage</tt>, the Amazon SES API
--   v2 returns a <tt>MailFromDomainNotVerified</tt> error, and doesn't
--   attempt to deliver the email.
--   
--   These behaviors are taken when the custom MAIL FROM domain
--   configuration is in the <tt>Pending</tt>, <tt>Failed</tt>, and
--   <tt>TemporaryFailure</tt> states.
newtype BehaviorOnMxFailure
BehaviorOnMxFailure' :: Text -> BehaviorOnMxFailure
[fromBehaviorOnMxFailure] :: BehaviorOnMxFailure -> Text
pattern BehaviorOnMxFailure_REJECT_MESSAGE :: BehaviorOnMxFailure
pattern BehaviorOnMxFailure_USE_DEFAULT_VALUE :: BehaviorOnMxFailure
newtype BulkEmailStatus
BulkEmailStatus' :: Text -> BulkEmailStatus
[fromBulkEmailStatus] :: BulkEmailStatus -> Text
pattern BulkEmailStatus_ACCOUNT_DAILY_QUOTA_EXCEEDED :: BulkEmailStatus
pattern BulkEmailStatus_ACCOUNT_SENDING_PAUSED :: BulkEmailStatus
pattern BulkEmailStatus_ACCOUNT_SUSPENDED :: BulkEmailStatus
pattern BulkEmailStatus_ACCOUNT_THROTTLED :: BulkEmailStatus
pattern BulkEmailStatus_CONFIGURATION_SET_NOT_FOUND :: BulkEmailStatus
pattern BulkEmailStatus_CONFIGURATION_SET_SENDING_PAUSED :: BulkEmailStatus
pattern BulkEmailStatus_FAILED :: BulkEmailStatus
pattern BulkEmailStatus_INVALID_PARAMETER :: BulkEmailStatus
pattern BulkEmailStatus_INVALID_SENDING_POOL_NAME :: BulkEmailStatus
pattern BulkEmailStatus_MAIL_FROM_DOMAIN_NOT_VERIFIED :: BulkEmailStatus
pattern BulkEmailStatus_MESSAGE_REJECTED :: BulkEmailStatus
pattern BulkEmailStatus_SUCCESS :: BulkEmailStatus
pattern BulkEmailStatus_TEMPLATE_NOT_FOUND :: BulkEmailStatus
pattern BulkEmailStatus_TRANSIENT_FAILURE :: BulkEmailStatus
newtype ContactLanguage

pattern ContactLanguage_EN :: ContactLanguage
pattern ContactLanguage_JA :: ContactLanguage
newtype ContactListImportAction

pattern ContactListImportAction_DELETE :: ContactListImportAction
pattern ContactListImportAction_PUT :: ContactListImportAction

-- | The data format of the import job's data source.
newtype DataFormat

pattern DataFormat_CSV :: DataFormat
pattern DataFormat_JSON :: DataFormat

-- | The current status of your Deliverability dashboard subscription. If
--   this value is <tt>PENDING_EXPIRATION</tt>, your subscription is
--   scheduled to expire at the end of the current calendar month.
newtype DeliverabilityDashboardAccountStatus
DeliverabilityDashboardAccountStatus' :: Text -> DeliverabilityDashboardAccountStatus
[fromDeliverabilityDashboardAccountStatus] :: DeliverabilityDashboardAccountStatus -> Text
pattern DeliverabilityDashboardAccountStatus_ACTIVE :: DeliverabilityDashboardAccountStatus
pattern DeliverabilityDashboardAccountStatus_DISABLED :: DeliverabilityDashboardAccountStatus
pattern DeliverabilityDashboardAccountStatus_PENDING_EXPIRATION :: DeliverabilityDashboardAccountStatus

-- | The status of a predictive inbox placement test. If the status is
--   <tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt>, then the predictive inbox placement test is
--   currently running. Predictive inbox placement tests are usually
--   complete within 24 hours of creating the test. If the status is
--   <tt>COMPLETE</tt>, then the test is finished, and you can use the
--   <tt>GetDeliverabilityTestReport</tt> operation to view the results of
--   the test.
newtype DeliverabilityTestStatus
DeliverabilityTestStatus' :: Text -> DeliverabilityTestStatus
[fromDeliverabilityTestStatus] :: DeliverabilityTestStatus -> Text
pattern DeliverabilityTestStatus_COMPLETED :: DeliverabilityTestStatus
pattern DeliverabilityTestStatus_IN_PROGRESS :: DeliverabilityTestStatus

-- | The location where the Amazon SES API v2 finds the value of a
--   dimension to publish to Amazon CloudWatch. To use the message tags
--   that you specify using an <tt>X-SES-MESSAGE-TAGS</tt> header or a
--   parameter to the <tt>SendEmail</tt> or <tt>SendRawEmail</tt> API,
--   choose <tt>messageTag</tt>. To use your own email headers, choose
--   <tt>emailHeader</tt>. To use link tags, choose <tt>linkTags</tt>.
newtype DimensionValueSource
DimensionValueSource' :: Text -> DimensionValueSource
[fromDimensionValueSource] :: DimensionValueSource -> Text
pattern DimensionValueSource_EMAIL_HEADER :: DimensionValueSource
pattern DimensionValueSource_LINK_TAG :: DimensionValueSource
pattern DimensionValueSource_MESSAGE_TAG :: DimensionValueSource
newtype DkimSigningAttributesOrigin
DkimSigningAttributesOrigin' :: Text -> DkimSigningAttributesOrigin
[fromDkimSigningAttributesOrigin] :: DkimSigningAttributesOrigin -> Text
pattern DkimSigningAttributesOrigin_AWS_SES :: DkimSigningAttributesOrigin
pattern DkimSigningAttributesOrigin_EXTERNAL :: DkimSigningAttributesOrigin
newtype DkimSigningKeyLength
DkimSigningKeyLength' :: Text -> DkimSigningKeyLength
[fromDkimSigningKeyLength] :: DkimSigningKeyLength -> Text
pattern DkimSigningKeyLength_RSA_1024_BIT :: DkimSigningKeyLength
pattern DkimSigningKeyLength_RSA_2048_BIT :: DkimSigningKeyLength

-- | The DKIM authentication status of the identity. The status can be one
--   of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>PENDING</tt>  The verification process was initiated, but
--   Amazon SES hasn't yet detected the DKIM records in the DNS
--   configuration for the domain.</li>
--   <li><tt>SUCCESS</tt>  The verification process completed
--   successfully.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt>  The verification process failed. This typically
--   occurs when Amazon SES fails to find the DKIM records in the DNS
--   configuration of the domain.</li>
--   <li><tt>TEMPORARY_FAILURE</tt>  A temporary issue is preventing
--   Amazon SES from determining the DKIM authentication status of the
--   domain.</li>
--   <li><tt>NOT_STARTED</tt>  The DKIM verification process hasn't been
--   initiated for the domain.</li>
--   </ul>
newtype DkimStatus
DkimStatus' :: Text -> DkimStatus
[fromDkimStatus] :: DkimStatus -> Text
pattern DkimStatus_FAILED :: DkimStatus
pattern DkimStatus_NOT_STARTED :: DkimStatus
pattern DkimStatus_PENDING :: DkimStatus
pattern DkimStatus_SUCCESS :: DkimStatus
pattern DkimStatus_TEMPORARY_FAILURE :: DkimStatus

-- | An email sending event type. For example, email sends, opens, and
--   bounces are all email events.
newtype EventType
EventType' :: Text -> EventType
[fromEventType] :: EventType -> Text
pattern EventType_BOUNCE :: EventType
pattern EventType_CLICK :: EventType
pattern EventType_COMPLAINT :: EventType
pattern EventType_DELIVERY :: EventType
pattern EventType_DELIVERY_DELAY :: EventType
pattern EventType_OPEN :: EventType
pattern EventType_REJECT :: EventType
pattern EventType_RENDERING_FAILURE :: EventType
pattern EventType_SEND :: EventType
pattern EventType_SUBSCRIPTION :: EventType
newtype IdentityType
IdentityType' :: Text -> IdentityType
[fromIdentityType] :: IdentityType -> Text
pattern IdentityType_DOMAIN :: IdentityType
pattern IdentityType_EMAIL_ADDRESS :: IdentityType
pattern IdentityType_MANAGED_DOMAIN :: IdentityType

-- | The destination of the import job, which can be used to list import
--   jobs that have a certain <tt>ImportDestinationType</tt>.
newtype ImportDestinationType
ImportDestinationType' :: Text -> ImportDestinationType
[fromImportDestinationType] :: ImportDestinationType -> Text
pattern ImportDestinationType_CONTACT_LIST :: ImportDestinationType
pattern ImportDestinationType_SUPPRESSION_LIST :: ImportDestinationType

-- | The status of the import job.
newtype JobStatus
JobStatus' :: Text -> JobStatus
[fromJobStatus] :: JobStatus -> Text
pattern JobStatus_COMPLETED :: JobStatus
pattern JobStatus_CREATED :: JobStatus
pattern JobStatus_FAILED :: JobStatus
pattern JobStatus_PROCESSING :: JobStatus

-- | The status of the MAIL FROM domain. This status can have the following
--   values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>PENDING</tt>  Amazon SES hasn't started searching for the MX
--   record yet.</li>
--   <li><tt>SUCCESS</tt>  Amazon SES detected the required MX record for
--   the MAIL FROM domain.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt>  Amazon SES can't find the required MX record, or
--   the record no longer exists.</li>
--   <li><tt>TEMPORARY_FAILURE</tt>  A temporary issue occurred, which
--   prevented Amazon SES from determining the status of the MAIL FROM
--   domain.</li>
--   </ul>
newtype MailFromDomainStatus
MailFromDomainStatus' :: Text -> MailFromDomainStatus
[fromMailFromDomainStatus] :: MailFromDomainStatus -> Text
pattern MailFromDomainStatus_FAILED :: MailFromDomainStatus
pattern MailFromDomainStatus_PENDING :: MailFromDomainStatus
pattern MailFromDomainStatus_SUCCESS :: MailFromDomainStatus
pattern MailFromDomainStatus_TEMPORARY_FAILURE :: MailFromDomainStatus
newtype MailType
MailType' :: Text -> MailType
[fromMailType] :: MailType -> Text
pattern MailType_MARKETING :: MailType
pattern MailType_TRANSACTIONAL :: MailType
newtype ReviewStatus
ReviewStatus' :: Text -> ReviewStatus
[fromReviewStatus] :: ReviewStatus -> Text
pattern ReviewStatus_DENIED :: ReviewStatus
pattern ReviewStatus_FAILED :: ReviewStatus
pattern ReviewStatus_GRANTED :: ReviewStatus
pattern ReviewStatus_PENDING :: ReviewStatus
newtype SubscriptionStatus
SubscriptionStatus' :: Text -> SubscriptionStatus
[fromSubscriptionStatus] :: SubscriptionStatus -> Text
pattern SubscriptionStatus_OPT_IN :: SubscriptionStatus
pattern SubscriptionStatus_OPT_OUT :: SubscriptionStatus

-- | The type of action to perform on the address. The following are
--   possible values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>PUT: add the addresses to the suppression list.</li>
--   <li>DELETE: remove the address from the suppression list.</li>
--   </ul>
newtype SuppressionListImportAction
SuppressionListImportAction' :: Text -> SuppressionListImportAction
[fromSuppressionListImportAction] :: SuppressionListImportAction -> Text
pattern SuppressionListImportAction_DELETE :: SuppressionListImportAction
pattern SuppressionListImportAction_PUT :: SuppressionListImportAction

-- | The reason that the address was added to the suppression list for your
--   account. The value can be one of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>COMPLAINT</tt>  Amazon SES added an email address to the
--   suppression list for your account because a message sent to that
--   address results in a complaint.</li>
--   <li><tt>BOUNCE</tt>  Amazon SES added an email address to the
--   suppression list for your account because a message sent to that
--   address results in a hard bounce.</li>
--   </ul>
newtype SuppressionListReason
SuppressionListReason' :: Text -> SuppressionListReason
[fromSuppressionListReason] :: SuppressionListReason -> Text
pattern SuppressionListReason_BOUNCE :: SuppressionListReason
pattern SuppressionListReason_COMPLAINT :: SuppressionListReason

-- | Specifies whether messages that use the configuration set are required
--   to use Transport Layer Security (TLS). If the value is
--   <tt>Require</tt>, messages are only delivered if a TLS connection can
--   be established. If the value is <tt>Optional</tt>, messages can be
--   delivered in plain text if a TLS connection can't be established.
newtype TlsPolicy
TlsPolicy' :: Text -> TlsPolicy
[fromTlsPolicy] :: TlsPolicy -> Text
pattern TlsPolicy_OPTIONAL :: TlsPolicy
pattern TlsPolicy_REQUIRE :: TlsPolicy

-- | The warmup status of a dedicated IP.
newtype WarmupStatus
WarmupStatus' :: Text -> WarmupStatus
[fromWarmupStatus] :: WarmupStatus -> Text
pattern WarmupStatus_DONE :: WarmupStatus
pattern WarmupStatus_IN_PROGRESS :: WarmupStatus

-- | An object that contains information about your account details.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAccountDetails</a> smart constructor.
data AccountDetails
AccountDetails' :: Maybe ReviewDetails -> Maybe MailType -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe ContactLanguage -> Maybe (Sensitive (NonEmpty (Sensitive Text))) -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> AccountDetails

-- | Information about the review of the latest details you submitted.
[$sel:reviewDetails:AccountDetails'] :: AccountDetails -> Maybe ReviewDetails

-- | The type of email your account is sending. The mail type can be one of
--   the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>MARKETING</tt>  Most of your sending traffic is to keep your
--   customers informed of your latest offering.</li>
--   <li><tt>TRANSACTIONAL</tt>  Most of your sending traffic is to
--   communicate during a transaction with a customer.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:mailType:AccountDetails'] :: AccountDetails -> Maybe MailType

-- | A description of the types of email that you plan to send.
[$sel:useCaseDescription:AccountDetails'] :: AccountDetails -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | The language you would prefer for the case. The contact language can
--   be one of <tt>ENGLISH</tt> or <tt>JAPANESE</tt>.
[$sel:contactLanguage:AccountDetails'] :: AccountDetails -> Maybe ContactLanguage

-- | Additional email addresses where updates are sent about your account
--   review process.
[$sel:additionalContactEmailAddresses:AccountDetails'] :: AccountDetails -> Maybe (Sensitive (NonEmpty (Sensitive Text)))

-- | The URL of your website. This information helps us better understand
--   the type of content that you plan to send.
[$sel:websiteURL:AccountDetails'] :: AccountDetails -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | Create a value of <a>AccountDetails</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:reviewDetails:AccountDetails'</a>,
--   <a>accountDetails_reviewDetails</a> - Information about the review of
--   the latest details you submitted.
--   
--   <a>$sel:mailType:AccountDetails'</a>, <a>accountDetails_mailType</a> -
--   The type of email your account is sending. The mail type can be one of
--   the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>MARKETING</tt>  Most of your sending traffic is to keep your
--   customers informed of your latest offering.</li>
--   <li><tt>TRANSACTIONAL</tt>  Most of your sending traffic is to
--   communicate during a transaction with a customer.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:useCaseDescription:AccountDetails'</a>,
--   <a>accountDetails_useCaseDescription</a> - A description of the types
--   of email that you plan to send.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contactLanguage:AccountDetails'</a>,
--   <a>accountDetails_contactLanguage</a> - The language you would prefer
--   for the case. The contact language can be one of <tt>ENGLISH</tt> or
--   <tt>JAPANESE</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:additionalContactEmailAddresses:AccountDetails'</a>,
--   <a>accountDetails_additionalContactEmailAddresses</a> - Additional
--   email addresses where updates are sent about your account review
--   process.
--   
--   <a>$sel:websiteURL:AccountDetails'</a>,
--   <a>accountDetails_websiteURL</a> - The URL of your website. This
--   information helps us better understand the type of content that you
--   plan to send.
newAccountDetails :: AccountDetails

-- | Information about the review of the latest details you submitted.
accountDetails_reviewDetails :: Lens' AccountDetails (Maybe ReviewDetails)

-- | The type of email your account is sending. The mail type can be one of
--   the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>MARKETING</tt>  Most of your sending traffic is to keep your
--   customers informed of your latest offering.</li>
--   <li><tt>TRANSACTIONAL</tt>  Most of your sending traffic is to
--   communicate during a transaction with a customer.</li>
--   </ul>
accountDetails_mailType :: Lens' AccountDetails (Maybe MailType)

-- | A description of the types of email that you plan to send.
accountDetails_useCaseDescription :: Lens' AccountDetails (Maybe Text)

-- | The language you would prefer for the case. The contact language can
--   be one of <tt>ENGLISH</tt> or <tt>JAPANESE</tt>.
accountDetails_contactLanguage :: Lens' AccountDetails (Maybe ContactLanguage)

-- | Additional email addresses where updates are sent about your account
--   review process.
accountDetails_additionalContactEmailAddresses :: Lens' AccountDetails (Maybe (NonEmpty Text))

-- | The URL of your website. This information helps us better understand
--   the type of content that you plan to send.
accountDetails_websiteURL :: Lens' AccountDetails (Maybe Text)

-- | An object that contains information about a blacklisting event that
--   impacts one of the dedicated IP addresses that is associated with your
--   account.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBlacklistEntry</a> smart constructor.
data BlacklistEntry
BlacklistEntry' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> BlacklistEntry

-- | The time when the blacklisting event occurred, shown in Unix time
--   format.
[$sel:listingTime:BlacklistEntry'] :: BlacklistEntry -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The name of the blacklist that the IP address appears on.
[$sel:rblName:BlacklistEntry'] :: BlacklistEntry -> Maybe Text

-- | Additional information about the blacklisting event, as provided by
--   the blacklist maintainer.
[$sel:description:BlacklistEntry'] :: BlacklistEntry -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>BlacklistEntry</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:listingTime:BlacklistEntry'</a>,
--   <a>blacklistEntry_listingTime</a> - The time when the blacklisting
--   event occurred, shown in Unix time format.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rblName:BlacklistEntry'</a>, <a>blacklistEntry_rblName</a> -
--   The name of the blacklist that the IP address appears on.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:BlacklistEntry'</a>,
--   <a>blacklistEntry_description</a> - Additional information about the
--   blacklisting event, as provided by the blacklist maintainer.
newBlacklistEntry :: BlacklistEntry

-- | The time when the blacklisting event occurred, shown in Unix time
--   format.
blacklistEntry_listingTime :: Lens' BlacklistEntry (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The name of the blacklist that the IP address appears on.
blacklistEntry_rblName :: Lens' BlacklistEntry (Maybe Text)

-- | Additional information about the blacklisting event, as provided by
--   the blacklist maintainer.
blacklistEntry_description :: Lens' BlacklistEntry (Maybe Text)

-- | Represents the body of the email message.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBody</a> smart constructor.
data Body
Body' :: Maybe Content -> Maybe Content -> Body

-- | An object that represents the version of the message that is displayed
--   in email clients that don't support HTML, or clients where the
--   recipient has disabled HTML rendering.
[$sel:text:Body'] :: Body -> Maybe Content

-- | An object that represents the version of the message that is displayed
--   in email clients that support HTML. HTML messages can include
--   formatted text, hyperlinks, images, and more.
[$sel:html:Body'] :: Body -> Maybe Content

-- | Create a value of <a>Body</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:text:Body'</a>, <a>body_text</a> - An object that represents
--   the version of the message that is displayed in email clients that
--   don't support HTML, or clients where the recipient has disabled HTML
--   rendering.
--   
--   <a>$sel:html:Body'</a>, <a>body_html</a> - An object that represents
--   the version of the message that is displayed in email clients that
--   support HTML. HTML messages can include formatted text, hyperlinks,
--   images, and more.
newBody :: Body

-- | An object that represents the version of the message that is displayed
--   in email clients that don't support HTML, or clients where the
--   recipient has disabled HTML rendering.
body_text :: Lens' Body (Maybe Content)

-- | An object that represents the version of the message that is displayed
--   in email clients that support HTML. HTML messages can include
--   formatted text, hyperlinks, images, and more.
body_html :: Lens' Body (Maybe Content)

-- | An object that contains the body of the message. You can specify a
--   template message.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBulkEmailContent</a> smart constructor.
data BulkEmailContent
BulkEmailContent' :: Maybe Template -> BulkEmailContent

-- | The template to use for the bulk email message.
[$sel:template:BulkEmailContent'] :: BulkEmailContent -> Maybe Template

-- | Create a value of <a>BulkEmailContent</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   <a>bulkEmailContent_template</a> - The template to use for the bulk
--   email message.
newBulkEmailContent :: BulkEmailContent

bulkEmailContent_template :: Lens' BulkEmailContent (Maybe Template)

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newBulkEmailEntry</a> smart constructor.
data BulkEmailEntry
BulkEmailEntry' :: Maybe ReplacementEmailContent -> Maybe [MessageTag] -> Destination -> BulkEmailEntry

-- | The <tt>ReplacementEmailContent</tt> associated with a
--   <tt>BulkEmailEntry</tt>.
[$sel:replacementEmailContent:BulkEmailEntry'] :: BulkEmailEntry -> Maybe ReplacementEmailContent

-- | A list of tags, in the form of name/value pairs, to apply to an email
--   that you send using the <tt>SendBulkTemplatedEmail</tt> operation.
--   Tags correspond to characteristics of the email that you define, so
--   that you can publish email sending events.
[$sel:replacementTags:BulkEmailEntry'] :: BulkEmailEntry -> Maybe [MessageTag]

-- | Represents the destination of the message, consisting of To:, CC:, and
--   BCC: fields.
--   
--   Amazon SES does not support the SMTPUTF8 extension, as described in
--   <a>RFC6531</a>. For this reason, the local part of a destination email
--   address (the part of the email address that precedes the @ sign) may
--   only contain <a>7-bit ASCII characters</a>. If the domain part of an
--   address (the part after the @ sign) contains non-ASCII characters,
--   they must be encoded using Punycode, as described in <a>RFC3492</a>.
[$sel:destination:BulkEmailEntry'] :: BulkEmailEntry -> Destination

-- | Create a value of <a>BulkEmailEntry</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:replacementEmailContent:BulkEmailEntry'</a>,
--   <a>bulkEmailEntry_replacementEmailContent</a> - The
--   <tt>ReplacementEmailContent</tt> associated with a
--   <tt>BulkEmailEntry</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:replacementTags:BulkEmailEntry'</a>,
--   <a>bulkEmailEntry_replacementTags</a> - A list of tags, in the form of
--   name/value pairs, to apply to an email that you send using the
--   <tt>SendBulkTemplatedEmail</tt> operation. Tags correspond to
--   characteristics of the email that you define, so that you can publish
--   email sending events.
--   
--   <a>$sel:destination:BulkEmailEntry'</a>,
--   <a>bulkEmailEntry_destination</a> - Represents the destination of the
--   message, consisting of To:, CC:, and BCC: fields.
--   
--   Amazon SES does not support the SMTPUTF8 extension, as described in
--   <a>RFC6531</a>. For this reason, the local part of a destination email
--   address (the part of the email address that precedes the @ sign) may
--   only contain <a>7-bit ASCII characters</a>. If the domain part of an
--   address (the part after the @ sign) contains non-ASCII characters,
--   they must be encoded using Punycode, as described in <a>RFC3492</a>.
newBulkEmailEntry :: Destination -> BulkEmailEntry

-- | The <tt>ReplacementEmailContent</tt> associated with a
--   <tt>BulkEmailEntry</tt>.
bulkEmailEntry_replacementEmailContent :: Lens' BulkEmailEntry (Maybe ReplacementEmailContent)

-- | A list of tags, in the form of name/value pairs, to apply to an email
--   that you send using the <tt>SendBulkTemplatedEmail</tt> operation.
--   Tags correspond to characteristics of the email that you define, so
--   that you can publish email sending events.
bulkEmailEntry_replacementTags :: Lens' BulkEmailEntry (Maybe [MessageTag])

-- | Represents the destination of the message, consisting of To:, CC:, and
--   BCC: fields.
--   
--   Amazon SES does not support the SMTPUTF8 extension, as described in
--   <a>RFC6531</a>. For this reason, the local part of a destination email
--   address (the part of the email address that precedes the @ sign) may
--   only contain <a>7-bit ASCII characters</a>. If the domain part of an
--   address (the part after the @ sign) contains non-ASCII characters,
--   they must be encoded using Punycode, as described in <a>RFC3492</a>.
bulkEmailEntry_destination :: Lens' BulkEmailEntry Destination

-- | The result of the <tt>SendBulkEmail</tt> operation of each specified
--   <tt>BulkEmailEntry</tt>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBulkEmailEntryResult</a> smart constructor.
data BulkEmailEntryResult
BulkEmailEntryResult' :: Maybe BulkEmailStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> BulkEmailEntryResult

-- | The status of a message sent using the <tt>SendBulkTemplatedEmail</tt>
--   operation.
--   
--   Possible values for this parameter include:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>SUCCESS: Amazon SES accepted the message, and will attempt to
--   deliver it to the recipients.</li>
--   <li>MESSAGE_REJECTED: The message was rejected because it contained a
--   virus.</li>
--   <li>MAIL_FROM_DOMAIN_NOT_VERIFIED: The sender's email address or
--   domain was not verified.</li>
--   <li>CONFIGURATION_SET_DOES_NOT_EXIST: The configuration set you
--   specified does not exist.</li>
--   <li>TEMPLATE_DOES_NOT_EXIST: The template you specified does not
--   exist.</li>
--   <li>ACCOUNT_SUSPENDED: Your account has been shut down because of
--   issues related to your email sending practices.</li>
--   <li>ACCOUNT_THROTTLED: The number of emails you can send has been
--   reduced because your account has exceeded its allocated sending
--   limit.</li>
--   <li>ACCOUNT_DAILY_QUOTA_EXCEEDED: You have reached or exceeded the
--   maximum number of emails you can send from your account in a 24-hour
--   period.</li>
--   <li>INVALID_SENDING_POOL_NAME: The configuration set you specified
--   refers to an IP pool that does not exist.</li>
--   <li>ACCOUNT_SENDING_PAUSED: Email sending for the Amazon SES account
--   was disabled using the <a>UpdateAccountSendingEnabled</a>
--   operation.</li>
--   <li>CONFIGURATION_SET_SENDING_PAUSED: Email sending for this
--   configuration set was disabled using the
--   <a>UpdateConfigurationSetSendingEnabled</a> operation.</li>
--   <li>INVALID_PARAMETER_VALUE: One or more of the parameters you
--   specified when calling this operation was invalid. See the error
--   message for additional information.</li>
--   <li>TRANSIENT_FAILURE: Amazon SES was unable to process your request
--   because of a temporary issue.</li>
--   <li>FAILED: Amazon SES was unable to process your request. See the
--   error message for additional information.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:status:BulkEmailEntryResult'] :: BulkEmailEntryResult -> Maybe BulkEmailStatus

-- | A description of an error that prevented a message being sent using
--   the <tt>SendBulkTemplatedEmail</tt> operation.
[$sel:error:BulkEmailEntryResult'] :: BulkEmailEntryResult -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique message identifier returned from the
--   <tt>SendBulkTemplatedEmail</tt> operation.
[$sel:messageId:BulkEmailEntryResult'] :: BulkEmailEntryResult -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>BulkEmailEntryResult</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:BulkEmailEntryResult'</a>,

--   
--   Possible values for this parameter include:

--   <li>SUCCESS: Amazon SES accepted the message, and will attempt to
--   deliver it to the recipients.</li>
--   <li>MESSAGE_REJECTED: The message was rejected because it contained a

--   specified does not exist.</li>
--   <li>TEMPLATE_DOES_NOT_EXIST: The template you specified does not
--   exist.</li>
--   <li>ACCOUNT_SUSPENDED: Your account has been shut down because of
--   issues related to your email sending practices.</li>
--   <li>ACCOUNT_THROTTLED: The number of emails you can send has been
--   reduced because your account has exceeded its allocated sending
--   limit.</li>

--   refers to an IP pool that does not exist.</li>
--   <li>ACCOUNT_SENDING_PAUSED: Email sending for the Amazon SES account

--   operation.</li>

--   <a>UpdateConfigurationSetSendingEnabled</a> operation.</li>

--   error message for additional information.</li>
--   </ul>
