--   <a>bulkEmailEntryResult_error</a> - A description of an error that
--   prevented a message being sent using the
--   <tt>SendBulkTemplatedEmail</tt> operation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:messageId:BulkEmailEntryResult'</a>,
--   <a>bulkEmailEntryResult_messageId</a> - The unique message identifier
--   returned from the <tt>SendBulkTemplatedEmail</tt> operation.
newBulkEmailEntryResult :: BulkEmailEntryResult

-- | The status of a message sent using the <tt>SendBulkTemplatedEmail</tt>
--   operation.
--   
--   Possible values for this parameter include:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>SUCCESS: Amazon SES accepted the message, and will attempt to
--   deliver it to the recipients.</li>
--   <li>MESSAGE_REJECTED: The message was rejected because it contained a
--   virus.</li>
--   <li>MAIL_FROM_DOMAIN_NOT_VERIFIED: The sender's email address or

--   specified does not exist.</li>
--   <li>TEMPLATE_DOES_NOT_EXIST: The template you specified does not
--   exist.</li>
--   <li>ACCOUNT_SUSPENDED: Your account has been shut down because of
--   issues related to your email sending practices.</li>

--   reduced because your account has exceeded its allocated sending
--   limit.</li>

--   maximum number of emails you can send from your account in a 24-hour
--   period.</li>
--   <li>INVALID_SENDING_POOL_NAME: The configuration set you specified

--   error message for additional information.</li>
--   </ul>
bulkEmailEntryResult_status :: Lens' BulkEmailEntryResult (Maybe BulkEmailStatus)

-- | An object that defines an Amazon CloudWatch destination for email
--   events. You can use Amazon CloudWatch to monitor and gain insights on
--   your email sending metrics.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCloudWatchDestination</a> smart constructor.
data CloudWatchDestination
CloudWatchDestination' :: [CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration] -> CloudWatchDestination

-- | An array of objects that define the dimensions to use when you send
--   email events to Amazon CloudWatch.
[$sel:dimensionConfigurations:CloudWatchDestination'] :: CloudWatchDestination -> [CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration]

-- | Create a value of <a>CloudWatchDestination</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   <a>cloudWatchDestination_dimensionConfigurations</a> - An array of
--   objects that define the dimensions to use when you send email events
--   to Amazon CloudWatch.
newCloudWatchDestination :: CloudWatchDestination

-- | An array of objects that define the dimensions to use when you send
--   email events to Amazon CloudWatch.
cloudWatchDestination_dimensionConfigurations :: Lens' CloudWatchDestination [CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration]

-- | An object that defines the dimension configuration to use when you
--   send email events to Amazon CloudWatch.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCloudWatchDimensionConfiguration</a> smart
--   constructor.
data CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration
CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration' :: Text -> DimensionValueSource -> Text -> CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration

-- | The name of an Amazon CloudWatch dimension associated with an email
--   sending metric. The name has to meet the following criteria:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>It can only contain ASCII letters (az, AZ), numbers (09),
--   underscores (_), or dashes (-).</li>
--   <li>It can contain no more than 256 characters.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:dimensionName:CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration'] :: CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration -> Text

-- | The location where the Amazon SES API v2 finds the value of a
--   dimension to publish to Amazon CloudWatch. To use the message tags
--   that you specify using an <tt>X-SES-MESSAGE-TAGS</tt> header or a
--   parameter to the <tt>SendEmail</tt> or <tt>SendRawEmail</tt> API,
--   choose <tt>messageTag</tt>. To use your own email headers, choose
--   <tt>emailHeader</tt>. To use link tags, choose <tt>linkTags</tt>.
[$sel:dimensionValueSource:CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration'] :: CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration -> DimensionValueSource

-- | The default value of the dimension that is published to Amazon
--   CloudWatch if you don't provide the value of the dimension when you
--   send an email. This value has to meet the following criteria:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>It can only contain ASCII letters (az, AZ), numbers (09),
--   underscores (_), or dashes (-).</li>
--   <li>It can contain no more than 256 characters.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:defaultDimensionValue:CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration'] :: CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:dimensionName:CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>cloudWatchDimensionConfiguration_dimensionName</a> - The name of an
--   Amazon CloudWatch dimension associated with an email sending metric.
--   The name has to meet the following criteria:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>It can only contain ASCII letters (az, AZ), numbers (09),
--   underscores (_), or dashes (-).</li>
--   <li>It can contain no more than 256 characters.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:dimensionValueSource:CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>cloudWatchDimensionConfiguration_dimensionValueSource</a> - The
--   location where the Amazon SES API v2 finds the value of a dimension to
--   publish to Amazon CloudWatch. To use the message tags that you specify
--   using an <tt>X-SES-MESSAGE-TAGS</tt> header or a parameter to the
--   <tt>SendEmail</tt> or <tt>SendRawEmail</tt> API, choose
--   <tt>messageTag</tt>. To use your own email headers, choose
--   <tt>emailHeader</tt>. To use link tags, choose <tt>linkTags</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultDimensionValue:CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>cloudWatchDimensionConfiguration_defaultDimensionValue</a> - The
--   default value of the dimension that is published to Amazon CloudWatch
--   if you don't provide the value of the dimension when you send an
--   email. This value has to meet the following criteria:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>It can only contain ASCII letters (az, AZ), numbers (09),
--   underscores (_), or dashes (-).</li>
--   <li>It can contain no more than 256 characters.</li>
--   </ul>
newCloudWatchDimensionConfiguration :: Text -> DimensionValueSource -> Text -> CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration

-- | The name of an Amazon CloudWatch dimension associated with an email
--   sending metric. The name has to meet the following criteria:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>It can only contain ASCII letters (az, AZ), numbers (09),
--   underscores (_), or dashes (-).</li>
--   <li>It can contain no more than 256 characters.</li>
--   </ul>
cloudWatchDimensionConfiguration_dimensionName :: Lens' CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration Text

-- | The location where the Amazon SES API v2 finds the value of a
--   dimension to publish to Amazon CloudWatch. To use the message tags
--   that you specify using an <tt>X-SES-MESSAGE-TAGS</tt> header or a
--   parameter to the <tt>SendEmail</tt> or <tt>SendRawEmail</tt> API,
--   choose <tt>messageTag</tt>. To use your own email headers, choose
--   <tt>emailHeader</tt>. To use link tags, choose <tt>linkTags</tt>.
cloudWatchDimensionConfiguration_dimensionValueSource :: Lens' CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration DimensionValueSource

-- | The default value of the dimension that is published to Amazon
--   CloudWatch if you don't provide the value of the dimension when you
--   send an email. This value has to meet the following criteria:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>It can only contain ASCII letters (az, AZ), numbers (09),
--   underscores (_), or dashes (-).</li>
--   <li>It can contain no more than 256 characters.</li>
--   </ul>
cloudWatchDimensionConfiguration_defaultDimensionValue :: Lens' CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration Text

-- | A contact is the end-user who is receiving the email.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newContact</a> smart constructor.
data Contact
Contact' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe [TopicPreference] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe [TopicPreference] -> Contact

-- | A boolean value status noting if the contact is unsubscribed from all
--   contact list topics.
[$sel:unsubscribeAll:Contact'] :: Contact -> Maybe Bool

-- | The default topic preferences applied to the contact.
[$sel:topicDefaultPreferences:Contact'] :: Contact -> Maybe [TopicPreference]

-- | The contact's email address.
[$sel:emailAddress:Contact'] :: Contact -> Maybe Text

-- | A timestamp noting the last time the contact's information was
--   updated.
[$sel:lastUpdatedTimestamp:Contact'] :: Contact -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The contact's preference for being opted-in to or opted-out of a
--   topic.
[$sel:topicPreferences:Contact'] :: Contact -> Maybe [TopicPreference]

-- | Create a value of <a>Contact</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:unsubscribeAll:Contact'</a>, <a>contact_unsubscribeAll</a> - A
--   boolean value status noting if the contact is unsubscribed from all
--   contact list topics.
--   
--   <a>$sel:topicDefaultPreferences:Contact'</a>,
--   <a>contact_topicDefaultPreferences</a> - The default topic preferences
--   applied to the contact.
--   
--   <a>$sel:emailAddress:Contact'</a>, <a>contact_emailAddress</a> - The
--   contact's email address.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastUpdatedTimestamp:Contact'</a>,
--   <a>contact_lastUpdatedTimestamp</a> - A timestamp noting the last time
--   the contact's information was updated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:topicPreferences:Contact'</a>, <a>contact_topicPreferences</a>
--   - The contact's preference for being opted-in to or opted-out of a
--   topic.
newContact :: Contact

-- | A boolean value status noting if the contact is unsubscribed from all
--   contact list topics.
contact_unsubscribeAll :: Lens' Contact (Maybe Bool)

-- | The default topic preferences applied to the contact.
contact_topicDefaultPreferences :: Lens' Contact (Maybe [TopicPreference])

-- | The contact's email address.
contact_emailAddress :: Lens' Contact (Maybe Text)

-- | A timestamp noting the last time the contact's information was
--   updated.
contact_lastUpdatedTimestamp :: Lens' Contact (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The contact's preference for being opted-in to or opted-out of a
--   topic.
contact_topicPreferences :: Lens' Contact (Maybe [TopicPreference])

-- | A list that contains contacts that have subscribed to a particular
--   topic or topics.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newContactList</a> smart constructor.
data ContactList

-- | The name of the contact list.

--   time the contact list was updated.
newContactList :: ContactList

-- | An object that contains details about the action of a contact list.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newContactListDestination</a> smart constructor.
data ContactListDestination
ContactListDestination' :: Text -> ContactListImportAction -> ContactListDestination

-- | The name of the contact list.
[$sel:contactListName:ContactListDestination'] :: ContactListDestination -> Text

-- | <pre>
--   The type of action to perform on the addresses. The following are the
--   </pre>
--   
--   possible values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>PUT: add the addresses to the contact list. If the record already
--   exists, it will override it with the new value.</li>
--   <li>DELETE: remove the addresses from the contact list.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:contactListImportAction:ContactListDestination'] :: ContactListDestination -> ContactListImportAction

-- | Create a value of <a>ContactListDestination</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   <a>contactListDestination_contactListName</a> - The name of the
--   contact list.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contactListImportAction:ContactListDestination'</a>,
--   <a>contactListDestination_contactListImportAction</a> - &gt;The type
--   of action to perform on the addresses. The following are the possible
--   values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>PUT: add the addresses to the contact list. If the record already
--   exists, it will override it with the new value.</li>
--   <li>DELETE: remove the addresses from the contact list.</li>
--   </ul>
newContactListDestination :: Text -> ContactListImportAction -> ContactListDestination

-- | The name of the contact list.
contactListDestination_contactListName :: Lens' ContactListDestination Text

-- | <pre>
--   The type of action to perform on the addresses. The following are the
--   </pre>
--   
--   possible values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>PUT: add the addresses to the contact list. If the record already
--   exists, it will override it with the new value.</li>
--   <li>DELETE: remove the addresses from the contact list.</li>
--   </ul>
contactListDestination_contactListImportAction :: Lens' ContactListDestination ContactListImportAction

-- | An object that represents the content of the email, and optionally a
--   character set specification.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newContent</a> smart constructor.
data Content
Content' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> Content

-- | The character set for the content. Because of the constraints of the
--   SMTP protocol, Amazon SES uses 7-bit ASCII by default. If the text
--   includes characters outside of the ASCII range, you have to specify a
--   character set. For example, you could specify <tt>UTF-8</tt>,
--   <tt>ISO-8859-1</tt>, or <tt>Shift_JIS</tt>.
[$sel:charset:Content'] :: Content -> Maybe Text

-- | The content of the message itself.
[$sel:data':Content'] :: Content -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Content</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:charset:Content'</a>, <a>content_charset</a> - The character
--   set for the content. Because of the constraints of the SMTP protocol,
--   Amazon SES uses 7-bit ASCII by default. If the text includes
--   characters outside of the ASCII range, you have to specify a character
--   set. For example, you could specify <tt>UTF-8</tt>,
--   <tt>ISO-8859-1</tt>, or <tt>Shift_JIS</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:data':Content'</a>, <a>content_data</a> - The content of the
--   message itself.
newContent :: Text -> Content

-- | The character set for the content. Because of the constraints of the
--   SMTP protocol, Amazon SES uses 7-bit ASCII by default. If the text
--   includes characters outside of the ASCII range, you have to specify a
--   character set. For example, you could specify <tt>UTF-8</tt>,
--   <tt>ISO-8859-1</tt>, or <tt>Shift_JIS</tt>.
content_charset :: Lens' Content (Maybe Text)

-- | The content of the message itself.
content_data :: Lens' Content Text

-- | Contains information about a custom verification email template.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCustomVerificationEmailTemplateMetadata</a> smart
--   constructor.
data CustomVerificationEmailTemplateMetadata
CustomVerificationEmailTemplateMetadata' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> CustomVerificationEmailTemplateMetadata

-- | The email address that the custom verification email is sent from.
[$sel:fromEmailAddress:CustomVerificationEmailTemplateMetadata'] :: CustomVerificationEmailTemplateMetadata -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the custom verification email template.
[$sel:templateName:CustomVerificationEmailTemplateMetadata'] :: CustomVerificationEmailTemplateMetadata -> Maybe Text

-- | The URL that the recipient of the verification email is sent to if his
--   or her address is not successfully verified.
[$sel:failureRedirectionURL:CustomVerificationEmailTemplateMetadata'] :: CustomVerificationEmailTemplateMetadata -> Maybe Text

-- | The subject line of the custom verification email.
[$sel:templateSubject:CustomVerificationEmailTemplateMetadata'] :: CustomVerificationEmailTemplateMetadata -> Maybe Text

-- | The URL that the recipient of the verification email is sent to if his
--   or her address is successfully verified.
[$sel:successRedirectionURL:CustomVerificationEmailTemplateMetadata'] :: CustomVerificationEmailTemplateMetadata -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CustomVerificationEmailTemplateMetadata</a> with
--   all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:fromEmailAddress:CustomVerificationEmailTemplateMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>customVerificationEmailTemplateMetadata_fromEmailAddress</a> - The
--   email address that the custom verification email is sent from.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateName:CustomVerificationEmailTemplateMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>customVerificationEmailTemplateMetadata_templateName</a> - The name
--   of the custom verification email template.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:failureRedirectionURL:CustomVerificationEmailTemplateMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>customVerificationEmailTemplateMetadata_failureRedirectionURL</a> -
--   The URL that the recipient of the verification email is sent to if his
--   or her address is not successfully verified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateSubject:CustomVerificationEmailTemplateMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>customVerificationEmailTemplateMetadata_templateSubject</a> - The
--   subject line of the custom verification email.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:successRedirectionURL:CustomVerificationEmailTemplateMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>customVerificationEmailTemplateMetadata_successRedirectionURL</a> -
--   The URL that the recipient of the verification email is sent to if his
--   or her address is successfully verified.
newCustomVerificationEmailTemplateMetadata :: CustomVerificationEmailTemplateMetadata

-- | The email address that the custom verification email is sent from.
customVerificationEmailTemplateMetadata_fromEmailAddress :: Lens' CustomVerificationEmailTemplateMetadata (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the custom verification email template.
customVerificationEmailTemplateMetadata_templateName :: Lens' CustomVerificationEmailTemplateMetadata (Maybe Text)

-- | The URL that the recipient of the verification email is sent to if his
--   or her address is not successfully verified.
customVerificationEmailTemplateMetadata_failureRedirectionURL :: Lens' CustomVerificationEmailTemplateMetadata (Maybe Text)

-- | The subject line of the custom verification email.
customVerificationEmailTemplateMetadata_templateSubject :: Lens' CustomVerificationEmailTemplateMetadata (Maybe Text)

-- | The URL that the recipient of the verification email is sent to if his
--   or her address is successfully verified.
customVerificationEmailTemplateMetadata_successRedirectionURL :: Lens' CustomVerificationEmailTemplateMetadata (Maybe Text)

-- | An object that contains information about the volume of email sent on
--   each day of the analysis period.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDailyVolume</a> smart constructor.
data DailyVolume
DailyVolume' :: Maybe [DomainIspPlacement] -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe VolumeStatistics -> DailyVolume

-- | An object that contains inbox placement metrics for a specified day in
--   the analysis period, broken out by the recipient's email provider.
[$sel:domainIspPlacements:DailyVolume'] :: DailyVolume -> Maybe [DomainIspPlacement]

-- | The date that the DailyVolume metrics apply to, in Unix time.
[$sel:startDate:DailyVolume'] :: DailyVolume -> Maybe POSIX

-- | An object that contains inbox placement metrics for a specific day in
--   the analysis period.
[$sel:volumeStatistics:DailyVolume'] :: DailyVolume -> Maybe VolumeStatistics

-- | Create a value of <a>DailyVolume</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:domainIspPlacements:DailyVolume'</a>,
--   <a>dailyVolume_domainIspPlacements</a> - An object that contains inbox
--   placement metrics for a specified day in the analysis period, broken
--   out by the recipient's email provider.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startDate:DailyVolume'</a>, <a>dailyVolume_startDate</a> - The
--   date that the DailyVolume metrics apply to, in Unix time.
--   
--   <a>$sel:volumeStatistics:DailyVolume'</a>,
--   <a>dailyVolume_volumeStatistics</a> - An object that contains inbox
--   placement metrics for a specific day in the analysis period.
newDailyVolume :: DailyVolume

-- | An object that contains inbox placement metrics for a specified day in
--   the analysis period, broken out by the recipient's email provider.
dailyVolume_domainIspPlacements :: Lens' DailyVolume (Maybe [DomainIspPlacement])

-- | The date that the DailyVolume metrics apply to, in Unix time.
dailyVolume_startDate :: Lens' DailyVolume (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | An object that contains inbox placement metrics for a specific day in
--   the analysis period.
dailyVolume_volumeStatistics :: Lens' DailyVolume (Maybe VolumeStatistics)

-- | Contains information about a dedicated IP address that is associated
--   with your Amazon SES account.
--   
--   To learn more about requesting dedicated IP addresses, see
--   <a>Requesting and Relinquishing Dedicated IP Addresses</a> in the
--   <i>Amazon SES Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDedicatedIp</a> smart constructor.
data DedicatedIp
DedicatedIp' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> WarmupStatus -> Int -> DedicatedIp

-- | The name of the dedicated IP pool that the IP address is associated
--   with.
[$sel:poolName:DedicatedIp'] :: DedicatedIp -> Maybe Text

-- | An IPv4 address.
[$sel:ip:DedicatedIp'] :: DedicatedIp -> Text

-- | The warm-up status of a dedicated IP address. The status can have one
--   of the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt>  The IP address isn't ready to use because
--   the dedicated IP warm-up process is ongoing.</li>
--   <li><tt>DONE</tt>  The dedicated IP warm-up process is complete, and
--   the IP address is ready to use.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:warmupStatus:DedicatedIp'] :: DedicatedIp -> WarmupStatus

-- | Indicates how complete the dedicated IP warm-up process is. When this
--   value equals 1, the address has completed the warm-up process and is
--   ready for use.
[$sel:warmupPercentage:DedicatedIp'] :: DedicatedIp -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>DedicatedIp</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:poolName:DedicatedIp'</a>, <a>dedicatedIp_poolName</a> - The
--   name of the dedicated IP pool that the IP address is associated with.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ip:DedicatedIp'</a>, <a>dedicatedIp_ip</a> - An IPv4 address.
--   
--   <a>$sel:warmupStatus:DedicatedIp'</a>, <a>dedicatedIp_warmupStatus</a>
--   - The warm-up status of a dedicated IP address. The status can have
--   one of the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt>  The IP address isn't ready to use because
--   the dedicated IP warm-up process is ongoing.</li>
--   <li><tt>DONE</tt>  The dedicated IP warm-up process is complete, and
--   the IP address is ready to use.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:warmupPercentage:DedicatedIp'</a>,
--   <a>dedicatedIp_warmupPercentage</a> - Indicates how complete the
--   dedicated IP warm-up process is. When this value equals 1, the address
--   has completed the warm-up process and is ready for use.
newDedicatedIp :: Text -> WarmupStatus -> Int -> DedicatedIp

-- | The name of the dedicated IP pool that the IP address is associated
--   with.
dedicatedIp_poolName :: Lens' DedicatedIp (Maybe Text)

-- | An IPv4 address.
dedicatedIp_ip :: Lens' DedicatedIp Text

-- | The warm-up status of a dedicated IP address. The status can have one
--   of the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt>  The IP address isn't ready to use because
--   the dedicated IP warm-up process is ongoing.</li>
--   <li><tt>DONE</tt>  The dedicated IP warm-up process is complete, and
--   the IP address is ready to use.</li>
--   </ul>
dedicatedIp_warmupStatus :: Lens' DedicatedIp WarmupStatus

-- | Indicates how complete the dedicated IP warm-up process is. When this
--   value equals 1, the address has completed the warm-up process and is
--   ready for use.
dedicatedIp_warmupPercentage :: Lens' DedicatedIp Int

-- | An object that contains metadata related to a predictive inbox
--   placement test.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDeliverabilityTestReport</a> smart constructor.
data DeliverabilityTestReport
DeliverabilityTestReport' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe DeliverabilityTestStatus -> DeliverabilityTestReport

-- | The subject line for an email that you submitted in a predictive inbox
--   placement test.
[$sel:subject:DeliverabilityTestReport'] :: DeliverabilityTestReport -> Maybe Text

-- | The sender address that you specified for the predictive inbox
--   placement test.
[$sel:fromEmailAddress:DeliverabilityTestReport'] :: DeliverabilityTestReport -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time when the predictive inbox placement test was
--   created, in Unix time format.
[$sel:createDate:DeliverabilityTestReport'] :: DeliverabilityTestReport -> Maybe POSIX

-- | A unique string that identifies the predictive inbox placement test.
[$sel:reportId:DeliverabilityTestReport'] :: DeliverabilityTestReport -> Maybe Text

-- | A name that helps you identify a predictive inbox placement test
--   report.
[$sel:reportName:DeliverabilityTestReport'] :: DeliverabilityTestReport -> Maybe Text

-- | The status of the predictive inbox placement test. If the status is
--   <tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt>, then the predictive inbox placement test is
--   currently running. Predictive inbox placement tests are usually
--   complete within 24 hours of creating the test. If the status is
--   <tt>COMPLETE</tt>, then the test is finished, and you can use the
--   <tt>GetDeliverabilityTestReport</tt> to view the results of the test.
[$sel:deliverabilityTestStatus:DeliverabilityTestReport'] :: DeliverabilityTestReport -> Maybe DeliverabilityTestStatus

-- | Create a value of <a>DeliverabilityTestReport</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:subject:DeliverabilityTestReport'</a>,
--   <a>deliverabilityTestReport_subject</a> - The subject line for an
--   email that you submitted in a predictive inbox placement test.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fromEmailAddress:DeliverabilityTestReport'</a>,
--   <a>deliverabilityTestReport_fromEmailAddress</a> - The sender address
--   that you specified for the predictive inbox placement test.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createDate:DeliverabilityTestReport'</a>,
--   <a>deliverabilityTestReport_createDate</a> - The date and time when
--   the predictive inbox placement test was created, in Unix time format.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reportId:DeliverabilityTestReport'</a>,
--   <a>deliverabilityTestReport_reportId</a> - A unique string that
--   identifies the predictive inbox placement test.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reportName:DeliverabilityTestReport'</a>,
--   <a>deliverabilityTestReport_reportName</a> - A name that helps you
--   identify a predictive inbox placement test report.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deliverabilityTestStatus:DeliverabilityTestReport'</a>,
--   <a>deliverabilityTestReport_deliverabilityTestStatus</a> - The status
--   of the predictive inbox placement test. If the status is
--   <tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt>, then the predictive inbox placement test is
--   currently running. Predictive inbox placement tests are usually
--   complete within 24 hours of creating the test. If the status is
--   <tt>COMPLETE</tt>, then the test is finished, and you can use the
--   <tt>GetDeliverabilityTestReport</tt> to view the results of the test.
newDeliverabilityTestReport :: DeliverabilityTestReport

-- | The subject line for an email that you submitted in a predictive inbox
--   placement test.
deliverabilityTestReport_subject :: Lens' DeliverabilityTestReport (Maybe Text)

-- | The sender address that you specified for the predictive inbox
--   placement test.
deliverabilityTestReport_fromEmailAddress :: Lens' DeliverabilityTestReport (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time when the predictive inbox placement test was
--   created, in Unix time format.
deliverabilityTestReport_createDate :: Lens' DeliverabilityTestReport (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | A unique string that identifies the predictive inbox placement test.
deliverabilityTestReport_reportId :: Lens' DeliverabilityTestReport (Maybe Text)

-- | A name that helps you identify a predictive inbox placement test
--   report.
deliverabilityTestReport_reportName :: Lens' DeliverabilityTestReport (Maybe Text)

-- | The status of the predictive inbox placement test. If the status is
--   <tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt>, then the predictive inbox placement test is
--   currently running. Predictive inbox placement tests are usually
--   complete within 24 hours of creating the test. If the status is
--   <tt>COMPLETE</tt>, then the test is finished, and you can use the
--   <tt>GetDeliverabilityTestReport</tt> to view the results of the test.
deliverabilityTestReport_deliverabilityTestStatus :: Lens' DeliverabilityTestReport (Maybe DeliverabilityTestStatus)

-- | Used to associate a configuration set with a dedicated IP pool.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDeliveryOptions</a> smart constructor.
data DeliveryOptions
DeliveryOptions' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe TlsPolicy -> DeliveryOptions

-- | The name of the dedicated IP pool to associate with the configuration
--   set.
[$sel:sendingPoolName:DeliveryOptions'] :: DeliveryOptions -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies whether messages that use the configuration set are required
--   to use Transport Layer Security (TLS). If the value is
--   <tt>Require</tt>, messages are only delivered if a TLS connection can
--   be established. If the value is <tt>Optional</tt>, messages can be
--   delivered in plain text if a TLS connection can't be established.
[$sel:tlsPolicy:DeliveryOptions'] :: DeliveryOptions -> Maybe TlsPolicy

-- | Create a value of <a>DeliveryOptions</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:sendingPoolName:DeliveryOptions'</a>,
--   <a>deliveryOptions_sendingPoolName</a> - The name of the dedicated IP
--   pool to associate with the configuration set.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tlsPolicy:DeliveryOptions'</a>,
--   <a>deliveryOptions_tlsPolicy</a> - Specifies whether messages that use
--   the configuration set are required to use Transport Layer Security
--   (TLS). If the value is <tt>Require</tt>, messages are only delivered
--   if a TLS connection can be established. If the value is
--   <tt>Optional</tt>, messages can be delivered in plain text if a TLS
--   connection can't be established.
newDeliveryOptions :: DeliveryOptions

-- | The name of the dedicated IP pool to associate with the configuration
--   set.
deliveryOptions_sendingPoolName :: Lens' DeliveryOptions (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies whether messages that use the configuration set are required
--   to use Transport Layer Security (TLS). If the value is
--   <tt>Require</tt>, messages are only delivered if a TLS connection can
--   be established. If the value is <tt>Optional</tt>, messages can be
--   delivered in plain text if a TLS connection can't be established.
deliveryOptions_tlsPolicy :: Lens' DeliveryOptions (Maybe TlsPolicy)

-- | An object that describes the recipients for an email.
--   
--   Amazon SES does not support the SMTPUTF8 extension, as described in
--   <a>RFC6531</a>. For this reason, the <i>local part</i> of a
--   destination email address (the part of the email address that precedes
--   the @ sign) may only contain <a>7-bit ASCII characters</a>. If the
--   <i>domain part</i> of an address (the part after the @ sign) contains
--   non-ASCII characters, they must be encoded using Punycode, as
--   described in <a>RFC3492</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDestination</a> smart constructor.
data Destination
Destination' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [Text] -> Destination

-- | An array that contains the email addresses of the "BCC" (blind carbon
--   copy) recipients for the email.
[$sel:bccAddresses:Destination'] :: Destination -> Maybe [Text]

-- | An array that contains the email addresses of the "CC" (carbon copy)
--   recipients for the email.
[$sel:ccAddresses:Destination'] :: Destination -> Maybe [Text]

-- | An array that contains the email addresses of the "To" recipients for
--   the email.
[$sel:toAddresses:Destination'] :: Destination -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>Destination</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:bccAddresses:Destination'</a>, <a>destination_bccAddresses</a>
--   - An array that contains the email addresses of the "BCC" (blind
--   carbon copy) recipients for the email.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ccAddresses:Destination'</a>, <a>destination_ccAddresses</a> -
--   An array that contains the email addresses of the "CC" (carbon copy)
--   recipients for the email.
--   
--   <a>$sel:toAddresses:Destination'</a>, <a>destination_toAddresses</a> -
--   An array that contains the email addresses of the "To" recipients for
--   the email.
newDestination :: Destination

-- | An array that contains the email addresses of the "BCC" (blind carbon
--   copy) recipients for the email.
destination_bccAddresses :: Lens' Destination (Maybe [Text])

-- | An array that contains the email addresses of the "CC" (carbon copy)
--   recipients for the email.
destination_ccAddresses :: Lens' Destination (Maybe [Text])

-- | An array that contains the email addresses of the "To" recipients for
--   the email.
destination_toAddresses :: Lens' Destination (Maybe [Text])

-- | An object that contains information about the DKIM authentication
--   status for an email identity.
--   
--   Amazon SES determines the authentication status by searching for
--   specific records in the DNS configuration for the domain. If you used
--   <a>Easy DKIM</a> to set up DKIM authentication, Amazon SES tries to
--   find three unique CNAME records in the DNS configuration for your
--   domain. If you provided a public key to perform DKIM authentication,
--   Amazon SES tries to find a TXT record that uses the selector that you
--   specified. The value of the TXT record must be a public key that's
--   paired with the private key that you specified in the process of
--   creating the identity
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDkimAttributes</a> smart constructor.
data DkimAttributes
DkimAttributes' :: Maybe DkimStatus -> Maybe DkimSigningKeyLength -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe DkimSigningKeyLength -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe DkimSigningAttributesOrigin -> DkimAttributes

-- | Describes whether or not Amazon SES has successfully located the DKIM
--   records in the DNS records for the domain. The status can be one of
--   the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>PENDING</tt>  The verification process was initiated, but
--   Amazon SES hasn't yet detected the DKIM records in the DNS
--   configuration for the domain.</li>
--   <li><tt>SUCCESS</tt>  The verification process completed
--   successfully.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt>  The verification process failed. This typically
--   occurs when Amazon SES fails to find the DKIM records in the DNS
--   configuration of the domain.</li>
--   <li><tt>TEMPORARY_FAILURE</tt>  A temporary issue is preventing
--   Amazon SES from determining the DKIM authentication status of the
--   domain.</li>
--   <li><tt>NOT_STARTED</tt>  The DKIM verification process hasn't been
--   initiated for the domain.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:status:DkimAttributes'] :: DkimAttributes -> Maybe DkimStatus

-- | <ul>
--   <li><i>Easy DKIM</i> The key length of the future DKIM key pair to be
--   generated. This can be changed at most once per day.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:nextSigningKeyLength:DkimAttributes'] :: DkimAttributes -> Maybe DkimSigningKeyLength

-- | If you used <a>Easy DKIM</a> to configure DKIM authentication for the
--   domain, then this object contains a set of unique strings that you use
--   to create a set of CNAME records that you add to the DNS configuration
--   for your domain. When Amazon SES detects these records in the DNS
--   configuration for your domain, the DKIM authentication process is
--   complete.
--   
--   If you configured DKIM authentication for the domain by providing your
--   own public-private key pair, then this object contains the selector
--   for the public key.
--   
--   Regardless of the DKIM authentication method you use, Amazon SES
--   searches for the appropriate records in the DNS configuration of the
--   domain for up to 72 hours.
[$sel:tokens:DkimAttributes'] :: DkimAttributes -> Maybe [Text]

-- | If the value is <tt>true</tt>, then the messages that you send from
--   the identity are signed using DKIM. If the value is <tt>false</tt>,
--   then the messages that you send from the identity aren't DKIM-signed.
[$sel:signingEnabled:DkimAttributes'] :: DkimAttributes -> Maybe Bool

-- | <ul>
--   <li><i>Easy DKIM</i> The key length of the DKIM key pair in use.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:currentSigningKeyLength:DkimAttributes'] :: DkimAttributes -> Maybe DkimSigningKeyLength

-- | <ul>
--   <li><i>Easy DKIM</i> The last time a key pair was generated for this
--   identity.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:lastKeyGenerationTimestamp:DkimAttributes'] :: DkimAttributes -> Maybe POSIX

-- | A string that indicates how DKIM was configured for the identity.
--   These are the possible values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>AWS_SES</tt>  Indicates that DKIM was configured for the
--   identity by using <a>Easy DKIM</a>.</li>
--   <li><tt>EXTERNAL</tt>  Indicates that DKIM was configured for the
--   identity by using Bring Your Own DKIM (BYODKIM).</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:signingAttributesOrigin:DkimAttributes'] :: DkimAttributes -> Maybe DkimSigningAttributesOrigin

-- | Create a value of <a>DkimAttributes</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:DkimAttributes'</a>, <a>dkimAttributes_status</a> -
--   Describes whether or not Amazon SES has successfully located the DKIM
--   records in the DNS records for the domain. The status can be one of
--   the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>PENDING</tt>  The verification process was initiated, but
--   Amazon SES hasn't yet detected the DKIM records in the DNS
--   configuration for the domain.</li>
--   <li><tt>SUCCESS</tt>  The verification process completed
--   successfully.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt>  The verification process failed. This typically
--   occurs when Amazon SES fails to find the DKIM records in the DNS
--   configuration of the domain.</li>
--   <li><tt>TEMPORARY_FAILURE</tt>  A temporary issue is preventing
--   Amazon SES from determining the DKIM authentication status of the
--   domain.</li>
--   <li><tt>NOT_STARTED</tt>  The DKIM verification process hasn't been
--   initiated for the domain.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextSigningKeyLength:DkimAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>dkimAttributes_nextSigningKeyLength</a> - [Easy DKIM] The key
--   length of the future DKIM key pair to be generated. This can be
--   changed at most once per day.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tokens:DkimAttributes'</a>, <a>dkimAttributes_tokens</a> - If
--   you used <a>Easy DKIM</a> to configure DKIM authentication for the
--   domain, then this object contains a set of unique strings that you use
--   to create a set of CNAME records that you add to the DNS configuration
--   for your domain. When Amazon SES detects these records in the DNS
--   configuration for your domain, the DKIM authentication process is
--   complete.
--   
--   If you configured DKIM authentication for the domain by providing your
--   own public-private key pair, then this object contains the selector
--   for the public key.
--   
--   Regardless of the DKIM authentication method you use, Amazon SES
--   searches for the appropriate records in the DNS configuration of the
--   domain for up to 72 hours.
--   
--   <a>$sel:signingEnabled:DkimAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>dkimAttributes_signingEnabled</a> - If the value is <tt>true</tt>,
--   then the messages that you send from the identity are signed using
--   DKIM. If the value is <tt>false</tt>, then the messages that you send
--   from the identity aren't DKIM-signed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:currentSigningKeyLength:DkimAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>dkimAttributes_currentSigningKeyLength</a> - [Easy DKIM] The key
--   length of the DKIM key pair in use.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastKeyGenerationTimestamp:DkimAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>dkimAttributes_lastKeyGenerationTimestamp</a> - [Easy DKIM] The
--   last time a key pair was generated for this identity.
--   
--   <a>$sel:signingAttributesOrigin:DkimAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>dkimAttributes_signingAttributesOrigin</a> - A string that
--   indicates how DKIM was configured for the identity. These are the
--   possible values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>AWS_SES</tt>  Indicates that DKIM was configured for the
--   identity by using <a>Easy DKIM</a>.</li>
--   <li><tt>EXTERNAL</tt>  Indicates that DKIM was configured for the
--   identity by using Bring Your Own DKIM (BYODKIM).</li>
--   </ul>
newDkimAttributes :: DkimAttributes

-- | Describes whether or not Amazon SES has successfully located the DKIM
--   records in the DNS records for the domain. The status can be one of
--   the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>PENDING</tt>  The verification process was initiated, but
--   Amazon SES hasn't yet detected the DKIM records in the DNS
--   configuration for the domain.</li>
--   <li><tt>SUCCESS</tt>  The verification process completed
--   successfully.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt>  The verification process failed. This typically
--   occurs when Amazon SES fails to find the DKIM records in the DNS
--   configuration of the domain.</li>
--   <li><tt>TEMPORARY_FAILURE</tt>  A temporary issue is preventing
--   Amazon SES from determining the DKIM authentication status of the
--   domain.</li>
--   <li><tt>NOT_STARTED</tt>  The DKIM verification process hasn't been
--   initiated for the domain.</li>
--   </ul>
dkimAttributes_status :: Lens' DkimAttributes (Maybe DkimStatus)

-- | <ul>
--   <li><i>Easy DKIM</i> The key length of the future DKIM key pair to be
--   generated. This can be changed at most once per day.</li>
--   </ul>
dkimAttributes_nextSigningKeyLength :: Lens' DkimAttributes (Maybe DkimSigningKeyLength)

-- | If you used <a>Easy DKIM</a> to configure DKIM authentication for the
--   domain, then this object contains a set of unique strings that you use
--   to create a set of CNAME records that you add to the DNS configuration
--   for your domain. When Amazon SES detects these records in the DNS
--   configuration for your domain, the DKIM authentication process is
--   complete.
--   
--   If you configured DKIM authentication for the domain by providing your
--   own public-private key pair, then this object contains the selector
--   for the public key.
--   
--   Regardless of the DKIM authentication method you use, Amazon SES
--   searches for the appropriate records in the DNS configuration of the
--   domain for up to 72 hours.
dkimAttributes_tokens :: Lens' DkimAttributes (Maybe [Text])

-- | If the value is <tt>true</tt>, then the messages that you send from
--   the identity are signed using DKIM. If the value is <tt>false</tt>,
--   then the messages that you send from the identity aren't DKIM-signed.
dkimAttributes_signingEnabled :: Lens' DkimAttributes (Maybe Bool)

-- | <ul>
--   <li><i>Easy DKIM</i> The key length of the DKIM key pair in use.</li>
--   </ul>
dkimAttributes_currentSigningKeyLength :: Lens' DkimAttributes (Maybe DkimSigningKeyLength)

-- | <ul>
--   <li><i>Easy DKIM</i> The last time a key pair was generated for this
--   identity.</li>
--   </ul>
dkimAttributes_lastKeyGenerationTimestamp :: Lens' DkimAttributes (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | A string that indicates how DKIM was configured for the identity.
--   These are the possible values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>AWS_SES</tt>  Indicates that DKIM was configured for the
--   identity by using <a>Easy DKIM</a>.</li>
--   <li><tt>EXTERNAL</tt>  Indicates that DKIM was configured for the
--   identity by using Bring Your Own DKIM (BYODKIM).</li>
--   </ul>
dkimAttributes_signingAttributesOrigin :: Lens' DkimAttributes (Maybe DkimSigningAttributesOrigin)

-- | An object that contains configuration for Bring Your Own DKIM
--   (BYODKIM), or, for Easy DKIM
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDkimSigningAttributes</a> smart constructor.
data DkimSigningAttributes
DkimSigningAttributes' :: Maybe DkimSigningKeyLength -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe Text -> DkimSigningAttributes

-- | <ul>
--   <li><i>Easy DKIM</i> The key length of the future DKIM key pair to be
--   generated. This can be changed at most once per day.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:nextSigningKeyLength:DkimSigningAttributes'] :: DkimSigningAttributes -> Maybe DkimSigningKeyLength

-- | <ul>
--   <li><i>Bring Your Own DKIM</i> A private key that's used to generate a
--   DKIM signature.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   The private key must use 1024 or 2048-bit RSA encryption, and must be
--   encoded using base64 encoding.
[$sel:domainSigningPrivateKey:DkimSigningAttributes'] :: DkimSigningAttributes -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | <ul>
--   <li><i>Bring Your Own DKIM</i> A string that's used to identify a
--   public key in the DNS configuration for a domain.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:domainSigningSelector:DkimSigningAttributes'] :: DkimSigningAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DkimSigningAttributes</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextSigningKeyLength:DkimSigningAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>dkimSigningAttributes_nextSigningKeyLength</a> - [Easy DKIM] The
--   key length of the future DKIM key pair to be generated. This can be
--   changed at most once per day.
--   
--   <a>$sel:domainSigningPrivateKey:DkimSigningAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>dkimSigningAttributes_domainSigningPrivateKey</a> - [Bring Your Own
--   DKIM] A private key that's used to generate a DKIM signature.
--   
--   The private key must use 1024 or 2048-bit RSA encryption, and must be
--   encoded using base64 encoding.
--   
--   <a>$sel:domainSigningSelector:DkimSigningAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>dkimSigningAttributes_domainSigningSelector</a> - [Bring Your Own
--   DKIM] A string that's used to identify a public key in the DNS
--   configuration for a domain.
newDkimSigningAttributes :: DkimSigningAttributes

-- | <ul>
--   <li><i>Easy DKIM</i> The key length of the future DKIM key pair to be
--   generated. This can be changed at most once per day.</li>
--   </ul>
dkimSigningAttributes_nextSigningKeyLength :: Lens' DkimSigningAttributes (Maybe DkimSigningKeyLength)

-- | <ul>
--   <li><i>Bring Your Own DKIM</i> A private key that's used to generate a
--   DKIM signature.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   The private key must use 1024 or 2048-bit RSA encryption, and must be
--   encoded using base64 encoding.
dkimSigningAttributes_domainSigningPrivateKey :: Lens' DkimSigningAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | <ul>
--   <li><i>Bring Your Own DKIM</i> A string that's used to identify a
--   public key in the DNS configuration for a domain.</li>
--   </ul>
dkimSigningAttributes_domainSigningSelector :: Lens' DkimSigningAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | An object that contains the deliverability data for a specific
--   campaign. This data is available for a campaign only if the campaign
--   sent email by using a domain that the Deliverability dashboard is
--   enabled for (<tt>PutDeliverabilityDashboardOption</tt> operation).
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDomainDeliverabilityCampaign</a> smart constructor.
data DomainDeliverabilityCampaign
DomainDeliverabilityCampaign' :: Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Double -> Maybe POSIX -> DomainDeliverabilityCampaign

-- | The number of email messages that were delivered to recipients' spam
--   or junk mail folders.
[$sel:spamCount:DomainDeliverabilityCampaign'] :: DomainDeliverabilityCampaign -> Maybe Integer

-- | The subject line, or title, of the email message.
[$sel:subject:DomainDeliverabilityCampaign'] :: DomainDeliverabilityCampaign -> Maybe Text

-- | The major email providers who handled the email message.
[$sel:esps:DomainDeliverabilityCampaign'] :: DomainDeliverabilityCampaign -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The verified email address that the email message was sent from.
[$sel:fromAddress:DomainDeliverabilityCampaign'] :: DomainDeliverabilityCampaign -> Maybe Text

-- | The percentage of email messages that were deleted by recipients,
--   without being opened first. Due to technical limitations, this value
--   only includes recipients who opened the message by using an email
--   client that supports images.
[$sel:deleteRate:DomainDeliverabilityCampaign'] :: DomainDeliverabilityCampaign -> Maybe Double

-- | The unique identifier for the campaign. The Deliverability dashboard
--   automatically generates and assigns this identifier to a campaign.
[$sel:campaignId:DomainDeliverabilityCampaign'] :: DomainDeliverabilityCampaign -> Maybe Text

-- | The IP addresses that were used to send the email message.
[$sel:sendingIps:DomainDeliverabilityCampaign'] :: DomainDeliverabilityCampaign -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The first time, in Unix time format, when the email message was
--   delivered to any recipient's inbox. This value can help you determine
--   how long it took for a campaign to deliver an email message.
[$sel:firstSeenDateTime:DomainDeliverabilityCampaign'] :: DomainDeliverabilityCampaign -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The number of email messages that were delivered to recipients
--   inboxes.
[$sel:inboxCount:DomainDeliverabilityCampaign'] :: DomainDeliverabilityCampaign -> Maybe Integer

-- | The percentage of email messages that were opened and then deleted by
--   recipients. Due to technical limitations, this value only includes
--   recipients who opened the message by using an email client that
--   supports images.
[$sel:readDeleteRate:DomainDeliverabilityCampaign'] :: DomainDeliverabilityCampaign -> Maybe Double

-- | The projected number of recipients that the email message was sent to.
[$sel:projectedVolume:DomainDeliverabilityCampaign'] :: DomainDeliverabilityCampaign -> Maybe Integer

-- | The URL of an image that contains a snapshot of the email message that
--   was sent.
[$sel:imageUrl:DomainDeliverabilityCampaign'] :: DomainDeliverabilityCampaign -> Maybe Text

-- | The percentage of email messages that were opened by recipients. Due
--   to technical limitations, this value only includes recipients who
--   opened the message by using an email client that supports images.
[$sel:readRate:DomainDeliverabilityCampaign'] :: DomainDeliverabilityCampaign -> Maybe Double

--   delivered to any recipient's inbox. This value can help you determine
--   how long it took for a campaign to deliver an email message.

-- | An object that defines the entire content of the email, including the
--   message headers and the body content. You can create a simple email
--   message, in which you specify the subject and the text and HTML
--   versions of the message body. You can also create raw messages, in
--   which you specify a complete MIME-formatted message. Raw messages can
--   include attachments and custom headers.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEmailContent</a> smart constructor.
data EmailContent
EmailContent' :: Maybe RawMessage -> Maybe Message -> Maybe Template -> EmailContent

-- | The raw email message. The message has to meet the following criteria:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The message has to contain a header and a body, separated by one
--   blank line.</li>
--   <li>All of the required header fields must be present in the
--   message.</li>
--   <li>Each part of a multipart MIME message must be formatted
--   properly.</li>
--   <li>If you include attachments, they must be in a file format that the
--   Amazon SES API v2 supports.</li>
--   <li>The entire message must be Base64 encoded.</li>
--   <li>If any of the MIME parts in your message contain content that is
--   outside of the 7-bit ASCII character range, you should encode that
--   content to ensure that recipients' email clients render the message
--   properly.</li>
--   <li>The length of any single line of text in the message can't exceed
--   1,000 characters. This restriction is defined in <a>RFC 5321</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:raw:EmailContent'] :: EmailContent -> Maybe RawMessage

-- | The simple email message. The message consists of a subject and a
--   message body.
[$sel:simple:EmailContent'] :: EmailContent -> Maybe Message

-- | The template to use for the email message.
[$sel:template:EmailContent'] :: EmailContent -> Maybe Template

-- | Create a value of <a>EmailContent</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:raw:EmailContent'</a>, <a>emailContent_raw</a> - The raw email
--   message. The message has to meet the following criteria:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The message has to contain a header and a body, separated by one
--   blank line.</li>
--   <li>All of the required header fields must be present in the
--   message.</li>
--   <li>Each part of a multipart MIME message must be formatted
--   properly.</li>
--   <li>If you include attachments, they must be in a file format that the
--   Amazon SES API v2 supports.</li>
--   <li>The entire message must be Base64 encoded.</li>
--   <li>If any of the MIME parts in your message contain content that is
--   outside of the 7-bit ASCII character range, you should encode that
--   content to ensure that recipients' email clients render the message
--   properly.</li>
--   <li>The length of any single line of text in the message can't exceed
--   1,000 characters. This restriction is defined in <a>RFC 5321</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:simple:EmailContent'</a>, <a>emailContent_simple</a> - The
--   simple email message. The message consists of a subject and a message
--   body.
--   
--   <a>$sel:template:EmailContent'</a>, <a>emailContent_template</a> - The
--   template to use for the email message.
newEmailContent :: EmailContent

-- | The raw email message. The message has to meet the following criteria:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The message has to contain a header and a body, separated by one
--   blank line.</li>
--   <li>All of the required header fields must be present in the
--   message.</li>
--   <li>Each part of a multipart MIME message must be formatted
--   properly.</li>
--   <li>If you include attachments, they must be in a file format that the
--   Amazon SES API v2 supports.</li>
--   <li>The entire message must be Base64 encoded.</li>
--   <li>If any of the MIME parts in your message contain content that is
--   outside of the 7-bit ASCII character range, you should encode that
--   content to ensure that recipients' email clients render the message
--   properly.</li>
--   <li>The length of any single line of text in the message can't exceed
--   1,000 characters. This restriction is defined in <a>RFC 5321</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
emailContent_raw :: Lens' EmailContent (Maybe RawMessage)

-- | The simple email message. The message consists of a subject and a
--   message body.
emailContent_simple :: Lens' EmailContent (Maybe Message)

-- | The template to use for the email message.
emailContent_template :: Lens' EmailContent (Maybe Template)

-- | The content of the email, composed of a subject line, an HTML part,
--   and a text-only part.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEmailTemplateContent</a> smart constructor.
data EmailTemplateContent
EmailTemplateContent' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> EmailTemplateContent

-- | The subject line of the email.
[$sel:subject:EmailTemplateContent'] :: EmailTemplateContent -> Maybe Text

-- | The email body that will be visible to recipients whose email clients
--   do not display HTML.
[$sel:text:EmailTemplateContent'] :: EmailTemplateContent -> Maybe Text

-- | The HTML body of the email.
[$sel:html:EmailTemplateContent'] :: EmailTemplateContent -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>EmailTemplateContent</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:subject:EmailTemplateContent'</a>,
--   <a>emailTemplateContent_subject</a> - The subject line of the email.
--   
--   <a>$sel:text:EmailTemplateContent'</a>,
--   <a>emailTemplateContent_text</a> - The email body that will be visible
--   to recipients whose email clients do not display HTML.
--   
--   <a>$sel:html:EmailTemplateContent'</a>,
--   <a>emailTemplateContent_html</a> - The HTML body of the email.
newEmailTemplateContent :: EmailTemplateContent

-- | The subject line of the email.
emailTemplateContent_subject :: Lens' EmailTemplateContent (Maybe Text)

-- | The email body that will be visible to recipients whose email clients
--   do not display HTML.
emailTemplateContent_text :: Lens' EmailTemplateContent (Maybe Text)

-- | The HTML body of the email.
emailTemplateContent_html :: Lens' EmailTemplateContent (Maybe Text)

-- | Contains information about an email template.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEmailTemplateMetadata</a> smart constructor.
data EmailTemplateMetadata
EmailTemplateMetadata' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> EmailTemplateMetadata

-- | The name of the template.
[$sel:templateName:EmailTemplateMetadata'] :: EmailTemplateMetadata -> Maybe Text

-- | The time and date the template was created.
[$sel:createdTimestamp:EmailTemplateMetadata'] :: EmailTemplateMetadata -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Create a value of <a>EmailTemplateMetadata</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   
--   <a>$sel:createdTimestamp:EmailTemplateMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>emailTemplateMetadata_createdTimestamp</a> - The time and date the
--   template was created.
newEmailTemplateMetadata :: EmailTemplateMetadata

-- | The name of the template.
emailTemplateMetadata_templateName :: Lens' EmailTemplateMetadata (Maybe Text)

-- | The time and date the template was created.
emailTemplateMetadata_createdTimestamp :: Lens' EmailTemplateMetadata (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | In the Amazon SES API v2, <i>events</i> include message sends,
--   deliveries, opens, clicks, bounces, complaints and delivery delays.
--   /Event destinations/ are places that you can send information about
--   these events to. For example, you can send event data to Amazon SNS to
--   receive notifications when you receive bounces or complaints, or you
--   can use Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose to stream data to Amazon S3 for
--   long-term storage.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEventDestination</a> smart constructor.
data EventDestination
EventDestination' :: Maybe PinpointDestination -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe KinesisFirehoseDestination -> Maybe CloudWatchDestination -> Maybe SnsDestination -> Text -> [EventType] -> EventDestination

-- | An object that defines an Amazon Pinpoint project destination for
--   email events. You can send email event data to a Amazon Pinpoint
--   project to view metrics using the Transactional Messaging dashboards
--   that are built in to Amazon Pinpoint. For more information, see
--   <a>Transactional Messaging Charts</a> in the <i>Amazon Pinpoint User
--   Guide</i>.
[$sel:pinpointDestination:EventDestination'] :: EventDestination -> Maybe PinpointDestination

-- | If <tt>true</tt>, the event destination is enabled. When the event
--   destination is enabled, the specified event types are sent to the
--   destinations in this <tt>EventDestinationDefinition</tt>.
--   
--   If <tt>false</tt>, the event destination is disabled. When the event
--   destination is disabled, events aren't sent to the specified
--   destinations.
[$sel:enabled:EventDestination'] :: EventDestination -> Maybe Bool

-- | An object that defines an Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose destination for
--   email events. You can use Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose to stream data
--   to other services, such as Amazon S3 and Amazon Redshift.
[$sel:kinesisFirehoseDestination:EventDestination'] :: EventDestination -> Maybe KinesisFirehoseDestination

-- | An object that defines an Amazon CloudWatch destination for email
--   events. You can use Amazon CloudWatch to monitor and gain insights on
--   your email sending metrics.
[$sel:cloudWatchDestination:EventDestination'] :: EventDestination -> Maybe CloudWatchDestination

-- | An object that defines an Amazon SNS destination for email events. You
--   can use Amazon SNS to send notification when certain email events
--   occur.
[$sel:snsDestination:EventDestination'] :: EventDestination -> Maybe SnsDestination

-- | A name that identifies the event destination.
[$sel:name:EventDestination'] :: EventDestination -> Text

-- | The types of events that Amazon SES sends to the specified event
--   destinations.
[$sel:matchingEventTypes:EventDestination'] :: EventDestination -> [EventType]

-- | Create a value of <a>EventDestination</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:pinpointDestination:EventDestination'</a>,
--   <a>eventDestination_pinpointDestination</a> - An object that defines
--   an Amazon Pinpoint project destination for email events. You can send
--   email event data to a Amazon Pinpoint project to view metrics using
--   the Transactional Messaging dashboards that are built in to Amazon
--   Pinpoint. For more information, see <a>Transactional Messaging
--   Charts</a> in the <i>Amazon Pinpoint User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enabled:EventDestination'</a>, <a>eventDestination_enabled</a>
--   - If <tt>true</tt>, the event destination is enabled. When the event
--   destination is enabled, the specified event types are sent to the
--   destinations in this <tt>EventDestinationDefinition</tt>.
--   
--   If <tt>false</tt>, the event destination is disabled. When the event
--   destination is disabled, events aren't sent to the specified
--   destinations.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kinesisFirehoseDestination:EventDestination'</a>,
--   <a>eventDestination_kinesisFirehoseDestination</a> - An object that
--   defines an Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose destination for email events.
--   You can use Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose to stream data to other
--   services, such as Amazon S3 and Amazon Redshift.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cloudWatchDestination:EventDestination'</a>,
--   <a>eventDestination_cloudWatchDestination</a> - An object that defines
--   an Amazon CloudWatch destination for email events. You can use Amazon
--   CloudWatch to monitor and gain insights on your email sending metrics.
--   
--   <a>$sel:snsDestination:EventDestination'</a>,
--   <a>eventDestination_snsDestination</a> - An object that defines an
--   Amazon SNS destination for email events. You can use Amazon SNS to
--   send notification when certain email events occur.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:EventDestination'</a>, <a>eventDestination_name</a> - A
--   name that identifies the event destination.
--   
--   <a>$sel:matchingEventTypes:EventDestination'</a>,
--   <a>eventDestination_matchingEventTypes</a> - The types of events that
--   Amazon SES sends to the specified event destinations.
newEventDestination :: Text -> EventDestination

-- | An object that defines an Amazon Pinpoint project destination for
--   email events. You can send email event data to a Amazon Pinpoint
--   project to view metrics using the Transactional Messaging dashboards
--   that are built in to Amazon Pinpoint. For more information, see
--   <a>Transactional Messaging Charts</a> in the <i>Amazon Pinpoint User
--   Guide</i>.
eventDestination_pinpointDestination :: Lens' EventDestination (Maybe PinpointDestination)

-- | If <tt>true</tt>, the event destination is enabled. When the event
--   destination is enabled, the specified event types are sent to the
--   destinations in this <tt>EventDestinationDefinition</tt>.
--   
--   If <tt>false</tt>, the event destination is disabled. When the event
--   destination is disabled, events aren't sent to the specified
--   destinations.
eventDestination_enabled :: Lens' EventDestination (Maybe Bool)

-- | An object that defines an Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose destination for
--   email events. You can use Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose to stream data
--   to other services, such as Amazon S3 and Amazon Redshift.
eventDestination_kinesisFirehoseDestination :: Lens' EventDestination (Maybe KinesisFirehoseDestination)

-- | An object that defines an Amazon CloudWatch destination for email
--   events. You can use Amazon CloudWatch to monitor and gain insights on
--   your email sending metrics.
eventDestination_cloudWatchDestination :: Lens' EventDestination (Maybe CloudWatchDestination)

-- | An object that defines an Amazon SNS destination for email events. You
--   can use Amazon SNS to send notification when certain email events
--   occur.
eventDestination_snsDestination :: Lens' EventDestination (Maybe SnsDestination)

-- | A name that identifies the event destination.
eventDestination_name :: Lens' EventDestination Text

-- | The types of events that Amazon SES sends to the specified event
--   destinations.
eventDestination_matchingEventTypes :: Lens' EventDestination [EventType]

-- | An object that defines the event destination. Specifically, it defines
--   which services receive events from emails sent using the configuration
--   set that the event destination is associated with. Also defines the
--   types of events that are sent to the event destination.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEventDestinationDefinition</a> smart constructor.
data EventDestinationDefinition
EventDestinationDefinition' :: Maybe [EventType] -> Maybe PinpointDestination -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe KinesisFirehoseDestination -> Maybe CloudWatchDestination -> Maybe SnsDestination -> EventDestinationDefinition

-- | An array that specifies which events the Amazon SES API v2 should send
--   to the destinations in this <tt>EventDestinationDefinition</tt>.
[$sel:matchingEventTypes:EventDestinationDefinition'] :: EventDestinationDefinition -> Maybe [EventType]

-- | An object that defines an Amazon Pinpoint project destination for
--   email events. You can send email event data to a Amazon Pinpoint
--   project to view metrics using the Transactional Messaging dashboards
--   that are built in to Amazon Pinpoint. For more information, see
--   <a>Transactional Messaging Charts</a> in the <i>Amazon Pinpoint User
--   Guide</i>.
[$sel:pinpointDestination:EventDestinationDefinition'] :: EventDestinationDefinition -> Maybe PinpointDestination

-- | If <tt>true</tt>, the event destination is enabled. When the event
--   destination is enabled, the specified event types are sent to the
--   destinations in this <tt>EventDestinationDefinition</tt>.
--   
--   If <tt>false</tt>, the event destination is disabled. When the event
--   destination is disabled, events aren't sent to the specified
--   destinations.
[$sel:enabled:EventDestinationDefinition'] :: EventDestinationDefinition -> Maybe Bool

-- | An object that defines an Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose destination for
--   email events. You can use Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose to stream data
--   to other services, such as Amazon S3 and Amazon Redshift.
[$sel:kinesisFirehoseDestination:EventDestinationDefinition'] :: EventDestinationDefinition -> Maybe KinesisFirehoseDestination

--   events. You can use Amazon CloudWatch to monitor and gain insights on
--   your email sending metrics.
[$sel:cloudWatchDestination:EventDestinationDefinition'] :: EventDestinationDefinition -> Maybe CloudWatchDestination

-- | An object that defines an Amazon SNS destination for email events. You
--   can use Amazon SNS to send notification when certain email events
--   occur.
[$sel:snsDestination:EventDestinationDefinition'] :: EventDestinationDefinition -> Maybe SnsDestination

-- | Create a value of <a>EventDestinationDefinition</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   event destination is enabled. When the event destination is enabled,
--   the specified event types are sent to the destinations in this
--   <tt>EventDestinationDefinition</tt>.

-- | An object that contains the failure details about an import job.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newFailureInfo</a> smart constructor.
data FailureInfo
FailureInfo' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> FailureInfo

-- | An Amazon S3 presigned URL that contains all the failed records and
--   related information.
[$sel:failedRecordsS3Url:FailureInfo'] :: FailureInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | A message about why the import job failed.
[$sel:errorMessage:FailureInfo'] :: FailureInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>FailureInfo</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   that contains all the failed records and related information.
--   
--   <a>$sel:errorMessage:FailureInfo'</a>, <a>failureInfo_errorMessage</a>
--   - A message about why the import job failed.
newFailureInfo :: FailureInfo

--   related information.
failureInfo_failedRecordsS3Url :: Lens' FailureInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | A message about why the import job failed.
failureInfo_errorMessage :: Lens' FailureInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | Information about an email identity.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newIdentityInfo</a> smart constructor.
data IdentityInfo
IdentityInfo' :: Maybe IdentityType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> IdentityInfo

-- | The email identity type. Note: the <tt>MANAGED_DOMAIN</tt> type is not
--   supported for email identity types.
[$sel:identityType:IdentityInfo'] :: IdentityInfo -> Maybe IdentityType

-- | The address or domain of the identity.
[$sel:identityName:IdentityInfo'] :: IdentityInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | Indicates whether or not you can send email from the identity.
--   
--   An <i>identity</i> is an email address or domain that you send email
--   from. Before you can send email from an identity, you have to
--   demostrate that you own the identity, and that you authorize Amazon
--   SES to send email from that identity.
[$sel:sendingEnabled:IdentityInfo'] :: IdentityInfo -> Maybe Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>IdentityInfo</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:identityType:IdentityInfo'</a>,
--   <a>identityInfo_identityType</a> - The email identity type. Note: the
--   <tt>MANAGED_DOMAIN</tt> type is not supported for email identity
--   types.
--   
--   <a>$sel:identityName:IdentityInfo'</a>,
--   <a>identityInfo_identityName</a> - The address or domain of the
--   identity.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sendingEnabled:IdentityInfo'</a>,
--   <a>identityInfo_sendingEnabled</a> - Indicates whether or not you can
--   send email from the identity.
--   
--   An <i>identity</i> is an email address or domain that you send email
--   from. Before you can send email from an identity, you have to
--   demostrate that you own the identity, and that you authorize Amazon
--   SES to send email from that identity.
newIdentityInfo :: IdentityInfo

-- | The email identity type. Note: the <tt>MANAGED_DOMAIN</tt> type is not
--   supported for email identity types.
identityInfo_identityType :: Lens' IdentityInfo (Maybe IdentityType)

-- | The address or domain of the identity.
identityInfo_identityName :: Lens' IdentityInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | Indicates whether or not you can send email from the identity.
--   
--   An <i>identity</i> is an email address or domain that you send email
--   from. Before you can send email from an identity, you have to
--   demostrate that you own the identity, and that you authorize Amazon
--   SES to send email from that identity.
identityInfo_sendingEnabled :: Lens' IdentityInfo (Maybe Bool)

-- | An object that contains details about the data source of the import

--   <i>See:</i> <a>newImportDataSource</a> smart constructor.

-- | An object that contains information about the inbox placement data
--   settings for a verified domain thats associated with your Amazon Web
--   Services account. This data is available only if you enabled the
--   Deliverability dashboard for the domain.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInboxPlacementTrackingOption</a> smart constructor.
data InboxPlacementTrackingOption
InboxPlacementTrackingOption' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Bool -> InboxPlacementTrackingOption

-- | An array of strings, one for each major email provider that the inbox
--   placement data applies to.
[$sel:trackedIsps:InboxPlacementTrackingOption'] :: InboxPlacementTrackingOption -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Specifies whether inbox placement data is being tracked for the
--   domain.
[$sel:global:InboxPlacementTrackingOption'] :: InboxPlacementTrackingOption -> Maybe Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>InboxPlacementTrackingOption</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:trackedIsps:InboxPlacementTrackingOption'</a>,
--   <a>inboxPlacementTrackingOption_trackedIsps</a> - An array of strings,
--   one for each major email provider that the inbox placement data
--   applies to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:global:InboxPlacementTrackingOption'</a>,
--   <a>inboxPlacementTrackingOption_global</a> - Specifies whether inbox
--   placement data is being tracked for the domain.
newInboxPlacementTrackingOption :: InboxPlacementTrackingOption

-- | An array of strings, one for each major email provider that the inbox
--   placement data applies to.
inboxPlacementTrackingOption_trackedIsps :: Lens' InboxPlacementTrackingOption (Maybe [Text])

-- | Specifies whether inbox placement data is being tracked for the
--   domain.
inboxPlacementTrackingOption_global :: Lens' InboxPlacementTrackingOption (Maybe Bool)

-- | An object that describes how email sent during the predictive inbox
--   placement test was handled by a certain email provider.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newIspPlacement</a> smart constructor.
data IspPlacement
IspPlacement' :: Maybe PlacementStatistics -> Maybe Text -> IspPlacement

-- | An object that contains inbox placement metrics for a specific email
--   provider.
[$sel:placementStatistics:IspPlacement'] :: IspPlacement -> Maybe PlacementStatistics

-- | The name of the email provider that the inbox placement data applies
--   to.
[$sel:ispName:IspPlacement'] :: IspPlacement -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>IspPlacement</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:placementStatistics:IspPlacement'</a>,
--   <a>ispPlacement_placementStatistics</a> - An object that contains
--   inbox placement metrics for a specific email provider.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ispName:IspPlacement'</a>, <a>ispPlacement_ispName</a> - The
--   name of the email provider that the inbox placement data applies to.
newIspPlacement :: IspPlacement

-- | An object that contains inbox placement metrics for a specific email
--   provider.
ispPlacement_placementStatistics :: Lens' IspPlacement (Maybe PlacementStatistics)

-- | The name of the email provider that the inbox placement data applies
--   to.
ispPlacement_ispName :: Lens' IspPlacement (Maybe Text)

-- | A filter that can be applied to a list of contacts.

data ListContactsFilter

--   specific topic preference.
