-- | A list of attributes that are associated with a MAIL FROM domain.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMailFromAttributes</a> smart constructor.
data MailFromAttributes
MailFromAttributes' :: Text -> MailFromDomainStatus -> BehaviorOnMxFailure -> MailFromAttributes

-- | The name of a domain that an email identity uses as a custom MAIL FROM
--   domain.
[$sel:mailFromDomain:MailFromAttributes'] :: MailFromAttributes -> Text

-- | The status of the MAIL FROM domain. This status can have the following
--   values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>PENDING</tt>  Amazon SES hasn't started searching for the MX
--   record yet.</li>
--   <li><tt>SUCCESS</tt>  Amazon SES detected the required MX record for
--   the MAIL FROM domain.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt>  Amazon SES can't find the required MX record, or
--   the record no longer exists.</li>
--   <li><tt>TEMPORARY_FAILURE</tt>  A temporary issue occurred, which
--   prevented Amazon SES from determining the status of the MAIL FROM
--   domain.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:mailFromDomainStatus:MailFromAttributes'] :: MailFromAttributes -> MailFromDomainStatus

-- | The action to take if the required MX record can't be found when you
--   send an email. When you set this value to <tt>UseDefaultValue</tt>,
--   the mail is sent using <i>amazonses.com</i> as the MAIL FROM domain.
--   When you set this value to <tt>RejectMessage</tt>, the Amazon SES API
--   v2 returns a <tt>MailFromDomainNotVerified</tt> error, and doesn't
--   attempt to deliver the email.
--   
--   These behaviors are taken when the custom MAIL FROM domain
--   configuration is in the <tt>Pending</tt>, <tt>Failed</tt>, and
--   <tt>TemporaryFailure</tt> states.
[$sel:behaviorOnMxFailure:MailFromAttributes'] :: MailFromAttributes -> BehaviorOnMxFailure

-- | Create a value of <a>MailFromAttributes</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:mailFromDomain:MailFromAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>mailFromAttributes_mailFromDomain</a> - The name of a domain that
--   an email identity uses as a custom MAIL FROM domain.
--   
--   <a>$sel:mailFromDomainStatus:MailFromAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>mailFromAttributes_mailFromDomainStatus</a> - The status of the
--   MAIL FROM domain. This status can have the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>PENDING</tt>  Amazon SES hasn't started searching for the MX
--   record yet.</li>
--   <li><tt>SUCCESS</tt>  Amazon SES detected the required MX record for
--   the MAIL FROM domain.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt>  Amazon SES can't find the required MX record, or
--   the record no longer exists.</li>
--   <li><tt>TEMPORARY_FAILURE</tt>  A temporary issue occurred, which
--   prevented Amazon SES from determining the status of the MAIL FROM
--   domain.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:behaviorOnMxFailure:MailFromAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>mailFromAttributes_behaviorOnMxFailure</a> - The action to take if
--   the required MX record can't be found when you send an email. When you
--   set this value to <tt>UseDefaultValue</tt>, the mail is sent using
--   <i>amazonses.com</i> as the MAIL FROM domain. When you set this value
--   to <tt>RejectMessage</tt>, the Amazon SES API v2 returns a
--   <tt>MailFromDomainNotVerified</tt> error, and doesn't attempt to
--   deliver the email.
--   
--   These behaviors are taken when the custom MAIL FROM domain
--   configuration is in the <tt>Pending</tt>, <tt>Failed</tt>, and
--   <tt>TemporaryFailure</tt> states.
newMailFromAttributes :: Text -> MailFromDomainStatus -> BehaviorOnMxFailure -> MailFromAttributes

-- | The name of a domain that an email identity uses as a custom MAIL FROM
--   domain.
mailFromAttributes_mailFromDomain :: Lens' MailFromAttributes Text

-- | The status of the MAIL FROM domain. This status can have the following
--   values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>PENDING</tt>  Amazon SES hasn't started searching for the MX
--   record yet.</li>
--   <li><tt>SUCCESS</tt>  Amazon SES detected the required MX record for
--   the MAIL FROM domain.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt>  Amazon SES can't find the required MX record, or
--   the record no longer exists.</li>
--   <li><tt>TEMPORARY_FAILURE</tt>  A temporary issue occurred, which
--   prevented Amazon SES from determining the status of the MAIL FROM
--   domain.</li>
--   </ul>
mailFromAttributes_mailFromDomainStatus :: Lens' MailFromAttributes MailFromDomainStatus

-- | The action to take if the required MX record can't be found when you
--   send an email. When you set this value to <tt>UseDefaultValue</tt>,
--   the mail is sent using <i>amazonses.com</i> as the MAIL FROM domain.
--   When you set this value to <tt>RejectMessage</tt>, the Amazon SES API
--   v2 returns a <tt>MailFromDomainNotVerified</tt> error, and doesn't
--   attempt to deliver the email.
--   
--   These behaviors are taken when the custom MAIL FROM domain
--   configuration is in the <tt>Pending</tt>, <tt>Failed</tt>, and
--   <tt>TemporaryFailure</tt> states.
mailFromAttributes_behaviorOnMxFailure :: Lens' MailFromAttributes BehaviorOnMxFailure

-- | Represents the email message that you're sending. The <tt>Message</tt>
--   object consists of a subject line and a message body.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMessage</a> smart constructor.
data Message
Message' :: Content -> Body -> Message

-- | The subject line of the email. The subject line can only contain 7-bit
--   ASCII characters. However, you can specify non-ASCII characters in the
--   subject line by using encoded-word syntax, as described in <a>RFC
--   2047</a>.
[$sel:subject:Message'] :: Message -> Content

-- | The body of the message. You can specify an HTML version of the
--   message, a text-only version of the message, or both.
[$sel:body:Message'] :: Message -> Body

-- | Create a value of <a>Message</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:subject:Message'</a>, <a>message_subject</a> - The subject
--   line of the email. The subject line can only contain 7-bit ASCII
--   characters. However, you can specify non-ASCII characters in the
--   subject line by using encoded-word syntax, as described in <a>RFC
--   2047</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:body:Message'</a>, <a>message_body</a> - The body of the
--   message. You can specify an HTML version of the message, a text-only
--   version of the message, or both.
newMessage :: Content -> Body -> Message

-- | The subject line of the email. The subject line can only contain 7-bit
--   ASCII characters. However, you can specify non-ASCII characters in the
--   subject line by using encoded-word syntax, as described in <a>RFC
--   2047</a>.
message_subject :: Lens' Message Content

-- | The body of the message. You can specify an HTML version of the
--   message, a text-only version of the message, or both.
message_body :: Lens' Message Body

-- | Contains the name and value of a tag that you apply to an email. You
--   can use message tags when you publish email sending events.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMessageTag</a> smart constructor.
data MessageTag
MessageTag' :: Text -> Text -> MessageTag

-- | The name of the message tag. The message tag name has to meet the
--   following criteria:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>It can only contain ASCII letters (az, AZ), numbers (09),
--   underscores (_), or dashes (-).</li>
--   <li>It can contain no more than 256 characters.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:name:MessageTag'] :: MessageTag -> Text

-- | The value of the message tag. The message tag value has to meet the
--   following criteria:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>It can only contain ASCII letters (az, AZ), numbers (09),
--   underscores (_), or dashes (-).</li>
--   <li>It can contain no more than 256 characters.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:value:MessageTag'] :: MessageTag -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>MessageTag</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:MessageTag'</a>, <a>messageTag_name</a> - The name of the
--   message tag. The message tag name has to meet the following criteria:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>It can only contain ASCII letters (az, AZ), numbers (09),
--   underscores (_), or dashes (-).</li>
--   <li>It can contain no more than 256 characters.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:MessageTag'</a>, <a>messageTag_value</a> - The value of
--   the message tag. The message tag value has to meet the following
--   criteria:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>It can only contain ASCII letters (az, AZ), numbers (09),
--   underscores (_), or dashes (-).</li>
--   <li>It can contain no more than 256 characters.</li>
--   </ul>
newMessageTag :: Text -> Text -> MessageTag

-- | The name of the message tag. The message tag name has to meet the
--   following criteria:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>It can only contain ASCII letters (az, AZ), numbers (09),
--   underscores (_), or dashes (-).</li>
--   <li>It can contain no more than 256 characters.</li>
--   </ul>
messageTag_name :: Lens' MessageTag Text

-- | The value of the message tag. The message tag value has to meet the
--   following criteria:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>It can only contain ASCII letters (az, AZ), numbers (09),
--   underscores (_), or dashes (-).</li>
--   <li>It can contain no more than 256 characters.</li>
--   </ul>
messageTag_value :: Lens' MessageTag Text

-- | An object that contains information about email that was sent from the
--   selected domain.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newOverallVolume</a> smart constructor.
data OverallVolume
OverallVolume' :: Maybe [DomainIspPlacement] -> Maybe VolumeStatistics -> Maybe Double -> OverallVolume

-- | An object that contains inbox and junk mail placement metrics for
--   individual email providers.
[$sel:domainIspPlacements:OverallVolume'] :: OverallVolume -> Maybe [DomainIspPlacement]

-- | An object that contains information about the numbers of messages that
--   arrived in recipients' inboxes and junk mail folders.
[$sel:volumeStatistics:OverallVolume'] :: OverallVolume -> Maybe VolumeStatistics

-- | The percentage of emails that were sent from the domain that were read
--   by their recipients.
[$sel:readRatePercent:OverallVolume'] :: OverallVolume -> Maybe Double

-- | Create a value of <a>OverallVolume</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.

--   inbox and junk mail placement metrics for individual email providers.
--   
--   <a>$sel:volumeStatistics:OverallVolume'</a>,
--   <a>overallVolume_volumeStatistics</a> - An object that contains
--   information about the numbers of messages that arrived in recipients'
--   inboxes and junk mail folders.

--   <a>overallVolume_readRatePercent</a> - The percentage of emails that
--   were sent from the domain that were read by their recipients.
newOverallVolume :: OverallVolume

--   individual email providers.
overallVolume_domainIspPlacements :: Lens' OverallVolume (Maybe [DomainIspPlacement])

-- | An object that contains information about the numbers of messages that
--   arrived in recipients' inboxes and junk mail folders.
overallVolume_volumeStatistics :: Lens' OverallVolume (Maybe VolumeStatistics)

-- | The percentage of emails that were sent from the domain that were read
--   by their recipients.
overallVolume_readRatePercent :: Lens' OverallVolume (Maybe Double)

-- | An object that defines an Amazon Pinpoint project destination for
--   email events. You can send email event data to a Amazon Pinpoint

--   <a>Transactional Messaging Charts</a> in the <i>Amazon Pinpoint User

newPinpointDestination :: PinpointDestination

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon Pinpoint project to send
--   email events to.

-- | An object that contains inbox placement data for an email provider.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPlacementStatistics</a> smart constructor.
data PlacementStatistics
PlacementStatistics' :: Maybe Double -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Double -> PlacementStatistics

-- | The percentage of emails that didn't arrive in recipients' inboxes at
--   all during the predictive inbox placement test.
[$sel:missingPercentage:PlacementStatistics'] :: PlacementStatistics -> Maybe Double

-- | The percentage of emails that arrived in recipients' spam or junk mail
--   folders during the predictive inbox placement test.
[$sel:spamPercentage:PlacementStatistics'] :: PlacementStatistics -> Maybe Double

-- | The percentage of emails that were authenticated by using Sender
--   Policy Framework (SPF) during the predictive inbox placement test.
[$sel:spfPercentage:PlacementStatistics'] :: PlacementStatistics -> Maybe Double

-- | The percentage of emails that were authenticated by using DomainKeys
--   Identified Mail (DKIM) during the predictive inbox placement test.
[$sel:dkimPercentage:PlacementStatistics'] :: PlacementStatistics -> Maybe Double

-- | The percentage of emails that arrived in recipients' inboxes during
--   the predictive inbox placement test.
[$sel:inboxPercentage:PlacementStatistics'] :: PlacementStatistics -> Maybe Double

-- | Create a value of <a>PlacementStatistics</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   <a>placementStatistics_missingPercentage</a> - The percentage of
--   emails that didn't arrive in recipients' inboxes at all during the
--   predictive inbox placement test.
--   
--   <a>$sel:spamPercentage:PlacementStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>placementStatistics_spamPercentage</a> - The percentage of emails
--   that arrived in recipients' spam or junk mail folders during the
--   predictive inbox placement test.
--   
--   <a>$sel:spfPercentage:PlacementStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>placementStatistics_spfPercentage</a> - The percentage of emails
--   that were authenticated by using Sender Policy Framework (SPF) during
--   the predictive inbox placement test.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dkimPercentage:PlacementStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>placementStatistics_dkimPercentage</a> - The percentage of emails
--   that were authenticated by using DomainKeys Identified Mail (DKIM)
--   during the predictive inbox placement test.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inboxPercentage:PlacementStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>placementStatistics_inboxPercentage</a> - The percentage of emails
--   that arrived in recipients' inboxes during the predictive inbox
--   placement test.
newPlacementStatistics :: PlacementStatistics

-- | The percentage of emails that didn't arrive in recipients' inboxes at
--   all during the predictive inbox placement test.
placementStatistics_missingPercentage :: Lens' PlacementStatistics (Maybe Double)

-- | The percentage of emails that arrived in recipients' spam or junk mail
--   folders during the predictive inbox placement test.
placementStatistics_spamPercentage :: Lens' PlacementStatistics (Maybe Double)

-- | The percentage of emails that were authenticated by using Sender
--   Policy Framework (SPF) during the predictive inbox placement test.
placementStatistics_spfPercentage :: Lens' PlacementStatistics (Maybe Double)

-- | The percentage of emails that were authenticated by using DomainKeys
--   Identified Mail (DKIM) during the predictive inbox placement test.
placementStatistics_dkimPercentage :: Lens' PlacementStatistics (Maybe Double)

-- | The percentage of emails that arrived in recipients' inboxes during
--   the predictive inbox placement test.
placementStatistics_inboxPercentage :: Lens' PlacementStatistics (Maybe Double)

-- | Represents the raw content of an email message.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRawMessage</a> smart constructor.
data RawMessage
RawMessage' :: Base64 -> RawMessage

-- | The raw email message. The message has to meet the following criteria:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The message has to contain a header and a body, separated by one
--   blank line.</li>
--   <li>All of the required header fields must be present in the
--   message.</li>
--   <li>Each part of a multipart MIME message must be formatted
--   properly.</li>
--   <li>Attachments must be in a file format that the Amazon SES
--   supports.</li>
--   <li>The entire message must be Base64 encoded.</li>
--   <li>If any of the MIME parts in your message contain content that is
--   outside of the 7-bit ASCII character range, you should encode that
--   content to ensure that recipients' email clients render the message
--   properly.</li>
--   <li>The length of any single line of text in the message can't exceed
--   1,000 characters. This restriction is defined in <a>RFC 5321</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:data':RawMessage'] :: RawMessage -> Base64

-- | Create a value of <a>RawMessage</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:data':RawMessage'</a>, <a>rawMessage_data</a> - The raw email
--   message. The message has to meet the following criteria:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The message has to contain a header and a body, separated by one
--   blank line.</li>
--   <li>All of the required header fields must be present in the
--   message.</li>
--   <li>Each part of a multipart MIME message must be formatted
--   properly.</li>
--   <li>Attachments must be in a file format that the Amazon SES
--   supports.</li>
--   <li>The entire message must be Base64 encoded.</li>
--   <li>If any of the MIME parts in your message contain content that is
--   outside of the 7-bit ASCII character range, you should encode that
--   content to ensure that recipients' email clients render the message
--   properly.</li>
--   <li>The length of any single line of text in the message can't exceed
--   1,000 characters. This restriction is defined in <a>RFC
--   5321</a>.--</li>
--   <li>- <i>Note:</i> This <tt>Lens</tt> automatically encodes and
--   decodes Base64 data.</li>
--   <li>- The underlying isomorphism will encode to Base64 representation
--   during</li>
--   <li>- serialisation, and decode from Base64 representation during
--   deserialisation.</li>
--   <li>- This <tt>Lens</tt> accepts and returns only raw unencoded
--   data.</li>
--   </ul>
newRawMessage :: ByteString -> RawMessage

-- | The raw email message. The message has to meet the following criteria:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The message has to contain a header and a body, separated by one
--   blank line.</li>
--   <li>All of the required header fields must be present in the
--   message.</li>
--   <li>Each part of a multipart MIME message must be formatted
--   properly.</li>
--   <li>Attachments must be in a file format that the Amazon SES
--   supports.</li>
--   <li>The entire message must be Base64 encoded.</li>
--   <li>If any of the MIME parts in your message contain content that is
--   outside of the 7-bit ASCII character range, you should encode that
--   content to ensure that recipients' email clients render the message
--   properly.</li>
--   <li>The length of any single line of text in the message can't exceed
--   1,000 characters. This restriction is defined in <a>RFC
--   5321</a>.--</li>
--   <li>- <i>Note:</i> This <tt>Lens</tt> automatically encodes and
--   decodes Base64 data.</li>
--   <li>- The underlying isomorphism will encode to Base64 representation
--   during</li>
--   <li>- serialisation, and decode from Base64 representation during
--   deserialisation.</li>
--   <li>- This <tt>Lens</tt> accepts and returns only raw unencoded
--   data.</li>
--   </ul>
rawMessage_data :: Lens' RawMessage ByteString

-- | The <tt>ReplaceEmailContent</tt> object to be used for a specific
--   <tt>BulkEmailEntry</tt>. The <tt>ReplacementTemplate</tt> can be
--   specified within this object.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newReplacementEmailContent</a> smart constructor.
data ReplacementEmailContent
ReplacementEmailContent' :: Maybe ReplacementTemplate -> ReplacementEmailContent

--   <tt>ReplacementEmailContent</tt>.
[$sel:replacementTemplate:ReplacementEmailContent'] :: ReplacementEmailContent -> Maybe ReplacementTemplate

--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   <a>$sel:replacementTemplate:ReplacementEmailContent'</a>,

--   <tt>ReplacementTemplate</tt> associated with
--   <tt>ReplacementEmailContent</tt>.
newReplacementEmailContent :: ReplacementEmailContent

-- | The <tt>ReplacementTemplate</tt> associated with
--   <tt>ReplacementEmailContent</tt>.
replacementEmailContent_replacementTemplate :: Lens' ReplacementEmailContent (Maybe ReplacementTemplate)

-- | An object which contains <tt>ReplacementTemplateData</tt> to be used

-- | Enable or disable collection of reputation metrics for emails that you
--   send using this configuration set in the current Amazon Web Services
--   Region.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newReputationOptions</a> smart constructor.
data ReputationOptions
ReputationOptions' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Bool -> ReputationOptions

-- | The date and time (in Unix time) when the reputation metrics were last
--   given a fresh start. When your account is given a fresh start, your
--   reputation metrics are calculated starting from the date of the fresh
--   start.
[$sel:lastFreshStart:ReputationOptions'] :: ReputationOptions -> Maybe POSIX

-- | If <tt>true</tt>, tracking of reputation metrics is enabled for the
--   configuration set. If <tt>false</tt>, tracking of reputation metrics
--   is disabled for the configuration set.
[$sel:reputationMetricsEnabled:ReputationOptions'] :: ReputationOptions -> Maybe Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>ReputationOptions</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastFreshStart:ReputationOptions'</a>,
--   <a>reputationOptions_lastFreshStart</a> - The date and time (in Unix
--   time) when the reputation metrics were last given a fresh start. When
--   your account is given a fresh start, your reputation metrics are
--   calculated starting from the date of the fresh start.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reputationMetricsEnabled:ReputationOptions'</a>,
--   <a>reputationOptions_reputationMetricsEnabled</a> - If <tt>true</tt>,
--   tracking of reputation metrics is enabled for the configuration set.
--   If <tt>false</tt>, tracking of reputation metrics is disabled for the
--   configuration set.
newReputationOptions :: ReputationOptions

-- | The date and time (in Unix time) when the reputation metrics were last
--   given a fresh start. When your account is given a fresh start, your
--   reputation metrics are calculated starting from the date of the fresh
--   start.
reputationOptions_lastFreshStart :: Lens' ReputationOptions (Maybe UTCTime)

--   configuration set. If <tt>false</tt>, tracking of reputation metrics
--   is disabled for the configuration set.
reputationOptions_reputationMetricsEnabled :: Lens' ReputationOptions (Maybe Bool)

data ReviewDetails

-- | The status of the latest review of your account. The status can be one
--   of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>PENDING</tt>  We have received your appeal and are in the
--   process of reviewing it.</li>
--   <li><tt>GRANTED</tt>  Your appeal has been reviewed and your
--   production access has been granted.</li>
--   <li><tt>DENIED</tt>  Your appeal has been reviewed and your
--   production access has been denied.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt>  An internal error occurred and we didn't receive
--   your appeal. You can submit your appeal again.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:status:ReviewDetails'] :: ReviewDetails -> Maybe ReviewStatus

--   the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>PENDING</tt>  We have received your appeal and are in the
--   process of reviewing it.</li>
--   <li><tt>GRANTED</tt>  Your appeal has been reviewed and your
--   production access has been granted.</li>
--   <li><tt>DENIED</tt>  Your appeal has been reviewed and your
--   production access has been denied.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt>  An internal error occurred and we didn't receive
--   your appeal. You can submit your appeal again.</li>
--   </ul>

--   associated support center case ID (if any).

--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSendQuota</a> smart constructor.

--   current Amazon Web Services Region. This value is also called your
--   /maximum sending rate<i> or your </i>maximum TPS (transactions per
--   second) rate/.
[$sel:maxSendRate:SendQuota'] :: SendQuota -> Maybe Double

--   Amazon Web Services Region over the past 24 hours.
[$sel:sentLast24Hours:SendQuota'] :: SendQuota -> Maybe Double

--   Web Services Region over a 24-hour period. This value is also called
--   your <i>sending quota</i>.

--   sending rate<i> or your </i>maximum TPS (transactions per second)
--   rate/.

--   <a>$sel:sentLast24Hours:SendQuota'</a>,

--   Amazon SES account in the current Amazon Web Services Region over the
--   past 24 hours.

--   The maximum number of emails that you can send in the current Amazon
--   Web Services Region over a 24-hour period. This value is also called
--   your <i>sending quota</i>.

--   second) rate/.

-- | An object that contains information about an email address that is on
--   the suppression list for your account.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSuppressedDestination</a> smart constructor.
data SuppressedDestination
SuppressedDestination' :: Maybe SuppressedDestinationAttributes -> Text -> SuppressionListReason -> POSIX -> SuppressedDestination

-- | An optional value that can contain additional information about the
--   reasons that the address was added to the suppression list for your
--   account.
[$sel:attributes:SuppressedDestination'] :: SuppressedDestination -> Maybe SuppressedDestinationAttributes

-- | The email address that is on the suppression list for your account.
[$sel:emailAddress:SuppressedDestination'] :: SuppressedDestination -> Text

-- | The reason that the address was added to the suppression list for your
--   account.

--   shown in Unix time format.
[$sel:lastUpdateTime:SuppressedDestination'] :: SuppressedDestination -> POSIX

--   fields omitted.

--   on the suppression list for your account.

--   <a>$sel:reason:SuppressedDestination'</a>,

--   added to the suppression list for your account.

--   <a>$sel:lastUpdateTime:SuppressedDestination'</a>,

--   the suppressed destination was last updated, shown in Unix time
--   format.

-- | An object that contains information about the email address
--   suppression preferences for your account in the current Amazon Web
--   Services Region.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSuppressionAttributes</a> smart constructor.
data SuppressionAttributes
SuppressionAttributes' :: Maybe [SuppressionListReason] -> SuppressionAttributes

-- | A list that contains the reasons that email addresses will be
--   automatically added to the suppression list for your account. This
--   list can contain any or all of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>COMPLAINT</tt>  Amazon SES adds an email address to the
--   suppression list for your account when a message sent to that address
--   results in a complaint.</li>
--   <li><tt>BOUNCE</tt>  Amazon SES adds an email address to the
--   suppression list for your account when a message sent to that address
--   results in a hard bounce.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:suppressedReasons:SuppressionAttributes'] :: SuppressionAttributes -> Maybe [SuppressionListReason]

-- | Create a value of <a>SuppressionAttributes</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:suppressedReasons:SuppressionAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>suppressionAttributes_suppressedReasons</a> - A list that contains
--   the reasons that email addresses will be automatically added to the
--   suppression list for your account. This list can contain any or all of
--   the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>COMPLAINT</tt>  Amazon SES adds an email address to the
--   suppression list for your account when a message sent to that address
--   results in a complaint.</li>
--   <li><tt>BOUNCE</tt>  Amazon SES adds an email address to the
--   suppression list for your account when a message sent to that address
--   results in a hard bounce.</li>
--   </ul>
newSuppressionAttributes :: SuppressionAttributes

-- | A list that contains the reasons that email addresses will be
--   automatically added to the suppression list for your account. This
--   list can contain any or all of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>COMPLAINT</tt>  Amazon SES adds an email address to the
--   suppression list for your account when a message sent to that address
--   results in a complaint.</li>
--   <li><tt>BOUNCE</tt>  Amazon SES adds an email address to the
--   suppression list for your account when a message sent to that address
--   results in a hard bounce.</li>
--   </ul>
suppressionAttributes_suppressedReasons :: Lens' SuppressionAttributes (Maybe [SuppressionListReason])

-- | An object that contains details about the action of suppression list.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSuppressionListDestination</a> smart constructor.
data SuppressionListDestination
SuppressionListDestination' :: SuppressionListImportAction -> SuppressionListDestination

-- | The type of action to perform on the address. The following are
--   possible values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>PUT: add the addresses to the suppression list. If the record
--   already exists, it will override it with the new value.</li>
--   <li>DELETE: remove the addresses from the suppression list.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:suppressionListImportAction:SuppressionListDestination'] :: SuppressionListDestination -> SuppressionListImportAction

-- | Create a value of <a>SuppressionListDestination</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:suppressionListImportAction:SuppressionListDestination'</a>,
--   <a>suppressionListDestination_suppressionListImportAction</a> - The
--   type of action to perform on the address. The following are possible
--   values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>PUT: add the addresses to the suppression list. If the record
--   already exists, it will override it with the new value.</li>
--   <li>DELETE: remove the addresses from the suppression list.</li>
--   </ul>
newSuppressionListDestination :: SuppressionListImportAction -> SuppressionListDestination

-- | The type of action to perform on the address. The following are
--   possible values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>PUT: add the addresses to the suppression list. If the record
--   already exists, it will override it with the new value.</li>
--   <li>DELETE: remove the addresses from the suppression list.</li>
--   </ul>
suppressionListDestination_suppressionListImportAction :: Lens' SuppressionListDestination SuppressionListImportAction

-- | An object that contains information about the suppression list
--   preferences for your account.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSuppressionOptions</a> smart constructor.
data SuppressionOptions
SuppressionOptions' :: Maybe [SuppressionListReason] -> SuppressionOptions

-- | A list that contains the reasons that email addresses are
--   automatically added to the suppression list for your account. This
--   list can contain any or all of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>COMPLAINT</tt>  Amazon SES adds an email address to the
--   suppression list for your account when a message sent to that address
--   results in a complaint.</li>
--   <li><tt>BOUNCE</tt>  Amazon SES adds an email address to the
--   suppression list for your account when a message sent to that address
--   results in a hard bounce.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:suppressedReasons:SuppressionOptions'] :: SuppressionOptions -> Maybe [SuppressionListReason]

-- | Create a value of <a>SuppressionOptions</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:suppressedReasons:SuppressionOptions'</a>,
--   <a>suppressionOptions_suppressedReasons</a> - A list that contains the
--   reasons that email addresses are automatically added to the
--   suppression list for your account. This list can contain any or all of
--   the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>COMPLAINT</tt>  Amazon SES adds an email address to the
--   suppression list for your account when a message sent to that address
--   results in a complaint.</li>
--   <li><tt>BOUNCE</tt>  Amazon SES adds an email address to the
--   suppression list for your account when a message sent to that address
--   results in a hard bounce.</li>
--   </ul>
newSuppressionOptions :: SuppressionOptions

-- | A list that contains the reasons that email addresses are
--   automatically added to the suppression list for your account. This
--   list can contain any or all of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>COMPLAINT</tt>  Amazon SES adds an email address to the
--   suppression list for your account when a message sent to that address
--   results in a complaint.</li>
--   <li><tt>BOUNCE</tt>  Amazon SES adds an email address to the
--   suppression list for your account when a message sent to that address
--   results in a hard bounce.</li>
--   </ul>
suppressionOptions_suppressedReasons :: Lens' SuppressionOptions (Maybe [SuppressionListReason])

-- | An object that defines the tags that are associated with a resource. A
--   <i>tag</i> is a label that you optionally define and associate with a
--   resource. Tags can help you categorize and manage resources in
--   different ways, such as by purpose, owner, environment, or other
--   criteria. A resource can have as many as 50 tags.
--   
--   Each tag consists of a required <i>tag key</i> and an associated
--   <i>tag value</i>, both of which you define. A tag key is a general
--   label that acts as a category for a more specific tag value. A tag
--   value acts as a descriptor within a tag key. A tag key can contain as
--   many as 128 characters. A tag value can contain as many as 256
--   characters. The characters can be Unicode letters, digits, white
--   space, or one of the following symbols: _ . : / = + -. The following
--   additional restrictions apply to tags:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Tag keys and values are case sensitive.</li>
--   <li>For each associated resource, each tag key must be unique and it
--   can have only one value.</li>
--   <li>The <tt>aws:</tt> prefix is reserved for use by Amazon Web
--   Services; you cant use it in any tag keys or values that you define.
--   In addition, you can't edit or remove tag keys or values that use this
--   prefix. Tags that use this prefix dont count against the limit of 50
--   tags per resource.</li>
--   <li>You can associate tags with public or shared resources, but the
--   tags are available only for your Amazon Web Services account, not any
--   other accounts that share the resource. In addition, the tags are
--   available only for resources that are located in the specified Amazon
--   Web Services Region for your Amazon Web Services account.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTag</a> smart constructor.
data Tag
Tag' :: Text -> Text -> Tag

-- | One part of a key-value pair that defines a tag. The maximum length of
--   a tag key is 128 characters. The minimum length is 1 character.
[$sel:key:Tag'] :: Tag -> Text

-- | The optional part of a key-value pair that defines a tag. The maximum
--   length of a tag value is 256 characters. The minimum length is 0
--   characters. If you don't want a resource to have a specific tag value,
--   don't specify a value for this parameter. If you don't specify a
--   value, Amazon SES sets the value to an empty string.
[$sel:value:Tag'] :: Tag -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Tag</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_key</a> - One part of a key-value pair
--   that defines a tag. The maximum length of a tag key is 128 characters.
--   The minimum length is 1 character.
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_value</a> - The optional part of a
--   key-value pair that defines a tag. The maximum length of a tag value
--   is 256 characters. The minimum length is 0 characters. If you don't
--   want a resource to have a specific tag value, don't specify a value
--   for this parameter. If you don't specify a value, Amazon SES sets the
--   value to an empty string.
newTag :: Text -> Text -> Tag

-- | One part of a key-value pair that defines a tag. The maximum length of
--   a tag key is 128 characters. The minimum length is 1 character.
tag_key :: Lens' Tag Text

-- | The optional part of a key-value pair that defines a tag. The maximum
--   length of a tag value is 256 characters. The minimum length is 0
--   characters. If you don't want a resource to have a specific tag value,
--   don't specify a value for this parameter. If you don't specify a
--   value, Amazon SES sets the value to an empty string.
tag_value :: Lens' Tag Text

-- | An object that defines the email template to use for an email message,
--   and the values to use for any message variables in that template. An
--   <i>email template</i> is a type of message template that contains
--   content that you want to define, save, and reuse in email messages
--   that you send.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTemplate</a> smart constructor.
data Template
Template' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Template

-- | The name of the template. You will refer to this name when you send
--   email using the <tt>SendTemplatedEmail</tt> or
--   <tt>SendBulkTemplatedEmail</tt> operations.
[$sel:templateName:Template'] :: Template -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the template.
[$sel:templateArn:Template'] :: Template -> Maybe Text

-- | An object that defines the values to use for message variables in the
--   template. This object is a set of key-value pairs. Each key defines a
--   message variable in the template. The corresponding value defines the
--   value to use for that variable.
[$sel:templateData:Template'] :: Template -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Template</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateName:Template'</a>, <a>template_templateName</a> - The
--   name of the template. You will refer to this name when you send email
--   using the <tt>SendTemplatedEmail</tt> or
--   <tt>SendBulkTemplatedEmail</tt> operations.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateArn:Template'</a>, <a>template_templateArn</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateData:Template'</a>, <a>template_templateData</a> - An
--   object that defines the values to use for message variables in the
--   template. This object is a set of key-value pairs. Each key defines a
--   message variable in the template. The corresponding value defines the
--   value to use for that variable.
newTemplate :: Template

-- | The name of the template. You will refer to this name when you send
--   email using the <tt>SendTemplatedEmail</tt> or
--   <tt>SendBulkTemplatedEmail</tt> operations.
template_templateName :: Lens' Template (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the template.
template_templateArn :: Lens' Template (Maybe Text)

-- | An object that defines the values to use for message variables in the
--   template. This object is a set of key-value pairs. Each key defines a
--   message variable in the template. The corresponding value defines the
--   value to use for that variable.
template_templateData :: Lens' Template (Maybe Text)

-- | An interest group, theme, or label within a list. Lists can have
--   multiple topics.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTopic</a> smart constructor.
data Topic
Topic' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> SubscriptionStatus -> Topic

-- | A description of what the topic is about, which the contact will see.
[$sel:description:Topic'] :: Topic -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the topic.
[$sel:topicName:Topic'] :: Topic -> Text

-- | The name of the topic the contact will see.
[$sel:displayName:Topic'] :: Topic -> Text

-- | The default subscription status to be applied to a contact if the
--   contact has not noted their preference for subscribing to a topic.
[$sel:defaultSubscriptionStatus:Topic'] :: Topic -> SubscriptionStatus

-- | Create a value of <a>Topic</a> with all optional fields omitted.

--   description of what the topic is about, which the contact will see.

--   topic.
--   
--   <a>$sel:displayName:Topic'</a>, <a>topic_displayName</a> - The name of
--   the topic the contact will see.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultSubscriptionStatus:Topic'</a>,
--   <a>topic_defaultSubscriptionStatus</a> - The default subscription
--   status to be applied to a contact if the contact has not noted their
--   preference for subscribing to a topic.
newTopic :: Text -> Text -> SubscriptionStatus -> Topic

--   contact has not noted their preference for subscribing to a topic.

-- | An object that defines the tracking options for a configuration set.
--   When you use the Amazon SES API v2 to send an email, it contains an
--   invisible image that's used to track when recipients open your email.
--   If your email contains links, those links are changed slightly in
--   order to track when recipients click them.
--   
--   These images and links include references to a domain operated by
--   Amazon Web Services. You can optionally configure the Amazon SES to
--   use a domain that you operate for these images and links.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTrackingOptions</a> smart constructor.

--   tracking open and click events.

-- | An object that contains information about the amount of email that was

--   that will arrive in recipients' spam or junk mail folders.

--   that will arrive in recipients' inboxes.

--   mail folders.

--   of emails sent from the current domain that will arrive in recipients'

-- | Creates a preview of the MIME content of an email when provided with a
--   template and a set of replacement data.
--   
--   You can execute this operation no more than once per second.
module Amazonka.SESV2.TestRenderEmailTemplate

-- | <pre>
--   Represents a request to create a preview of the MIME content of an
--   </pre>
--   
--   email when provided with a template and a set of replacement data.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTestRenderEmailTemplate</a> smart constructor.

--   is a JSON object, typically consisting of key-value pairs in which the
--   keys correspond to replacement tags in the email template.

--   values to apply to the template. This parameter is a JSON object,

-- | Add one or more tags (keys and values) to a specified resource. A
--   <i>tag</i> is a label that you optionally define and associate with a
--   resource. Tags can help you categorize and manage resources in
--   different ways, such as by purpose, owner, environment, or other
--   criteria. A resource can have as many as 50 tags.
--   
--   Each tag consists of a required <i>tag key</i> and an associated
--   <i>tag value</i>, both of which you define. A tag key is a general
--   label that acts as a category for more specific tag values. A tag
--   value acts as a descriptor within a tag key.
module Amazonka.SESV2.TagResource

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newTagResource</a> smart constructor.
data TagResource
TagResource' :: Text -> [Tag] -> TagResource

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource that you want to add
--   one or more tags to.
[$sel:resourceArn:TagResource'] :: TagResource -> Text

-- | A list of the tags that you want to add to the resource. A tag
--   consists of a required tag key (<tt>Key</tt>) and an associated tag
--   value (<tt>Value</tt>). The maximum length of a tag key is 128
--   characters. The maximum length of a tag value is 256 characters.
[$sel:tags:TagResource'] :: TagResource -> [Tag]

-- | Create a value of <a>TagResource</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceArn:TagResource'</a>, <a>tagResource_resourceArn</a> -
--   The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource that you want to add
--   one or more tags to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:TagResource'</a>, <a>tagResource_tags</a> - A list of the
--   tags that you want to add to the resource. A tag consists of a
--   required tag key (<tt>Key</tt>) and an associated tag value
--   (<tt>Value</tt>). The maximum length of a tag key is 128 characters.
--   The maximum length of a tag value is 256 characters.
newTagResource :: Text -> TagResource

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource that you want to add
--   one or more tags to.
tagResource_resourceArn :: Lens' TagResource Text

-- | A list of the tags that you want to add to the resource. A tag
--   consists of a required tag key (<tt>Key</tt>) and an associated tag
--   value (<tt>Value</tt>). The maximum length of a tag key is 128
--   characters. The maximum length of a tag value is 256 characters.
tagResource_tags :: Lens' TagResource [Tag]

instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.SESV2.TagResource.TagResource
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.SESV2.TagResource.TagResource
instance Amazonka.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Amazonka.SESV2.TagResource.TagResource
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.SESV2.TagResource.TagResource
instance Amazonka.Data.Path.ToPath Amazonka.SESV2.TagResource.TagResource
instance Amazonka.Data.Query.ToQuery Amazonka.SESV2.TagResource.TagResource


-- | Sends an email message. You can use the Amazon SES API v2 to send the
--   following types of messages:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b>Simple</b>  A standard email message. When you create this
--   type of message, you specify the sender, the recipient, and the
--   message body, and Amazon SES assembles the message for you.</li>
--   <li><b>Raw</b>  A raw, MIME-formatted email message. When you send
--   this type of email, you have to specify all of the message headers, as
--   well as the message body. You can use this message type to send
--   messages that contain attachments. The message that you specify has to
--   be a valid MIME message.</li>
--   <li><b>Templated</b>  A message that contains personalization tags.
--   When you send this type of email, Amazon SES API v2 automatically
--   replaces the tags with values that you specify.</li>
--   </ul>
module Amazonka.SESV2.SendEmail

-- | Represents a request to send a single formatted email using Amazon
--   SES. For more information, see the <a>Amazon SES Developer Guide</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSendEmail</a> smart constructor.
data SendEmail
SendEmail' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Destination -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ListManagementOptions -> Maybe [MessageTag] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> EmailContent -> SendEmail

-- | The email address to use as the "From" address for the email. The
--   address that you specify has to be verified.
[$sel:fromEmailAddress:SendEmail'] :: SendEmail -> Maybe Text

-- | An object that contains the recipients of the email message.
[$sel:destination:SendEmail'] :: SendEmail -> Maybe Destination

-- | This parameter is used only for sending authorization. It is the ARN
--   of the identity that is associated with the sending authorization
--   policy that permits you to use the email address specified in the
--   <tt>FromEmailAddress</tt> parameter.
--   
--   For example, if the owner of example.com (which has ARN
--   arn:aws:ses:us-east-1:123456789012:identity/example.com) attaches a
--   policy to it that authorizes you to use sender@example.com, then you
--   would specify the <tt>FromEmailAddressIdentityArn</tt> to be
--   arn:aws:ses:us-east-1:123456789012:identity/example.com, and the
--   <tt>FromEmailAddress</tt> to be sender@example.com.
--   
--   For more information about sending authorization, see the <a>Amazon
--   SES Developer Guide</a>.
--   
--   For Raw emails, the <tt>FromEmailAddressIdentityArn</tt> value
--   overrides the X-SES-SOURCE-ARN and X-SES-FROM-ARN headers specified in
--   raw email message content.
[$sel:fromEmailAddressIdentityArn:SendEmail'] :: SendEmail -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the configuration set to use when sending the email.
[$sel:configurationSetName:SendEmail'] :: SendEmail -> Maybe Text

-- | An object used to specify a list or topic to which an email belongs,
--   which will be used when a contact chooses to unsubscribe.
[$sel:listManagementOptions:SendEmail'] :: SendEmail -> Maybe ListManagementOptions

-- | A list of tags, in the form of name/value pairs, to apply to an email
--   that you send using the <tt>SendEmail</tt> operation. Tags correspond
--   to characteristics of the email that you define, so that you can
--   publish email sending events.
[$sel:emailTags:SendEmail'] :: SendEmail -> Maybe [MessageTag]

-- | The address that you want bounce and complaint notifications to be
--   sent to.
[$sel:feedbackForwardingEmailAddress:SendEmail'] :: SendEmail -> Maybe Text

-- | This parameter is used only for sending authorization. It is the ARN
--   of the identity that is associated with the sending authorization
--   policy that permits you to use the email address specified in the
--   <tt>FeedbackForwardingEmailAddress</tt> parameter.
--   
--   For example, if the owner of example.com (which has ARN
--   arn:aws:ses:us-east-1:123456789012:identity/example.com) attaches a
--   policy to it that authorizes you to use feedback@example.com, then you
--   would specify the <tt>FeedbackForwardingEmailAddressIdentityArn</tt>
--   to be arn:aws:ses:us-east-1:123456789012:identity/example.com, and the
--   <tt>FeedbackForwardingEmailAddress</tt> to be feedback@example.com.
--   
--   For more information about sending authorization, see the <a>Amazon
--   SES Developer Guide</a>.
[$sel:feedbackForwardingEmailAddressIdentityArn:SendEmail'] :: SendEmail -> Maybe Text

-- | The "Reply-to" email addresses for the message. When the recipient
--   replies to the message, each Reply-to address receives the reply.
[$sel:replyToAddresses:SendEmail'] :: SendEmail -> Maybe [Text]

-- | An object that contains the body of the message. You can send either a
--   Simple message Raw message or a template Message.
[$sel:content:SendEmail'] :: SendEmail -> EmailContent

-- | Create a value of <a>SendEmail</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--

--   For example, if the owner of example.com (which has ARN
--   arn:aws:ses:us-east-1:123456789012:identity/example.com) attaches a

--   would specify the <tt>FromEmailAddressIdentityArn</tt> to be
--   arn:aws:ses:us-east-1:123456789012:identity/example.com, and the
--   <tt>FromEmailAddress</tt> to be sender@example.com.
--   
--   For more information about sending authorization, see the <a>Amazon
--   SES Developer Guide</a>.
--   
--   For Raw emails, the <tt>FromEmailAddressIdentityArn</tt> value
--   overrides the X-SES-SOURCE-ARN and X-SES-FROM-ARN headers specified in
--   raw email message content.
--   
--   <a>$sel:configurationSetName:SendEmail'</a>,

--   set to use when sending the email.
--   
--   <a>$sel:listManagementOptions:SendEmail'</a>,

--   contact chooses to unsubscribe.

--   email sending events.
--   
--   <a>$sel:feedbackForwardingEmailAddress:SendEmail'</a>,
--   <a>sendEmail_feedbackForwardingEmailAddress</a> - The address that you
--   want bounce and complaint notifications to be sent to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:feedbackForwardingEmailAddressIdentityArn:SendEmail'</a>,
--   <a>sendEmail_feedbackForwardingEmailAddressIdentityArn</a> - This
--   parameter is used only for sending authorization. It is the ARN of the
--   identity that is associated with the sending authorization policy that
--   permits you to use the email address specified in the
--   <tt>FeedbackForwardingEmailAddress</tt> parameter.
--   
--   For example, if the owner of example.com (which has ARN
--   arn:aws:ses:us-east-1:123456789012:identity/example.com) attaches a
--   policy to it that authorizes you to use feedback@example.com, then you
--   would specify the <tt>FeedbackForwardingEmailAddressIdentityArn</tt>
--   to be arn:aws:ses:us-east-1:123456789012:identity/example.com, and the
--   <tt>FeedbackForwardingEmailAddress</tt> to be feedback@example.com.
--   
--   For more information about sending authorization, see the <a>Amazon
--   SES Developer Guide</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:replyToAddresses:SendEmail'</a>,
--   <a>sendEmail_replyToAddresses</a> - The "Reply-to" email addresses for
--   the message. When the recipient replies to the message, each Reply-to
--   address receives the reply.
--   
--   <a>$sel:content:SendEmail'</a>, <a>sendEmail_content</a> - An object
--   that contains the body of the message. You can send either a Simple
--   message Raw message or a template Message.
newSendEmail :: EmailContent -> SendEmail

-- | The email address to use as the "From" address for the email. The
--   address that you specify has to be verified.
sendEmail_fromEmailAddress :: Lens' SendEmail (Maybe Text)

-- | An object that contains the recipients of the email message.
sendEmail_destination :: Lens' SendEmail (Maybe Destination)

-- | This parameter is used only for sending authorization. It is the ARN

sendEmail_fromEmailAddressIdentityArn :: Lens' SendEmail (Maybe Text)

-- | A unique message ID that you receive when an email is accepted for
--   sending.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSendEmailResponse</a> smart constructor.
data SendEmailResponse
SendEmailResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Int -> SendEmailResponse

-- | A unique identifier for the message that is generated when the message
--   is accepted.
--   
--   It's possible for Amazon SES to accept a message without sending it.
--   This can happen when the message that you're trying to send has an
--   attachment contains a virus, or when you send a templated email that
--   contains invalid personalization content, for example.
[$sel:messageId:SendEmailResponse'] :: SendEmailResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:SendEmailResponse'] :: SendEmailResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>SendEmailResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.

-- | Adds an email address to the list of identities for your Amazon SES
--   account in the current Amazon Web Services Region and attempts to
--   verify it. As a result of executing this operation, a customized
--   verification email is sent to the specified address.
--   
--   To use this operation, you must first create a custom verification
--   email template. For more information about creating and using custom
--   verification email templates, see <a>Using Custom Verification Email
--   Templates</a> in the <i>Amazon SES Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   You can execute this operation no more than once per second.
module Amazonka.SESV2.SendCustomVerificationEmail

-- | Represents a request to send a custom verification email to a
--   specified recipient.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSendCustomVerificationEmail</a> smart constructor.
data SendCustomVerificationEmail
SendCustomVerificationEmail' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> SendCustomVerificationEmail

-- | Name of a configuration set to use when sending the verification
--   email.
[$sel:configurationSetName:SendCustomVerificationEmail'] :: SendCustomVerificationEmail -> Maybe Text

-- | The email address to verify.
[$sel:emailAddress:SendCustomVerificationEmail'] :: SendCustomVerificationEmail -> Text

-- | The name of the custom verification email template to use when sending
--   the verification email.
[$sel:templateName:SendCustomVerificationEmail'] :: SendCustomVerificationEmail -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>SendCustomVerificationEmail</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:configurationSetName:SendCustomVerificationEmail'</a>,
--   <a>sendCustomVerificationEmail_configurationSetName</a> - Name of a
--   configuration set to use when sending the verification email.
--   
--   <a>$sel:emailAddress:SendCustomVerificationEmail'</a>,
--   <a>sendCustomVerificationEmail_emailAddress</a> - The email address to
--   verify.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateName:SendCustomVerificationEmail'</a>,
--   <a>sendCustomVerificationEmail_templateName</a> - The name of the
--   custom verification email template to use when sending the
--   verification email.
newSendCustomVerificationEmail :: Text -> Text -> SendCustomVerificationEmail

-- | Name of a configuration set to use when sending the verification
--   email.
sendCustomVerificationEmail_configurationSetName :: Lens' SendCustomVerificationEmail (Maybe Text)

-- | The email address to verify.
sendCustomVerificationEmail_emailAddress :: Lens' SendCustomVerificationEmail Text

-- | The name of the custom verification email template to use when sending
--   the verification email.
sendCustomVerificationEmail_templateName :: Lens' SendCustomVerificationEmail Text

-- | The following element is returned by the service.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSendCustomVerificationEmailResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data SendCustomVerificationEmailResponse

[$sel:messageId:SendCustomVerificationEmailResponse'] :: SendCustomVerificationEmailResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | Composes an email message to multiple destinations.
module Amazonka.SESV2.SendBulkEmail

-- | Represents a request to send email messages to multiple destinations
--   using Amazon SES. For more information, see the <a>Amazon SES
--   Developer Guide</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSendBulkEmail</a> smart constructor.
data SendBulkEmail
SendBulkEmail' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [MessageTag] -> Maybe [Text] -> BulkEmailContent -> [BulkEmailEntry] -> SendBulkEmail

-- | The email address to use as the "From" address for the email. The
--   address that you specify has to be verified.
[$sel:fromEmailAddress:SendBulkEmail'] :: SendBulkEmail -> Maybe Text

-- | This parameter is used only for sending authorization. It is the ARN
--   of the identity that is associated with the sending authorization
--   policy that permits you to use the email address specified in the
--   <tt>FromEmailAddress</tt> parameter.
--   
--   For example, if the owner of example.com (which has ARN
--   arn:aws:ses:us-east-1:123456789012:identity/example.com) attaches a
--   policy to it that authorizes you to use sender@example.com, then you
--   would specify the <tt>FromEmailAddressIdentityArn</tt> to be
--   arn:aws:ses:us-east-1:123456789012:identity/example.com, and the
--   <tt>FromEmailAddress</tt> to be sender@example.com.
--   
--   For more information about sending authorization, see the <a>Amazon
--   SES Developer Guide</a>.
[$sel:fromEmailAddressIdentityArn:SendBulkEmail'] :: SendBulkEmail -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the configuration set to use when sending the email.
[$sel:configurationSetName:SendBulkEmail'] :: SendBulkEmail -> Maybe Text

-- | The address that you want bounce and complaint notifications to be
--   sent to.
[$sel:feedbackForwardingEmailAddress:SendBulkEmail'] :: SendBulkEmail -> Maybe Text

-- | This parameter is used only for sending authorization. It is the ARN
--   of the identity that is associated with the sending authorization
--   policy that permits you to use the email address specified in the
--   <tt>FeedbackForwardingEmailAddress</tt> parameter.
--   
--   For example, if the owner of example.com (which has ARN
--   arn:aws:ses:us-east-1:123456789012:identity/example.com) attaches a
--   policy to it that authorizes you to use feedback@example.com, then you
--   would specify the <tt>FeedbackForwardingEmailAddressIdentityArn</tt>
--   to be arn:aws:ses:us-east-1:123456789012:identity/example.com, and the
--   <tt>FeedbackForwardingEmailAddress</tt> to be feedback@example.com.
--   
--   For more information about sending authorization, see the <a>Amazon
--   SES Developer Guide</a>.
[$sel:feedbackForwardingEmailAddressIdentityArn:SendBulkEmail'] :: SendBulkEmail -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of tags, in the form of name/value pairs, to apply to an email
--   that you send using the <tt>SendEmail</tt> operation. Tags correspond
--   to characteristics of the email that you define, so that you can
--   publish email sending events.
[$sel:defaultEmailTags:SendBulkEmail'] :: SendBulkEmail -> Maybe [MessageTag]

-- | The "Reply-to" email addresses for the message. When the recipient
--   replies to the message, each Reply-to address receives the reply.
[$sel:replyToAddresses:SendBulkEmail'] :: SendBulkEmail -> Maybe [Text]

-- | An object that contains the body of the message. You can specify a
--   template message.
[$sel:defaultContent:SendBulkEmail'] :: SendBulkEmail -> BulkEmailContent

-- | The list of bulk email entry objects.
[$sel:bulkEmailEntries:SendBulkEmail'] :: SendBulkEmail -> [BulkEmailEntry]

-- | Create a value of <a>SendBulkEmail</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:fromEmailAddress:SendBulkEmail'</a>,
--   <a>sendBulkEmail_fromEmailAddress</a> - The email address to use as
--   the "From" address for the email. The address that you specify has to
--   be verified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fromEmailAddressIdentityArn:SendBulkEmail'</a>,
--   <a>sendBulkEmail_fromEmailAddressIdentityArn</a> - This parameter is
--   used only for sending authorization. It is the ARN of the identity
--   that is associated with the sending authorization policy that permits
--   you to use the email address specified in the
--   <tt>FromEmailAddress</tt> parameter.
--   
--   For example, if the owner of example.com (which has ARN
--   arn:aws:ses:us-east-1:123456789012:identity/example.com) attaches a
--   policy to it that authorizes you to use sender@example.com, then you
--   would specify the <tt>FromEmailAddressIdentityArn</tt> to be
--   arn:aws:ses:us-east-1:123456789012:identity/example.com, and the
--   <tt>FromEmailAddress</tt> to be sender@example.com.
--   
--   For more information about sending authorization, see the <a>Amazon
--   SES Developer Guide</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:configurationSetName:SendBulkEmail'</a>,
--   <a>sendBulkEmail_configurationSetName</a> - The name of the
--   configuration set to use when sending the email.
--   
--   <a>$sel:feedbackForwardingEmailAddress:SendBulkEmail'</a>,
--   <a>sendBulkEmail_feedbackForwardingEmailAddress</a> - The address that
--   you want bounce and complaint notifications to be sent to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:feedbackForwardingEmailAddressIdentityArn:SendBulkEmail'</a>,
--   <a>sendBulkEmail_feedbackForwardingEmailAddressIdentityArn</a> - This
--   parameter is used only for sending authorization. It is the ARN of the
--   identity that is associated with the sending authorization policy that
--   permits you to use the email address specified in the
--   <tt>FeedbackForwardingEmailAddress</tt> parameter.
--   
--   For example, if the owner of example.com (which has ARN
--   arn:aws:ses:us-east-1:123456789012:identity/example.com) attaches a
--   policy to it that authorizes you to use feedback@example.com, then you
--   would specify the <tt>FeedbackForwardingEmailAddressIdentityArn</tt>
--   to be arn:aws:ses:us-east-1:123456789012:identity/example.com, and the
--   <tt>FeedbackForwardingEmailAddress</tt> to be feedback@example.com.
--   
--   For more information about sending authorization, see the <a>Amazon
--   SES Developer Guide</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultEmailTags:SendBulkEmail'</a>,
--   <a>sendBulkEmail_defaultEmailTags</a> - A list of tags, in the form of
--   name/value pairs, to apply to an email that you send using the
--   <tt>SendEmail</tt> operation. Tags correspond to characteristics of
--   the email that you define, so that you can publish email sending
--   events.
--   
--   <a>$sel:replyToAddresses:SendBulkEmail'</a>,
--   <a>sendBulkEmail_replyToAddresses</a> - The "Reply-to" email addresses
--   for the message. When the recipient replies to the message, each
--   Reply-to address receives the reply.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultContent:SendBulkEmail'</a>,
--   <a>sendBulkEmail_defaultContent</a> - An object that contains the body
--   of the message. You can specify a template message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bulkEmailEntries:SendBulkEmail'</a>,
--   <a>sendBulkEmail_bulkEmailEntries</a> - The list of bulk email entry
--   objects.
newSendBulkEmail :: BulkEmailContent -> SendBulkEmail

-- | The email address to use as the "From" address for the email. The
--   address that you specify has to be verified.
sendBulkEmail_fromEmailAddress :: Lens' SendBulkEmail (Maybe Text)

-- | This parameter is used only for sending authorization. It is the ARN
--   of the identity that is associated with the sending authorization
--   policy that permits you to use the email address specified in the
--   <tt>FromEmailAddress</tt> parameter.
--   
--   For example, if the owner of example.com (which has ARN
--   arn:aws:ses:us-east-1:123456789012:identity/example.com) attaches a
--   policy to it that authorizes you to use sender@example.com, then you
--   would specify the <tt>FromEmailAddressIdentityArn</tt> to be
--   arn:aws:ses:us-east-1:123456789012:identity/example.com, and the
--   <tt>FromEmailAddress</tt> to be sender@example.com.
--   
--   For more information about sending authorization, see the <a>Amazon
--   SES Developer Guide</a>.
sendBulkEmail_fromEmailAddressIdentityArn :: Lens' SendBulkEmail (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the configuration set to use when sending the email.
sendBulkEmail_configurationSetName :: Lens' SendBulkEmail (Maybe Text)

-- | The address that you want bounce and complaint notifications to be
--   sent to.
sendBulkEmail_feedbackForwardingEmailAddress :: Lens' SendBulkEmail (Maybe Text)

-- | This parameter is used only for sending authorization. It is the ARN
--   of the identity that is associated with the sending authorization
--   policy that permits you to use the email address specified in the
--   <tt>FeedbackForwardingEmailAddress</tt> parameter.
--   
--   For example, if the owner of example.com (which has ARN

--   publish email sending events.

--   template message.

-- | Used to enable or disable the custom Mail-From domain configuration
--   for an email identity.
module Amazonka.SESV2.PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes

-- | A request to configure the custom MAIL FROM domain for a verified
--   identity.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes</a> smart
--   constructor.
data PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes
PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe BehaviorOnMxFailure -> Text -> PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes

-- | The custom MAIL FROM domain that you want the verified identity to
--   use. The MAIL FROM domain must meet the following criteria:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>It has to be a subdomain of the verified identity.</li>
--   <li>It can't be used to receive email.</li>
--   <li>It can't be used in a "From" address if the MAIL FROM domain is a
--   destination for feedback forwarding emails.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:mailFromDomain:PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes'] :: PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | The action to take if the required MX record isn't found when you send
--   an email. When you set this value to <tt>UseDefaultValue</tt>, the
--   mail is sent using <i>amazonses.com</i> as the MAIL FROM domain. When
--   you set this value to <tt>RejectMessage</tt>, the Amazon SES API v2
--   returns a <tt>MailFromDomainNotVerified</tt> error, and doesn't
--   attempt to deliver the email.
--   
--   These behaviors are taken when the custom MAIL FROM domain
--   configuration is in the <tt>Pending</tt>, <tt>Failed</tt>, and
--   <tt>TemporaryFailure</tt> states.
[$sel:behaviorOnMxFailure:PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes'] :: PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes -> Maybe BehaviorOnMxFailure

-- | The verified email identity.
[$sel:emailIdentity:PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes'] :: PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:mailFromDomain:PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>putEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes_mailFromDomain</a> - The custom
--   MAIL FROM domain that you want the verified identity to use. The MAIL
--   FROM domain must meet the following criteria:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>It has to be a subdomain of the verified identity.</li>
--   <li>It can't be used to receive email.</li>
--   <li>It can't be used in a "From" address if the MAIL FROM domain is a
--   destination for feedback forwarding emails.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:behaviorOnMxFailure:PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>putEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes_behaviorOnMxFailure</a> - The
--   action to take if the required MX record isn't found when you send an
--   email. When you set this value to <tt>UseDefaultValue</tt>, the mail
--   is sent using <i>amazonses.com</i> as the MAIL FROM domain. When you
--   set this value to <tt>RejectMessage</tt>, the Amazon SES API v2

--   <tt>TemporaryFailure</tt> states.
--   
--   <a>$sel:emailIdentity:PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>putEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes_emailIdentity</a> - The verified
--   email identity.
newPutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes :: Text -> PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes

-- | The custom MAIL FROM domain that you want the verified identity to
--   use. The MAIL FROM domain must meet the following criteria:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>It has to be a subdomain of the verified identity.</li>
--   <li>It can't be used to receive email.</li>

--   destination for feedback forwarding emails.</li>

--   mail is sent using <i>amazonses.com</i> as the MAIL FROM domain. When

--

-- | Used to enable or disable feedback forwarding for an identity. This
--   setting determines what happens when an identity is used to send an
--   email that results in a bounce or complaint event.
--   
--   If the value is <tt>true</tt>, you receive email notifications when
--   bounce or complaint events occur. These notifications are sent to the
--   address that you specified in the <tt>Return-Path</tt> header of the
--   original email.
--   
--   You're required to have a method of tracking bounces and complaints.
--   If you haven't set up another mechanism for receiving bounce or
--   complaint notifications (for example, by setting up an event
--   destination), you receive an email notification when these events
--   occur (even if this setting is disabled).
module Amazonka.SESV2.PutEmailIdentityFeedbackAttributes

-- | A request to set the attributes that control how bounce and complaint
--   events are processed.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPutEmailIdentityFeedbackAttributes</a> smart
--   constructor.
data PutEmailIdentityFeedbackAttributes
PutEmailIdentityFeedbackAttributes' :: Maybe Bool -> Text -> PutEmailIdentityFeedbackAttributes

-- | Sets the feedback forwarding configuration for the identity.
--   
--   If the value is <tt>true</tt>, you receive email notifications when
--   bounce or complaint events occur. These notifications are sent to the
--   address that you specified in the <tt>Return-Path</tt> header of the
--   original email.
--   
--   You're required to have a method of tracking bounces and complaints.
--   If you haven't set up another mechanism for receiving bounce or
--   complaint notifications (for example, by setting up an event
--   destination), you receive an email notification when these events
--   occur (even if this setting is disabled).
[$sel:emailForwardingEnabled:PutEmailIdentityFeedbackAttributes'] :: PutEmailIdentityFeedbackAttributes -> Maybe Bool

-- | The email identity.
[$sel:emailIdentity:PutEmailIdentityFeedbackAttributes'] :: PutEmailIdentityFeedbackAttributes -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>PutEmailIdentityFeedbackAttributes</a> with all

--   original email.

--   If you haven't set up another mechanism for receiving bounce or

--   destination), you receive an email notification when these events
--   occur (even if this setting is disabled).
--
