instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.SESV2.PutEmailIdentityFeedbackAttributes.PutEmailIdentityFeedbackAttributes
instance Amazonka.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Amazonka.SESV2.PutEmailIdentityFeedbackAttributes.PutEmailIdentityFeedbackAttributes
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.SESV2.PutEmailIdentityFeedbackAttributes.PutEmailIdentityFeedbackAttributes
instance Amazonka.Data.Path.ToPath Amazonka.SESV2.PutEmailIdentityFeedbackAttributes.PutEmailIdentityFeedbackAttributes
instance Amazonka.Data.Query.ToQuery Amazonka.SESV2.PutEmailIdentityFeedbackAttributes.PutEmailIdentityFeedbackAttributes


-- | Used to configure or change the DKIM authentication settings for an
--   email domain identity. You can use this operation to do any of the
--   following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Update the signing attributes for an identity that uses Bring Your
--   Own DKIM (BYODKIM).</li>
--   <li>Update the key length that should be used for Easy DKIM.</li>
--   <li>Change from using no DKIM authentication to using Easy DKIM.</li>
--   <li>Change from using no DKIM authentication to using BYODKIM.</li>
--   <li>Change from using Easy DKIM to using BYODKIM.</li>
--   <li>Change from using BYODKIM to using Easy DKIM.</li>
--   </ul>
module Amazonka.SESV2.PutEmailIdentityDkimSigningAttributes

-- | A request to change the DKIM attributes for an email identity.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPutEmailIdentityDkimSigningAttributes</a> smart
--   constructor.
data PutEmailIdentityDkimSigningAttributes
PutEmailIdentityDkimSigningAttributes' :: Maybe DkimSigningAttributes -> Text -> DkimSigningAttributesOrigin -> PutEmailIdentityDkimSigningAttributes

-- | An object that contains information about the private key and selector
--   that you want to use to configure DKIM for the identity for Bring Your
--   Own DKIM (BYODKIM) for the identity, or, configures the key length to
--   be used for <a>Easy DKIM</a>.
[$sel:signingAttributes:PutEmailIdentityDkimSigningAttributes'] :: PutEmailIdentityDkimSigningAttributes -> Maybe DkimSigningAttributes

-- | The email identity.
[$sel:emailIdentity:PutEmailIdentityDkimSigningAttributes'] :: PutEmailIdentityDkimSigningAttributes -> Text

-- | The method to use to configure DKIM for the identity. There are the
--   following possible values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>AWS_SES</tt>  Configure DKIM for the identity by using
--   <a>Easy DKIM</a>.</li>
--   <li><tt>EXTERNAL</tt>  Configure DKIM for the identity by using Bring
--   Your Own DKIM (BYODKIM).</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:signingAttributesOrigin:PutEmailIdentityDkimSigningAttributes'] :: PutEmailIdentityDkimSigningAttributes -> DkimSigningAttributesOrigin

-- | Create a value of <a>PutEmailIdentityDkimSigningAttributes</a> with
--   all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:signingAttributes:PutEmailIdentityDkimSigningAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>putEmailIdentityDkimSigningAttributes_signingAttributes</a> - An
--   object that contains information about the private key and selector
--   that you want to use to configure DKIM for the identity for Bring Your
--   Own DKIM (BYODKIM) for the identity, or, configures the key length to
--   be used for <a>Easy DKIM</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:emailIdentity:PutEmailIdentityDkimSigningAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>putEmailIdentityDkimSigningAttributes_emailIdentity</a> - The email
--   identity.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:signingAttributesOrigin:PutEmailIdentityDkimSigningAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>putEmailIdentityDkimSigningAttributes_signingAttributesOrigin</a> -
--   The method to use to configure DKIM for the identity. There are the
--   following possible values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>AWS_SES</tt>  Configure DKIM for the identity by using
--   <a>Easy DKIM</a>.</li>
--   <li><tt>EXTERNAL</tt>  Configure DKIM for the identity by using Bring
--   Your Own DKIM (BYODKIM).</li>
--   </ul>
newPutEmailIdentityDkimSigningAttributes :: Text -> DkimSigningAttributesOrigin -> PutEmailIdentityDkimSigningAttributes

-- | An object that contains information about the private key and selector
--   that you want to use to configure DKIM for the identity for Bring Your
--   Own DKIM (BYODKIM) for the identity, or, configures the key length to
--   be used for <a>Easy DKIM</a>.
putEmailIdentityDkimSigningAttributes_signingAttributes :: Lens' PutEmailIdentityDkimSigningAttributes (Maybe DkimSigningAttributes)

-- | The email identity.
putEmailIdentityDkimSigningAttributes_emailIdentity :: Lens' PutEmailIdentityDkimSigningAttributes Text

-- | The method to use to configure DKIM for the identity. There are the
--   following possible values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>AWS_SES</tt>  Configure DKIM for the identity by using
--   <a>Easy DKIM</a>.</li>
--   <li><tt>EXTERNAL</tt>  Configure DKIM for the identity by using Bring
--   Your Own DKIM (BYODKIM).</li>
--   </ul>
putEmailIdentityDkimSigningAttributes_signingAttributesOrigin :: Lens' PutEmailIdentityDkimSigningAttributes DkimSigningAttributesOrigin

-- | If the action is successful, the service sends back an HTTP 200
--   response.
--   
--   The following data is returned in JSON format by the service.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPutEmailIdentityDkimSigningAttributesResponse</a>
--   smart constructor.
data PutEmailIdentityDkimSigningAttributesResponse
PutEmailIdentityDkimSigningAttributesResponse' :: Maybe DkimStatus -> Maybe [Text] -> Int -> PutEmailIdentityDkimSigningAttributesResponse

-- | The DKIM authentication status of the identity. Amazon SES determines
--   the authentication status by searching for specific records in the DNS
--   configuration for your domain. If you used <a>Easy DKIM</a> to set up
--   DKIM authentication, Amazon SES tries to find three unique CNAME
--   records in the DNS configuration for your domain.
--   
--   If you provided a public key to perform DKIM authentication, Amazon
--   SES tries to find a TXT record that uses the selector that you
--   specified. The value of the TXT record must be a public key that's
--   paired with the private key that you specified in the process of
--   creating the identity.
--   
--   The status can be one of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>PENDING</tt>  The verification process was initiated, but
--   Amazon SES hasn't yet detected the DKIM records in the DNS
--   configuration for the domain.</li>
--   <li><tt>SUCCESS</tt>  The verification process completed
--   successfully.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt>  The verification process failed. This typically
--   occurs when Amazon SES fails to find the DKIM records in the DNS
--   configuration of the domain.</li>
--   <li><tt>TEMPORARY_FAILURE</tt>  A temporary issue is preventing
--   Amazon SES from determining the DKIM authentication status of the
--   domain.</li>
--   <li><tt>NOT_STARTED</tt>  The DKIM verification process hasn't been
--   initiated for the domain.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:dkimStatus:PutEmailIdentityDkimSigningAttributesResponse'] :: PutEmailIdentityDkimSigningAttributesResponse -> Maybe DkimStatus

-- | If you used <a>Easy DKIM</a> to configure DKIM authentication for the
--   domain, then this object contains a set of unique strings that you use
--   to create a set of CNAME records that you add to the DNS configuration
--   for your domain. When Amazon SES detects these records in the DNS
--   configuration for your domain, the DKIM authentication process is
--   complete.
--   
--   If you configured DKIM authentication for the domain by providing your
--   own public-private key pair, then this object contains the selector
--   that's associated with your public key.
--   
--   Regardless of the DKIM authentication method you use, Amazon SES
--   searches for the appropriate records in the DNS configuration of the
--   domain for up to 72 hours.
[$sel:dkimTokens:PutEmailIdentityDkimSigningAttributesResponse'] :: PutEmailIdentityDkimSigningAttributesResponse -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:PutEmailIdentityDkimSigningAttributesResponse'] :: PutEmailIdentityDkimSigningAttributesResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>PutEmailIdentityDkimSigningAttributesResponse</a>
--   with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   The status can be one of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>PENDING</tt>  The verification process was initiated, but
--   Amazon SES hasn't yet detected the DKIM records in the DNS

newPutEmailIdentityDkimSigningAttributesResponse :: Int -> PutEmailIdentityDkimSigningAttributesResponse

-- | Used to enable or disable DKIM authentication for an email identity.

-- | A request to enable or disable DKIM signing of email that you send
--   from an email identity.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPutEmailIdentityDkimAttributes</a> smart
--   constructor.
data PutEmailIdentityDkimAttributes
PutEmailIdentityDkimAttributes' :: Maybe Bool -> Text -> PutEmailIdentityDkimAttributes

-- | Sets the DKIM signing configuration for the identity.
--   
--   When you set this value <tt>true</tt>, then the messages that are sent
--   from the identity are signed using DKIM. If you set this value to
--   <tt>false</tt>, your messages are sent without DKIM signing.
[$sel:signingEnabled:PutEmailIdentityDkimAttributes'] :: PutEmailIdentityDkimAttributes -> Maybe Bool

-- | The email identity.
[$sel:emailIdentity:PutEmailIdentityDkimAttributes'] :: PutEmailIdentityDkimAttributes -> Text

-- | Enable or disable the Deliverability dashboard. When you enable the
--   Deliverability dashboard, you gain access to reputation,
--   deliverability, and other metrics for the domains that you use to send
--   email. You also gain the ability to perform predictive inbox placement
--   tests.
--   
--   When you use the Deliverability dashboard, you pay a monthly
--   subscription charge, in addition to any other fees that you accrue by
--   using Amazon SES and other Amazon Web Services services. For more
--   information about the features and cost of a Deliverability dashboard
--   subscription, see <a>Amazon SES Pricing</a>.
module Amazonka.SESV2.PutDeliverabilityDashboardOption

-- | Enable or disable the Deliverability dashboard. When you enable the
--   Deliverability dashboard, you gain access to reputation,
--   deliverability, and other metrics for the domains that you use to send
--   email using Amazon SES API v2. You also gain the ability to perform
--   predictive inbox placement tests.
--   
--   When you use the Deliverability dashboard, you pay a monthly
--   subscription charge, in addition to any other fees that you accrue by
--   using Amazon SES and other Amazon Web Services services. For more
--   information about the features and cost of a Deliverability dashboard
--   subscription, see <a>Amazon Pinpoint Pricing</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPutDeliverabilityDashboardOption</a> smart
--   constructor.
data PutDeliverabilityDashboardOption
PutDeliverabilityDashboardOption' :: Maybe [DomainDeliverabilityTrackingOption] -> Bool -> PutDeliverabilityDashboardOption

-- | An array of objects, one for each verified domain that you use to send
--   email and enabled the Deliverability dashboard for.

-- | Move a dedicated IP address to an existing dedicated IP pool.
--   
--   The dedicated IP address that you specify must already exist, and must
--   be associated with your Amazon Web Services account.
--   
--   The dedicated IP pool you specify must already exist. You can create a
--   new pool by using the <tt>CreateDedicatedIpPool</tt> operation.
module Amazonka.SESV2.PutDedicatedIpInPool

--

--   to. You have to specify an IP pool that already exists.

-- | Specify the account suppression list preferences for a configuration
--   set.
module Amazonka.SESV2.PutConfigurationSetSuppressionOptions

-- | A request to change the account suppression list preferences for a
--   specific configuration set.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPutConfigurationSetSuppressionOptions</a> smart
--   constructor.
data PutConfigurationSetSuppressionOptions
PutConfigurationSetSuppressionOptions' :: Maybe [SuppressionListReason] -> Text -> PutConfigurationSetSuppressionOptions

-- | A list that contains the reasons that email addresses are
--   automatically added to the suppression list for your account. This
--   list can contain any or all of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>COMPLAINT</tt>  Amazon SES adds an email address to the
--   suppression list for your account when a message sent to that address
--   results in a complaint.</li>
--   <li><tt>BOUNCE</tt>  Amazon SES adds an email address to the
--   suppression list for your account when a message sent to that address
--   results in a hard bounce.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:suppressedReasons:PutConfigurationSetSuppressionOptions'] :: PutConfigurationSetSuppressionOptions -> Maybe [SuppressionListReason]

-- | The name of the configuration set to change the suppression list
--   preferences for.
[$sel:configurationSetName:PutConfigurationSetSuppressionOptions'] :: PutConfigurationSetSuppressionOptions -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>PutConfigurationSetSuppressionOptions</a> with
--   all optional fields omitted.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   list that contains the reasons that email addresses are automatically
--   added to the suppression list for your account. This list can contain
--   any or all of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>COMPLAINT</tt>  Amazon SES adds an email address to the
--   suppression list for your account when a message sent to that address
--   results in a complaint.</li>
--   <li><tt>BOUNCE</tt>  Amazon SES adds an email address to the
--   suppression list for your account when a message sent to that address
--   results in a hard bounce.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:configurationSetName:PutConfigurationSetSuppressionOptions'</a>,
--   <a>putConfigurationSetSuppressionOptions_configurationSetName</a> -
--   The name of the configuration set to change the suppression list
--   preferences for.
newPutConfigurationSetSuppressionOptions :: Text -> PutConfigurationSetSuppressionOptions

--   automatically added to the suppression list for your account. This
--   list can contain any or all of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>COMPLAINT</tt>  Amazon SES adds an email address to the
--   suppression list for your account when a message sent to that address
--   results in a complaint.</li>
--   <li><tt>BOUNCE</tt>  Amazon SES adds an email address to the
--   suppression list for your account when a message sent to that address
--   results in a hard bounce.</li>
--   </ul>

-- | Enable or disable email sending for messages that use a particular
--   configuration set in a specific Amazon Web Services Region.
module Amazonka.SESV2.PutConfigurationSetSendingOptions

-- | A request to enable or disable the ability of Amazon SES to send
--   emails that use a specific configuration set.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPutConfigurationSetSendingOptions</a> smart
--   constructor.
data PutConfigurationSetSendingOptions
PutConfigurationSetSendingOptions' :: Maybe Bool -> Text -> PutConfigurationSetSendingOptions

-- | If <tt>true</tt>, email sending is enabled for the configuration set.
--   If <tt>false</tt>, email sending is disabled for the configuration

--   to use Transport Layer Security (TLS). If the value is
--   <tt>Require</tt>, messages are only delivered if a TLS connection can
--   be established. If the value is <tt>Optional</tt>, messages can be
--   delivered in plain text if a TLS connection can't be established.

-- | Change the settings for the account-level suppression list.
module Amazonka.SESV2.PutAccountSuppressionAttributes

-- | A request to change your account's suppression preferences.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPutAccountSuppressionAttributes</a> smart
--   constructor.
data PutAccountSuppressionAttributes
PutAccountSuppressionAttributes' :: Maybe [SuppressionListReason] -> PutAccountSuppressionAttributes

-- | A list that contains the reasons that email addresses will be
--   automatically added to the suppression list for your account. This
--   list can contain any or all of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>COMPLAINT</tt>  Amazon SES adds an email address to the
--   suppression list for your account when a message sent to that address
--   results in a complaint.</li>
--   <li><tt>BOUNCE</tt>  Amazon SES adds an email address to the
--   suppression list for your account when a message sent to that address
--   results in a hard bounce.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:suppressedReasons:PutAccountSuppressionAttributes'] :: PutAccountSuppressionAttributes -> Maybe [SuppressionListReason]

-- | Create a value of <a>PutAccountSuppressionAttributes</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   contains the reasons that email addresses will be automatically added
--   to the suppression list for your account. This list can contain any or
--   all of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>COMPLAINT</tt>  Amazon SES adds an email address to the
--   suppression list for your account when a message sent to that address
--   results in a complaint.</li>
--   <li><tt>BOUNCE</tt>  Amazon SES adds an email address to the
--   suppression list for your account when a message sent to that address
--   results in a hard bounce.</li>
--   </ul>
newPutAccountSuppressionAttributes :: PutAccountSuppressionAttributes

-- | A list that contains the reasons that email addresses will be
--   automatically added to the suppression list for your account. This
--   list can contain any or all of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>COMPLAINT</tt>  Amazon SES adds an email address to the
--   suppression list for your account when a message sent to that address
--   results in a complaint.</li>
--   <li><tt>BOUNCE</tt>  Amazon SES adds an email address to the
--   suppression list for your account when a message sent to that address
--   results in a hard bounce.</li>
--   </ul>

-- | Enable or disable the ability of your account to send email.

--   <tt>true</tt> to enable email sending, or set to <tt>false</tt> to
--   disable email sending.
--

--   you can't use this operation to resume your account's ability to send
--   email.

--   sending.

--   you can't use this operation to resume your account's ability to send
--   email.
newPutAccountSendingAttributes :: PutAccountSendingAttributes

--   <tt>true</tt> to enable email sending, or set to <tt>false</tt> to
--   disable email sending.

-- | Update your Amazon SES account details.
module Amazonka.SESV2.PutAccountDetails

-- | A request to submit new account details.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPutAccountDetails</a> smart constructor.
data PutAccountDetails
PutAccountDetails' :: Maybe ContactLanguage -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe (Sensitive (NonEmpty (Sensitive Text))) -> MailType -> Sensitive Text -> Sensitive Text -> PutAccountDetails

-- | The language you would prefer to be contacted with.
[$sel:contactLanguage:PutAccountDetails'] :: PutAccountDetails -> Maybe ContactLanguage

-- | Indicates whether or not your account should have production access in
--   the current Amazon Web Services Region.
--   
--   If the value is <tt>false</tt>, then your account is in the
--   <i>sandbox</i>. When your account is in the sandbox, you can only send
--   email to verified identities. Additionally, the maximum number of
--   emails you can send in a 24-hour period (your sending quota) is 200,
--   and the maximum number of emails you can send per second (your maximum
--   sending rate) is 1.
--   
--   If the value is <tt>true</tt>, then your account has production
--   access. When your account has production access, you can send email to
--   any address. The sending quota and maximum sending rate for your
--   account vary based on your specific use case.
[$sel:productionAccessEnabled:PutAccountDetails'] :: PutAccountDetails -> Maybe Bool

-- | Additional email addresses that you would like to be notified
--   regarding Amazon SES matters.
[$sel:additionalContactEmailAddresses:PutAccountDetails'] :: PutAccountDetails -> Maybe (Sensitive (NonEmpty (Sensitive Text)))

-- | The type of email your account will send.
[$sel:mailType:PutAccountDetails'] :: PutAccountDetails -> MailType

-- | The URL of your website. This information helps us better understand
--   the type of content that you plan to send.

--   <a>putAccountDetails_contactLanguage</a> - The language you would
--   prefer to be contacted with.
--   
--   <a>$sel:productionAccessEnabled:PutAccountDetails'</a>,
--   <a>putAccountDetails_productionAccessEnabled</a> - Indicates whether
--   or not your account should have production access in the current
--   Amazon Web Services Region.
--   
--   If the value is <tt>false</tt>, then your account is in the
--   <i>sandbox</i>. When your account is in the sandbox, you can only send
--   email to verified identities. Additionally, the maximum number of
--   emails you can send in a 24-hour period (your sending quota) is 200,
--   and the maximum number of emails you can send per second (your maximum
--   sending rate) is 1.
--   
--   If the value is <tt>true</tt>, then your account has production
--   access. When your account has production access, you can send email to
--   any address. The sending quota and maximum sending rate for your
--   account vary based on your specific use case.
--   
--   <a>$sel:additionalContactEmailAddresses:PutAccountDetails'</a>,

--   email addresses that you would like to be notified regarding Amazon
--   SES matters.

--   will send.

--   <i>tag key</i> and an optional associated <i>tag value</i>. A tag key
--   is a general label that acts as a category for more specific tag
--   values. A tag value acts as a descriptor within a tag key.

--

data ListSuppressedDestinations

--   only includes addresses that were added to the list before a specific
--   date. The date that you specify should be in Unix time format.

--   only includes addresses that were added to the list after a specific
--   date. The date that you specify should be in Unix time format.

-- | Lists all of the import jobs.
module Amazonka.SESV2.ListImportJobs

-- | Represents a request to list all of the import jobs for a data
--   destination within the specified maximum number of import jobs.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newListImportJobs</a> smart constructor.
data ListImportJobs
ListImportJobs' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe ImportDestinationType -> ListImportJobs

-- | A string token indicating that there might be additional import jobs
--   available to be listed. Copy this token to a subsequent call to
--   <tt>ListImportJobs</tt> with the same parameters to retrieve the next
--   page of import jobs.
[$sel:nextToken:ListImportJobs'] :: ListImportJobs -> Maybe Text

-- | Maximum number of import jobs to return at once. Use this parameter to
--   paginate results. If additional import jobs exist beyond the specified
--   limit, the <tt>NextToken</tt> element is sent in the response. Use the
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> value in subsequent requests to retrieve additional
--   addresses.
[$sel:pageSize:ListImportJobs'] :: ListImportJobs -> Maybe Int

-- | The destination of the import job, which can be used to list import
--   jobs that have a certain <tt>ImportDestinationType</tt>.
[$sel:importDestinationType:ListImportJobs'] :: ListImportJobs -> Maybe ImportDestinationType

-- | Create a value of <a>ListImportJobs</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListImportJobs'</a>, <a>listImportJobs_nextToken</a>
--   - A string token indicating that there might be additional import jobs
--   available to be listed. Copy this token to a subsequent call to
--   <tt>ListImportJobs</tt> with the same parameters to retrieve the next
--   page of import jobs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:pageSize:ListImportJobs'</a>, <a>listImportJobs_pageSize</a> -
--   Maximum number of import jobs to return at once. Use this parameter to
--   paginate results. If additional import jobs exist beyond the specified
--   limit, the <tt>NextToken</tt> element is sent in the response. Use the
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> value in subsequent requests to retrieve additional
--   addresses.

--   <a>listImportJobs_importDestinationType</a> - The destination of the
--   import job, which can be used to list import jobs that have a certain
--   <tt>ImportDestinationType</tt>.

-- | Returns a list of all of the email identities that are associated with
--   your Amazon Web Services account. An identity can be either an email
--   address or a domain. This operation returns identities that are
--   verified as well as those that aren't. This operation returns
--   identities that are associated with Amazon SES and Amazon Pinpoint.
module Amazonka.SESV2.ListEmailIdentities

-- | A request to list all of the email identities associated with your
--   Amazon Web Services account. This list includes identities that you've
--   already verified, identities that are unverified, and identities that
--   were verified in the past, but are no longer verified.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newListEmailIdentities</a> smart constructor.

-- | Retrieve deliverability data for all the campaigns that used a
--   specific domain to send email during a specified time range. This data
--   is available for a domain only if you enabled the Deliverability
--   dashboard for the domain.
module Amazonka.SESV2.ListDomainDeliverabilityCampaigns

--   specific domain to send email during a specified time range. This data

--   deliverability data for.

--   deliverability data for. This value has to be less than or equal to 30

-- | Lists the contacts present in a specific contact list.
module Amazonka.SESV2.ListContacts

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListContacts</a> smart constructor.
data ListContacts
ListContacts' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe ListContactsFilter -> Maybe Int -> Text -> ListContacts

-- | A string token indicating that there might be additional contacts
--   available to be listed. Use the token provided in the Response to use
--   in the subsequent call to ListContacts with the same parameters to
--   retrieve the next page of contacts.
[$sel:nextToken:ListContacts'] :: ListContacts -> Maybe Text

-- | A filter that can be applied to a list of contacts.
[$sel:filter':ListContacts'] :: ListContacts -> Maybe ListContactsFilter

-- | The number of contacts that may be returned at once, which is
--   dependent on if there are more or less contacts than the value of the
--   PageSize. Use this parameter to paginate results. If additional
--   contacts exist beyond the specified limit, the <tt>NextToken</tt>
--   element is sent in the response. Use the <tt>NextToken</tt> value in
--   subsequent requests to retrieve additional contacts.
[$sel:pageSize:ListContacts'] :: ListContacts -> Maybe Int

-- | The name of the contact list.
[$sel:contactListName:ListContacts'] :: ListContacts -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ListContacts</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListContacts'</a>, <a>listContacts_nextToken</a> - A
--   string token indicating that there might be additional contacts
--   available to be listed. Use the token provided in the Response to use
--   in the subsequent call to ListContacts with the same parameters to
--   retrieve the next page of contacts.
--   
--   <a>$sel:filter':ListContacts'</a>, <a>listContacts_filter</a> - A
--   filter that can be applied to a list of contacts.
--   
--   <a>$sel:pageSize:ListContacts'</a>, <a>listContacts_pageSize</a> - The
--   number of contacts that may be returned at once, which is dependent on
--   if there are more or less contacts than the value of the PageSize. Use
--   this parameter to paginate results. If additional contacts exist
--   beyond the specified limit, the <tt>NextToken</tt> element is sent in
--   the response. Use the <tt>NextToken</tt> value in subsequent requests
--   to retrieve additional contacts.

--   <a>$sel:contactListName:ListContacts'</a>,
--   <a>listContacts_contactListName</a> - The name of the contact list.

--   dependent on if there are more or less contacts than the value of the

-- | List all of the configuration sets associated with your account in the
--   current region.
--   
--   <i>Configuration sets</i> are groups of rules that you can apply to
--   the emails you send. You apply a configuration set to an email by
--   including a reference to the configuration set in the headers of the
--   email. When you apply a configuration set to an email, all of the
--   rules in that configuration set are applied to the email.
module Amazonka.SESV2.ListConfigurationSets

-- | A request to obtain a list of configuration sets for your Amazon SES
--   account in the current Amazon Web Services Region.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newListConfigurationSets</a> smart constructor.
data ListConfigurationSets
ListConfigurationSets' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> ListConfigurationSets

--   <tt>ListConfigurationSets</tt> to indicate the position in the list of
--   configuration sets.

--   <tt>ListConfigurationSets</tt>. If the number of results is larger
--   than the number you specified in this parameter, then the response
--   includes a <tt>NextToken</tt> element, which you can use to obtain
--   additional results.
[$sel:pageSize:ListConfigurationSets'] :: ListConfigurationSets -> Maybe Int

-- | Create a value of <a>ListConfigurationSets</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional

--   position in the list of configuration sets.

--   <a>listConfigurationSets_pageSize</a> - The number of results to show
--   in a single call to <tt>ListConfigurationSets</tt>. If the number of
--   results is larger than the number you specified in this parameter,
--   then the response includes a <tt>NextToken</tt> element, which you can
--   use to obtain additional results.
newListConfigurationSets :: ListConfigurationSets

-- | A token returned from a previous call to
--   <tt>ListConfigurationSets</tt> to indicate the position in the list of
--   configuration sets.
listConfigurationSets_nextToken :: Lens' ListConfigurationSets (Maybe Text)

-- | The number of results to show in a single call to
--   <tt>ListConfigurationSets</tt>. If the number of results is larger
--   than the number you specified in this parameter, then the response
--   includes a <tt>NextToken</tt> element, which you can use to obtain
--   additional results.

--   the request fails.
--

data GetImportJobResponse

[$sel:processedRecordsCount:GetImportJobResponse'] :: GetImportJobResponse -> Maybe Int

-- | The failure details about an import job.

[$sel:importDestination:GetImportJobResponse'] :: GetImportJobResponse -> Maybe ImportDestination

-- | The status of the import job.
[$sel:jobStatus:GetImportJobResponse'] :: GetImportJobResponse -> Maybe JobStatus

-- | The number of records that failed processing because of invalid input
--   or other reasons.
[$sel:failedRecordsCount:GetImportJobResponse'] :: GetImportJobResponse -> Maybe Int

-- | The time stamp of when the import job was created.
[$sel:createdTimestamp:GetImportJobResponse'] :: GetImportJobResponse -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:GetImportJobResponse'] :: GetImportJobResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>GetImportJobResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--

--   fields.

--   string that represents the import job ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:importDataSource:GetImportJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getImportJobResponse_importDataSource</a> - The data source of the
--   import job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:completedTimestamp:GetImportJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getImportJobResponse_completedTimestamp</a> - The time stamp of
--   when the import job was completed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:failureInfo:GetImportJobResponse'</a>,

--   import job.

--   import job.

--   <a>getImportJobResponse_failedRecordsCount</a> - The number of records
--   that failed processing because of invalid input or other reasons.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdTimestamp:GetImportJobResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getImportJobResponse_createdTimestamp</a> - The time stamp of when
--   the import job was created.

--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:GetImportJobResponse'</a>,

-- | Returns the requested sending authorization policies for the given
--   identity (an email address or a domain). The policies are returned as
--   a map of policy names to policy contents. You can retrieve a maximum
--   of 20 policies at a time.
--   
--   This API is for the identity owner only. If you have not verified the
--   identity, this API will return an error.
--   
--   Sending authorization is a feature that enables an identity owner to
--   authorize other senders to use its identities. For information about
--   using sending authorization, see the <a>Amazon SES Developer
--   Guide</a>.
--   
--   You can execute this operation no more than once per second.
module Amazonka.SESV2.GetEmailIdentityPolicies

--   identity's verification status, sending authorization policies, its
--   DKIM authentication status, and its custom Mail-From settings.
module Amazonka.SESV2.GetEmailIdentity

--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGetEmailIdentity</a> smart constructor.
data GetEmailIdentity

--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGetEmailIdentityResponse</a> smart constructor.
data GetEmailIdentityResponse
GetEmailIdentityResponse' :: Maybe DkimAttributes -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe IdentityType -> Maybe MailFromAttributes -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe [Tag] -> Int -> GetEmailIdentityResponse

-- | An object that contains information about the DKIM attributes for the
--   identity.
[$sel:dkimAttributes:GetEmailIdentityResponse'] :: GetEmailIdentityResponse -> Maybe DkimAttributes

-- | Specifies whether or not the identity is verified. You can only send
--   email from verified email addresses or domains. For more information
--   about verifying identities, see the <a>Amazon Pinpoint User Guide</a>.
[$sel:verifiedForSendingStatus:GetEmailIdentityResponse'] :: GetEmailIdentityResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | The configuration set used by default when sending from this identity.
[$sel:configurationSetName:GetEmailIdentityResponse'] :: GetEmailIdentityResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The email identity type. Note: the <tt>MANAGED_DOMAIN</tt> identity
--   type is not supported.
[$sel:identityType:GetEmailIdentityResponse'] :: GetEmailIdentityResponse -> Maybe IdentityType

-- | An object that contains information about the Mail-From attributes for
--   the email identity.
[$sel:mailFromAttributes:GetEmailIdentityResponse'] :: GetEmailIdentityResponse -> Maybe MailFromAttributes

-- | The feedback forwarding configuration for the identity.
--   
--   If the value is <tt>true</tt>, you receive email notifications when
--   bounce or complaint events occur. These notifications are sent to the
--   address that you specified in the <tt>Return-Path</tt> header of the
--   original email.
--   
--   You're required to have a method of tracking bounces and complaints.
--   If you haven't set up another mechanism for receiving bounce or
--   complaint notifications (for example, by setting up an event
--   destination), you receive an email notification when these events
--   occur (even if this setting is disabled).
[$sel:feedbackForwardingStatus:GetEmailIdentityResponse'] :: GetEmailIdentityResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | A map of policy names to policies.
[$sel:policies:GetEmailIdentityResponse'] :: GetEmailIdentityResponse -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | An array of objects that define the tags (keys and values) that are
--   associated with the email identity.
[$sel:tags:GetEmailIdentityResponse'] :: GetEmailIdentityResponse -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:GetEmailIdentityResponse'] :: GetEmailIdentityResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>GetEmailIdentityResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

-- | Retrieve inbox placement and engagement rates for the domains that you
--   use to send email.
module Amazonka.SESV2.GetDomainStatisticsReport

-- | A request to obtain deliverability metrics for a domain.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGetDomainStatisticsReport</a> smart constructor.
data GetDomainStatisticsReport
GetDomainStatisticsReport' :: Text -> POSIX -> POSIX -> GetDomainStatisticsReport

-- | The domain that you want to obtain deliverability metrics for.
[$sel:domain:GetDomainStatisticsReport'] :: GetDomainStatisticsReport -> Text

-- | The first day (in Unix time) that you want to obtain domain
--   deliverability metrics for.
[$sel:startDate:GetDomainStatisticsReport'] :: GetDomainStatisticsReport -> POSIX

-- | The last day (in Unix time) that you want to obtain domain
--   deliverability metrics for. The <tt>EndDate</tt> that you specify has
--   to be less than or equal to 30 days after the <tt>StartDate</tt>.
[$sel:endDate:GetDomainStatisticsReport'] :: GetDomainStatisticsReport -> POSIX

-- | Create a value of <a>GetDomainStatisticsReport</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--

--   <a>getDomainStatisticsReport_startDate</a> - The first day (in Unix
--   time) that you want to obtain domain deliverability metrics for.

--   <a>getDomainStatisticsReport_endDate</a> - The last day (in Unix time)
--   that you want to obtain domain deliverability metrics for. The

--   days after the <tt>StartDate</tt>.

-- | The last day (in Unix time) that you want to obtain domain
--   deliverability metrics for. The <tt>EndDate</tt> that you specify has
--   to be less than or equal to 30 days after the <tt>StartDate</tt>.

--   you specified.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGetDomainStatisticsReportResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data GetDomainStatisticsReportResponse
GetDomainStatisticsReportResponse' :: Int -> OverallVolume -> [DailyVolume] -> GetDomainStatisticsReportResponse

[$sel:httpStatus:GetDomainStatisticsReportResponse'] :: GetDomainStatisticsReportResponse -> Int

--   specified. The data in this object is a summary of all of the data
--   that was collected from the <tt>StartDate</tt> to the
--   <tt>EndDate</tt>.
[$sel:overallVolume:GetDomainStatisticsReportResponse'] :: GetDomainStatisticsReportResponse -> OverallVolume

--   specified. This object contains data for each day, starting on the
--   <tt>StartDate</tt> and ending on the <tt>EndDate</tt>.

--   optional fields omitted.

--   that contains deliverability metrics for the domain that you
--   specified. The data in this object is a summary of all of the data
--   that was collected from the <tt>StartDate</tt> to the
--   <tt>EndDate</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dailyVolumes:GetDomainStatisticsReportResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getDomainStatisticsReportResponse_dailyVolumes</a> - An object that
--   contains deliverability metrics for the domain that you specified.
--   This object contains data for each day, starting on the
--   <tt>StartDate</tt> and ending on the <tt>EndDate</tt>.
newGetDomainStatisticsReportResponse :: Int -> OverallVolume -> GetDomainStatisticsReportResponse

-- | Retrieve information about the status of the Deliverability dashboard
--   for your account. When the Deliverability dashboard is enabled, you
--   gain access to reputation, deliverability, and other metrics for the
--   domains that you use to send email. You also gain the ability to
--   perform predictive inbox placement tests.
--   
--   When you use the Deliverability dashboard, you pay a monthly
--   subscription charge, in addition to any other fees that you accrue by
--   using Amazon SES and other Amazon Web Services services. For more
--   information about the features and cost of a Deliverability dashboard
--   subscription, see <a>Amazon SES Pricing</a>.

newGetContactResponse :: Int -> GetContactResponse

-- | A boolean value status noting if the contact is unsubscribed from all
--   contact list topics.
getContactResponse_unsubscribeAll :: Lens' GetContactResponse (Maybe Bool)

getContactResponse_attributesData :: Lens' GetContactResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The default topic preferences applied to the contact.
getContactResponse_topicDefaultPreferences :: Lens' GetContactResponse (Maybe [TopicPreference])

-- | The name of the contact list to which the contact belongs.
getContactResponse_contactListName :: Lens' GetContactResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | A timestamp noting when the contact was created.
getContactResponse_createdTimestamp :: Lens' GetContactResponse (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | A timestamp noting the last time the contact's information was
--   updated.
getContactResponse_lastUpdatedTimestamp :: Lens' GetContactResponse (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The contact's preference for being opted-in to or opted-out of a
--   topic.&gt;
getContactResponse_topicPreferences :: Lens' GetContactResponse (Maybe [TopicPreference])

-- | Retrieve a list of event destinations that are associated with a
--   configuration set.
--   
--   <i>Events</i> include message sends, deliveries, opens, clicks,
--   bounces, and complaints. <i>Event destinations</i> are places that you
--   can send information about these events to. For example, you can send
--   event data to Amazon SNS to receive notifications when you receive
--   bounces or complaints, or you can use Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose to
--   stream data to Amazon S3 for long-term storage.
module Amazonka.SESV2.GetConfigurationSetEventDestinations

--   configuration set.

-- | Get information about an existing configuration set, including the
--   dedicated IP pool that it's associated with, whether or not it's
--   enabled for sending email, and more.
--   
--   <i>Configuration sets</i> are groups of rules that you can apply to
--   the emails you send. You apply a configuration set to an email by
--   including a reference to the configuration set in the headers of the
--   email. When you apply a configuration set to an email, all of the
--   rules in that configuration set are applied to the email.
module Amazonka.SESV2.GetConfigurationSet

-- | A request to obtain information about a configuration set.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGetConfigurationSet</a> smart constructor.
data GetConfigurationSet
GetConfigurationSet' :: Text -> GetConfigurationSet

--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:configurationSetName:GetConfigurationSet'</a>,
--   <a>getConfigurationSet_configurationSetName</a> - The name of the
--   configuration set.
newGetConfigurationSet :: Text -> GetConfigurationSet

-- | The name of the configuration set.
getConfigurationSet_configurationSetName :: Lens' GetConfigurationSet Text

--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGetConfigurationSetResponse</a> smart constructor.

--   you send using the configuration set.

--   preferences for your account.

-- | Obtain information about the email-sending status and capabilities of
--   your Amazon SES account in the current Amazon Web Services Region.
module Amazonka.SESV2.GetAccount

-- | A request to obtain information about the email-sending capabilities
--   of your Amazon SES account.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGetAccount</a> smart constructor.
data GetAccount
GetAccount' :: GetAccount

-- | Create a value of <a>GetAccount</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
newGetAccount :: GetAccount

-- | A list of details about the email-sending capabilities of your Amazon
--   SES account in the current Amazon Web Services Region.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGetAccountResponse</a> smart constructor.
data GetAccountResponse
GetAccountResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe SendQuota -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe AccountDetails -> Maybe SuppressionAttributes -> Maybe Bool -> Int -> GetAccountResponse

-- | The reputation status of your Amazon SES account. The status can be
--   one of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>HEALTHY</tt>  There are no reputation-related issues that
--   currently impact your account.</li>
--   <li><tt>PROBATION</tt>  We've identified potential issues with your
--   Amazon SES account. We're placing your account under review while you
--   work on correcting these issues.</li>
--   <li><tt>SHUTDOWN</tt>  Your account's ability to send email is
--   currently paused because of an issue with the email sent from your
--   account. When you correct the issue, you can contact us and request
--   that your account's ability to send email is resumed.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:enforcementStatus:GetAccountResponse'] :: GetAccountResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | Indicates whether or not the automatic warm-up feature is enabled for
--   dedicated IP addresses that are associated with your account.
[$sel:dedicatedIpAutoWarmupEnabled:GetAccountResponse'] :: GetAccountResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | An object that contains information about the per-day and per-second
--   sending limits for your Amazon SES account in the current Amazon Web
--   Services Region.
[$sel:sendQuota:GetAccountResponse'] :: GetAccountResponse -> Maybe SendQuota

-- | Indicates whether or not your account has production access in the
--   current Amazon Web Services Region.
--   
--   If the value is <tt>false</tt>, then your account is in the
--   <i>sandbox</i>. When your account is in the sandbox, you can only send
--   email to verified identities. Additionally, the maximum number of
--   emails you can send in a 24-hour period (your sending quota) is 200,
--   and the maximum number of emails you can send per second (your maximum
--   sending rate) is 1.
--   
--   If the value is <tt>true</tt>, then your account has production
--   access. When your account has production access, you can send email to
--   any address. The sending quota and maximum sending rate for your
--   account vary based on your specific use case.
[$sel:productionAccessEnabled:GetAccountResponse'] :: GetAccountResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | An object that defines your account details.
[$sel:details:GetAccountResponse'] :: GetAccountResponse -> Maybe AccountDetails

-- | An object that contains information about the email address
--   suppression preferences for your account in the current Amazon Web
--   Services Region.
[$sel:suppressionAttributes:GetAccountResponse'] :: GetAccountResponse -> Maybe SuppressionAttributes

-- | Indicates whether or not email sending is enabled for your Amazon SES
--   account in the current Amazon Web Services Region.
[$sel:sendingEnabled:GetAccountResponse'] :: GetAccountResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:GetAccountResponse'] :: GetAccountResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>GetAccountResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:enforcementStatus:GetAccountResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getAccountResponse_enforcementStatus</a> - The reputation status of
--   your Amazon SES account. The status can be one of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>HEALTHY</tt>  There are no reputation-related issues that
--   currently impact your account.</li>
--   <li><tt>PROBATION</tt>  We've identified potential issues with your
--   Amazon SES account. We're placing your account under review while you
--   work on correcting these issues.</li>
--   <li><tt>SHUTDOWN</tt>  Your account's ability to send email is
--   currently paused because of an issue with the email sent from your
--   account. When you correct the issue, you can contact us and request
--   that your account's ability to send email is resumed.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:dedicatedIpAutoWarmupEnabled:GetAccountResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getAccountResponse_dedicatedIpAutoWarmupEnabled</a> - Indicates
--   whether or not the automatic warm-up feature is enabled for dedicated
--   IP addresses that are associated with your account.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sendQuota:GetAccountResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getAccountResponse_sendQuota</a> - An object that contains
--   information about the per-day and per-second sending limits for your
--   Amazon SES account in the current Amazon Web Services Region.
--   
--   <a>$sel:productionAccessEnabled:GetAccountResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getAccountResponse_productionAccessEnabled</a> - Indicates whether
--   or not your account has production access in the current Amazon Web
--   Services Region.
--   
--   If the value is <tt>false</tt>, then your account is in the
--   <i>sandbox</i>. When your account is in the sandbox, you can only send
--   email to verified identities. Additionally, the maximum number of
--   emails you can send in a 24-hour period (your sending quota) is 200,
--   and the maximum number of emails you can send per second (your maximum
--   sending rate) is 1.
--   
--   If the value is <tt>true</tt>, then your account has production
--   access. When your account has production access, you can send email to
--   any address. The sending quota and maximum sending rate for your
--   account vary based on your specific use case.
--   
--   <a>$sel:details:GetAccountResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getAccountResponse_details</a> - An object that defines your
--   account details.
--   
--   <a>$sel:suppressionAttributes:GetAccountResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getAccountResponse_suppressionAttributes</a> - An object that
--   contains information about the email address suppression preferences
--   for your account in the current Amazon Web Services Region.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sendingEnabled:GetAccountResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getAccountResponse_sendingEnabled</a> - Indicates whether or not
--   email sending is enabled for your Amazon SES account in the current
--   Amazon Web Services Region.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:GetAccountResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getAccountResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newGetAccountResponse :: Int -> GetAccountResponse

-- | The reputation status of your Amazon SES account. The status can be
--   one of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>HEALTHY</tt>  There are no reputation-related issues that
--   currently impact your account.</li>
--   <li><tt>PROBATION</tt>  We've identified potential issues with your
--   Amazon SES account. We're placing your account under review while you
--   work on correcting these issues.</li>
--   <li><tt>SHUTDOWN</tt>  Your account's ability to send email is
--   currently paused because of an issue with the email sent from your
--   account. When you correct the issue, you can contact us and request
--   that your account's ability to send email is resumed.</li>
--   </ul>
getAccountResponse_enforcementStatus :: Lens' GetAccountResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Indicates whether or not the automatic warm-up feature is enabled for
--   dedicated IP addresses that are associated with your account.
getAccountResponse_dedicatedIpAutoWarmupEnabled :: Lens' GetAccountResponse (Maybe Bool)

-- | An object that contains information about the per-day and per-second
--   sending limits for your Amazon SES account in the current Amazon Web
--   Services Region.
getAccountResponse_sendQuota :: Lens' GetAccountResponse (Maybe SendQuota)

-- | Indicates whether or not your account has production access in the
--   current Amazon Web Services Region.
--   
--   If the value is <tt>false</tt>, then your account is in the
--   <i>sandbox</i>. When your account is in the sandbox, you can only send
--   email to verified identities. Additionally, the maximum number of
--   emails you can send in a 24-hour period (your sending quota) is 200,
--   and the maximum number of emails you can send per second (your maximum
--   sending rate) is 1.
--   
--   If the value is <tt>true</tt>, then your account has production
--   access. When your account has production access, you can send email to
--   any address. The sending quota and maximum sending rate for your
--   account vary based on your specific use case.
getAccountResponse_productionAccessEnabled :: Lens' GetAccountResponse (Maybe Bool)

-- | An object that defines your account details.
getAccountResponse_details :: Lens' GetAccountResponse (Maybe AccountDetails)

-- | An object that contains information about the email address
--   suppression preferences for your account in the current Amazon Web
--   Services Region.
getAccountResponse_suppressionAttributes :: Lens' GetAccountResponse (Maybe SuppressionAttributes)

-- | Indicates whether or not email sending is enabled for your Amazon SES
--   account in the current Amazon Web Services Region.
getAccountResponse_sendingEnabled :: Lens' GetAccountResponse (Maybe Bool)

-- | The response's http status code.
getAccountResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' GetAccountResponse Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.SESV2.GetAccount.GetAccount
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.SESV2.GetAccount.GetAccount
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.SESV2.GetAccount.GetAccount
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.SESV2.GetAccount.GetAccount
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.SESV2.GetAccount.GetAccountResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.SESV2.GetAccount.GetAccountResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.SESV2.GetAccount.GetAccountResponse
instance Amazonka.Types.AWSRequest Amazonka.SESV2.GetAccount.GetAccount

-- | Deletes the specified sending authorization policy for the given
--   identity (an email address or a domain). This API returns successfully
--   even if a policy with the specified name does not exist.
--   
--   This API is for the identity owner only. If you have not verified the
--   identity, this API will return an error.
--   
--   Sending authorization is a feature that enables an identity owner to
--   authorize other senders to use its identities. For information about
--   using sending authorization, see the <a>Amazon SES Developer
--   Guide</a>.
--   
--   You can execute this operation no more than once per second.

-- | Creates the specified sending authorization policy for the given
--   identity (an email address or a domain).
--   
--   This API is for the identity owner only. If you have not verified the
--   identity, this API will return an error.
--   
--   Sending authorization is a feature that enables an identity owner to
--   authorize other senders to use its identities. For information about
--   using sending authorization, see the <a>Amazon SES Developer
--   Guide</a>.
--   
--   You can execute this operation no more than once per second.
module Amazonka.SESV2.CreateEmailIdentityPolicy

-- | Represents a request to create a sending authorization policy for an
--   identity. Sending authorization is an Amazon SES feature that enables
--   you to authorize other senders to use your identities. For
--   information, see the <a>Amazon SES Developer Guide</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateEmailIdentityPolicy</a> smart constructor.

--

--   alphanumeric characters, dashes, and underscores.
[$sel:policyName:CreateEmailIdentityPolicy'] :: CreateEmailIdentityPolicy -> Text

-- | The text of the policy in JSON format. The policy cannot exceed 4 KB.
--   
--   For information about the syntax of sending authorization policies,
--   see the <a>Amazon SES Developer Guide</a>.

-- | Starts the process of verifying an email identity. An <i>identity</i>
--   is an email address or domain that you use when you send email. Before
--   you can use an identity to send email, you first have to verify it. By
--   verifying an identity, you demonstrate that you're the owner of the
--   identity, and that you've given Amazon SES API v2 permission to send
--   email from the identity.
--   
--   When you verify an email address, Amazon SES sends an email to the
--   address. Your email address is verified as soon as you follow the link
--   in the verification email.
--   
--   When you verify a domain without specifying the
--   <tt>DkimSigningAttributes</tt> object, this operation provides a set
--   of DKIM tokens. You can convert these tokens into CNAME records, which
--   you then add to the DNS configuration for your domain. Your domain is
--   verified when Amazon SES detects these records in the DNS
--   configuration for your domain. This verification method is known as
--   <a>Easy DKIM</a>.
--   
--   Alternatively, you can perform the verification process by providing
--   your own public-private key pair. This verification method is known as
--   Bring Your Own DKIM (BYODKIM). To use BYODKIM, your call to the
--   <tt>CreateEmailIdentity</tt> operation has to include the
--   <tt>DkimSigningAttributes</tt> object. When you specify this object,
--   you provide a selector (a component of the DNS record name that
--   identifies the public key to use for DKIM authentication) and a
--   private key.
--   
--   When you verify a domain, this operation provides a set of DKIM
--   tokens, which you can convert into CNAME tokens. You add these CNAME
--   tokens to the DNS configuration for your domain. Your domain is
--   verified when Amazon SES detects these records in the DNS
--   configuration for your domain. For some DNS providers, it can take 72
--   hours or more to complete the domain verification process.
--   
--   Additionally, you can associate an existing configuration set with the
--   email identity that you're verifying.
module Amazonka.SESV2.CreateEmailIdentity

-- | A request to begin the verification process for an email identity (an
--   email address or domain).
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateEmailIdentity</a> smart constructor.
data CreateEmailIdentity
CreateEmailIdentity' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe DkimSigningAttributes -> Maybe [Tag] -> Text -> CreateEmailIdentity

-- | The configuration set to use by default when sending from this
--   identity. Note that any configuration set defined in the email sending
--   request takes precedence.
[$sel:configurationSetName:CreateEmailIdentity'] :: CreateEmailIdentity -> Maybe Text

-- | If your request includes this object, Amazon SES configures the
--   identity to use Bring Your Own DKIM (BYODKIM) for DKIM authentication
--   purposes, or, configures the key length to be used for <a>Easy
--   DKIM</a>.
--   
--   You can only specify this object if the email identity is a domain, as
--   opposed to an address.
[$sel:dkimSigningAttributes:CreateEmailIdentity'] :: CreateEmailIdentity -> Maybe DkimSigningAttributes

-- | An array of objects that define the tags (keys and values) to
--   associate with the email identity.
[$sel:tags:CreateEmailIdentity'] :: CreateEmailIdentity -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | The email address or domain to verify.
[$sel:emailIdentity:CreateEmailIdentity'] :: CreateEmailIdentity -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateEmailIdentity</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:configurationSetName:CreateEmailIdentity'</a>,
--   <a>createEmailIdentity_configurationSetName</a> - The configuration
--   set to use by default when sending from this identity. Note that any
--   configuration set defined in the email sending request takes
--   precedence.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dkimSigningAttributes:CreateEmailIdentity'</a>,
--   <a>createEmailIdentity_dkimSigningAttributes</a> - If your request
--   includes this object, Amazon SES configures the identity to use Bring
--   Your Own DKIM (BYODKIM) for DKIM authentication purposes, or,
--   configures the key length to be used for <a>Easy DKIM</a>.
--   
--   You can only specify this object if the email identity is a domain, as
--   opposed to an address.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:CreateEmailIdentity'</a>, <a>createEmailIdentity_tags</a>
--   - An array of objects that define the tags (keys and values) to
--   associate with the email identity.
--   
--   <a>$sel:emailIdentity:CreateEmailIdentity'</a>,
--   <a>createEmailIdentity_emailIdentity</a> - The email address or domain
--   to verify.
newCreateEmailIdentity :: Text -> CreateEmailIdentity

--   identity. Note that any configuration set defined in the email sending
--   request takes precedence.

--   purposes, or, configures the key length to be used for <a>Easy
--   DKIM</a>.

-- | Create a new predictive inbox placement test. Predictive inbox
--   placement tests can help you predict how your messages will be handled
--   by various email providers around the world. When you perform a
--   predictive inbox placement test, you provide a sample message that
--   contains the content that you plan to send to your customers. Amazon
--   SES then sends that message to special email addresses spread across
--   several major email providers. After about 24 hours, the test is
--   complete, and you can use the <tt>GetDeliverabilityTestReport</tt>
--   operation to view the results of the test.
module Amazonka.SESV2.CreateDeliverabilityTestReport

-- | A request to perform a predictive inbox placement test. Predictive
--   inbox placement tests can help you predict how your messages will be
--   handled by various email providers around the world. When you perform
--   a predictive inbox placement test, you provide a sample message that
--   contains the content that you plan to send to your customers. We send
--   that message to special email addresses spread across several major
--   email providers around the world. The test takes about 24 hours to
--   complete. When the test is complete, you can use the
--   <tt>GetDeliverabilityTestReport</tt> operation to view the results of
--   the test.

--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateDeliverabilityTestReport</a> smart

-- | Creates a new custom verification email template.
--   
--   For more information about custom verification email templates, see
--   <a>Using Custom Verification Email Templates</a> in the <i>Amazon SES
--   Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   You can execute this operation no more than once per second.
module Amazonka.SESV2.CreateCustomVerificationEmailTemplate

-- | Represents a request to create a custom verification email template.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateCustomVerificationEmailTemplate</a> smart
--   constructor.
data CreateCustomVerificationEmailTemplate
CreateCustomVerificationEmailTemplate' :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> CreateCustomVerificationEmailTemplate

-- | The name of the custom verification email template.
[$sel:templateName:CreateCustomVerificationEmailTemplate'] :: CreateCustomVerificationEmailTemplate -> Text

-- | The email address that the custom verification email is sent from.
[$sel:fromEmailAddress:CreateCustomVerificationEmailTemplate'] :: CreateCustomVerificationEmailTemplate -> Text

-- | The subject line of the custom verification email.
[$sel:templateSubject:CreateCustomVerificationEmailTemplate'] :: CreateCustomVerificationEmailTemplate -> Text

-- | The content of the custom verification email. The total size of the
--   email must be less than 10 MB. The message body may contain HTML, with
--   some limitations. For more information, see <a>Custom Verification
--   Email Frequently Asked Questions</a> in the <i>Amazon SES Developer
--   Guide</i>.
[$sel:templateContent:CreateCustomVerificationEmailTemplate'] :: CreateCustomVerificationEmailTemplate -> Text

-- | The URL that the recipient of the verification email is sent to if his
--   or her address is successfully verified.
[$sel:successRedirectionURL:CreateCustomVerificationEmailTemplate'] :: CreateCustomVerificationEmailTemplate -> Text

-- | The URL that the recipient of the verification email is sent to if his
--   or her address is not successfully verified.
[$sel:failureRedirectionURL:CreateCustomVerificationEmailTemplate'] :: CreateCustomVerificationEmailTemplate -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateCustomVerificationEmailTemplate</a> with
--   all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateName:CreateCustomVerificationEmailTemplate'</a>,
--   <a>createCustomVerificationEmailTemplate_templateName</a> - The name
--   of the custom verification email template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fromEmailAddress:CreateCustomVerificationEmailTemplate'</a>,
--   <a>createCustomVerificationEmailTemplate_fromEmailAddress</a> - The
--   email address that the custom verification email is sent from.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateSubject:CreateCustomVerificationEmailTemplate'</a>,
--   <a>createCustomVerificationEmailTemplate_templateSubject</a> - The
--   subject line of the custom verification email.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateContent:CreateCustomVerificationEmailTemplate'</a>,
--   <a>createCustomVerificationEmailTemplate_templateContent</a> - The
--   content of the custom verification email. The total size of the email
--   must be less than 10 MB. The message body may contain HTML, with some
--   limitations. For more information, see <a>Custom Verification Email
--   Frequently Asked Questions</a> in the <i>Amazon SES Developer
--   Guide</i>.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:successRedirectionURL:CreateCustomVerificationEmailTemplate'</a>,
--   <a>createCustomVerificationEmailTemplate_successRedirectionURL</a> -
--   The URL that the recipient of the verification email is sent to if his
--   or her address is successfully verified.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:failureRedirectionURL:CreateCustomVerificationEmailTemplate'</a>,
--   <a>createCustomVerificationEmailTemplate_failureRedirectionURL</a> -
--   The URL that the recipient of the verification email is sent to if his
--   or her address is not successfully verified.

--   email must be less than 10 MB. The message body may contain HTML, with
--   some limitations. For more information, see <a>Custom Verification
--   Email Frequently Asked Questions</a> in the <i>Amazon SES Developer
--   Guide</i>.

createCustomVerificationEmailTemplate_successRedirectionURL :: Lens' CreateCustomVerificationEmailTemplate Text

-- | Create an event destination. <i>Events</i> include message sends,
--   deliveries, opens, clicks, bounces, and complaints. <i>Event
--   destinations</i> are places that you can send information about these
--   events to. For example, you can send event data to Amazon SNS to
--   receive notifications when you receive bounces or complaints, or you
--   can use Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose to stream data to Amazon S3 for
--   long-term storage.
--   
--   A single configuration set can include more than one event
--   destination.
module Amazonka.SESV2.CreateConfigurationSetEventDestination

-- | Create a configuration set. <i>Configuration sets</i> are groups of
--   rules that you can apply to the emails that you send. You apply a
--   configuration set to an email by specifying the name of the
--   configuration set when you call the Amazon SES API v2. When you apply
--   a configuration set to an email, all of the rules in that
--   configuration set are applied to the email.
module Amazonka.SESV2.CreateConfigurationSet

-- | A request to create a configuration set.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateConfigurationSet</a> smart constructor.
data CreateConfigurationSet
CreateConfigurationSet' :: Maybe SendingOptions -> Maybe DeliveryOptions -> Maybe TrackingOptions -> Maybe ReputationOptions -> Maybe [Tag] -> Maybe SuppressionOptions -> Text -> CreateConfigurationSet

-- | An object that defines whether or not Amazon SES can send email that
--   you send using the configuration set.
[$sel:sendingOptions:CreateConfigurationSet'] :: CreateConfigurationSet -> Maybe SendingOptions

-- | An object that defines the dedicated IP pool that is used to send
--   emails that you send using the configuration set.
[$sel:deliveryOptions:CreateConfigurationSet'] :: CreateConfigurationSet -> Maybe DeliveryOptions

-- | An object that defines the open and click tracking options for emails
--   that you send using the configuration set.
[$sel:trackingOptions:CreateConfigurationSet'] :: CreateConfigurationSet -> Maybe TrackingOptions

-- | An object that defines whether or not Amazon SES collects reputation
--   metrics for the emails that you send that use the configuration set.
[$sel:reputationOptions:CreateConfigurationSet'] :: CreateConfigurationSet -> Maybe ReputationOptions

-- | An array of objects that define the tags (keys and values) to
--   associate with the configuration set.
[$sel:tags:CreateConfigurationSet'] :: CreateConfigurationSet -> Maybe [Tag]
[$sel:suppressionOptions:CreateConfigurationSet'] :: CreateConfigurationSet -> Maybe SuppressionOptions

-- | The name of the configuration set. The name can contain up to 64
--   alphanumeric characters, including letters, numbers, hyphens (-) and
--   underscores (_) only.
[$sel:configurationSetName:CreateConfigurationSet'] :: CreateConfigurationSet -> Text

--   fields omitted.

-- | Remove one or more tags (keys and values) from a specified resource.
module Amazonka.SESV2.UntagResource

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUntagResource</a> smart constructor.
data UntagResource
UntagResource' :: Text -> [Text] -> UntagResource

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource that you want to remove
--   one or more tags from.
[$sel:resourceArn:UntagResource'] :: UntagResource -> Text

-- | The tags (tag keys) that you want to remove from the resource. When
--   you specify a tag key, the action removes both that key and its
--   associated tag value.
--   
--   To remove more than one tag from the resource, append the
--   <tt>TagKeys</tt> parameter and argument for each additional tag to
--   remove, separated by an ampersand. For example:
--   <tt>/v2/email/tags?ResourceArn=ResourceArn&amp;TagKeys=Key1&amp;TagKeys=Key2</tt>
[$sel:tagKeys:UntagResource'] :: UntagResource -> [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>UntagResource</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceArn:UntagResource'</a>,
--   <a>untagResource_resourceArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of
--   the resource that you want to remove one or more tags from.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tagKeys:UntagResource'</a>, <a>untagResource_tagKeys</a> - The
--   tags (tag keys) that you want to remove from the resource. When you
--   specify a tag key, the action removes both that key and its associated
--   tag value.
--   
--   To remove more than one tag from the resource, append the
--   <tt>TagKeys</tt> parameter and argument for each additional tag to
--   remove, separated by an ampersand. For example:
--   <tt>/v2/email/tags?ResourceArn=ResourceArn&amp;TagKeys=Key1&amp;TagKeys=Key2</tt>
newUntagResource :: Text -> UntagResource

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource that you want to remove
--   one or more tags from.
untagResource_resourceArn :: Lens' UntagResource Text

-- | The tags (tag keys) that you want to remove from the resource. When
--   you specify a tag key, the action removes both that key and its
--   associated tag value.
--   
--   To remove more than one tag from the resource, append the
--   <tt>TagKeys</tt> parameter and argument for each additional tag to
--   remove, separated by an ampersand. For example:
--   <tt>/v2/email/tags?ResourceArn=ResourceArn&amp;TagKeys=Key1&amp;TagKeys=Key2</tt>
untagResource_tagKeys :: Lens' UntagResource [Text]

-- | Update the configuration of an event destination for a configuration
--   set.
--   
--   <i>Events</i> include message sends, deliveries, opens, clicks,
--   bounces, and complaints. <i>Event destinations</i> are places that you
--   can send information about these events to. For example, you can send
--   event data to Amazon SNS to receive notifications when you receive
--   bounces or complaints, or you can use Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose to
--   stream data to Amazon S3 for long-term storage.
module Amazonka.SESV2.UpdateConfigurationSetEventDestination

--   configuration set.

-- | Updates an existing custom verification email template.
--   
--   For more information about custom verification email templates, see
--   <a>Using Custom Verification Email Templates</a> in the <i>Amazon SES
--   Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   You can execute this operation no more than once per second.
module Amazonka.SESV2.UpdateCustomVerificationEmailTemplate

-- | Represents a request to update an existing custom verification email
--   template.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateCustomVerificationEmailTemplate</a> smart
--   constructor.
data UpdateCustomVerificationEmailTemplate
UpdateCustomVerificationEmailTemplate' :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> UpdateCustomVerificationEmailTemplate

-- | The name of the custom verification email template that you want to
--   update.
[$sel:templateName:UpdateCustomVerificationEmailTemplate'] :: UpdateCustomVerificationEmailTemplate -> Text

-- | The email address that the custom verification email is sent from.
[$sel:fromEmailAddress:UpdateCustomVerificationEmailTemplate'] :: UpdateCustomVerificationEmailTemplate -> Text

-- | The subject line of the custom verification email.
[$sel:templateSubject:UpdateCustomVerificationEmailTemplate'] :: UpdateCustomVerificationEmailTemplate -> Text

-- | The content of the custom verification email. The total size of the
--   email must be less than 10 MB. The message body may contain HTML, with
--   some limitations. For more information, see <a>Custom Verification
--   Email Frequently Asked Questions</a> in the <i>Amazon SES Developer
--   Guide</i>.
[$sel:templateContent:UpdateCustomVerificationEmailTemplate'] :: UpdateCustomVerificationEmailTemplate -> Text

-- | The URL that the recipient of the verification email is sent to if his
--   or her address is successfully verified.
[$sel:successRedirectionURL:UpdateCustomVerificationEmailTemplate'] :: UpdateCustomVerificationEmailTemplate -> Text

-- | The URL that the recipient of the verification email is sent to if his
--   or her address is not successfully verified.
[$sel:failureRedirectionURL:UpdateCustomVerificationEmailTemplate'] :: UpdateCustomVerificationEmailTemplate -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateCustomVerificationEmailTemplate</a> with
--   all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   <a>updateCustomVerificationEmailTemplate_templateName</a> - The name
--   of the custom verification email template that you want to update.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fromEmailAddress:UpdateCustomVerificationEmailTemplate'</a>,
--   <a>updateCustomVerificationEmailTemplate_fromEmailAddress</a> - The
--   email address that the custom verification email is sent from.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateSubject:UpdateCustomVerificationEmailTemplate'</a>,
--   <a>updateCustomVerificationEmailTemplate_templateSubject</a> - The
--   subject line of the custom verification email.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateContent:UpdateCustomVerificationEmailTemplate'</a>,
--   <a>updateCustomVerificationEmailTemplate_templateContent</a> - The
--   content of the custom verification email. The total size of the email
--   must be less than 10 MB. The message body may contain HTML, with some
--   limitations. For more information, see <a>Custom Verification Email
--   Frequently Asked Questions</a> in the <i>Amazon SES Developer
--   Guide</i>.

--   or her address is successfully verified.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:failureRedirectionURL:UpdateCustomVerificationEmailTemplate'</a>,
--   <a>updateCustomVerificationEmailTemplate_failureRedirectionURL</a> -
--   The URL that the recipient of the verification email is sent to if his
--   or her address is not successfully verified.
newUpdateCustomVerificationEmailTemplate :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> UpdateCustomVerificationEmailTemplate

-- | The content of the custom verification email. The total size of the
--   email must be less than 10 MB. The message body may contain HTML, with
--   some limitations. For more information, see <a>Custom Verification
--   Email Frequently Asked Questions</a> in the <i>Amazon SES Developer
--   Guide</i>.
updateCustomVerificationEmailTemplate_templateContent :: Lens' UpdateCustomVerificationEmailTemplate Text

--   or her address is successfully verified.
updateCustomVerificationEmailTemplate_successRedirectionURL :: Lens' UpdateCustomVerificationEmailTemplate Text
