-- | Updates the specified sending authorization policy for the given
--   identity (an email address or a domain). This API returns successfully
--   even if a policy with the specified name does not exist.
--   
--   This API is for the identity owner only. If you have not verified the
--   identity, this API will return an error.
--   
--   Sending authorization is a feature that enables an identity owner to
--   authorize other senders to use its identities. For information about
--   using sending authorization, see the <a>Amazon SES Developer
--   Guide</a>.
--   
--   You can execute this operation no more than once per second.
module Amazonka.SESV2.UpdateEmailIdentityPolicy

-- | Represents a request to update a sending authorization policy for an
--   identity. Sending authorization is an Amazon SES feature that enables
--   you to authorize other senders to use your identities. For
--   information, see the <a>Amazon SES Developer Guide</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateEmailIdentityPolicy</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateEmailIdentityPolicy
UpdateEmailIdentityPolicy' :: Text -> Text -> Text -> UpdateEmailIdentityPolicy

-- | The email identity.
[$sel:emailIdentity:UpdateEmailIdentityPolicy'] :: UpdateEmailIdentityPolicy -> Text

-- | The name of the policy.
--   
--   The policy name cannot exceed 64 characters and can only include
--   alphanumeric characters, dashes, and underscores.
[$sel:policyName:UpdateEmailIdentityPolicy'] :: UpdateEmailIdentityPolicy -> Text

-- | The text of the policy in JSON format. The policy cannot exceed 4 KB.
--   
--   For information about the syntax of sending authorization policies,
--   see the <a>Amazon SES Developer Guide</a>.
[$sel:policy:UpdateEmailIdentityPolicy'] :: UpdateEmailIdentityPolicy -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateEmailIdentityPolicy</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:emailIdentity:UpdateEmailIdentityPolicy'</a>,
--   <a>updateEmailIdentityPolicy_emailIdentity</a> - The email identity.
--   
--   <a>$sel:policyName:UpdateEmailIdentityPolicy'</a>,
--   <a>updateEmailIdentityPolicy_policyName</a> - The name of the policy.
--   
--   The policy name cannot exceed 64 characters and can only include
--   alphanumeric characters, dashes, and underscores.
--   
--   <a>$sel:policy:UpdateEmailIdentityPolicy'</a>,
--   <a>updateEmailIdentityPolicy_policy</a> - The text of the policy in
--   JSON format. The policy cannot exceed 4 KB.
--   
--   For information about the syntax of sending authorization policies,
--   see the <a>Amazon SES Developer Guide</a>.
newUpdateEmailIdentityPolicy :: Text -> Text -> Text -> UpdateEmailIdentityPolicy

-- | The email identity.
updateEmailIdentityPolicy_emailIdentity :: Lens' UpdateEmailIdentityPolicy Text

--   
--   The policy name cannot exceed 64 characters and can only include
--   alphanumeric characters, dashes, and underscores.
updateEmailIdentityPolicy_policyName :: Lens' UpdateEmailIdentityPolicy Text

--   
--   For information about the syntax of sending authorization policies,
--   see the <a>Amazon SES Developer Guide</a>.

-- | Updates an email template. Email templates enable you to send

--   operation. For more information, see the <a>Amazon SES Developer

--   You can execute this operation no more than once per second.
module Amazonka.SESV2.UpdateEmailTemplate

-- | The name of the configuration set.

--   you send using the configuration set.
getConfigurationSetResponse_sendingOptions :: Lens' GetConfigurationSetResponse (Maybe SendingOptions)

-- | The name of the configuration set.
getConfigurationSetResponse_configurationSetName :: Lens' GetConfigurationSetResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | An object that defines the dedicated IP pool that is used to send
--   emails that you send using the configuration set.
getConfigurationSetResponse_deliveryOptions :: Lens' GetConfigurationSetResponse (Maybe DeliveryOptions)

-- | An object that defines the open and click tracking options for emails
--   that you send using the configuration set.
getConfigurationSetResponse_trackingOptions :: Lens' GetConfigurationSetResponse (Maybe TrackingOptions)

-- | An object that defines whether or not Amazon SES collects reputation
--   metrics for the emails that you send that use the configuration set.
getConfigurationSetResponse_reputationOptions :: Lens' GetConfigurationSetResponse (Maybe ReputationOptions)

-- | An array of objects that define the tags (keys and values) that are
--   associated with the configuration set.
getConfigurationSetResponse_tags :: Lens' GetConfigurationSetResponse (Maybe [Tag])

-- | An object that contains information about the suppression list
--   preferences for your account.
getConfigurationSetResponse_suppressionOptions :: Lens' GetConfigurationSetResponse (Maybe SuppressionOptions)

-- | The response's http status code.
getConfigurationSetResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' GetConfigurationSetResponse Int

getImportJob_jobId :: Lens' GetImportJob Text

getImportJobResponse_processedRecordsCount :: Lens' GetImportJobResponse (Maybe Int)

-- | A string that represents the import job ID.
getImportJobResponse_jobId :: Lens' GetImportJobResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The data source of the import job.
getImportJobResponse_importDataSource :: Lens' GetImportJobResponse (Maybe ImportDataSource)

-- | The time stamp of when the import job was completed.
getImportJobResponse_completedTimestamp :: Lens' GetImportJobResponse (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The failure details about an import job.
getImportJobResponse_failureInfo :: Lens' GetImportJobResponse (Maybe FailureInfo)

-- | The destination of the import job.
getImportJobResponse_importDestination :: Lens' GetImportJobResponse (Maybe ImportDestination)

getImportJobResponse_jobStatus :: Lens' GetImportJobResponse (Maybe JobStatus)

--   or other reasons.

getImportJobResponse_createdTimestamp :: Lens' GetImportJobResponse (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The response's http status code.
getImportJobResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' GetImportJobResponse Int

-- | The domain to use to track open and click events.
putConfigurationSetTrackingOptions_customRedirectDomain :: Lens' PutConfigurationSetTrackingOptions (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the configuration set.
putConfigurationSetTrackingOptions_configurationSetName :: Lens' PutConfigurationSetTrackingOptions Text

-- | The response's http status code.
putConfigurationSetTrackingOptionsResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' PutConfigurationSetTrackingOptionsResponse Int

-- | An object that contains information about the private key and selector
--   that you want to use to configure DKIM for the identity for Bring Your
--   Own DKIM (BYODKIM) for the identity, or, configures the key length to
--   be used for <a>Easy DKIM</a>.
putEmailIdentityDkimSigningAttributes_signingAttributes :: Lens' PutEmailIdentityDkimSigningAttributes (Maybe DkimSigningAttributes)

-- | The email identity.
putEmailIdentityDkimSigningAttributes_emailIdentity :: Lens' PutEmailIdentityDkimSigningAttributes Text

-- | The method to use to configure DKIM for the identity. There are the
--   following possible values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>AWS_SES</tt>  Configure DKIM for the identity by using
--   <a>Easy DKIM</a>.</li>
--   <li><tt>EXTERNAL</tt>  Configure DKIM for the identity by using Bring
--   Your Own DKIM (BYODKIM).</li>
--   </ul>
putEmailIdentityDkimSigningAttributes_signingAttributesOrigin :: Lens' PutEmailIdentityDkimSigningAttributes DkimSigningAttributesOrigin

-- | The DKIM authentication status of the identity. Amazon SES determines
--   the authentication status by searching for specific records in the DNS
--   configuration for your domain. If you used <a>Easy DKIM</a> to set up
--   DKIM authentication, Amazon SES tries to find three unique CNAME
--   records in the DNS configuration for your domain.
--   
--   If you provided a public key to perform DKIM authentication, Amazon
--   SES tries to find a TXT record that uses the selector that you
--   specified. The value of the TXT record must be a public key that's
--   paired with the private key that you specified in the process of
--   creating the identity.
--   
--   The status can be one of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>PENDING</tt>  The verification process was initiated, but
--   Amazon SES hasn't yet detected the DKIM records in the DNS
--   configuration for the domain.</li>
--   <li><tt>SUCCESS</tt>  The verification process completed
--   successfully.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt>  The verification process failed. This typically
--   occurs when Amazon SES fails to find the DKIM records in the DNS
--   configuration of the domain.</li>
--   <li><tt>TEMPORARY_FAILURE</tt>  A temporary issue is preventing
--   Amazon SES from determining the DKIM authentication status of the
--   domain.</li>
--   <li><tt>NOT_STARTED</tt>  The DKIM verification process hasn't been
--   initiated for the domain.</li>
--   </ul>
putEmailIdentityDkimSigningAttributesResponse_dkimStatus :: Lens' PutEmailIdentityDkimSigningAttributesResponse (Maybe DkimStatus)

-- | If you used <a>Easy DKIM</a> to configure DKIM authentication for the
--   domain, then this object contains a set of unique strings that you use
--   to create a set of CNAME records that you add to the DNS configuration
--   for your domain. When Amazon SES detects these records in the DNS
--   configuration for your domain, the DKIM authentication process is
--   complete.
--   
--   If you configured DKIM authentication for the domain by providing your
--   own public-private key pair, then this object contains the selector
--   that's associated with your public key.
--   
--   Regardless of the DKIM authentication method you use, Amazon SES
--   searches for the appropriate records in the DNS configuration of the
--   domain for up to 72 hours.
putEmailIdentityDkimSigningAttributesResponse_dkimTokens :: Lens' PutEmailIdentityDkimSigningAttributesResponse (Maybe [Text])

-- | The response's http status code.
putEmailIdentityDkimSigningAttributesResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' PutEmailIdentityDkimSigningAttributesResponse Int

-- | Sets the DKIM signing configuration for the identity.
--   
--   When you set this value <tt>true</tt>, then the messages that are sent
--   from the identity are signed using DKIM. If you set this value to
--   <tt>false</tt>, your messages are sent without DKIM signing.
putEmailIdentityDkimAttributes_signingEnabled :: Lens' PutEmailIdentityDkimAttributes (Maybe Bool)

-- | The email identity.
putEmailIdentityDkimAttributes_emailIdentity :: Lens' PutEmailIdentityDkimAttributes Text

-- | The response's http status code.
putEmailIdentityDkimAttributesResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' PutEmailIdentityDkimAttributesResponse Int

--   set.

-- | Specifies whether messages that use the configuration set are required
--   to use Transport Layer Security (TLS). If the value is
--   <tt>Require</tt>, messages are only delivered if a TLS connection can
--   be established. If the value is <tt>Optional</tt>, messages can be
--   delivered in plain text if a TLS connection can't be established.

listSuppressedDestinations_startDate :: Lens' ListSuppressedDestinations (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | A token returned from a previous call to
--   <tt>ListSuppressedDestinations</tt> to indicate the position in the
--   list of suppressed email addresses.

--   larger than the number you specified in this parameter, then the

-- | Sets the feedback forwarding configuration for the identity.
--   
--   If the value is <tt>true</tt>, you receive email notifications when
--   bounce or complaint events occur. These notifications are sent to the
--   address that you specified in the <tt>Return-Path</tt> header of the
--   original email.
--   
--   You're required to have a method of tracking bounces and complaints.
--   If you haven't set up another mechanism for receiving bounce or
--   complaint notifications (for example, by setting up an event
--   destination), you receive an email notification when these events
--   occur (even if this setting is disabled).
putEmailIdentityFeedbackAttributes_emailForwardingEnabled :: Lens' PutEmailIdentityFeedbackAttributes (Maybe Bool)

-- | The response's http status code.

-- | The reputation status of your Amazon SES account. The status can be
--   one of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>HEALTHY</tt>  There are no reputation-related issues that
--   currently impact your account.</li>
--   <li><tt>PROBATION</tt>  We've identified potential issues with your
--   Amazon SES account. We're placing your account under review while you
--   work on correcting these issues.</li>
--   <li><tt>SHUTDOWN</tt>  Your account's ability to send email is
--   currently paused because of an issue with the email sent from your
--   account. When you correct the issue, you can contact us and request
--   that your account's ability to send email is resumed.</li>
--   </ul>

--   Services Region.
getAccountResponse_sendQuota :: Lens' GetAccountResponse (Maybe SendQuota)

-- | Indicates whether or not your account has production access in the
--   current Amazon Web Services Region.
--   
--   If the value is <tt>false</tt>, then your account is in the
--   <i>sandbox</i>. When your account is in the sandbox, you can only send
--   email to verified identities. Additionally, the maximum number of
--   emails you can send in a 24-hour period (your sending quota) is 200,
--   and the maximum number of emails you can send per second (your maximum
--   sending rate) is 1.
--   
--   If the value is <tt>true</tt>, then your account has production
--   access. When your account has production access, you can send email to
--   any address. The sending quota and maximum sending rate for your
--   account vary based on your specific use case.
getAccountResponse_productionAccessEnabled :: Lens' GetAccountResponse (Maybe Bool)

--   list can contain any or all of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>COMPLAINT</tt>  Amazon SES adds an email address to the
--   suppression list for your account when a message sent to that address
--   results in a complaint.</li>

--   suppression list for your account when a message sent to that address

--   <i>sandbox</i>. When your account is in the sandbox, you can only send
--   email to verified identities. Additionally, the maximum number of
--   emails you can send in a 24-hour period (your sending quota) is 200,
--   and the maximum number of emails you can send per second (your maximum
--   sending rate) is 1.
--   
--   If the value is <tt>true</tt>, then your account has production
--   access. When your account has production access, you can send email to
--   any address. The sending quota and maximum sending rate for your
--   account vary based on your specific use case.
putAccountDetails_productionAccessEnabled :: Lens' PutAccountDetails (Maybe Bool)

-- | Additional email addresses that you would like to be notified
--   regarding Amazon SES matters.
putAccountDetails_additionalContactEmailAddresses :: Lens' PutAccountDetails (Maybe (NonEmpty Text))

-- | The type of email your account will send.
putAccountDetails_mailType :: Lens' PutAccountDetails MailType

-- | The URL of your website. This information helps us better understand
--   the type of content that you plan to send.
putAccountDetails_websiteURL :: Lens' PutAccountDetails Text

-- | A description of the types of email that you plan to send.
putAccountDetails_useCaseDescription :: Lens' PutAccountDetails Text

-- | The response's http status code.
putAccountDetailsResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' PutAccountDetailsResponse Int

-- | The suppressed email destination to remove from the account
--   suppression list.
deleteSuppressedDestination_emailAddress :: Lens' DeleteSuppressedDestination Text

-- | The response's http status code.
deleteSuppressedDestinationResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DeleteSuppressedDestinationResponse Int

--   your account.

--   suppression list for your account.

-- | The response's http status code.
putSuppressedDestinationResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' PutSuppressedDestinationResponse Int

--   <tt>EndDate</tt>.

-- | The email address to use as the "From" address for the email. The
--   address that you specify has to be verified.
sendBulkEmail_fromEmailAddress :: Lens' SendBulkEmail (Maybe Text)

-- | This parameter is used only for sending authorization. It is the ARN
--   of the identity that is associated with the sending authorization
--   policy that permits you to use the email address specified in the
--   <tt>FromEmailAddress</tt> parameter.
--   
--   For example, if the owner of example.com (which has ARN
--   arn:aws:ses:us-east-1:123456789012:identity/example.com) attaches a
--   policy to it that authorizes you to use sender@example.com, then you
--   would specify the <tt>FromEmailAddressIdentityArn</tt> to be
--   arn:aws:ses:us-east-1:123456789012:identity/example.com, and the
--   <tt>FromEmailAddress</tt> to be sender@example.com.
--   
--   For more information about sending authorization, see the <a>Amazon
--   SES Developer Guide</a>.
sendBulkEmail_fromEmailAddressIdentityArn :: Lens' SendBulkEmail (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the configuration set to use when sending the email.
sendBulkEmail_configurationSetName :: Lens' SendBulkEmail (Maybe Text)

--   sent to.

--   of the identity that is associated with the sending authorization
--   policy that permits you to use the email address specified in the
--   <tt>FeedbackForwardingEmailAddress</tt> parameter.
--   
--   For example, if the owner of example.com (which has ARN
--   arn:aws:ses:us-east-1:123456789012:identity/example.com) attaches a
--   policy to it that authorizes you to use feedback@example.com, then you
--   would specify the <tt>FeedbackForwardingEmailAddressIdentityArn</tt>
--   to be arn:aws:ses:us-east-1:123456789012:identity/example.com, and the
--   <tt>FeedbackForwardingEmailAddress</tt> to be feedback@example.com.
--   
--   For more information about sending authorization, see the <a>Amazon
--   SES Developer Guide</a>.

--   For example, if the owner of example.com (which has ARN

--   overrides the X-SES-SOURCE-ARN and X-SES-FROM-ARN headers specified in

--   use. The MAIL FROM domain must meet the following criteria:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>It has to be a subdomain of the verified identity.</li>
--   <li>It can't be used to receive email.</li>
--   <li>It can't be used in a "From" address if the MAIL FROM domain is a
--   destination for feedback forwarding emails.</li>
--   </ul>
putEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes_mailFromDomain :: Lens' PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | The action to take if the required MX record isn't found when you send
--   an email. When you set this value to <tt>UseDefaultValue</tt>, the
--   mail is sent using <i>amazonses.com</i> as the MAIL FROM domain. When
--   you set this value to <tt>RejectMessage</tt>, the Amazon SES API v2
--   returns a <tt>MailFromDomainNotVerified</tt> error, and doesn't
--   attempt to deliver the email.
--   
--   These behaviors are taken when the custom MAIL FROM domain
--   configuration is in the <tt>Pending</tt>, <tt>Failed</tt>, and
--   <tt>TemporaryFailure</tt> states.
putEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes_behaviorOnMxFailure :: Lens' PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes (Maybe BehaviorOnMxFailure)

--   list can contain any or all of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>COMPLAINT</tt>  Amazon SES adds an email address to the
--   suppression list for your account when a message sent to that address
--   results in a complaint.</li>

--   suppression list for your account when a message sent to that address

-- | An object that defines whether or not Amazon SES can send email that
--   you send using the configuration set.
createConfigurationSet_sendingOptions :: Lens' CreateConfigurationSet (Maybe SendingOptions)

-- | An object that defines the dedicated IP pool that is used to send
--   emails that you send using the configuration set.
createConfigurationSet_deliveryOptions :: Lens' CreateConfigurationSet (Maybe DeliveryOptions)

-- | An object that defines the open and click tracking options for emails
--   that you send using the configuration set.
createConfigurationSet_trackingOptions :: Lens' CreateConfigurationSet (Maybe TrackingOptions)

-- | An object that defines whether or not Amazon SES collects reputation
--   metrics for the emails that you send that use the configuration set.
createConfigurationSet_reputationOptions :: Lens' CreateConfigurationSet (Maybe ReputationOptions)

-- | An array of objects that define the tags (keys and values) to
--   associate with the configuration set.
createConfigurationSet_tags :: Lens' CreateConfigurationSet (Maybe [Tag])

-- | Undocumented member.
createConfigurationSet_suppressionOptions :: Lens' CreateConfigurationSet (Maybe SuppressionOptions)

-- | The name of the configuration set. The name can contain up to 64
--   alphanumeric characters, including letters, numbers, hyphens (-) and
--   underscores (_) only.
createConfigurationSet_configurationSetName :: Lens' CreateConfigurationSet Text

-- | The response's http status code.
createConfigurationSetResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' CreateConfigurationSetResponse Int

-- | A unique string that identifies the predictive inbox placement test.
getDeliverabilityTestReport_reportId :: Lens' GetDeliverabilityTestReport Text

-- | An object that contains the message that you sent when you performed
--   this predictive inbox placement test.
getDeliverabilityTestReportResponse_message :: Lens' GetDeliverabilityTestReportResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | An array of objects that define the tags (keys and values) that are
--   associated with the predictive inbox placement test.
getDeliverabilityTestReportResponse_tags :: Lens' GetDeliverabilityTestReportResponse (Maybe [Tag])

-- | The response's http status code.
getDeliverabilityTestReportResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' GetDeliverabilityTestReportResponse Int

-- | An object that contains the results of the predictive inbox placement
--   test.
getDeliverabilityTestReportResponse_deliverabilityTestReport :: Lens' GetDeliverabilityTestReportResponse DeliverabilityTestReport

-- | An object that specifies how many test messages that were sent during
--   the predictive inbox placement test were delivered to recipients'
--   inboxes, how many were sent to recipients' spam folders, and how many
--   weren't delivered.
getDeliverabilityTestReportResponse_overallPlacement :: Lens' GetDeliverabilityTestReportResponse PlacementStatistics

-- | An object that describes how the test email was handled by several
--   email providers, including Gmail, Hotmail, Yahoo, AOL, and others.
getDeliverabilityTestReportResponse_ispPlacements :: Lens' GetDeliverabilityTestReportResponse [IspPlacement]

-- | An array of objects, one for each verified domain that you use to send
--   email and enabled the Deliverability dashboard for.
putDeliverabilityDashboardOption_subscribedDomains :: Lens' PutDeliverabilityDashboardOption (Maybe [DomainDeliverabilityTrackingOption])

-- | Specifies whether to enable the Deliverability dashboard. To enable
--   the dashboard, set this value to <tt>true</tt>.
putDeliverabilityDashboardOption_dashboardEnabled :: Lens' PutDeliverabilityDashboardOption Bool

-- | The response's http status code.
putDeliverabilityDashboardOptionResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' PutDeliverabilityDashboardOptionResponse Int

-- | Enables or disables the automatic warm-up feature for dedicated IP
--   addresses that are associated with your Amazon SES account in the
--   current Amazon Web Services Region. Set to <tt>true</tt> to enable the
--   automatic warm-up feature, or set to <tt>false</tt> to disable it.
putAccountDedicatedIpWarmupAttributes_autoWarmupEnabled :: Lens' PutAccountDedicatedIpWarmupAttributes (Maybe Bool)

-- | The response's http status code.
putAccountDedicatedIpWarmupAttributesResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' PutAccountDedicatedIpWarmupAttributesResponse Int

-- | A string token indicating that there might be additional contacts
--   available to be listed. Use the token provided in the Response to use
--   in the subsequent call to ListContacts with the same parameters to
--   retrieve the next page of contacts.
listContacts_nextToken :: Lens' ListContacts (Maybe Text)

-- | A filter that can be applied to a list of contacts.
listContacts_filter :: Lens' ListContacts (Maybe ListContactsFilter)

-- | The number of contacts that may be returned at once, which is
--   dependent on if there are more or less contacts than the value of the
--   PageSize. Use this parameter to paginate results. If additional
--   contacts exist beyond the specified limit, the <tt>NextToken</tt>
--   element is sent in the response. Use the <tt>NextToken</tt> value in
--   subsequent requests to retrieve additional contacts.
listContacts_pageSize :: Lens' ListContacts (Maybe Int)

-- | The name of the contact list.
listContacts_contactListName :: Lens' ListContacts Text

-- | A string token indicating that there might be additional contacts
--   available to be listed. Copy this token to a subsequent call to
--   <tt>ListContacts</tt> with the same parameters to retrieve the next
--   page of contacts.
listContactsResponse_nextToken :: Lens' ListContactsResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The contacts present in a specific contact list.
listContactsResponse_contacts :: Lens' ListContactsResponse (Maybe [Contact])

-- | The response's http status code.
listContactsResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' ListContactsResponse Int

-- | Information about the review of the latest details you submitted.
accountDetails_reviewDetails :: Lens' AccountDetails (Maybe ReviewDetails)

-- | The type of email your account is sending. The mail type can be one of
--   the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>MARKETING</tt>  Most of your sending traffic is to keep your
--   customers informed of your latest offering.</li>
--   <li><tt>TRANSACTIONAL</tt>  Most of your sending traffic is to
--   communicate during a transaction with a customer.</li>
--   </ul>
accountDetails_mailType :: Lens' AccountDetails (Maybe MailType)

-- | A description of the types of email that you plan to send.
accountDetails_useCaseDescription :: Lens' AccountDetails (Maybe Text)

-- | The language you would prefer for the case. The contact language can
--   be one of <tt>ENGLISH</tt> or <tt>JAPANESE</tt>.
accountDetails_contactLanguage :: Lens' AccountDetails (Maybe ContactLanguage)

-- | Additional email addresses where updates are sent about your account
--   review process.
accountDetails_additionalContactEmailAddresses :: Lens' AccountDetails (Maybe (NonEmpty Text))

-- | The URL of your website. This information helps us better understand
--   the type of content that you plan to send.
accountDetails_websiteURL :: Lens' AccountDetails (Maybe Text)

-- | The time when the blacklisting event occurred, shown in Unix time
--   format.
blacklistEntry_listingTime :: Lens' BlacklistEntry (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The name of the blacklist that the IP address appears on.
blacklistEntry_rblName :: Lens' BlacklistEntry (Maybe Text)

-- | Additional information about the blacklisting event, as provided by
--   the blacklist maintainer.
blacklistEntry_description :: Lens' BlacklistEntry (Maybe Text)

-- | An object that represents the version of the message that is displayed
--   in email clients that don't support HTML, or clients where the
--   recipient has disabled HTML rendering.
body_text :: Lens' Body (Maybe Content)

-- | An object that represents the version of the message that is displayed
--   in email clients that support HTML. HTML messages can include
--   formatted text, hyperlinks, images, and more.
body_html :: Lens' Body (Maybe Content)

-- | The template to use for the bulk email message.
bulkEmailContent_template :: Lens' BulkEmailContent (Maybe Template)

-- | The <tt>ReplacementEmailContent</tt> associated with a
--   <tt>BulkEmailEntry</tt>.
bulkEmailEntry_replacementEmailContent :: Lens' BulkEmailEntry (Maybe ReplacementEmailContent)

-- | A list of tags, in the form of name/value pairs, to apply to an email
--   that you send using the <tt>SendBulkTemplatedEmail</tt> operation.
--   Tags correspond to characteristics of the email that you define, so
--   that you can publish email sending events.
bulkEmailEntry_replacementTags :: Lens' BulkEmailEntry (Maybe [MessageTag])

-- | Represents the destination of the message, consisting of To:, CC:, and
--   BCC: fields.
--   
--   Amazon SES does not support the SMTPUTF8 extension, as described in
--   <a>RFC6531</a>. For this reason, the local part of a destination email
--   address (the part of the email address that precedes the @ sign) may
--   only contain <a>7-bit ASCII characters</a>. If the domain part of an
--   address (the part after the @ sign) contains non-ASCII characters,
--   they must be encoded using Punycode, as described in <a>RFC3492</a>.
bulkEmailEntry_destination :: Lens' BulkEmailEntry Destination

-- | The status of a message sent using the <tt>SendBulkTemplatedEmail</tt>
--   operation.
--   
--   Possible values for this parameter include:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>SUCCESS: Amazon SES accepted the message, and will attempt to
--   deliver it to the recipients.</li>
--   <li>MESSAGE_REJECTED: The message was rejected because it contained a
--   virus.</li>
--   <li>MAIL_FROM_DOMAIN_NOT_VERIFIED: The sender's email address or
--   domain was not verified.</li>
--   <li>CONFIGURATION_SET_DOES_NOT_EXIST: The configuration set you
--   specified does not exist.</li>
--   <li>TEMPLATE_DOES_NOT_EXIST: The template you specified does not
--   exist.</li>
--   <li>ACCOUNT_SUSPENDED: Your account has been shut down because of
--   issues related to your email sending practices.</li>
--   <li>ACCOUNT_THROTTLED: The number of emails you can send has been
--   reduced because your account has exceeded its allocated sending
--   limit.</li>
--   <li>ACCOUNT_DAILY_QUOTA_EXCEEDED: You have reached or exceeded the
--   maximum number of emails you can send from your account in a 24-hour
--   period.</li>
--   <li>INVALID_SENDING_POOL_NAME: The configuration set you specified
--   refers to an IP pool that does not exist.</li>
--   <li>ACCOUNT_SENDING_PAUSED: Email sending for the Amazon SES account
--   was disabled using the <a>UpdateAccountSendingEnabled</a>
--   operation.</li>
--   <li>CONFIGURATION_SET_SENDING_PAUSED: Email sending for this
--   configuration set was disabled using the
--   <a>UpdateConfigurationSetSendingEnabled</a> operation.</li>
--   <li>INVALID_PARAMETER_VALUE: One or more of the parameters you
--   specified when calling this operation was invalid. See the error
--   message for additional information.</li>
--   <li>TRANSIENT_FAILURE: Amazon SES was unable to process your request
--   because of a temporary issue.</li>
--   <li>FAILED: Amazon SES was unable to process your request. See the
--   error message for additional information.</li>
--   </ul>
bulkEmailEntryResult_status :: Lens' BulkEmailEntryResult (Maybe BulkEmailStatus)

-- | A description of an error that prevented a message being sent using
--   the <tt>SendBulkTemplatedEmail</tt> operation.
bulkEmailEntryResult_error :: Lens' BulkEmailEntryResult (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique message identifier returned from the
--   <tt>SendBulkTemplatedEmail</tt> operation.
bulkEmailEntryResult_messageId :: Lens' BulkEmailEntryResult (Maybe Text)

-- | An array of objects that define the dimensions to use when you send
--   email events to Amazon CloudWatch.
cloudWatchDestination_dimensionConfigurations :: Lens' CloudWatchDestination [CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration]

-- | The name of an Amazon CloudWatch dimension associated with an email
--   sending metric. The name has to meet the following criteria:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>It can only contain ASCII letters (az, AZ), numbers (09),
--   underscores (_), or dashes (-).</li>
--   <li>It can contain no more than 256 characters.</li>
--   </ul>
cloudWatchDimensionConfiguration_dimensionName :: Lens' CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration Text

-- | The location where the Amazon SES API v2 finds the value of a
--   dimension to publish to Amazon CloudWatch. To use the message tags
--   that you specify using an <tt>X-SES-MESSAGE-TAGS</tt> header or a
--   parameter to the <tt>SendEmail</tt> or <tt>SendRawEmail</tt> API,
--   choose <tt>messageTag</tt>. To use your own email headers, choose
--   <tt>emailHeader</tt>. To use link tags, choose <tt>linkTags</tt>.
cloudWatchDimensionConfiguration_dimensionValueSource :: Lens' CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration DimensionValueSource

-- | The default value of the dimension that is published to Amazon
--   CloudWatch if you don't provide the value of the dimension when you
--   send an email. This value has to meet the following criteria:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>It can only contain ASCII letters (az, AZ), numbers (09),
--   underscores (_), or dashes (-).</li>
--   <li>It can contain no more than 256 characters.</li>
--   </ul>
cloudWatchDimensionConfiguration_defaultDimensionValue :: Lens' CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration Text

-- | A boolean value status noting if the contact is unsubscribed from all
--   contact list topics.
contact_unsubscribeAll :: Lens' Contact (Maybe Bool)

contact_topicDefaultPreferences :: Lens' Contact (Maybe [TopicPreference])

--   topic.
contact_topicPreferences :: Lens' Contact (Maybe [TopicPreference])

contactList_contactListName :: Lens' ContactList (Maybe Text)

contactList_lastUpdatedTimestamp :: Lens' ContactList (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The name of the contact list.
contactListDestination_contactListName :: Lens' ContactListDestination Text

-- | <pre>
--   The type of action to perform on the addresses. The following are the
--   </pre>
--   
--   possible values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>PUT: add the addresses to the contact list. If the record already
--   exists, it will override it with the new value.</li>
--   <li>DELETE: remove the addresses from the contact list.</li>
--   </ul>
contactListDestination_contactListImportAction :: Lens' ContactListDestination ContactListImportAction

-- | The character set for the content. Because of the constraints of the
--   SMTP protocol, Amazon SES uses 7-bit ASCII by default. If the text
--   includes characters outside of the ASCII range, you have to specify a
--   character set. For example, you could specify <tt>UTF-8</tt>,
--   <tt>ISO-8859-1</tt>, or <tt>Shift_JIS</tt>.
content_charset :: Lens' Content (Maybe Text)

-- | The content of the message itself.
content_data :: Lens' Content Text

customVerificationEmailTemplateMetadata_templateName :: Lens' CustomVerificationEmailTemplateMetadata (Maybe Text)

-- | The URL that the recipient of the verification email is sent to if his
--   or her address is not successfully verified.
customVerificationEmailTemplateMetadata_failureRedirectionURL :: Lens' CustomVerificationEmailTemplateMetadata (Maybe Text)

-- | The subject line of the custom verification email.

-- | The URL that the recipient of the verification email is sent to if his
--   or her address is successfully verified.
customVerificationEmailTemplateMetadata_successRedirectionURL :: Lens' CustomVerificationEmailTemplateMetadata (Maybe Text)

--   the analysis period.

--   with.
dedicatedIp_poolName :: Lens' DedicatedIp (Maybe Text)

-- | An IPv4 address.
dedicatedIp_ip :: Lens' DedicatedIp Text

-- | The warm-up status of a dedicated IP address. The status can have one
--   of the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt>  The IP address isn't ready to use because
--   the dedicated IP warm-up process is ongoing.</li>
--   <li><tt>DONE</tt>  The dedicated IP warm-up process is complete, and
--   the IP address is ready to use.</li>
--   </ul>
dedicatedIp_warmupStatus :: Lens' DedicatedIp WarmupStatus

-- | Indicates how complete the dedicated IP warm-up process is. When this
--   value equals 1, the address has completed the warm-up process and is
--   ready for use.
dedicatedIp_warmupPercentage :: Lens' DedicatedIp Int

-- | The subject line for an email that you submitted in a predictive inbox
--   placement test.
deliverabilityTestReport_subject :: Lens' DeliverabilityTestReport (Maybe Text)

--   placement test.
deliverabilityTestReport_fromEmailAddress :: Lens' DeliverabilityTestReport (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time when the predictive inbox placement test was
--   created, in Unix time format.
deliverabilityTestReport_createDate :: Lens' DeliverabilityTestReport (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | A unique string that identifies the predictive inbox placement test.
deliverabilityTestReport_reportId :: Lens' DeliverabilityTestReport (Maybe Text)

-- | A name that helps you identify a predictive inbox placement test
--   report.
deliverabilityTestReport_reportName :: Lens' DeliverabilityTestReport (Maybe Text)

-- | The status of the predictive inbox placement test. If the status is
--   <tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt>, then the predictive inbox placement test is
--   currently running. Predictive inbox placement tests are usually
--   complete within 24 hours of creating the test. If the status is
--   <tt>COMPLETE</tt>, then the test is finished, and you can use the
--   <tt>GetDeliverabilityTestReport</tt> to view the results of the test.
deliverabilityTestReport_deliverabilityTestStatus :: Lens' DeliverabilityTestReport (Maybe DeliverabilityTestStatus)

--   set.
deliveryOptions_sendingPoolName :: Lens' DeliveryOptions (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies whether messages that use the configuration set are required
--   to use Transport Layer Security (TLS). If the value is
--   <tt>Require</tt>, messages are only delivered if a TLS connection can
--   be established. If the value is <tt>Optional</tt>, messages can be
--   delivered in plain text if a TLS connection can't be established.
deliveryOptions_tlsPolicy :: Lens' DeliveryOptions (Maybe TlsPolicy)

-- | An array that contains the email addresses of the "BCC" (blind carbon
--   copy) recipients for the email.
destination_bccAddresses :: Lens' Destination (Maybe [Text])

-- | An array that contains the email addresses of the "CC" (carbon copy)
--   recipients for the email.
destination_ccAddresses :: Lens' Destination (Maybe [Text])

-- | An array that contains the email addresses of the "To" recipients for
--   the email.
destination_toAddresses :: Lens' Destination (Maybe [Text])

-- | Describes whether or not Amazon SES has successfully located the DKIM
--   records in the DNS records for the domain. The status can be one of
--   the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>PENDING</tt>  The verification process was initiated, but
--   Amazon SES hasn't yet detected the DKIM records in the DNS
--   configuration for the domain.</li>
--   <li><tt>SUCCESS</tt>  The verification process completed
--   successfully.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt>  The verification process failed. This typically
--   occurs when Amazon SES fails to find the DKIM records in the DNS
--   configuration of the domain.</li>
--   <li><tt>TEMPORARY_FAILURE</tt>  A temporary issue is preventing
--   Amazon SES from determining the DKIM authentication status of the
--   domain.</li>
--   <li><tt>NOT_STARTED</tt>  The DKIM verification process hasn't been
--   initiated for the domain.</li>
--   </ul>
dkimAttributes_status :: Lens' DkimAttributes (Maybe DkimStatus)

-- | <ul>
--   <li><i>Easy DKIM</i> The key length of the future DKIM key pair to be
--   generated. This can be changed at most once per day.</li>
--   </ul>
dkimAttributes_nextSigningKeyLength :: Lens' DkimAttributes (Maybe DkimSigningKeyLength)

-- | If you used <a>Easy DKIM</a> to configure DKIM authentication for the
--   domain, then this object contains a set of unique strings that you use
--   to create a set of CNAME records that you add to the DNS configuration
--   for your domain. When Amazon SES detects these records in the DNS
--   configuration for your domain, the DKIM authentication process is
--   complete.
--   
--   If you configured DKIM authentication for the domain by providing your
--   own public-private key pair, then this object contains the selector
--   for the public key.
--   
--   Regardless of the DKIM authentication method you use, Amazon SES
--   searches for the appropriate records in the DNS configuration of the
--   domain for up to 72 hours.
dkimAttributes_tokens :: Lens' DkimAttributes (Maybe [Text])

-- | If the value is <tt>true</tt>, then the messages that you send from
--   the identity are signed using DKIM. If the value is <tt>false</tt>,
--   then the messages that you send from the identity aren't DKIM-signed.
dkimAttributes_signingEnabled :: Lens' DkimAttributes (Maybe Bool)

-- | <ul>
--   <li><i>Easy DKIM</i> The key length of the DKIM key pair in use.</li>
--   </ul>
dkimAttributes_currentSigningKeyLength :: Lens' DkimAttributes (Maybe DkimSigningKeyLength)

-- | <ul>
--   <li><i>Easy DKIM</i> The last time a key pair was generated for this
--   identity.</li>
--   </ul>
dkimAttributes_lastKeyGenerationTimestamp :: Lens' DkimAttributes (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | A string that indicates how DKIM was configured for the identity.
--   These are the possible values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>AWS_SES</tt>  Indicates that DKIM was configured for the
--   identity by using <a>Easy DKIM</a>.</li>
--   <li><tt>EXTERNAL</tt>  Indicates that DKIM was configured for the
--   identity by using Bring Your Own DKIM (BYODKIM).</li>
--   </ul>
dkimAttributes_signingAttributesOrigin :: Lens' DkimAttributes (Maybe DkimSigningAttributesOrigin)

-- | <ul>
--   <li><i>Easy DKIM</i> The key length of the future DKIM key pair to be
--   generated. This can be changed at most once per day.</li>
--   </ul>
dkimSigningAttributes_nextSigningKeyLength :: Lens' DkimSigningAttributes (Maybe DkimSigningKeyLength)

-- | <ul>
--   <li><i>Bring Your Own DKIM</i> A private key that's used to generate a
--   DKIM signature.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   The private key must use 1024 or 2048-bit RSA encryption, and must be
--   encoded using base64 encoding.
dkimSigningAttributes_domainSigningPrivateKey :: Lens' DkimSigningAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | <ul>
--   <li><i>Bring Your Own DKIM</i> A string that's used to identify a
--   public key in the DNS configuration for a domain.</li>
--   </ul>
dkimSigningAttributes_domainSigningSelector :: Lens' DkimSigningAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | The number of email messages that were delivered to recipients' spam
--   or junk mail folders.
domainDeliverabilityCampaign_spamCount :: Lens' DomainDeliverabilityCampaign (Maybe Integer)

-- | The subject line, or title, of the email message.
domainDeliverabilityCampaign_subject :: Lens' DomainDeliverabilityCampaign (Maybe Text)

-- | The major email providers who handled the email message.
domainDeliverabilityCampaign_esps :: Lens' DomainDeliverabilityCampaign (Maybe [Text])

-- | The verified email address that the email message was sent from.
domainDeliverabilityCampaign_fromAddress :: Lens' DomainDeliverabilityCampaign (Maybe Text)

-- | The percentage of email messages that were deleted by recipients,
--   without being opened first. Due to technical limitations, this value
--   only includes recipients who opened the message by using an email
--   client that supports images.
domainDeliverabilityCampaign_deleteRate :: Lens' DomainDeliverabilityCampaign (Maybe Double)

-- | The unique identifier for the campaign. The Deliverability dashboard
--   automatically generates and assigns this identifier to a campaign.
domainDeliverabilityCampaign_campaignId :: Lens' DomainDeliverabilityCampaign (Maybe Text)

-- | The IP addresses that were used to send the email message.
domainDeliverabilityCampaign_sendingIps :: Lens' DomainDeliverabilityCampaign (Maybe [Text])

-- | The first time, in Unix time format, when the email message was
--   delivered to any recipient's inbox. This value can help you determine
--   how long it took for a campaign to deliver an email message.
domainDeliverabilityCampaign_firstSeenDateTime :: Lens' DomainDeliverabilityCampaign (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The number of email messages that were delivered to recipients
--   inboxes.
domainDeliverabilityCampaign_inboxCount :: Lens' DomainDeliverabilityCampaign (Maybe Integer)

-- | The percentage of email messages that were opened and then deleted by
--   recipients. Due to technical limitations, this value only includes
--   recipients who opened the message by using an email client that
--   supports images.
domainDeliverabilityCampaign_readDeleteRate :: Lens' DomainDeliverabilityCampaign (Maybe Double)

-- | The projected number of recipients that the email message was sent to.
domainDeliverabilityCampaign_projectedVolume :: Lens' DomainDeliverabilityCampaign (Maybe Integer)

-- | The URL of an image that contains a snapshot of the email message that
--   was sent.
domainDeliverabilityCampaign_imageUrl :: Lens' DomainDeliverabilityCampaign (Maybe Text)

-- | The percentage of email messages that were opened by recipients. Due
--   to technical limitations, this value only includes recipients who
--   opened the message by using an email client that supports images.
domainDeliverabilityCampaign_readRate :: Lens' DomainDeliverabilityCampaign (Maybe Double)

-- | The last time, in Unix time format, when the email message was
--   delivered to any recipient's inbox. This value can help you determine
--   how long it took for a campaign to deliver an email message.
domainDeliverabilityCampaign_lastSeenDateTime :: Lens' DomainDeliverabilityCampaign (Maybe UTCTime)

--   account and currently has an active Deliverability dashboard
--   subscription.

--   to.

-- | The percentage of messages that were sent from the selected domain to
--   the specified email provider that arrived in recipients' inboxes.
domainIspPlacement_inboxPercentage :: Lens' DomainIspPlacement (Maybe Double)

-- | The total number of messages that were sent from the selected domain
--   to the specified email provider that arrived in recipients' spam or
--   junk mail folders.
domainIspPlacement_spamRawCount :: Lens' DomainIspPlacement (Maybe Integer)

-- | The raw email message. The message has to meet the following criteria:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The message has to contain a header and a body, separated by one
--   blank line.</li>
--   <li>All of the required header fields must be present in the
--   message.</li>
--   <li>Each part of a multipart MIME message must be formatted
--   properly.</li>
--   <li>If you include attachments, they must be in a file format that the
--   Amazon SES API v2 supports.</li>
--   <li>The entire message must be Base64 encoded.</li>
--   <li>If any of the MIME parts in your message contain content that is
--   outside of the 7-bit ASCII character range, you should encode that
--   content to ensure that recipients' email clients render the message
--   properly.</li>
--   <li>The length of any single line of text in the message can't exceed
--   1,000 characters. This restriction is defined in <a>RFC 5321</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
emailContent_raw :: Lens' EmailContent (Maybe RawMessage)

-- | The simple email message. The message consists of a subject and a
--   message body.
emailContent_simple :: Lens' EmailContent (Maybe Message)

-- | The template to use for the email message.
emailContent_template :: Lens' EmailContent (Maybe Template)

-- | The subject line of the email.
emailTemplateContent_subject :: Lens' EmailTemplateContent (Maybe Text)

-- | The email body that will be visible to recipients whose email clients
--   do not display HTML.
emailTemplateContent_text :: Lens' EmailTemplateContent (Maybe Text)

-- | The HTML body of the email.
emailTemplateContent_html :: Lens' EmailTemplateContent (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the template.
emailTemplateMetadata_templateName :: Lens' EmailTemplateMetadata (Maybe Text)

-- | The time and date the template was created.
emailTemplateMetadata_createdTimestamp :: Lens' EmailTemplateMetadata (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | An object that defines an Amazon Pinpoint project destination for
--   email events. You can send email event data to a Amazon Pinpoint
--   project to view metrics using the Transactional Messaging dashboards
--   that are built in to Amazon Pinpoint. For more information, see
--   <a>Transactional Messaging Charts</a> in the <i>Amazon Pinpoint User
--   Guide</i>.
eventDestination_pinpointDestination :: Lens' EventDestination (Maybe PinpointDestination)

-- | If <tt>true</tt>, the event destination is enabled. When the event
--   destination is enabled, the specified event types are sent to the
--   destinations in this <tt>EventDestinationDefinition</tt>.
--   
--   If <tt>false</tt>, the event destination is disabled. When the event
--   destination is disabled, events aren't sent to the specified
--   destinations.
eventDestination_enabled :: Lens' EventDestination (Maybe Bool)

-- | An object that defines an Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose destination for
--   email events. You can use Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose to stream data
--   to other services, such as Amazon S3 and Amazon Redshift.
eventDestination_kinesisFirehoseDestination :: Lens' EventDestination (Maybe KinesisFirehoseDestination)

-- | An object that defines an Amazon CloudWatch destination for email
--   events. You can use Amazon CloudWatch to monitor and gain insights on
--   your email sending metrics.
eventDestination_cloudWatchDestination :: Lens' EventDestination (Maybe CloudWatchDestination)

-- | An object that defines an Amazon SNS destination for email events. You
--   can use Amazon SNS to send notification when certain email events
--   occur.
eventDestination_snsDestination :: Lens' EventDestination (Maybe SnsDestination)

-- | A name that identifies the event destination.
eventDestination_name :: Lens' EventDestination Text

-- | The types of events that Amazon SES sends to the specified event
--   destinations.
eventDestination_matchingEventTypes :: Lens' EventDestination [EventType]

-- | An array that specifies which events the Amazon SES API v2 should send
--   to the destinations in this <tt>EventDestinationDefinition</tt>.
eventDestinationDefinition_matchingEventTypes :: Lens' EventDestinationDefinition (Maybe [EventType])

-- | An object that defines an Amazon Pinpoint project destination for
--   email events. You can send email event data to a Amazon Pinpoint
--   project to view metrics using the Transactional Messaging dashboards
--   that are built in to Amazon Pinpoint. For more information, see
--   <a>Transactional Messaging Charts</a> in the <i>Amazon Pinpoint User
--   Guide</i>.
eventDestinationDefinition_pinpointDestination :: Lens' EventDestinationDefinition (Maybe PinpointDestination)

-- | If <tt>true</tt>, the event destination is enabled. When the event
--   destination is enabled, the specified event types are sent to the
--   destinations in this <tt>EventDestinationDefinition</tt>.
--   
--   If <tt>false</tt>, the event destination is disabled. When the event
--   destination is disabled, events aren't sent to the specified
--   destinations.
eventDestinationDefinition_enabled :: Lens' EventDestinationDefinition (Maybe Bool)

-- | An object that defines an Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose destination for
--   email events. You can use Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose to stream data
--   to other services, such as Amazon S3 and Amazon Redshift.
eventDestinationDefinition_kinesisFirehoseDestination :: Lens' EventDestinationDefinition (Maybe KinesisFirehoseDestination)

-- | An object that defines an Amazon CloudWatch destination for email
--   events. You can use Amazon CloudWatch to monitor and gain insights on
--   your email sending metrics.
eventDestinationDefinition_cloudWatchDestination :: Lens' EventDestinationDefinition (Maybe CloudWatchDestination)

-- | An object that defines an Amazon SNS destination for email events. You
--   can use Amazon SNS to send notification when certain email events
--   occur.
eventDestinationDefinition_snsDestination :: Lens' EventDestinationDefinition (Maybe SnsDestination)

-- | An Amazon S3 presigned URL that contains all the failed records and
--   related information.
failureInfo_failedRecordsS3Url :: Lens' FailureInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | A message about why the import job failed.
failureInfo_errorMessage :: Lens' FailureInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The email identity type. Note: the <tt>MANAGED_DOMAIN</tt> type is not
--   supported for email identity types.
identityInfo_identityType :: Lens' IdentityInfo (Maybe IdentityType)

-- | The address or domain of the identity.
identityInfo_identityName :: Lens' IdentityInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | Indicates whether or not you can send email from the identity.
--   
--   An <i>identity</i> is an email address or domain that you send email
--   from. Before you can send email from an identity, you have to
--   demostrate that you own the identity, and that you authorize Amazon
--   SES to send email from that identity.
identityInfo_sendingEnabled :: Lens' IdentityInfo (Maybe Bool)

-- | An Amazon S3 URL in the format
--   s3://<i>&lt;bucket_name&gt;</i>/<i>&lt;object&gt;</i>.
importDataSource_s3Url :: Lens' ImportDataSource Text

-- | The data format of the import job's data source.
importDataSource_dataFormat :: Lens' ImportDataSource DataFormat

-- | An object that contains the action of the import job towards
--   suppression list.
importDestination_suppressionListDestination :: Lens' ImportDestination (Maybe SuppressionListDestination)

-- | An object that contains the action of the import job towards a contact
--   list.
importDestination_contactListDestination :: Lens' ImportDestination (Maybe ContactListDestination)

-- | Undocumented member.
importJobSummary_jobId :: Lens' ImportJobSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | Undocumented member.
importJobSummary_importDestination :: Lens' ImportJobSummary (Maybe ImportDestination)

-- | Undocumented member.
importJobSummary_jobStatus :: Lens' ImportJobSummary (Maybe JobStatus)

-- | The date and time when the import job was created.
importJobSummary_createdTimestamp :: Lens' ImportJobSummary (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | An array of strings, one for each major email provider that the inbox
--   placement data applies to.
inboxPlacementTrackingOption_trackedIsps :: Lens' InboxPlacementTrackingOption (Maybe [Text])

-- | Specifies whether inbox placement data is being tracked for the
--   domain.
inboxPlacementTrackingOption_global :: Lens' InboxPlacementTrackingOption (Maybe Bool)

-- | An object that contains inbox placement metrics for a specific email
--   provider.
ispPlacement_placementStatistics :: Lens' IspPlacement (Maybe PlacementStatistics)

-- | The name of the email provider that the inbox placement data applies
--   to.
ispPlacement_ispName :: Lens' IspPlacement (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that the Amazon SES API
--   v2 uses to send email events to the Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose
--   stream.
kinesisFirehoseDestination_iamRoleArn :: Lens' KinesisFirehoseDestination Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose
--   stream that the Amazon SES API v2 sends email events to.
kinesisFirehoseDestination_deliveryStreamArn :: Lens' KinesisFirehoseDestination Text

-- | The status by which you are filtering: <tt>OPT_IN</tt> or
--   <tt>OPT_OUT</tt>.
listContactsFilter_filteredStatus :: Lens' ListContactsFilter (Maybe SubscriptionStatus)

-- | Used for filtering by a specific topic preference.
listContactsFilter_topicFilter :: Lens' ListContactsFilter (Maybe TopicFilter)

-- | The name of the topic.
listManagementOptions_topicName :: Lens' ListManagementOptions (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the contact list.
listManagementOptions_contactListName :: Lens' ListManagementOptions Text

-- | The name of a domain that an email identity uses as a custom MAIL FROM
--   domain.
mailFromAttributes_mailFromDomain :: Lens' MailFromAttributes Text

-- | The status of the MAIL FROM domain. This status can have the following
--   values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>PENDING</tt>  Amazon SES hasn't started searching for the MX
--   record yet.</li>
--   <li><tt>SUCCESS</tt>  Amazon SES detected the required MX record for
--   the MAIL FROM domain.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt>  Amazon SES can't find the required MX record, or
--   the record no longer exists.</li>
--   <li><tt>TEMPORARY_FAILURE</tt>  A temporary issue occurred, which
--   prevented Amazon SES from determining the status of the MAIL FROM
--   domain.</li>
--   </ul>
mailFromAttributes_mailFromDomainStatus :: Lens' MailFromAttributes MailFromDomainStatus

-- | The action to take if the required MX record can't be found when you
--   send an email. When you set this value to <tt>UseDefaultValue</tt>,
--   the mail is sent using <i>amazonses.com</i> as the MAIL FROM domain.
--   When you set this value to <tt>RejectMessage</tt>, the Amazon SES API
--   v2 returns a <tt>MailFromDomainNotVerified</tt> error, and doesn't
--   attempt to deliver the email.
--   
--   These behaviors are taken when the custom MAIL FROM domain
--   configuration is in the <tt>Pending</tt>, <tt>Failed</tt>, and
--   <tt>TemporaryFailure</tt> states.
mailFromAttributes_behaviorOnMxFailure :: Lens' MailFromAttributes BehaviorOnMxFailure

-- | The subject line of the email. The subject line can only contain 7-bit
--   ASCII characters. However, you can specify non-ASCII characters in the
--   subject line by using encoded-word syntax, as described in <a>RFC
--   2047</a>.
message_subject :: Lens' Message Content

-- | The body of the message. You can specify an HTML version of the
--   message, a text-only version of the message, or both.
message_body :: Lens' Message Body

-- | The name of the message tag. The message tag name has to meet the
--   following criteria:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>It can only contain ASCII letters (az, AZ), numbers (09),
--   underscores (_), or dashes (-).</li>
--   <li>It can contain no more than 256 characters.</li>
--   </ul>
messageTag_name :: Lens' MessageTag Text

-- | The value of the message tag. The message tag value has to meet the
--   following criteria:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>It can only contain ASCII letters (az, AZ), numbers (09),
--   underscores (_), or dashes (-).</li>
--   <li>It can contain no more than 256 characters.</li>
--   </ul>
messageTag_value :: Lens' MessageTag Text

-- | An object that contains inbox and junk mail placement metrics for
--   individual email providers.
overallVolume_domainIspPlacements :: Lens' OverallVolume (Maybe [DomainIspPlacement])

-- | An object that contains information about the numbers of messages that
--   arrived in recipients' inboxes and junk mail folders.
overallVolume_volumeStatistics :: Lens' OverallVolume (Maybe VolumeStatistics)

-- | The percentage of emails that were sent from the domain that were read
--   by their recipients.
overallVolume_readRatePercent :: Lens' OverallVolume (Maybe Double)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon Pinpoint project to send
--   email events to.
pinpointDestination_applicationArn :: Lens' PinpointDestination (Maybe Text)

-- | The percentage of emails that didn't arrive in recipients' inboxes at
--   all during the predictive inbox placement test.
placementStatistics_missingPercentage :: Lens' PlacementStatistics (Maybe Double)

-- | The percentage of emails that arrived in recipients' spam or junk mail
--   folders during the predictive inbox placement test.
placementStatistics_spamPercentage :: Lens' PlacementStatistics (Maybe Double)

-- | The percentage of emails that were authenticated by using Sender
--   Policy Framework (SPF) during the predictive inbox placement test.
placementStatistics_spfPercentage :: Lens' PlacementStatistics (Maybe Double)

-- | The percentage of emails that were authenticated by using DomainKeys
--   Identified Mail (DKIM) during the predictive inbox placement test.
placementStatistics_dkimPercentage :: Lens' PlacementStatistics (Maybe Double)

-- | The percentage of emails that arrived in recipients' inboxes during
--   the predictive inbox placement test.
placementStatistics_inboxPercentage :: Lens' PlacementStatistics (Maybe Double)

-- | The raw email message. The message has to meet the following criteria:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The message has to contain a header and a body, separated by one
--   blank line.</li>
--   <li>All of the required header fields must be present in the
--   message.</li>
--   <li>Each part of a multipart MIME message must be formatted
--   properly.</li>
--   <li>Attachments must be in a file format that the Amazon SES
--   supports.</li>
--   <li>The entire message must be Base64 encoded.</li>
--   <li>If any of the MIME parts in your message contain content that is
--   outside of the 7-bit ASCII character range, you should encode that
--   content to ensure that recipients' email clients render the message
--   properly.</li>
--   <li>The length of any single line of text in the message can't exceed
--   1,000 characters. This restriction is defined in <a>RFC
--   5321</a>.--</li>
--   <li>- <i>Note:</i> This <tt>Lens</tt> automatically encodes and
--   decodes Base64 data.</li>
--   <li>- The underlying isomorphism will encode to Base64 representation
--   during</li>
--   <li>- serialisation, and decode from Base64 representation during
--   deserialisation.</li>
--   <li>- This <tt>Lens</tt> accepts and returns only raw unencoded
--   data.</li>
--   </ul>
rawMessage_data :: Lens' RawMessage ByteString

-- | The <tt>ReplacementTemplate</tt> associated with
--   <tt>ReplacementEmailContent</tt>.
replacementEmailContent_replacementTemplate :: Lens' ReplacementEmailContent (Maybe ReplacementTemplate)

-- | A list of replacement values to apply to the template. This parameter
--   is a JSON object, typically consisting of key-value pairs in which the
--   keys correspond to replacement tags in the email template.
replacementTemplate_replacementTemplateData :: Lens' ReplacementTemplate (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time (in Unix time) when the reputation metrics were last
--   given a fresh start. When your account is given a fresh start, your
--   reputation metrics are calculated starting from the date of the fresh
--   start.
reputationOptions_lastFreshStart :: Lens' ReputationOptions (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | If <tt>true</tt>, tracking of reputation metrics is enabled for the
--   configuration set. If <tt>false</tt>, tracking of reputation metrics
--   is disabled for the configuration set.
reputationOptions_reputationMetricsEnabled :: Lens' ReputationOptions (Maybe Bool)

-- | The status of the latest review of your account. The status can be one
--   of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>PENDING</tt>  We have received your appeal and are in the
--   process of reviewing it.</li>
--   <li><tt>GRANTED</tt>  Your appeal has been reviewed and your
--   production access has been granted.</li>
--   <li><tt>DENIED</tt>  Your appeal has been reviewed and your
--   production access has been denied.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt>  An internal error occurred and we didn't receive
--   your appeal. You can submit your appeal again.</li>
--   </ul>
reviewDetails_status :: Lens' ReviewDetails (Maybe ReviewStatus)

-- | The associated support center case ID (if any).
reviewDetails_caseId :: Lens' ReviewDetails (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum number of emails that you can send per second in the
--   current Amazon Web Services Region. This value is also called your
--   /maximum sending rate<i> or your </i>maximum TPS (transactions per
--   second) rate/.
sendQuota_maxSendRate :: Lens' SendQuota (Maybe Double)

-- | The number of emails sent from your Amazon SES account in the current
--   Amazon Web Services Region over the past 24 hours.
sendQuota_sentLast24Hours :: Lens' SendQuota (Maybe Double)

-- | The maximum number of emails that you can send in the current Amazon
--   Web Services Region over a 24-hour period. This value is also called
--   your <i>sending quota</i>.
sendQuota_max24HourSend :: Lens' SendQuota (Maybe Double)

-- | If <tt>true</tt>, email sending is enabled for the configuration set.
--   If <tt>false</tt>, email sending is disabled for the configuration
--   set.
sendingOptions_sendingEnabled :: Lens' SendingOptions (Maybe Bool)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon SNS topic to publish
--   email events to. For more information about Amazon SNS topics, see the
--   <a>Amazon SNS Developer Guide</a>.
snsDestination_topicArn :: Lens' SnsDestination Text

-- | An optional value that can contain additional information about the
--   reasons that the address was added to the suppression list for your
--   account.
suppressedDestination_attributes :: Lens' SuppressedDestination (Maybe SuppressedDestinationAttributes)

-- | The email address that is on the suppression list for your account.
suppressedDestination_emailAddress :: Lens' SuppressedDestination Text

-- | The reason that the address was added to the suppression list for your
--   account.
suppressedDestination_reason :: Lens' SuppressedDestination SuppressionListReason

-- | The date and time when the suppressed destination was last updated,
--   shown in Unix time format.
suppressedDestination_lastUpdateTime :: Lens' SuppressedDestination UTCTime

-- | A unique identifier that's generated when an email address is added to
--   the suppression list for your account.
suppressedDestinationAttributes_feedbackId :: Lens' SuppressedDestinationAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier of the email message that caused the email
--   address to be added to the suppression list for your account.
suppressedDestinationAttributes_messageId :: Lens' SuppressedDestinationAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | The email address that's on the suppression list for your account.
suppressedDestinationSummary_emailAddress :: Lens' SuppressedDestinationSummary Text

-- | The reason that the address was added to the suppression list for your
--   account.
suppressedDestinationSummary_reason :: Lens' SuppressedDestinationSummary SuppressionListReason

-- | The date and time when the suppressed destination was last updated,
--   shown in Unix time format.
suppressedDestinationSummary_lastUpdateTime :: Lens' SuppressedDestinationSummary UTCTime

-- | A list that contains the reasons that email addresses will be
--   automatically added to the suppression list for your account. This
--   list can contain any or all of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>COMPLAINT</tt>  Amazon SES adds an email address to the
--   suppression list for your account when a message sent to that address
--   results in a complaint.</li>
--   <li><tt>BOUNCE</tt>  Amazon SES adds an email address to the
--   suppression list for your account when a message sent to that address
--   results in a hard bounce.</li>
--   </ul>
suppressionAttributes_suppressedReasons :: Lens' SuppressionAttributes (Maybe [SuppressionListReason])

-- | The type of action to perform on the address. The following are
--   possible values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>PUT: add the addresses to the suppression list. If the record
--   already exists, it will override it with the new value.</li>
--   <li>DELETE: remove the addresses from the suppression list.</li>
--   </ul>
suppressionListDestination_suppressionListImportAction :: Lens' SuppressionListDestination SuppressionListImportAction

-- | A list that contains the reasons that email addresses are
--   automatically added to the suppression list for your account. This
--   list can contain any or all of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>COMPLAINT</tt>  Amazon SES adds an email address to the
--   suppression list for your account when a message sent to that address
--   results in a complaint.</li>
--   <li><tt>BOUNCE</tt>  Amazon SES adds an email address to the
--   suppression list for your account when a message sent to that address
--   results in a hard bounce.</li>
--   </ul>
suppressionOptions_suppressedReasons :: Lens' SuppressionOptions (Maybe [SuppressionListReason])

-- | One part of a key-value pair that defines a tag. The maximum length of
--   a tag key is 128 characters. The minimum length is 1 character.
tag_key :: Lens' Tag Text

-- | The optional part of a key-value pair that defines a tag. The maximum
--   length of a tag value is 256 characters. The minimum length is 0
--   characters. If you don't want a resource to have a specific tag value,
--   don't specify a value for this parameter. If you don't specify a
--   value, Amazon SES sets the value to an empty string.
tag_value :: Lens' Tag Text

-- | The name of the template. You will refer to this name when you send
--   email using the <tt>SendTemplatedEmail</tt> or
--   <tt>SendBulkTemplatedEmail</tt> operations.
template_templateName :: Lens' Template (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the template.
template_templateArn :: Lens' Template (Maybe Text)

-- | An object that defines the values to use for message variables in the
--   template. This object is a set of key-value pairs. Each key defines a
--   message variable in the template. The corresponding value defines the
--   value to use for that variable.
template_templateData :: Lens' Template (Maybe Text)

-- | A description of what the topic is about, which the contact will see.
topic_description :: Lens' Topic (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the topic.
topic_topicName :: Lens' Topic Text

-- | The name of the topic the contact will see.
topic_displayName :: Lens' Topic Text

-- | The default subscription status to be applied to a contact if the
--   contact has not noted their preference for subscribing to a topic.
topic_defaultSubscriptionStatus :: Lens' Topic SubscriptionStatus

-- | The name of a topic on which you wish to apply the filter.
topicFilter_topicName :: Lens' TopicFilter (Maybe Text)

-- | Notes that the default subscription status should be applied to a
--   contact because the contact has not noted their preference for
--   subscribing to a topic.
topicFilter_useDefaultIfPreferenceUnavailable :: Lens' TopicFilter (Maybe Bool)

-- | The name of the topic.
topicPreference_topicName :: Lens' TopicPreference Text

-- | The contact's subscription status to a topic which is either
--   <tt>OPT_IN</tt> or <tt>OPT_OUT</tt>.
topicPreference_subscriptionStatus :: Lens' TopicPreference SubscriptionStatus

-- | The domain to use for tracking open and click events.
trackingOptions_customRedirectDomain :: Lens' TrackingOptions Text

-- | The total number of emails that arrived in recipients' inboxes.
volumeStatistics_inboxRawCount :: Lens' VolumeStatistics (Maybe Integer)

-- | An estimate of the percentage of emails sent from the current domain
--   that will arrive in recipients' spam or junk mail folders.
volumeStatistics_projectedSpam :: Lens' VolumeStatistics (Maybe Integer)

-- | An estimate of the percentage of emails sent from the current domain
--   that will arrive in recipients' inboxes.
volumeStatistics_projectedInbox :: Lens' VolumeStatistics (Maybe Integer)

-- | The total number of emails that arrived in recipients' spam or junk
--   mail folders.
volumeStatistics_spamRawCount :: Lens' VolumeStatistics (Maybe Integer)


module Amazonka.SESV2.Waiters


-- | Derived from API version <tt>2019-09-27</tt> of the AWS service
--   descriptions, licensed under Apache 2.0.
--   
--   Amazon SES API v2
--   
--   <a>Amazon SES</a> is an Amazon Web Services service that you can use
--   to send email messages to your customers.
--   
--   If you're new to Amazon SES API v2, you might find it helpful to
--   review the <a>Amazon Simple Email Service Developer Guide</a>. The
--   <i>Amazon SES Developer Guide</i> provides information and code
--   samples that demonstrate how to use Amazon SES API v2 features
--   programmatically.
module Amazonka.SESV2

-- | API version <tt>2019-09-27</tt> of the Amazon Simple Email Service SDK
--   configuration.
defaultService :: Service

-- | The message can't be sent because it contains invalid content.
_MessageRejected :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The message can't be sent because the sending domain isn't verified.
_MailFromDomainNotVerifiedException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | If there is already an ongoing account details update under review.
_ConflictException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The resource you attempted to access doesn't exist.
_NotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Too many requests have been made to the operation.
_TooManyRequestsException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The resource is being modified by another operation or thread.
_ConcurrentModificationException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The specified request includes an invalid or expired token.
_InvalidNextTokenException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The message can't be sent because the account's ability to send email
--   has been permanently restricted.
_AccountSuspendedException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The message can't be sent because the account's ability to send email
--   is currently paused.
_SendingPausedException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The input you provided is invalid.
_BadRequestException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The resource specified in your request already exists.
_AlreadyExistsException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | There are too many instances of the specified resource type.
_LimitExceededException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | A request to obtain information about a configuration set.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGetConfigurationSet</a> smart constructor.
data GetConfigurationSet
GetConfigurationSet' :: Text -> GetConfigurationSet

-- | Create a value of <a>GetConfigurationSet</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:configurationSetName:GetConfigurationSet'</a>,
--   <a>getConfigurationSet_configurationSetName</a> - The name of the
--   configuration set.
newGetConfigurationSet :: Text -> GetConfigurationSet

-- | Information about a configuration set.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGetConfigurationSetResponse</a> smart constructor.
data GetConfigurationSetResponse
GetConfigurationSetResponse' :: Maybe SendingOptions -> Maybe Text -> Maybe DeliveryOptions -> Maybe TrackingOptions -> Maybe ReputationOptions -> Maybe [Tag] -> Maybe SuppressionOptions -> Int -> GetConfigurationSetResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>GetConfigurationSetResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:sendingOptions:GetConfigurationSetResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getConfigurationSetResponse_sendingOptions</a> - An object that
--   defines whether or not Amazon SES can send email that you send using

--   response.
--   
--   The following data is returned in JSON format by the service.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPutEmailIdentityDkimSigningAttributesResponse</a>
--   smart constructor.
data PutEmailIdentityDkimSigningAttributesResponse
PutEmailIdentityDkimSigningAttributesResponse' :: Maybe DkimStatus -> Maybe [Text] -> Int -> PutEmailIdentityDkimSigningAttributesResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>PutEmailIdentityDkimSigningAttributesResponse</a>
--   with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:dkimStatus:PutEmailIdentityDkimSigningAttributesResponse'</a>,
--   <a>putEmailIdentityDkimSigningAttributesResponse_dkimStatus</a> - The
--   DKIM authentication status of the identity. Amazon SES determines the
--   authentication status by searching for specific records in the DNS
--   configuration for your domain. If you used <a>Easy DKIM</a> to set up
--   DKIM authentication, Amazon SES tries to find three unique CNAME
--   records in the DNS configuration for your domain.
--   
--   If you provided a public key to perform DKIM authentication, Amazon
--   SES tries to find a TXT record that uses the selector that you
--   specified. The value of the TXT record must be a public key that's
--   paired with the private key that you specified in the process of
--   creating the identity.
--   
--   The status can be one of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>PENDING</tt>  The verification process was initiated, but
--   Amazon SES hasn't yet detected the DKIM records in the DNS
--   configuration for the domain.</li>
--   <li><tt>SUCCESS</tt>  The verification process completed
--   successfully.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt>  The verification process failed. This typically
--   occurs when Amazon SES fails to find the DKIM records in the DNS
--   configuration of the domain.</li>
--   <li><tt>TEMPORARY_FAILURE</tt>  A temporary issue is preventing
--   Amazon SES from determining the DKIM authentication status of the
--   domain.</li>
--   <li><tt>NOT_STARTED</tt>  The DKIM verification process hasn't been
--   initiated for the domain.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:dkimTokens:PutEmailIdentityDkimSigningAttributesResponse'</a>,
--   <a>putEmailIdentityDkimSigningAttributesResponse_dkimTokens</a> - If
--   you used <a>Easy DKIM</a> to configure DKIM authentication for the
--   domain, then this object contains a set of unique strings that you use
--   to create a set of CNAME records that you add to the DNS configuration
--   for your domain. When Amazon SES detects these records in the DNS
--   configuration for your domain, the DKIM authentication process is
--   complete.
--   
--   If you configured DKIM authentication for the domain by providing your
--   own public-private key pair, then this object contains the selector
--   that's associated with your public key.
--   
--   Regardless of the DKIM authentication method you use, Amazon SES
--   searches for the appropriate records in the DNS configuration of the
--   domain for up to 72 hours.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:PutEmailIdentityDkimSigningAttributesResponse'</a>,
--   <a>putEmailIdentityDkimSigningAttributesResponse_httpStatus</a> - The
--   response's http status code.
newPutEmailIdentityDkimSigningAttributesResponse :: Int -> PutEmailIdentityDkimSigningAttributesResponse

--

--   bounce or complaint events occur. These notifications are sent to the
--   address that you specified in the <tt>Return-Path</tt> header of the
--   original email.
--

--   If you haven't set up another mechanism for receiving bounce or

--   destination), you receive an email notification when these events

--   identity.
