--   feedback forwarding configuration for the identity.
--   
--   If the value is <tt>true</tt>, you receive email notifications when
--   bounce or complaint events occur. These notifications are sent to the
--   address that you specified in the <tt>Return-Path</tt> header of the
--   original email.
--   
--   You're required to have a method of tracking bounces and complaints.
--   If you haven't set up another mechanism for receiving bounce or
--   complaint notifications (for example, by setting up an event
--   destination), you receive an email notification when these events
--   occur (even if this setting is disabled).
--   
--   <a>$sel:policies:GetEmailIdentityResponse'</a>,

--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>HEALTHY</tt>  There are no reputation-related issues that
--   currently impact your account.</li>
--   <li><tt>PROBATION</tt>  We've identified potential issues with your
--   Amazon SES account. We're placing your account under review while you
--   work on correcting these issues.</li>
--   <li><tt>SHUTDOWN</tt>  Your account's ability to send email is
--   currently paused because of an issue with the email sent from your

--   that your account's ability to send email is resumed.</li>

--   Services Region.
--   
--   If the value is <tt>false</tt>, then your account is in the
--   <i>sandbox</i>. When your account is in the sandbox, you can only send
--   email to verified identities. Additionally, the maximum number of
--   emails you can send in a 24-hour period (your sending quota) is 200,
--   and the maximum number of emails you can send per second (your maximum
--   sending rate) is 1.
--   
--   If the value is <tt>true</tt>, then your account has production
--   access. When your account has production access, you can send email to
--   any address. The sending quota and maximum sending rate for your
--   account vary based on your specific use case.

-- | Represents a request to send email messages to multiple destinations
--   using Amazon SES. For more information, see the <a>Amazon SES
--   Developer Guide</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSendBulkEmail</a> smart constructor.
data SendBulkEmail
SendBulkEmail' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [MessageTag] -> Maybe [Text] -> BulkEmailContent -> [BulkEmailEntry] -> SendBulkEmail

-- | Create a value of <a>SendBulkEmail</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:fromEmailAddress:SendBulkEmail'</a>,
--   <a>sendBulkEmail_fromEmailAddress</a> - The email address to use as
--   the "From" address for the email. The address that you specify has to
--   be verified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fromEmailAddressIdentityArn:SendBulkEmail'</a>,
--   <a>sendBulkEmail_fromEmailAddressIdentityArn</a> - This parameter is
--   used only for sending authorization. It is the ARN of the identity
--   that is associated with the sending authorization policy that permits
--   you to use the email address specified in the
--   <tt>FromEmailAddress</tt> parameter.
--   
--   For example, if the owner of example.com (which has ARN
--   arn:aws:ses:us-east-1:123456789012:identity/example.com) attaches a
--   policy to it that authorizes you to use sender@example.com, then you
--   would specify the <tt>FromEmailAddressIdentityArn</tt> to be
--   arn:aws:ses:us-east-1:123456789012:identity/example.com, and the
--   <tt>FromEmailAddress</tt> to be sender@example.com.
--   
--   For more information about sending authorization, see the <a>Amazon
--   SES Developer Guide</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:configurationSetName:SendBulkEmail'</a>,
--   <a>sendBulkEmail_configurationSetName</a> - The name of the
--   configuration set to use when sending the email.
--   
--   <a>$sel:feedbackForwardingEmailAddress:SendBulkEmail'</a>,
--   <a>sendBulkEmail_feedbackForwardingEmailAddress</a> - The address that
--   you want bounce and complaint notifications to be sent to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:feedbackForwardingEmailAddressIdentityArn:SendBulkEmail'</a>,
--   <a>sendBulkEmail_feedbackForwardingEmailAddressIdentityArn</a> - This
--   parameter is used only for sending authorization. It is the ARN of the
--   identity that is associated with the sending authorization policy that
--   permits you to use the email address specified in the
--   <tt>FeedbackForwardingEmailAddress</tt> parameter.
--   
--   For example, if the owner of example.com (which has ARN
--   arn:aws:ses:us-east-1:123456789012:identity/example.com) attaches a
--   policy to it that authorizes you to use feedback@example.com, then you
--   would specify the <tt>FeedbackForwardingEmailAddressIdentityArn</tt>
--   to be arn:aws:ses:us-east-1:123456789012:identity/example.com, and the
--   <tt>FeedbackForwardingEmailAddress</tt> to be feedback@example.com.
--   
--   For more information about sending authorization, see the <a>Amazon
--   SES Developer Guide</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultEmailTags:SendBulkEmail'</a>,
--   <a>sendBulkEmail_defaultEmailTags</a> - A list of tags, in the form of
--   name/value pairs, to apply to an email that you send using the
--   <tt>SendEmail</tt> operation. Tags correspond to characteristics of
--   the email that you define, so that you can publish email sending
--   events.
--   
--   <a>$sel:replyToAddresses:SendBulkEmail'</a>,
--   <a>sendBulkEmail_replyToAddresses</a> - The "Reply-to" email addresses
--   for the message. When the recipient replies to the message, each
--   Reply-to address receives the reply.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultContent:SendBulkEmail'</a>,
--   <a>sendBulkEmail_defaultContent</a> - An object that contains the body
--   of the message. You can specify a template message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bulkEmailEntries:SendBulkEmail'</a>,
--   <a>sendBulkEmail_bulkEmailEntries</a> - The list of bulk email entry
--   objects.
newSendBulkEmail :: BulkEmailContent -> SendBulkEmail

-- | Represents a request to send a single formatted email using Amazon
--   SES. For more information, see the <a>Amazon SES Developer Guide</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSendEmail</a> smart constructor.
data SendEmail
SendEmail' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Destination -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ListManagementOptions -> Maybe [MessageTag] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> EmailContent -> SendEmail

-- | Create a value of <a>SendEmail</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:fromEmailAddress:SendEmail'</a>,
--   <a>sendEmail_fromEmailAddress</a> - The email address to use as the
--   "From" address for the email. The address that you specify has to be
--   verified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:destination:SendEmail'</a>, <a>sendEmail_destination</a> - An
--   object that contains the recipients of the email message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fromEmailAddressIdentityArn:SendEmail'</a>,
--   <a>sendEmail_fromEmailAddressIdentityArn</a> - This parameter is used
--   only for sending authorization. It is the ARN of the identity that is
--   associated with the sending authorization policy that permits you to
--   use the email address specified in the <tt>FromEmailAddress</tt>
--   parameter.
--   
--   For example, if the owner of example.com (which has ARN
--   arn:aws:ses:us-east-1:123456789012:identity/example.com) attaches a
--   policy to it that authorizes you to use sender@example.com, then you
--   would specify the <tt>FromEmailAddressIdentityArn</tt> to be
--   arn:aws:ses:us-east-1:123456789012:identity/example.com, and the
--   <tt>FromEmailAddress</tt> to be sender@example.com.
--   
--   For more information about sending authorization, see the <a>Amazon
--   SES Developer Guide</a>.
--   
--   For Raw emails, the <tt>FromEmailAddressIdentityArn</tt> value
--   overrides the X-SES-SOURCE-ARN and X-SES-FROM-ARN headers specified in
--   raw email message content.
--   
--   <a>$sel:configurationSetName:SendEmail'</a>,
--   <a>sendEmail_configurationSetName</a> - The name of the configuration
--   set to use when sending the email.
--   
--   <a>$sel:listManagementOptions:SendEmail'</a>,
--   <a>sendEmail_listManagementOptions</a> - An object used to specify a
--   list or topic to which an email belongs, which will be used when a
--   contact chooses to unsubscribe.
--   
--   <a>$sel:emailTags:SendEmail'</a>, <a>sendEmail_emailTags</a> - A list
--   of tags, in the form of name/value pairs, to apply to an email that
--   you send using the <tt>SendEmail</tt> operation. Tags correspond to
--   characteristics of the email that you define, so that you can publish
--   email sending events.
--   
--   <a>$sel:feedbackForwardingEmailAddress:SendEmail'</a>,
--   <a>sendEmail_feedbackForwardingEmailAddress</a> - The address that you
--   want bounce and complaint notifications to be sent to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:feedbackForwardingEmailAddressIdentityArn:SendEmail'</a>,
--   <a>sendEmail_feedbackForwardingEmailAddressIdentityArn</a> - This
--   parameter is used only for sending authorization. It is the ARN of the
--   identity that is associated with the sending authorization policy that
--   permits you to use the email address specified in the
--   <tt>FeedbackForwardingEmailAddress</tt> parameter.
--   
--   For example, if the owner of example.com (which has ARN
--   arn:aws:ses:us-east-1:123456789012:identity/example.com) attaches a
--   policy to it that authorizes you to use feedback@example.com, then you
--   would specify the <tt>FeedbackForwardingEmailAddressIdentityArn</tt>
--   to be arn:aws:ses:us-east-1:123456789012:identity/example.com, and the
--   <tt>FeedbackForwardingEmailAddress</tt> to be feedback@example.com.
--   
--   For more information about sending authorization, see the <a>Amazon
--   SES Developer Guide</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:replyToAddresses:SendEmail'</a>,
--   <a>sendEmail_replyToAddresses</a> - The "Reply-to" email addresses for
--   the message. When the recipient replies to the message, each Reply-to
--   address receives the reply.
--   
--   <a>$sel:content:SendEmail'</a>, <a>sendEmail_content</a> - An object
--   that contains the body of the message. You can send either a Simple
--   message Raw message or a template Message.
newSendEmail :: EmailContent -> SendEmail

-- | A unique message ID that you receive when an email is accepted for
--   sending.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSendEmailResponse</a> smart constructor.
data SendEmailResponse
SendEmailResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Int -> SendEmailResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>SendEmailResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:messageId:SendEmailResponse'</a>,
--   <a>sendEmailResponse_messageId</a> - A unique identifier for the
--   message that is generated when the message is accepted.
--   
--   It's possible for Amazon SES to accept a message without sending it.
--   This can happen when the message that you're trying to send has an
--   attachment contains a virus, or when you send a templated email that
--   contains invalid personalization content, for example.

-- | A request to perform a predictive inbox placement test. Predictive
--   inbox placement tests can help you predict how your messages will be
--   handled by various email providers around the world. When you perform
--   a predictive inbox placement test, you provide a sample message that
--   contains the content that you plan to send to your customers. We send
--   that message to special email addresses spread across several major
--   email providers around the world. The test takes about 24 hours to
--   complete. When the test is complete, you can use the
--   <tt>GetDeliverabilityTestReport</tt> operation to view the results of
--   the test.
--

--   helps you to identify the predictive inbox placement test when you
--   retrieve the results.

--   <a>createDeliverabilityTestReport_tags</a> - An array of objects that
--   define the tags (keys and values) that you want to associate with the
--   predictive inbox placement test.

--   address that the predictive inbox placement test email was sent from.

-- | A request to configure the custom MAIL FROM domain for a verified
--   identity.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes</a> smart
--   constructor.
data PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes
PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe BehaviorOnMxFailure -> Text -> PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes

-- | Create a value of <a>PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:mailFromDomain:PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>putEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes_mailFromDomain</a> - The custom
--   MAIL FROM domain that you want the verified identity to use. The MAIL
--   FROM domain must meet the following criteria:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>It has to be a subdomain of the verified identity.</li>
--   <li>It can't be used to receive email.</li>
--   <li>It can't be used in a "From" address if the MAIL FROM domain is a
--   destination for feedback forwarding emails.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:behaviorOnMxFailure:PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>putEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes_behaviorOnMxFailure</a> - The
--   action to take if the required MX record isn't found when you send an
--   email. When you set this value to <tt>UseDefaultValue</tt>, the mail
--   is sent using <i>amazonses.com</i> as the MAIL FROM domain. When you
--   set this value to <tt>RejectMessage</tt>, the Amazon SES API v2
--   returns a <tt>MailFromDomainNotVerified</tt> error, and doesn't
--   attempt to deliver the email.
--   
--   These behaviors are taken when the custom MAIL FROM domain
--   configuration is in the <tt>Pending</tt>, <tt>Failed</tt>, and
--   <tt>TemporaryFailure</tt> states.
--   
--   <a>$sel:emailIdentity:PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>putEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes_emailIdentity</a> - The verified
--   email identity.
newPutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes :: Text -> PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes

--   suppression list for your account when a message sent to that address

-- | Enable or disable the Deliverability dashboard. When you enable the
--   Deliverability dashboard, you gain access to reputation,
--   deliverability, and other metrics for the domains that you use to send
--   email using Amazon SES API v2. You also gain the ability to perform
--   predictive inbox placement tests.
--   
--   When you use the Deliverability dashboard, you pay a monthly
--   subscription charge, in addition to any other fees that you accrue by
--   using Amazon SES and other Amazon Web Services services. For more
--   information about the features and cost of a Deliverability dashboard
--   subscription, see <a>Amazon Pinpoint Pricing</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPutDeliverabilityDashboardOption</a> smart
--   constructor.

--   and enabled the Deliverability dashboard for.

-- | The action to take if the required MX record can't be found when you
--   send an email. When you set this value to <tt>UseDefaultValue</tt>,
--   the mail is sent using <i>amazonses.com</i> as the MAIL FROM domain.
--   When you set this value to <tt>RejectMessage</tt>, the Amazon SES API
--   v2 returns a <tt>MailFromDomainNotVerified</tt> error, and doesn't
--   attempt to deliver the email.
--   
--   These behaviors are taken when the custom MAIL FROM domain
--   configuration is in the <tt>Pending</tt>, <tt>Failed</tt>, and
--   <tt>TemporaryFailure</tt> states.
newtype BehaviorOnMxFailure
BehaviorOnMxFailure' :: Text -> BehaviorOnMxFailure
[fromBehaviorOnMxFailure] :: BehaviorOnMxFailure -> Text
pattern BehaviorOnMxFailure_REJECT_MESSAGE :: BehaviorOnMxFailure
pattern BehaviorOnMxFailure_USE_DEFAULT_VALUE :: BehaviorOnMxFailure
newtype BulkEmailStatus
BulkEmailStatus' :: Text -> BulkEmailStatus
[fromBulkEmailStatus] :: BulkEmailStatus -> Text
pattern BulkEmailStatus_ACCOUNT_DAILY_QUOTA_EXCEEDED :: BulkEmailStatus
pattern BulkEmailStatus_ACCOUNT_SENDING_PAUSED :: BulkEmailStatus
pattern BulkEmailStatus_ACCOUNT_SUSPENDED :: BulkEmailStatus
pattern BulkEmailStatus_ACCOUNT_THROTTLED :: BulkEmailStatus
pattern BulkEmailStatus_CONFIGURATION_SET_NOT_FOUND :: BulkEmailStatus
pattern BulkEmailStatus_CONFIGURATION_SET_SENDING_PAUSED :: BulkEmailStatus
pattern BulkEmailStatus_FAILED :: BulkEmailStatus
pattern BulkEmailStatus_INVALID_PARAMETER :: BulkEmailStatus
pattern BulkEmailStatus_INVALID_SENDING_POOL_NAME :: BulkEmailStatus
pattern BulkEmailStatus_MAIL_FROM_DOMAIN_NOT_VERIFIED :: BulkEmailStatus
pattern BulkEmailStatus_MESSAGE_REJECTED :: BulkEmailStatus
pattern BulkEmailStatus_SUCCESS :: BulkEmailStatus
pattern BulkEmailStatus_TEMPLATE_NOT_FOUND :: BulkEmailStatus
pattern BulkEmailStatus_TRANSIENT_FAILURE :: BulkEmailStatus

-- | The current status of your Deliverability dashboard subscription. If
--   this value is <tt>PENDING_EXPIRATION</tt>, your subscription is
--   scheduled to expire at the end of the current calendar month.

pattern DeliverabilityDashboardAccountStatus_DISABLED :: DeliverabilityDashboardAccountStatus
pattern DeliverabilityDashboardAccountStatus_PENDING_EXPIRATION :: DeliverabilityDashboardAccountStatus

-- | The status of a predictive inbox placement test. If the status is
--   <tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt>, then the predictive inbox placement test is
--   currently running. Predictive inbox placement tests are usually
--   complete within 24 hours of creating the test. If the status is
--   <tt>COMPLETE</tt>, then the test is finished, and you can use the
--   <tt>GetDeliverabilityTestReport</tt> operation to view the results of
--   the test.
newtype DeliverabilityTestStatus
DeliverabilityTestStatus' :: Text -> DeliverabilityTestStatus
[fromDeliverabilityTestStatus] :: DeliverabilityTestStatus -> Text
pattern DeliverabilityTestStatus_COMPLETED :: DeliverabilityTestStatus
pattern DeliverabilityTestStatus_IN_PROGRESS :: DeliverabilityTestStatus

-- | The location where the Amazon SES API v2 finds the value of a
--   dimension to publish to Amazon CloudWatch. To use the message tags
--   that you specify using an <tt>X-SES-MESSAGE-TAGS</tt> header or a
--   parameter to the <tt>SendEmail</tt> or <tt>SendRawEmail</tt> API,
--   choose <tt>messageTag</tt>. To use your own email headers, choose
--   <tt>emailHeader</tt>. To use link tags, choose <tt>linkTags</tt>.
newtype DimensionValueSource
DimensionValueSource' :: Text -> DimensionValueSource
[fromDimensionValueSource] :: DimensionValueSource -> Text
pattern DimensionValueSource_EMAIL_HEADER :: DimensionValueSource
pattern DimensionValueSource_LINK_TAG :: DimensionValueSource
pattern DimensionValueSource_MESSAGE_TAG :: DimensionValueSource
newtype DkimSigningAttributesOrigin
DkimSigningAttributesOrigin' :: Text -> DkimSigningAttributesOrigin
[fromDkimSigningAttributesOrigin] :: DkimSigningAttributesOrigin -> Text
pattern DkimSigningAttributesOrigin_AWS_SES :: DkimSigningAttributesOrigin
pattern DkimSigningAttributesOrigin_EXTERNAL :: DkimSigningAttributesOrigin
newtype DkimSigningKeyLength
DkimSigningKeyLength' :: Text -> DkimSigningKeyLength
[fromDkimSigningKeyLength] :: DkimSigningKeyLength -> Text
pattern DkimSigningKeyLength_RSA_1024_BIT :: DkimSigningKeyLength
pattern DkimSigningKeyLength_RSA_2048_BIT :: DkimSigningKeyLength

-- | The DKIM authentication status of the identity. The status can be one
--   of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>PENDING</tt>  The verification process was initiated, but
--   Amazon SES hasn't yet detected the DKIM records in the DNS
--   configuration for the domain.</li>
--   <li><tt>SUCCESS</tt>  The verification process completed
--   successfully.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt>  The verification process failed. This typically
--   occurs when Amazon SES fails to find the DKIM records in the DNS
--   configuration of the domain.</li>
--   <li><tt>TEMPORARY_FAILURE</tt>  A temporary issue is preventing
--   Amazon SES from determining the DKIM authentication status of the
--   domain.</li>
--   <li><tt>NOT_STARTED</tt>  The DKIM verification process hasn't been
--   initiated for the domain.</li>
--   </ul>
newtype DkimStatus
DkimStatus' :: Text -> DkimStatus
[fromDkimStatus] :: DkimStatus -> Text
pattern DkimStatus_FAILED :: DkimStatus
pattern DkimStatus_NOT_STARTED :: DkimStatus
pattern DkimStatus_PENDING :: DkimStatus
pattern DkimStatus_SUCCESS :: DkimStatus
pattern DkimStatus_TEMPORARY_FAILURE :: DkimStatus

-- | An email sending event type. For example, email sends, opens, and
--   bounces are all email events.
newtype EventType
EventType' :: Text -> EventType
[fromEventType] :: EventType -> Text
pattern EventType_BOUNCE :: EventType
pattern EventType_CLICK :: EventType
pattern EventType_COMPLAINT :: EventType
pattern EventType_DELIVERY :: EventType
pattern EventType_DELIVERY_DELAY :: EventType
pattern EventType_OPEN :: EventType
pattern EventType_REJECT :: EventType
pattern EventType_RENDERING_FAILURE :: EventType
pattern EventType_SEND :: EventType
pattern EventType_SUBSCRIPTION :: EventType
newtype IdentityType
IdentityType' :: Text -> IdentityType
[fromIdentityType] :: IdentityType -> Text
pattern IdentityType_DOMAIN :: IdentityType
pattern IdentityType_EMAIL_ADDRESS :: IdentityType
pattern IdentityType_MANAGED_DOMAIN :: IdentityType

-- | The destination of the import job, which can be used to list import
--   jobs that have a certain <tt>ImportDestinationType</tt>.
newtype ImportDestinationType
ImportDestinationType' :: Text -> ImportDestinationType
[fromImportDestinationType] :: ImportDestinationType -> Text
pattern ImportDestinationType_CONTACT_LIST :: ImportDestinationType
pattern ImportDestinationType_SUPPRESSION_LIST :: ImportDestinationType

-- | The status of the import job.
newtype JobStatus

pattern JobStatus_COMPLETED :: JobStatus
pattern JobStatus_CREATED :: JobStatus
pattern JobStatus_FAILED :: JobStatus
pattern JobStatus_PROCESSING :: JobStatus

-- | The status of the MAIL FROM domain. This status can have the following
--   values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>PENDING</tt>  Amazon SES hasn't started searching for the MX
--   record yet.</li>
--   <li><tt>SUCCESS</tt>  Amazon SES detected the required MX record for
--   the MAIL FROM domain.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt>  Amazon SES can't find the required MX record, or
--   the record no longer exists.</li>
--   <li><tt>TEMPORARY_FAILURE</tt>  A temporary issue occurred, which
--   prevented Amazon SES from determining the status of the MAIL FROM
--   domain.</li>
--   </ul>
newtype MailFromDomainStatus
MailFromDomainStatus' :: Text -> MailFromDomainStatus
[fromMailFromDomainStatus] :: MailFromDomainStatus -> Text
pattern MailFromDomainStatus_FAILED :: MailFromDomainStatus
pattern MailFromDomainStatus_PENDING :: MailFromDomainStatus
pattern MailFromDomainStatus_SUCCESS :: MailFromDomainStatus
pattern MailFromDomainStatus_TEMPORARY_FAILURE :: MailFromDomainStatus
newtype MailType
MailType' :: Text -> MailType
[fromMailType] :: MailType -> Text
pattern MailType_MARKETING :: MailType
pattern MailType_TRANSACTIONAL :: MailType
newtype ReviewStatus
ReviewStatus' :: Text -> ReviewStatus
[fromReviewStatus] :: ReviewStatus -> Text
pattern ReviewStatus_DENIED :: ReviewStatus
pattern ReviewStatus_FAILED :: ReviewStatus
pattern ReviewStatus_GRANTED :: ReviewStatus
pattern ReviewStatus_PENDING :: ReviewStatus
newtype SubscriptionStatus
SubscriptionStatus' :: Text -> SubscriptionStatus
[fromSubscriptionStatus] :: SubscriptionStatus -> Text
pattern SubscriptionStatus_OPT_IN :: SubscriptionStatus
pattern SubscriptionStatus_OPT_OUT :: SubscriptionStatus

-- | The type of action to perform on the address. The following are
--   possible values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>PUT: add the addresses to the suppression list.</li>
--   <li>DELETE: remove the address from the suppression list.</li>
--   </ul>
newtype SuppressionListImportAction
SuppressionListImportAction' :: Text -> SuppressionListImportAction
[fromSuppressionListImportAction] :: SuppressionListImportAction -> Text
pattern SuppressionListImportAction_DELETE :: SuppressionListImportAction
pattern SuppressionListImportAction_PUT :: SuppressionListImportAction

-- | The reason that the address was added to the suppression list for your
--   account. The value can be one of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>COMPLAINT</tt>  Amazon SES added an email address to the
--   suppression list for your account because a message sent to that
--   address results in a complaint.</li>
--   <li><tt>BOUNCE</tt>  Amazon SES added an email address to the
--   suppression list for your account because a message sent to that
--   address results in a hard bounce.</li>
--   </ul>
newtype SuppressionListReason
SuppressionListReason' :: Text -> SuppressionListReason
[fromSuppressionListReason] :: SuppressionListReason -> Text
pattern SuppressionListReason_BOUNCE :: SuppressionListReason
pattern SuppressionListReason_COMPLAINT :: SuppressionListReason

-- | Specifies whether messages that use the configuration set are required
--   to use Transport Layer Security (TLS). If the value is
--   <tt>Require</tt>, messages are only delivered if a TLS connection can
--   be established. If the value is <tt>Optional</tt>, messages can be
--   delivered in plain text if a TLS connection can't be established.
newtype TlsPolicy
TlsPolicy' :: Text -> TlsPolicy
[fromTlsPolicy] :: TlsPolicy -> Text
pattern TlsPolicy_OPTIONAL :: TlsPolicy
pattern TlsPolicy_REQUIRE :: TlsPolicy

-- | The warmup status of a dedicated IP.
newtype WarmupStatus
WarmupStatus' :: Text -> WarmupStatus
[fromWarmupStatus] :: WarmupStatus -> Text
pattern WarmupStatus_DONE :: WarmupStatus
pattern WarmupStatus_IN_PROGRESS :: WarmupStatus

-- | An object that contains information about your account details.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAccountDetails</a> smart constructor.
data AccountDetails
AccountDetails' :: Maybe ReviewDetails -> Maybe MailType -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe ContactLanguage -> Maybe (Sensitive (NonEmpty (Sensitive Text))) -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> AccountDetails

-- | Create a value of <a>AccountDetails</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:reviewDetails:AccountDetails'</a>,
--   <a>accountDetails_reviewDetails</a> - Information about the review of
--   the latest details you submitted.
--   
--   <a>$sel:mailType:AccountDetails'</a>, <a>accountDetails_mailType</a> -
--   The type of email your account is sending. The mail type can be one of
--   the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>MARKETING</tt>  Most of your sending traffic is to keep your
--   customers informed of your latest offering.</li>
--   <li><tt>TRANSACTIONAL</tt>  Most of your sending traffic is to
--   communicate during a transaction with a customer.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:useCaseDescription:AccountDetails'</a>,
--   <a>accountDetails_useCaseDescription</a> - A description of the types
--   of email that you plan to send.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contactLanguage:AccountDetails'</a>,
--   <a>accountDetails_contactLanguage</a> - The language you would prefer
--   for the case. The contact language can be one of <tt>ENGLISH</tt> or
--   <tt>JAPANESE</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:additionalContactEmailAddresses:AccountDetails'</a>,
--   <a>accountDetails_additionalContactEmailAddresses</a> - Additional
--   email addresses where updates are sent about your account review
--   process.
--   
--   <a>$sel:websiteURL:AccountDetails'</a>,
--   <a>accountDetails_websiteURL</a> - The URL of your website. This
--   information helps us better understand the type of content that you
--   plan to send.
newAccountDetails :: AccountDetails

newBlacklistEntry :: BlacklistEntry

-- | Represents the body of the email message.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBody</a> smart constructor.
data Body

--   don't support HTML, or clients where the recipient has disabled HTML
--   rendering.
--   
--   <a>$sel:html:Body'</a>, <a>body_html</a> - An object that represents
--   the version of the message that is displayed in email clients that
--   support HTML. HTML messages can include formatted text, hyperlinks,
--   images, and more.
newBody :: Body

-- | An object that contains the body of the message. You can specify a
--   template message.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBulkEmailContent</a> smart constructor.
data BulkEmailContent
BulkEmailContent' :: Maybe Template -> BulkEmailContent

-- | Create a value of <a>BulkEmailContent</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:template:BulkEmailContent'</a>,
--   <a>bulkEmailContent_template</a> - The template to use for the bulk
--   email message.
newBulkEmailContent :: BulkEmailContent

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newBulkEmailEntry</a> smart constructor.
data BulkEmailEntry
BulkEmailEntry' :: Maybe ReplacementEmailContent -> Maybe [MessageTag] -> Destination -> BulkEmailEntry

-- | Create a value of <a>BulkEmailEntry</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:replacementEmailContent:BulkEmailEntry'</a>,
--   <a>bulkEmailEntry_replacementEmailContent</a> - The
--   <tt>ReplacementEmailContent</tt> associated with a
--   <tt>BulkEmailEntry</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:replacementTags:BulkEmailEntry'</a>,
--   <a>bulkEmailEntry_replacementTags</a> - A list of tags, in the form of
--   name/value pairs, to apply to an email that you send using the
--   <tt>SendBulkTemplatedEmail</tt> operation. Tags correspond to
--   characteristics of the email that you define, so that you can publish
--   email sending events.
--   
--   <a>$sel:destination:BulkEmailEntry'</a>,
--   <a>bulkEmailEntry_destination</a> - Represents the destination of the
--   message, consisting of To:, CC:, and BCC: fields.
--   
--   Amazon SES does not support the SMTPUTF8 extension, as described in
--   <a>RFC6531</a>. For this reason, the local part of a destination email
--   address (the part of the email address that precedes the @ sign) may
--   only contain <a>7-bit ASCII characters</a>. If the domain part of an
--   address (the part after the @ sign) contains non-ASCII characters,
--   they must be encoded using Punycode, as described in <a>RFC3492</a>.
newBulkEmailEntry :: Destination -> BulkEmailEntry

-- | The result of the <tt>SendBulkEmail</tt> operation of each specified
--   <tt>BulkEmailEntry</tt>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBulkEmailEntryResult</a> smart constructor.
data BulkEmailEntryResult
BulkEmailEntryResult' :: Maybe BulkEmailStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> BulkEmailEntryResult

-- | Create a value of <a>BulkEmailEntryResult</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:BulkEmailEntryResult'</a>,
--   <a>bulkEmailEntryResult_status</a> - The status of a message sent
--   using the <tt>SendBulkTemplatedEmail</tt> operation.
--   
--   Possible values for this parameter include:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>SUCCESS: Amazon SES accepted the message, and will attempt to
--   deliver it to the recipients.</li>
--   <li>MESSAGE_REJECTED: The message was rejected because it contained a
--   virus.</li>
--   <li>MAIL_FROM_DOMAIN_NOT_VERIFIED: The sender's email address or
--   domain was not verified.</li>
--   <li>CONFIGURATION_SET_DOES_NOT_EXIST: The configuration set you
--   specified does not exist.</li>
--   <li>TEMPLATE_DOES_NOT_EXIST: The template you specified does not
--   exist.</li>
--   <li>ACCOUNT_SUSPENDED: Your account has been shut down because of
--   issues related to your email sending practices.</li>
--   <li>ACCOUNT_THROTTLED: The number of emails you can send has been
--   reduced because your account has exceeded its allocated sending
--   limit.</li>
--   <li>ACCOUNT_DAILY_QUOTA_EXCEEDED: You have reached or exceeded the
--   maximum number of emails you can send from your account in a 24-hour
--   period.</li>
--   <li>INVALID_SENDING_POOL_NAME: The configuration set you specified
--   refers to an IP pool that does not exist.</li>
--   <li>ACCOUNT_SENDING_PAUSED: Email sending for the Amazon SES account
--   was disabled using the <a>UpdateAccountSendingEnabled</a>
--   operation.</li>
--   <li>CONFIGURATION_SET_SENDING_PAUSED: Email sending for this
--   configuration set was disabled using the
--   <a>UpdateConfigurationSetSendingEnabled</a> operation.</li>
--   <li>INVALID_PARAMETER_VALUE: One or more of the parameters you
--   specified when calling this operation was invalid. See the error
--   message for additional information.</li>
--   <li>TRANSIENT_FAILURE: Amazon SES was unable to process your request
--   because of a temporary issue.</li>
--   <li>FAILED: Amazon SES was unable to process your request. See the
--   error message for additional information.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:error:BulkEmailEntryResult'</a>,
--   <a>bulkEmailEntryResult_error</a> - A description of an error that
--   prevented a message being sent using the
--   <tt>SendBulkTemplatedEmail</tt> operation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:messageId:BulkEmailEntryResult'</a>,
--   <a>bulkEmailEntryResult_messageId</a> - The unique message identifier
--   returned from the <tt>SendBulkTemplatedEmail</tt> operation.
newBulkEmailEntryResult :: BulkEmailEntryResult

-- | An object that defines an Amazon CloudWatch destination for email

--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCloudWatchDestination</a> smart constructor.
data CloudWatchDestination

--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:dimensionConfigurations:CloudWatchDestination'</a>,
--   <a>cloudWatchDestination_dimensionConfigurations</a> - An array of
--   objects that define the dimensions to use when you send email events
--   to Amazon CloudWatch.
newCloudWatchDestination :: CloudWatchDestination

-- | An object that defines the dimension configuration to use when you
--   send email events to Amazon CloudWatch.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCloudWatchDimensionConfiguration</a> smart
--   constructor.
data CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration
CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration' :: Text -> DimensionValueSource -> Text -> CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration

-- | Create a value of <a>CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:dimensionName:CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>cloudWatchDimensionConfiguration_dimensionName</a> - The name of an
--   Amazon CloudWatch dimension associated with an email sending metric.
--   The name has to meet the following criteria:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>It can only contain ASCII letters (az, AZ), numbers (09),
--   underscores (_), or dashes (-).</li>
--   <li>It can contain no more than 256 characters.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:dimensionValueSource:CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>cloudWatchDimensionConfiguration_dimensionValueSource</a> - The
--   location where the Amazon SES API v2 finds the value of a dimension to
--   publish to Amazon CloudWatch. To use the message tags that you specify
--   using an <tt>X-SES-MESSAGE-TAGS</tt> header or a parameter to the
--   <tt>SendEmail</tt> or <tt>SendRawEmail</tt> API, choose
--   <tt>messageTag</tt>. To use your own email headers, choose
--   <tt>emailHeader</tt>. To use link tags, choose <tt>linkTags</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultDimensionValue:CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>cloudWatchDimensionConfiguration_defaultDimensionValue</a> - The
--   default value of the dimension that is published to Amazon CloudWatch
--   if you don't provide the value of the dimension when you send an
--   email. This value has to meet the following criteria:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>It can only contain ASCII letters (az, AZ), numbers (09),
--   underscores (_), or dashes (-).</li>
--   <li>It can contain no more than 256 characters.</li>
--   </ul>
newCloudWatchDimensionConfiguration :: Text -> DimensionValueSource -> Text -> CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration

-- | A contact is the end-user who is receiving the email.

--   contact list topics.

--   applied to the contact.
--

--   contact's email address.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastUpdatedTimestamp:Contact'</a>,
--   <a>contact_lastUpdatedTimestamp</a> - A timestamp noting the last time
--   the contact's information was updated.
--

--   - The contact's preference for being opted-in to or opted-out of a
--   topic.
newContact :: Contact

-- | An object that represents the content of the email, and optionally a
--   character set specification.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newContent</a> smart constructor.
data Content

-- | Create a value of <a>Content</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:charset:Content'</a>, <a>content_charset</a> - The character
--   set for the content. Because of the constraints of the SMTP protocol,
--   Amazon SES uses 7-bit ASCII by default. If the text includes
--   characters outside of the ASCII range, you have to specify a character
--   set. For example, you could specify <tt>UTF-8</tt>,
--   <tt>ISO-8859-1</tt>, or <tt>Shift_JIS</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:data':Content'</a>, <a>content_data</a> - The content of the
--   message itself.
newContent :: Text -> Content

-- | An object that contains information about the volume of email sent on

data DailyVolume

--   placement metrics for a specific day in the analysis period.
newDailyVolume :: DailyVolume

-- | Contains information about a dedicated IP address that is associated
--   with your Amazon SES account.
--   
--   To learn more about requesting dedicated IP addresses, see
--   <a>Requesting and Relinquishing Dedicated IP Addresses</a> in the
--   <i>Amazon SES Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDedicatedIp</a> smart constructor.
data DedicatedIp
DedicatedIp' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> WarmupStatus -> Int -> DedicatedIp

-- | Create a value of <a>DedicatedIp</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:poolName:DedicatedIp'</a>, <a>dedicatedIp_poolName</a> - The
--   name of the dedicated IP pool that the IP address is associated with.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ip:DedicatedIp'</a>, <a>dedicatedIp_ip</a> - An IPv4 address.
--   
--   <a>$sel:warmupStatus:DedicatedIp'</a>, <a>dedicatedIp_warmupStatus</a>
--   - The warm-up status of a dedicated IP address. The status can have
--   one of the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt>  The IP address isn't ready to use because
--   the dedicated IP warm-up process is ongoing.</li>
--   <li><tt>DONE</tt>  The dedicated IP warm-up process is complete, and
--   the IP address is ready to use.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:warmupPercentage:DedicatedIp'</a>,
--   <a>dedicatedIp_warmupPercentage</a> - Indicates how complete the
--   dedicated IP warm-up process is. When this value equals 1, the address
--   has completed the warm-up process and is ready for use.
newDedicatedIp :: Text -> WarmupStatus -> Int -> DedicatedIp

-- | An object that contains metadata related to a predictive inbox
--   placement test.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDeliverabilityTestReport</a> smart constructor.
data DeliverabilityTestReport
DeliverabilityTestReport' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe DeliverabilityTestStatus -> DeliverabilityTestReport

-- | Create a value of <a>DeliverabilityTestReport</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:subject:DeliverabilityTestReport'</a>,
--   <a>deliverabilityTestReport_subject</a> - The subject line for an
--   email that you submitted in a predictive inbox placement test.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fromEmailAddress:DeliverabilityTestReport'</a>,
--   <a>deliverabilityTestReport_fromEmailAddress</a> - The sender address
--   that you specified for the predictive inbox placement test.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createDate:DeliverabilityTestReport'</a>,
--   <a>deliverabilityTestReport_createDate</a> - The date and time when
--   the predictive inbox placement test was created, in Unix time format.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reportId:DeliverabilityTestReport'</a>,
--   <a>deliverabilityTestReport_reportId</a> - A unique string that
--   identifies the predictive inbox placement test.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reportName:DeliverabilityTestReport'</a>,
--   <a>deliverabilityTestReport_reportName</a> - A name that helps you
--   identify a predictive inbox placement test report.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deliverabilityTestStatus:DeliverabilityTestReport'</a>,
--   <a>deliverabilityTestReport_deliverabilityTestStatus</a> - The status
--   of the predictive inbox placement test. If the status is
--   <tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt>, then the predictive inbox placement test is
--   currently running. Predictive inbox placement tests are usually
--   complete within 24 hours of creating the test. If the status is
--   <tt>COMPLETE</tt>, then the test is finished, and you can use the
--   <tt>GetDeliverabilityTestReport</tt> to view the results of the test.
newDeliverabilityTestReport :: DeliverabilityTestReport

-- | Used to associate a configuration set with a dedicated IP pool.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDeliveryOptions</a> smart constructor.
data DeliveryOptions
DeliveryOptions' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe TlsPolicy -> DeliveryOptions

-- | Create a value of <a>DeliveryOptions</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:sendingPoolName:DeliveryOptions'</a>,
--   <a>deliveryOptions_sendingPoolName</a> - The name of the dedicated IP
--   pool to associate with the configuration set.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tlsPolicy:DeliveryOptions'</a>,
--   <a>deliveryOptions_tlsPolicy</a> - Specifies whether messages that use
--   the configuration set are required to use Transport Layer Security
--   (TLS). If the value is <tt>Require</tt>, messages are only delivered
--   if a TLS connection can be established. If the value is
--   <tt>Optional</tt>, messages can be delivered in plain text if a TLS
--   connection can't be established.
newDeliveryOptions :: DeliveryOptions

-- | An object that describes the recipients for an email.
--   
--   Amazon SES does not support the SMTPUTF8 extension, as described in
--   <a>RFC6531</a>. For this reason, the <i>local part</i> of a
--   destination email address (the part of the email address that precedes
--   the @ sign) may only contain <a>7-bit ASCII characters</a>. If the
--   <i>domain part</i> of an address (the part after the @ sign) contains
--   non-ASCII characters, they must be encoded using Punycode, as
--   described in <a>RFC3492</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDestination</a> smart constructor.
data Destination
Destination' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [Text] -> Destination

-- | Create a value of <a>Destination</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:bccAddresses:Destination'</a>, <a>destination_bccAddresses</a>
--   - An array that contains the email addresses of the "BCC" (blind
--   carbon copy) recipients for the email.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ccAddresses:Destination'</a>, <a>destination_ccAddresses</a> -
--   An array that contains the email addresses of the "CC" (carbon copy)
--   recipients for the email.
--   
--   <a>$sel:toAddresses:Destination'</a>, <a>destination_toAddresses</a> -
--   An array that contains the email addresses of the "To" recipients for
--   the email.
newDestination :: Destination

-- | An object that contains information about the DKIM authentication
--   status for an email identity.
--   
--   Amazon SES determines the authentication status by searching for
--   specific records in the DNS configuration for the domain. If you used
--   <a>Easy DKIM</a> to set up DKIM authentication, Amazon SES tries to
--   find three unique CNAME records in the DNS configuration for your
--   domain. If you provided a public key to perform DKIM authentication,
--   Amazon SES tries to find a TXT record that uses the selector that you
--   specified. The value of the TXT record must be a public key that's
--   paired with the private key that you specified in the process of
--   creating the identity
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDkimAttributes</a> smart constructor.
data DkimAttributes
DkimAttributes' :: Maybe DkimStatus -> Maybe DkimSigningKeyLength -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe DkimSigningKeyLength -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe DkimSigningAttributesOrigin -> DkimAttributes

-- | Create a value of <a>DkimAttributes</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:DkimAttributes'</a>, <a>dkimAttributes_status</a> -
--   Describes whether or not Amazon SES has successfully located the DKIM
--   records in the DNS records for the domain. The status can be one of
--   the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>PENDING</tt>  The verification process was initiated, but
--   Amazon SES hasn't yet detected the DKIM records in the DNS
--   configuration for the domain.</li>
--   <li><tt>SUCCESS</tt>  The verification process completed
--   successfully.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt>  The verification process failed. This typically
--   occurs when Amazon SES fails to find the DKIM records in the DNS
--   configuration of the domain.</li>
--   <li><tt>TEMPORARY_FAILURE</tt>  A temporary issue is preventing
--   Amazon SES from determining the DKIM authentication status of the
--   domain.</li>
--   <li><tt>NOT_STARTED</tt>  The DKIM verification process hasn't been
--   initiated for the domain.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextSigningKeyLength:DkimAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>dkimAttributes_nextSigningKeyLength</a> - [Easy DKIM] The key
--   length of the future DKIM key pair to be generated. This can be
--   changed at most once per day.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tokens:DkimAttributes'</a>, <a>dkimAttributes_tokens</a> - If
--   you used <a>Easy DKIM</a> to configure DKIM authentication for the
--   domain, then this object contains a set of unique strings that you use
--   to create a set of CNAME records that you add to the DNS configuration
--   for your domain. When Amazon SES detects these records in the DNS
--   configuration for your domain, the DKIM authentication process is
--   complete.
--   
--   If you configured DKIM authentication for the domain by providing your
--   own public-private key pair, then this object contains the selector
--   for the public key.
--   
--   Regardless of the DKIM authentication method you use, Amazon SES
--   searches for the appropriate records in the DNS configuration of the
--   domain for up to 72 hours.
--   
--   <a>$sel:signingEnabled:DkimAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>dkimAttributes_signingEnabled</a> - If the value is <tt>true</tt>,
--   then the messages that you send from the identity are signed using
--   DKIM. If the value is <tt>false</tt>, then the messages that you send
--   from the identity aren't DKIM-signed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:currentSigningKeyLength:DkimAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>dkimAttributes_currentSigningKeyLength</a> - [Easy DKIM] The key
--   length of the DKIM key pair in use.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastKeyGenerationTimestamp:DkimAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>dkimAttributes_lastKeyGenerationTimestamp</a> - [Easy DKIM] The
--   last time a key pair was generated for this identity.
--   
--   <a>$sel:signingAttributesOrigin:DkimAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>dkimAttributes_signingAttributesOrigin</a> - A string that
--   indicates how DKIM was configured for the identity. These are the
--   possible values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>AWS_SES</tt>  Indicates that DKIM was configured for the
--   identity by using <a>Easy DKIM</a>.</li>
--   <li><tt>EXTERNAL</tt>  Indicates that DKIM was configured for the
--   identity by using Bring Your Own DKIM (BYODKIM).</li>
--   </ul>
newDkimAttributes :: DkimAttributes

-- | An object that contains configuration for Bring Your Own DKIM
--   (BYODKIM), or, for Easy DKIM
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDkimSigningAttributes</a> smart constructor.
data DkimSigningAttributes
DkimSigningAttributes' :: Maybe DkimSigningKeyLength -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe Text -> DkimSigningAttributes

-- | Create a value of <a>DkimSigningAttributes</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextSigningKeyLength:DkimSigningAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>dkimSigningAttributes_nextSigningKeyLength</a> - [Easy DKIM] The
--   key length of the future DKIM key pair to be generated. This can be
--   changed at most once per day.
--   
--   <a>$sel:domainSigningPrivateKey:DkimSigningAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>dkimSigningAttributes_domainSigningPrivateKey</a> - [Bring Your Own
--   DKIM] A private key that's used to generate a DKIM signature.
--   
--   The private key must use 1024 or 2048-bit RSA encryption, and must be
--   encoded using base64 encoding.
--   
--   <a>$sel:domainSigningSelector:DkimSigningAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>dkimSigningAttributes_domainSigningSelector</a> - [Bring Your Own
--   DKIM] A string that's used to identify a public key in the DNS
--   configuration for a domain.
newDkimSigningAttributes :: DkimSigningAttributes

-- | An object that contains the deliverability data for a specific
--   campaign. This data is available for a campaign only if the campaign
--   sent email by using a domain that the Deliverability dashboard is
--   enabled for (<tt>PutDeliverabilityDashboardOption</tt> operation).
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDomainDeliverabilityCampaign</a> smart constructor.
data DomainDeliverabilityCampaign
DomainDeliverabilityCampaign' :: Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Double -> Maybe POSIX -> DomainDeliverabilityCampaign

-- | Create a value of <a>DomainDeliverabilityCampaign</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:spamCount:DomainDeliverabilityCampaign'</a>,
--   <a>domainDeliverabilityCampaign_spamCount</a> - The number of email
--   messages that were delivered to recipients' spam or junk mail folders.
--   
--   <a>$sel:subject:DomainDeliverabilityCampaign'</a>,
--   <a>domainDeliverabilityCampaign_subject</a> - The subject line, or
--   title, of the email message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:esps:DomainDeliverabilityCampaign'</a>,
--   <a>domainDeliverabilityCampaign_esps</a> - The major email providers
--   who handled the email message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fromAddress:DomainDeliverabilityCampaign'</a>,
--   <a>domainDeliverabilityCampaign_fromAddress</a> - The verified email
--   address that the email message was sent from.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deleteRate:DomainDeliverabilityCampaign'</a>,
--   <a>domainDeliverabilityCampaign_deleteRate</a> - The percentage of
--   email messages that were deleted by recipients, without being opened
--   first. Due to technical limitations, this value only includes
--   recipients who opened the message by using an email client that
--   supports images.
--   
--   <a>$sel:campaignId:DomainDeliverabilityCampaign'</a>,
--   <a>domainDeliverabilityCampaign_campaignId</a> - The unique identifier
--   for the campaign. The Deliverability dashboard automatically generates
--   and assigns this identifier to a campaign.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sendingIps:DomainDeliverabilityCampaign'</a>,
--   <a>domainDeliverabilityCampaign_sendingIps</a> - The IP addresses that
--   were used to send the email message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:firstSeenDateTime:DomainDeliverabilityCampaign'</a>,
--   <a>domainDeliverabilityCampaign_firstSeenDateTime</a> - The first
--   time, in Unix time format, when the email message was delivered to any
--   recipient's inbox. This value can help you determine how long it took
--   for a campaign to deliver an email message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inboxCount:DomainDeliverabilityCampaign'</a>,
--   <a>domainDeliverabilityCampaign_inboxCount</a> - The number of email
--   messages that were delivered to recipients inboxes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:readDeleteRate:DomainDeliverabilityCampaign'</a>,
--   <a>domainDeliverabilityCampaign_readDeleteRate</a> - The percentage of
--   email messages that were opened and then deleted by recipients. Due to
--   technical limitations, this value only includes recipients who opened
--   the message by using an email client that supports images.
--   
--   <a>$sel:projectedVolume:DomainDeliverabilityCampaign'</a>,
--   <a>domainDeliverabilityCampaign_projectedVolume</a> - The projected
--   number of recipients that the email message was sent to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:imageUrl:DomainDeliverabilityCampaign'</a>,
--   <a>domainDeliverabilityCampaign_imageUrl</a> - The URL of an image
--   that contains a snapshot of the email message that was sent.
--   
--   <a>$sel:readRate:DomainDeliverabilityCampaign'</a>,
--   <a>domainDeliverabilityCampaign_readRate</a> - The percentage of email
--   messages that were opened by recipients. Due to technical limitations,
--   this value only includes recipients who opened the message by using an
--   email client that supports images.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastSeenDateTime:DomainDeliverabilityCampaign'</a>,
--   <a>domainDeliverabilityCampaign_lastSeenDateTime</a> - The last time,
--   in Unix time format, when the email message was delivered to any
--   recipient's inbox. This value can help you determine how long it took
--   for a campaign to deliver an email message.
newDomainDeliverabilityCampaign :: DomainDeliverabilityCampaign

newDomainIspPlacement :: DomainIspPlacement

-- | An object that defines the entire content of the email, including the
--   message headers and the body content. You can create a simple email
--   message, in which you specify the subject and the text and HTML
--   versions of the message body. You can also create raw messages, in
--   which you specify a complete MIME-formatted message. Raw messages can
--   include attachments and custom headers.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEmailContent</a> smart constructor.
data EmailContent
EmailContent' :: Maybe RawMessage -> Maybe Message -> Maybe Template -> EmailContent

-- | Create a value of <a>EmailContent</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:raw:EmailContent'</a>, <a>emailContent_raw</a> - The raw email
--   message. The message has to meet the following criteria:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The message has to contain a header and a body, separated by one
--   blank line.</li>
--   <li>All of the required header fields must be present in the
--   message.</li>
--   <li>Each part of a multipart MIME message must be formatted
--   properly.</li>
--   <li>If you include attachments, they must be in a file format that the
--   Amazon SES API v2 supports.</li>
--   <li>The entire message must be Base64 encoded.</li>
--   <li>If any of the MIME parts in your message contain content that is
--   outside of the 7-bit ASCII character range, you should encode that
--   content to ensure that recipients' email clients render the message
--   properly.</li>
--   <li>The length of any single line of text in the message can't exceed
--   1,000 characters. This restriction is defined in <a>RFC 5321</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:simple:EmailContent'</a>, <a>emailContent_simple</a> - The
--   simple email message. The message consists of a subject and a message
--   body.
--   
--   <a>$sel:template:EmailContent'</a>, <a>emailContent_template</a> - The
--   template to use for the email message.
newEmailContent :: EmailContent

-- | The content of the email, composed of a subject line, an HTML part,
--   and a text-only part.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEmailTemplateContent</a> smart constructor.
data EmailTemplateContent
EmailTemplateContent' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> EmailTemplateContent

-- | Create a value of <a>EmailTemplateContent</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:subject:EmailTemplateContent'</a>,
--   <a>emailTemplateContent_subject</a> - The subject line of the email.
--   
--   <a>$sel:text:EmailTemplateContent'</a>,
--   <a>emailTemplateContent_text</a> - The email body that will be visible
--   to recipients whose email clients do not display HTML.
--   
--   <a>$sel:html:EmailTemplateContent'</a>,
--   <a>emailTemplateContent_html</a> - The HTML body of the email.
newEmailTemplateContent :: EmailTemplateContent

newEmailTemplateMetadata :: EmailTemplateMetadata

-- | In the Amazon SES API v2, <i>events</i> include message sends,
--   deliveries, opens, clicks, bounces, complaints and delivery delays.
--   /Event destinations/ are places that you can send information about
--   these events to. For example, you can send event data to Amazon SNS to
--   receive notifications when you receive bounces or complaints, or you
--   can use Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose to stream data to Amazon S3 for
--   long-term storage.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEventDestination</a> smart constructor.
data EventDestination
EventDestination' :: Maybe PinpointDestination -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe KinesisFirehoseDestination -> Maybe CloudWatchDestination -> Maybe SnsDestination -> Text -> [EventType] -> EventDestination

-- | Create a value of <a>EventDestination</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:pinpointDestination:EventDestination'</a>,
--   <a>eventDestination_pinpointDestination</a> - An object that defines
--   an Amazon Pinpoint project destination for email events. You can send
--   email event data to a Amazon Pinpoint project to view metrics using
--   the Transactional Messaging dashboards that are built in to Amazon
--   Pinpoint. For more information, see <a>Transactional Messaging
--   Charts</a> in the <i>Amazon Pinpoint User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enabled:EventDestination'</a>, <a>eventDestination_enabled</a>
--   - If <tt>true</tt>, the event destination is enabled. When the event
--   destination is enabled, the specified event types are sent to the
--   destinations in this <tt>EventDestinationDefinition</tt>.
--   
--   If <tt>false</tt>, the event destination is disabled. When the event
--   destination is disabled, events aren't sent to the specified
--   destinations.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kinesisFirehoseDestination:EventDestination'</a>,
--   <a>eventDestination_kinesisFirehoseDestination</a> - An object that
--   defines an Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose destination for email events.
--   You can use Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose to stream data to other
--   services, such as Amazon S3 and Amazon Redshift.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cloudWatchDestination:EventDestination'</a>,
--   <a>eventDestination_cloudWatchDestination</a> - An object that defines
--   an Amazon CloudWatch destination for email events. You can use Amazon
--   CloudWatch to monitor and gain insights on your email sending metrics.
--   
--   <a>$sel:snsDestination:EventDestination'</a>,
--   <a>eventDestination_snsDestination</a> - An object that defines an
--   Amazon SNS destination for email events. You can use Amazon SNS to
--   send notification when certain email events occur.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:EventDestination'</a>, <a>eventDestination_name</a> - A
--   name that identifies the event destination.
--   
--   <a>$sel:matchingEventTypes:EventDestination'</a>,
--   <a>eventDestination_matchingEventTypes</a> - The types of events that
--   Amazon SES sends to the specified event destinations.
newEventDestination :: Text -> EventDestination

-- | An object that defines the event destination. Specifically, it defines
--   which services receive events from emails sent using the configuration
--   set that the event destination is associated with. Also defines the
--   types of events that are sent to the event destination.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEventDestinationDefinition</a> smart constructor.
data EventDestinationDefinition
EventDestinationDefinition' :: Maybe [EventType] -> Maybe PinpointDestination -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe KinesisFirehoseDestination -> Maybe CloudWatchDestination -> Maybe SnsDestination -> EventDestinationDefinition

-- | Create a value of <a>EventDestinationDefinition</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:matchingEventTypes:EventDestinationDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>eventDestinationDefinition_matchingEventTypes</a> - An array that
--   specifies which events the Amazon SES API v2 should send to the
--   destinations in this <tt>EventDestinationDefinition</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:pinpointDestination:EventDestinationDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>eventDestinationDefinition_pinpointDestination</a> - An object that
--   defines an Amazon Pinpoint project destination for email events. You
--   can send email event data to a Amazon Pinpoint project to view metrics
--   using the Transactional Messaging dashboards that are built in to
--   Amazon Pinpoint. For more information, see <a>Transactional Messaging
--   Charts</a> in the <i>Amazon Pinpoint User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enabled:EventDestinationDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>eventDestinationDefinition_enabled</a> - If <tt>true</tt>, the
--   event destination is enabled. When the event destination is enabled,
--   the specified event types are sent to the destinations in this
--   <tt>EventDestinationDefinition</tt>.
--   
--   If <tt>false</tt>, the event destination is disabled. When the event
--   destination is disabled, events aren't sent to the specified
--   destinations.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kinesisFirehoseDestination:EventDestinationDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>eventDestinationDefinition_kinesisFirehoseDestination</a> - An
--   object that defines an Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose destination for
--   email events. You can use Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose to stream data
--   to other services, such as Amazon S3 and Amazon Redshift.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cloudWatchDestination:EventDestinationDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>eventDestinationDefinition_cloudWatchDestination</a> - An object
--   that defines an Amazon CloudWatch destination for email events. You
--   can use Amazon CloudWatch to monitor and gain insights on your email
--   sending metrics.
--   
--   <a>$sel:snsDestination:EventDestinationDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>eventDestinationDefinition_snsDestination</a> - An object that
--   defines an Amazon SNS destination for email events. You can use Amazon
--   SNS to send notification when certain email events occur.
newEventDestinationDefinition :: EventDestinationDefinition

-- | A list of attributes that are associated with a MAIL FROM domain.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMailFromAttributes</a> smart constructor.
data MailFromAttributes
MailFromAttributes' :: Text -> MailFromDomainStatus -> BehaviorOnMxFailure -> MailFromAttributes

-- | Create a value of <a>MailFromAttributes</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:mailFromDomain:MailFromAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>mailFromAttributes_mailFromDomain</a> - The name of a domain that
--   an email identity uses as a custom MAIL FROM domain.
--   
--   <a>$sel:mailFromDomainStatus:MailFromAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>mailFromAttributes_mailFromDomainStatus</a> - The status of the
--   MAIL FROM domain. This status can have the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>PENDING</tt>  Amazon SES hasn't started searching for the MX
--   record yet.</li>
--   <li><tt>SUCCESS</tt>  Amazon SES detected the required MX record for
--   the MAIL FROM domain.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt>  Amazon SES can't find the required MX record, or
--   the record no longer exists.</li>
--   <li><tt>TEMPORARY_FAILURE</tt>  A temporary issue occurred, which
--   prevented Amazon SES from determining the status of the MAIL FROM
--   domain.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:behaviorOnMxFailure:MailFromAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>mailFromAttributes_behaviorOnMxFailure</a> - The action to take if
--   the required MX record can't be found when you send an email. When you
--   set this value to <tt>UseDefaultValue</tt>, the mail is sent using
--   <i>amazonses.com</i> as the MAIL FROM domain. When you set this value
--   to <tt>RejectMessage</tt>, the Amazon SES API v2 returns a
--   <tt>MailFromDomainNotVerified</tt> error, and doesn't attempt to
--   deliver the email.
--   
--   These behaviors are taken when the custom MAIL FROM domain
--   configuration is in the <tt>Pending</tt>, <tt>Failed</tt>, and
--   <tt>TemporaryFailure</tt> states.
newMailFromAttributes :: Text -> MailFromDomainStatus -> BehaviorOnMxFailure -> MailFromAttributes

-- | Represents the email message that you're sending. The <tt>Message</tt>
--   object consists of a subject line and a message body.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMessage</a> smart constructor.
data Message
Message' :: Content -> Body -> Message

-- | Create a value of <a>Message</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:subject:Message'</a>, <a>message_subject</a> - The subject
--   line of the email. The subject line can only contain 7-bit ASCII
--   characters. However, you can specify non-ASCII characters in the
--   subject line by using encoded-word syntax, as described in <a>RFC
--   2047</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:body:Message'</a>, <a>message_body</a> - The body of the
--   message. You can specify an HTML version of the message, a text-only
--   version of the message, or both.
newMessage :: Content -> Body -> Message

-- | Contains the name and value of a tag that you apply to an email. You
--   can use message tags when you publish email sending events.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMessageTag</a> smart constructor.
data MessageTag
MessageTag' :: Text -> Text -> MessageTag

-- | Create a value of <a>MessageTag</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:MessageTag'</a>, <a>messageTag_name</a> - The name of the
--   message tag. The message tag name has to meet the following criteria:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>It can only contain ASCII letters (az, AZ), numbers (09),
--   underscores (_), or dashes (-).</li>
--   <li>It can contain no more than 256 characters.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:MessageTag'</a>, <a>messageTag_value</a> - The value of
--   the message tag. The message tag value has to meet the following
--   criteria:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>It can only contain ASCII letters (az, AZ), numbers (09),
--   underscores (_), or dashes (-).</li>
--   <li>It can contain no more than 256 characters.</li>
--   </ul>
newMessageTag :: Text -> Text -> MessageTag

-- | Represents the raw content of an email message.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRawMessage</a> smart constructor.
data RawMessage
RawMessage' :: Base64 -> RawMessage

-- | Create a value of <a>RawMessage</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:data':RawMessage'</a>, <a>rawMessage_data</a> - The raw email
--   message. The message has to meet the following criteria:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The message has to contain a header and a body, separated by one
--   blank line.</li>
--   <li>All of the required header fields must be present in the
--   message.</li>
--   <li>Each part of a multipart MIME message must be formatted
--   properly.</li>
--   <li>Attachments must be in a file format that the Amazon SES
--   supports.</li>
--   <li>The entire message must be Base64 encoded.</li>
--   <li>If any of the MIME parts in your message contain content that is
--   outside of the 7-bit ASCII character range, you should encode that
--   content to ensure that recipients' email clients render the message
--   properly.</li>
--   <li>The length of any single line of text in the message can't exceed
--   1,000 characters. This restriction is defined in <a>RFC
--   5321</a>.--</li>
--   <li>- <i>Note:</i> This <tt>Lens</tt> automatically encodes and
--   decodes Base64 data.</li>
--   <li>- The underlying isomorphism will encode to Base64 representation
--   during</li>
--   <li>- serialisation, and decode from Base64 representation during
--   deserialisation.</li>
--   <li>- This <tt>Lens</tt> accepts and returns only raw unencoded
--   data.</li>
--   </ul>
newRawMessage :: ByteString -> RawMessage

-- | The <tt>ReplaceEmailContent</tt> object to be used for a specific

--   suppression list for your account when a message sent to that address
--   results in a hard bounce.</li>

-- | An object that defines the tags that are associated with a resource. A
--   <i>tag</i> is a label that you optionally define and associate with a
--   resource. Tags can help you categorize and manage resources in
--   different ways, such as by purpose, owner, environment, or other
--   criteria. A resource can have as many as 50 tags.
--   
--   Each tag consists of a required <i>tag key</i> and an associated
--   <i>tag value</i>, both of which you define. A tag key is a general
--   label that acts as a category for a more specific tag value. A tag
--   value acts as a descriptor within a tag key. A tag key can contain as
--   many as 128 characters. A tag value can contain as many as 256
--   characters. The characters can be Unicode letters, digits, white
--   space, or one of the following symbols: _ . : / = + -. The following
--   additional restrictions apply to tags:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Tag keys and values are case sensitive.</li>
--   <li>For each associated resource, each tag key must be unique and it
--   can have only one value.</li>
--   <li>The <tt>aws:</tt> prefix is reserved for use by Amazon Web
--   Services; you cant use it in any tag keys or values that you define.
--   In addition, you can't edit or remove tag keys or values that use this
--   prefix. Tags that use this prefix dont count against the limit of 50
--   tags per resource.</li>
--   <li>You can associate tags with public or shared resources, but the
--   tags are available only for your Amazon Web Services account, not any
--   other accounts that share the resource. In addition, the tags are
--   available only for resources that are located in the specified Amazon
--   Web Services Region for your Amazon Web Services account.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTag</a> smart constructor.
data Tag
Tag' :: Text -> Text -> Tag

-- | Create a value of <a>Tag</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_key</a> - One part of a key-value pair
--   that defines a tag. The maximum length of a tag key is 128 characters.
--   The minimum length is 1 character.
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_value</a> - The optional part of a
--   key-value pair that defines a tag. The maximum length of a tag value
--   is 256 characters. The minimum length is 0 characters. If you don't
--   want a resource to have a specific tag value, don't specify a value
--   for this parameter. If you don't specify a value, Amazon SES sets the
--   value to an empty string.
newTag :: Text -> Text -> Tag

-- | An object that defines the email template to use for an email message,
--   and the values to use for any message variables in that template. An
--   <i>email template</i> is a type of message template that contains
--   content that you want to define, save, and reuse in email messages
--   that you send.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTemplate</a> smart constructor.
data Template

-- | Create a value of <a>Template</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateName:Template'</a>, <a>template_templateName</a> - The
--   name of the template. You will refer to this name when you send email
--   using the <tt>SendTemplatedEmail</tt> or
--   <tt>SendBulkTemplatedEmail</tt> operations.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateArn:Template'</a>, <a>template_templateArn</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateData:Template'</a>, <a>template_templateData</a> - An
--   object that defines the values to use for message variables in the
--   template. This object is a set of key-value pairs. Each key defines a
--   message variable in the template. The corresponding value defines the
--   value to use for that variable.
newTemplate :: Template

-- | An object that defines the tracking options for a configuration set.

--   order to track when recipients click them.
--   
--   These images and links include references to a domain operated by
--   Amazon Web Services. You can optionally configure the Amazon SES to
--   use a domain that you operate for these images and links.

--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTrackingOptions</a> smart constructor.

newTrackingOptions :: Text -> TrackingOptions
